column1: Which Is More Important
column2: Technical Or Fundamental Analysis?;4/5/2017;"Despite many thousands of books written on the subject of market analysis and countless theories that attempt to explain the movement of stocks
column3: bonds
column4: commodities and currencies
column5: there are
column6: at heart
column7: only two types of analysis: fundamental and technical.Fundamental analysis involves assessing the economic conditions that influence price
column8: such as supply
column9: demand
column10: and the overall state of the domestic
column11: and global economy. In the case of the stock and bond markets
column12: it also involves looking at the balance sheet and financial health of a corporation
column13: or maybe at the prospects for a specific industry.Technical analysis
column14: on the other hand
column15: is about analyzing past price action and from that deriving a predictive model for the future.makeArticleAd();The question I am most frequently asked by those new to trading is “Which is more important
column16: technical or fundamental analysis?”When that question arises one of the hardest things for me is to avoid answering with a cliché
column17: as there are really only two honest answers: ”Both” or “It depends.”As is so often the case
column18: what is presented as a binary choice in that question is anything but that. There is no reason that traders or investors need to choose between fundamental and technical analysis. In an ideal world each trade would come about from a combination of the two
column19: with technical analysis supporting the fundamental
column20: or vice versa.That makes “both” a valid answer to the question
column21: but “it depends” can be just as accurate. In general
column22: fundamental analysis is more useful for long term trades and investments
column23: whereas technical analysis is more useful from a short term perspective. Over a period of a few minutes to a day or two technical levels of support and resistance can influence the direction of a price massively. Take a look at the chart below for Microsoft (MSFT) as an example.Following the earnings release in October the stock jumped to a high of 61.40 before retracing. When that level was tested again at the end of November it proved to be a significant point of resistance
column24: and after several tries to break through
column25: MSFT dropped back around 4.5% in just a couple of days. Clearly previous price action matters
column26: but then look at what happened after that.Microsoft at that time was growing its enterprise business significantly
column27: and stocks in general were in the midst of what has become known as the “Trump Bump”. Fundamental conditions
column28: both micro (pertaining to Microsoft) and macro (pertaining to the broader economy)
column29: made MSFT an attractive stock
column30: and as a result it smashed through that level a few days later and carried on higher. This ably demonstrates that while technical factors can have a huge short term influence
column31: fundamentals win in the end.If forced to choose between the two I would pick fundamental analysis as the more influential. There is no real reason for what happened in the past should influence the future. It does so only because we
column32: as human beings
column33: seek to impose order on things. We look for reasons to do things
column34: and past price history can provide us with them. Understanding that also leads to the conclusion that the best technical analysis is the most simple.The significance of a particular price level is a function of how many people identify it and act accordingly. In the MSFT example above
column35: the previous high attracted enough sellers to push the price down
column36: but it was an obvious level. The more obscure analyses that demand advanced math skills or calculations may appeal to our vanity
column37: but if nobody else recognizes the levels that they suggest they are essentially worthless. When it comes to technical analysis the old KISS adage (Keep It Simple
column38: Stupid) definitely applies.It should be clear that both technical and fundamental analysis have a place in devising a trade. Ideally
column39: fundamental analysis is used to determine direction
column40: while technical analysis suggests timing and specific entry and exit points. Of course nothing can guarantee that every trade is successful
column41: but if you use that formula you give yourself a better chance of success than relying on one or the other."

column1: Adobe Is Going All In on AI;4/5/2017;"Adobe Systems Inc.(NASDAQ: ADBE) may be best known for its ubiquitous Portable   Document Format (PDF)
column2: which is used in the creation and exchange   of documents. The company is also well-known for its suite of   creative products like photo editing software Photoshop
column3: Illustrator software for creating scalable graphics and artwork
column4: and desktop publishing software InDesign.Over the last several years
column5: Adobe embarked on a mission to   migrate its business
column6: and has gradually evolved from a company   producing and selling creative programs to a   software-as-a-service (SaaS) company that provides subscriptions   to a suite of products hosted on the web. During its transition
column7: the company has also become a force in the area of web analytics.   Adobe is currently working to integrate artificial intelligence   (AI) into its products
column8: via a system it dubbed Sensei
column9: for use by   cloud customers.Senseiis a Japanese word which means an honored teacher or mentor.Adobe wants to train every technical employee in AI     fundamentals. Image source: Adobe Systems.makeArticleAd();Excitement about developments in AIMachine learning
column10: a subdiscipline of AI
column11: endows computers with   the ability to learn
column12: combining software models and complex   algorithms that can search through massive amounts of data for   hidden patterns and insights. These programs can apply what they   have learned while adapting to new information.During its most recent earnings conference call
column13: Adobe stated   (emphasis mine):Last month we held our internal Tech Summit where we     announced our commitmentto train every one of our technical employees in     artificial intelligence fundamentals. We also demonstrated the incredible work happening across the     company.Partnering for the AI revolutionThe company has revealed several recent collaborations in   pursuit of its AI agenda. Last week
column14: it announced a partnership   withMicrosoft(NASDAQ: MSFT) that would integrate customer relationship   management (CRM) data from Microsoft's Azure cloud and the Adobe   Cloud. Applying machine-learning techniques across the data will   provide advertisers with additional insights
column15: help manage   advertising across a variety of platforms
column16: and allow for more   targeted and personalized messages. The companies are also   sharing data models and core libraries between Sensei andMicrosoft's AI assistant Cortana
column17: and will collaborate on ways to leverage Microsoft's   virtual-reality HoloLens headset for advertising.Adobe and Microsoft are partnering across platforms. Image     source: Adobe Systems.Sensei will be powered by graphics processing units (GPUs)   from industry leaderNVIDIA(NASDAQ: NVDA)
column18: which Adobe already uses in many of its creative   products. The companies have an ongoing collaboration to develop   and optimize these graphics chips for new applications.NVIDIA GPUs have been widely usedto accelerate the training of AI systems due to their massive   parallel-processing capabilities
column19: and arealready employed by Microsoft's Azure Cloud
column20: where Sensei is being hosted.Adobe is partnering withAmazon.com(NASDAQ: AMZN) and itsvirtual assistant Alexato develop skills that will integrate with its Experience Cloud   and provide customers the status of their rewards miles from   hotels and airlines. Alexa will also recommend activities or   promotions based on customer profiles
column21: and Adobe says it will do   so while still protecting user privacy. Alexa and itsEcho smart-home speakerpossess over 10
column22: 000 skills and were the hit of the holiday season   for Amazon. With a user base estimated to be nearing10% of U.S. households
column23: this could provide a rich source of additional data for   Adobe.Joining an emerging trendAdobe has produced impressive gains during its transition. In   its most recent quarter
column24: the company reported record results in a   variety of metrics including revenue
column25: earnings
column26: and cash flow.   Its revenue increased 22% over the prior-year quarter
column27: while net   income grew an impressive 42% year over year. The company   finished 2016 with a record $5.85 billion in annual revenue
column28: $4.01 billion of which was recurring
column29: and $2.01 billion in   deferred revenue.Adobe joins a growing trend of companies jumping on the AI   bandwagon to improve their businesses and gain competitive   advantages. Adobe says that it has been using similar technology   for some time and that this is just the next logical step.   There's no way to quantify how the company will benefit   financially from its venture into AI
column30: but it provides intriguing   opportunities
column31: and companies that don't make use of the latest   technology risk being left behind.10 stocks we like better than Adobe SystemsWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column32: it can pay to listen. After all
column33: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade
column34: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column35: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and Adobe Systems wasn't one     of them! That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even     better buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of February 6
column36: 2017Teresa Kersten is an employee of LinkedIn and is a member     of The Motley Fool's board of directors; LinkedIn is owned by     Microsoft.Danny Venaowns shares of Amazon. The Motley Fool owns shares of and     recommends Amazon and Nvidia. The Motley Fool recommends Adobe     Systems. The Motley Fool has adisclosure policy."

column1: Amazon & Microsoft: Are These Cloud Computing Leaders in a Growth Slowdown?;4/4/2017;"""The cloud"" and ""cloud computing"" have become incredible buzzwords. It seems most people are floating around the idea
column2: as the term ambiguously suggests
column3: but don't seem to have a grasp on how the cloud functions.Believed to be invented by American psychologist and computer scientist J.C.R. Licklider in the 1960's
column4: cloud computing was created to connect data for people between locations and times. Now
column5: this technology has vastly grown and made publicly available by industry leaders AmazonAMZNand MicrosoftMSFT.What is the Cloud?In basic terms
column6: cloud computing is accessing and storing data over the Internet. To the end user
column7: benefits of the cloud include: the ability to deliver and manage their own computer resources
column8: scale up or scale down computing levels as needed
column9: and only pay for the amount of computing power they use.Synergy Research Groupshowscloud vendor revenues reached $148 billion in 2016
column10: which accounts for 25% annualized growth. Clearly
column11: this is a vast and fast growing space. Leaders in the movement are changing the traditional notion of accessing data through hardware by introducing the idea of retrieving data through space
column12: or the cloud.At the end of the day
column13: this data needs to be stored somewhere. Companies which offer cloud computing services allocate massive and secure servers to store the data being held in the cloud. Even though cloud data is not being stored in users' personal hard drives
column14: is it held somewhere and may be vulnerable to failures.With the rate of growth this technology is flying at
column15: it seems cloud computing will soon take over the necessities of personal hard drive space. The two popularly known leaders of the cloud computing business are known to be: Amazon with AWS (Amazon Web Service
column16: Inc) and Microsoft with Azure.How Fast are the Amazon and Microsoft Growing?Amazon's cloud computing service
column17: AWS
column18: launched in 2006. They advertise themselves to deliver large computing capabilities and capacities which cost less and take less time than a company building physical servers. As of 2016
column19: AWS offers more than 70 services.Year over Year (Y/Y) growth of AWS sales for Amazon were increasing until
column20: and as of now peaked on
column21: Q2 of 2015 at 81%. Since
column22: AWS revenues have been seeing high growth
column23: but not to the level it once did. In Q4 of 2016
column24: Y/Y net sales growth for AWS was 47%.A similar story is shown with Microsoft's Azure. Y/Y revenue growth (GAAP) of their Azure business capped
column25: to date
column26: in Q2 of 2016 at 127% growth. Just like AWS
column27: the later quarters show sales growth at a decreasing rate with Q4 2016 Y/Y revenue growth (GAAP) at 93%.So… Who Cares?Two of the leaders in cloud computing platforms have not been able to increase their sales growth of their respective cloud businesses. In an industry which is infamous for how fast it is expanding into the hands of businesses and individuals
column28: these numbers are concerning.It looks like the maximum potential for Amazon's and Microsoft's sales growth for their cloud computing businesses have capped. Unless either company releases break through cloud computing technology or breaking price points
column29: their sales growth rates look to continually decrease considering current levels.Which Stocks are Zacks Experts Talking About?makeArticleAd();Stocks in today's headlines may be tempting buys

column1: Apple Inc. (AAPL) Promises New Mac Pro in 2018
column2: New Pro iMac in 2017;4/4/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) has been taking heat from customers for ignoring its core
column4: professional Mac users. The Mac Pro was last updated in 2013
column5: and even then
column6: its design alienated some. Apple held a rare turntable event with tech journalists to talk about the Mac. The company promises it has heard the complaints and it's pledging an all new Mac Pro in 2018.makeArticleAd();Source: AppleTo tide those power users over in the meantime
column7: the company has goosed the specs of the existing model
column8: is cutting some prices and it will introduce a new iMac aimed at pro users later this year.Senior Apple Execs Talk Mac PlansApple brought a handful of tech journalists to its headquarters for a very rare
column9: roundtable meeting with three of its senior executives: Phil Schiller (Senior VP Worldwide Marketing)
column10: Craig Federighi (Senior VP Software Engineering) and John Ternus (VP Hardware Engineering).The reason? To talk about AAPL's desktop Mac roadmap.The companyupdated its MacBook Pro laptops late last year
column11: but desktop Macs have languished with outdated specs sometimes for years. The Mac Pro was last updated in 2013
column12: the iMac in 2015 and the Mac Mini in 2014. In the meantime
column13: Windows PCs have received multiple upgrades and are equipped with processors and graphics cards that leave AAPL's offering in the dust - despite the Mac premium price tag.The 10 Best Stocks of the S&P 500 in Q1AndMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) has emerged as a threat for the creative professional users who traditionally bought Macs
column14: with its newSurface Studio all-in-one PC.The situation was bad enough that AAPL staged this event to assure everyone that it hasn't abandoned the Mac or its professional users. It follows oncomments from CEO Tim Cookthat suggested APPL might be quietly working on a new Mac Pro.Apple Admits It Missed the Mark with Old Mac ProProfessionals who need a workstation-class desktop PC need a computer that can be upgraded. The Mac Pro AAPL introduced in 2013 looked cool
column15: but its compact cylinder form factor limited upgrade options.Quoted byMashable'sLance Ulanoff (who was at the routable)
column16: Apple's Federighihad this to say about the current Mac Pro:""The Mac Pro
column17: the current vintage that we introduced
column18: we wanted to do something bold and different. In retrospect
column19: it didn't well suit some of the people we wanted to reach … We designed ourselves into a bit of a thermal corner.""Phil Schiller then went on to say that AAPL engineers are designing an all new Mac Pro that supports upgradability and expansion. The Apple team admitted that this move came later than they would like
column20: but promised that a new Mac Pro in 2018 will win back its professional users. It is also going to release a new Pro display
column21: one made by Apple
column22: not theLGmonitor it has been steering customers towardsince discontinuing its Thunderbolt Display last year.In the Meantime
column23: Spec Bumps and a New iMac for Pro UsersA year is a long time to wait for a new computer - especially if you have already been waiting two or three years. But Apple has several solutions in the meantime. After noting that many professional users had been moving to high end iMacs
column24: the company is committing to releasing a new iMac in 2017 that's aimed at pro users.Tesla Inc (TSLA) Stock Hits New Highs
column25: Threatens Massive BreakoutIt won't have touch capability - AAPL isn't trying to replicate that Surface Studio - but expect high end component options for this Pro iMac like more powerful CPUs and graphics cards. And for everyone else
column26: Apple is at leastgiving the existing Mac Pro lineup spec bumps and price cuts.Will the new Mac Pro arrive in time to save Apple's professional desktop PC market? While there have been some Windows switchers
column27: Mac users tend to be stubbornly dedicated to the platform. The effort by Apple to be transparent about its plans
column28: acknowledgment that it has allowed its desktop lineup to fall behind and a promise of a new Mac Pro in 2018 will hold many over.For those who can't wait
column29: price cuts and spec bumps take at least some of the sting out of buying a current Mac Pro. And the prospect of a new iMac aimed at the professional market is intriguing.The Mac business may not count for much in an Apple that is focused on iPhone revenue
column30: but the company is sending the message that it has no intention of abandoning the market.As of this writing
column31: Brad Moon did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceSamsung (SSNLF) Introduces the Galaxy S8 With Infinity DisplayThe New Apple Inc. iPad Strategy Is Sneakier Than You ThinkThe postApple Inc. (AAPL) Promises New Mac Pro in 2018
column32: New Pro iMac in 2017appeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Happy Birthday Microsoft: 5 Fun Facts About The Software Giant's Founding;4/4/2017;"On this day in 1975
column2: the fate of the technology industry was forever changed as long-time friends Bill Gates and Paul Allen founded MicrosoftMSFT
column3: a once-modest software business that rose to become one of the most important and innovative companies in the world.The remarkable story of this tech pioneer begins with another important innovator
column4: Micro Instrumentation and Telemetry Systems (MITS)
column5: a former calculator company that begin developing computers in the mid-70s.MITS produced the first commercially successful home computer
column6: the Altair 8800. After Gates and Allen saw the computer featured on the cover ofPopular Electronics
column7: the pair began writing software for the device and eventually moved to New Mexico to work for the company.It was here that Gates and Allen would found Microsoft. By the end of 1978
column8: their young company was doing more than $1 million in revenue. In 1979
column9: Microsoft moved from New Mexico to Bellevue
column10: Washington
column11: a suburb of Seattle where the founders grew up.A couple of years later
column12: Microsoft would pave the way for its domination of the operating system market by purchasing the rights to what would later become MS-DOS. Over the years
column13: the company would develop its other infamous programs
column14: including Word
column15: Excel
column16: and Windows.The rest
column17: as they say
column18: is history. Microsoft remains a massive tech giant
column19: and Gates and Allen remain two of the wealthiest people on the planet. Of course
column20: this summary is short on some of the more fun details. Everyone likes the fun details.In celebration of its 42ndbirthday
column21: check out these five fun facts about the early days of Microsoft:1.Microsoft was not the founders' first companyGates and Allen met in high school and quickly bonded over a love for computers. The friends were able to use their school's computers for free
column22: which led to the creation of their first business partnership
column23: ""Traf-O-Data
column24: a project focused on the efficient creation of vehicle traffic flow charts.At the time
column25: traffic patterns were measured mechanically. Rubber hoses were laid along roads
column26: and as cars passed over them
column27: a small burst of air triggered a measuring device. This data was then recorded on paper tape. Gates and Allen thought they could do better. The young friends eventually designed a program and a compatible piece of hardware to create traffic charts.2.It started with a white lieWell before Bill Gates earned his reputation for being a generous philanthropist
column28: he was apparently a bit of a fibber. Shortly after reading about the Altair 8800
column29: a 20-year-old Gates called MITS and claimed to have a working BASIC interpreter for the computer. Gates and Allen had no such interpreter. In fact
column30: the pair didn't even own an Altair 8800.In what could have been an attempt to call their bluff
column31: MITS requested a demonstration of the interpreter. Allen began working on a simulator for the Altair 8800
column32: while Gates worked on the program. The founders pulled it off
column33: successfully demonstrating the interpreter on a real Altair 8800 a few months later.3.There used to be a hyphenAlthough the hyphen didn't last long
column34: Microsoft was originally called ""Micro-Soft."" Allen is credited with coming up with the name
column35: which is a combination of the words ""microcomputer"" and ""software.""In a 1995 interview withFortune
column36: the founders revealed that Microsoft felt like the ""totally obvious"" name
column37: but they did toy around with other names like ""Outcorporated Inc
column38: ""Unlimited Ltd
column39: and even ""Allen & Gates.""4.Its headquarters had humble beginningsToday
column40: Microsoft's corporate headquarters is located at One Microsoft Way in Redmond
column41: Washington. The multi-billion dollar campus includes a shopping mall
column42: a soccer field
column43: and shuttle-bus service to nearby neighborhoods. Microsoft's first offices were a bit less flashy.""Next door was a vacuum-cleaner place
column44: then a massage parlor. To get to our offices
column45: you had to walk past the vacuum-cleaner guy. We stayed in this motel down the road called the Sand and Sage
column46: Gates toldFortune.5.Gates and Allen almost ran out of cash… thanks to   pirates.Ok fine
column47: I'm talking about software pirates
column48: not the sea-based swashbuckling kind. In the very early days of Microsoft
column49: when Gates and Allen were still working with MITS
column50: the two almost ran completely out of money because of how many people were stealing their BASIC program.According to the founders
column51: their original contract with MITS was structured so that MITS was responsible for selling the BASIC program to their customers. When pirated copies of Gates and Allen's BASIC began floating around
column52: MITS figured it was a waste of time to try to sell it. After a months-long legal battle
column53: an arbitrator eventually sided with the Microsoft founders.Bottom LineRome wasn't built in a day
column54: and neither was Microsoft. The company's incredible history fits the extraordinary impact it has had on the world
column55: and it is fascinating to look back on the earliest days of what is now a tech powerhouse.Which Stocks are Zacks Experts Talking About?Stocks in today's headlines may be tempting buys

column1: Does Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Have Any Meaningful Growth Left?;4/4/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsMy bearish call earlier this month on smartphone and technology titanApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) has not yet played out. AAPL stock is up nearly 3% since March 6
column3: which easily bests the negative 1% return of the market as a whole since then.makeArticleAd();Besides
column4: a month is only a blink of an eye to a long-term-minded investor. Apple's prospects over the next few years are far from certain
column5: and the business fundamentals are what will drive Apple (and any) stock going forward.A recent note from Pacific Crest puts those fundamentals into long-term doubt.Pacific Crest
column6: which is mildly bullish on shares - despite an ""Overweight"" rating
column7: they have a price target of just $150
column8: or 4% higher - sees an end to the gravy train
column9: or at least a slowing. ""We see potential for further upside to our unit and gross profit dollar estimates in the coming iPhone cycle
column10: but believe growth beyond that will slow substantially.""I tend to agree.A key concern for AAPL is the dominance of the Android operating system - the open-source system developed by Apple's archrivalAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOGL). As of the third quarter of last year
column11: Android boasted a market share of nearly 87% (86.8%)
column12: which came despite an embarrassing recall of the Galaxy Note 7.Samsung(OTCMKTS:SSNLF) is the leading manufacturer of smart phones that run off Android.Apple's iOS operating system has seen its market share decline over the past year. It ended the third quarter of last year with a market share of 12.5%. The third largest competitor isMicrosoft Corporation's(NASDAQ:MSFT) Windows Phone. Yet its market share was only 0.3% to barely qualify it as a competitor. The rest of the market accounted for the remaining 0.4%.Despite its seemingly small operating system market share
column13: Apple is projected to report total sales of $228 billion for all of fiscal 2017. Expectations for the next year (2018) stand at $246 billion
column14: or annual growth of 8%. Not too bad for such a large installed base of users.Try This Apple Inc. Trade Before the CorrectionYet there are concerns about where future growth in AAPL stock will stem from.Apple fell to fifth place in China when it reported its latest quarterly results. Its market share fell to 10.8% from 12% in the previous year.Huaweiis the market leader in China.Apple is also considered only a bit player in India
column15: where smart phone prices average less than $150. Its market share is only 10th  in India.Apple changed the smartphone space with the release of the iPhone. It also essentially invented apps that users deploy to play games
column16: access social media and shop.But tech moves fast
column17: and rivals have quickly gotten up to speed by copying - or should I say emulating - the best of what the iPhone has to offer. Patent litigation is working out the fine line between the two.The Future of SmartphonesAn overview of 10 predicted trends in mobile phones byPC Worldlate last year indicates that new innovations are likely to be incremental
column18: as opposed to revolutionary. It cites new designs
column19: such as slimmer and sleeker iPhones
column20: perhaps a folding smartphone from Samsung
column21: or new customization
column22: such as mixing a phone and watch capabilities.Chips are getting faster
column23: which helps users access data and services more quickly. USB-C ports are fast replacing micro-USB ports on Android-based phones. Charging is getting quicker
column24: and storage is increasing. Tech moves at the speed of light
column25: or at least tries to.This will likely make it difficult for Apple to gain any meaningful market share against Android-based rivals. Yet the total market continues to grow
column26: and AAPL stock will benefit accordingly.Pacific Crest's Andy Hargreaves seems to think the stock needs a different type of push; namely
column27: ""tax reform and a subsequent increase to the dividend may be necessary to drive significant upside"" in the stock.Apple's forward earnings multiple of 16 is actually quite reasonable. It's below the market average (closer to 20) and the company is still in a robustly growing market. Yet it is slightly above Apple's average multiple over the past five years.Monday Apple Rumors: AAPL Places Large Order of OLED PanelsIn addition to the growth of the overall market
column28: Apple's higher-margin service revenue is growing briskly. Warren Buffett'sBerkshire Hathaway Inc.(NYSE:BRK.B) has also been accumulating Apple stock. There is no greater vote of confidence than the backing of the Oracle of Omaha.Bottom LineIt is valid to argue that the strength of iPhone hardware sales is highly uncertain in the coming five years. There is a very good chance that a cheap Android version sweeps across the world - especially in more emerging markets. Back in the day
column29: Nokiadominated the worldwide cell phone market with affordable phones and a massive distribution network.That makes AAPL stock unattractive at this point.I still find thatIntel Corporation(NASDAQ:INTC) is a more compellingvalue right now. It has a lower forward earnings multiple below 13 and just boughtMobileye NV(NASDAQ:MBLY) for exposure to chips that are likely to help run self-driving cars.Alphabet also looks quite appealing. It essentially manages the Android operating system
column30: and dominates the search engine business that has safely migrated to smart phones. GOOGL's forward P/E is 20
column31: but the firm is growing rapidly. Sales are projected to jump 18% this year to $106 billion.As of this writing
column32: Ryan Fuhrmann was long GOOGL and INTC.More From InvestorPlaceThe 5 Best Stocks to Buy for AprilApple Inc. (AAPL) Will Develop Its Own iPhone Graphics ChipAdvanced Micro Devices
column33: Inc. (AMD) Stock Is a Rotten AppleThe postDoes Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Have Any Meaningful Growth Left?appeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Alphabet's Android Topples Windows as Most Preferred OS;4/4/2017;"Per Techcrunch
column2: Alphabet Inc.'sGOOGLAndroid operating system (OS) has dethroned Microsoft'sMSFTWindows as the most popular OS in the world with respect to Internet usage.TechCrunch quoted data provided by StatCounter (a web analytics company) per which Android had a 37.93% market share in the Internet usage space in Mar 2017. This was followed by Microsoft with 37.91% share
column3: Apple'sAAPLiOS at 13.1% and Mac OS at 5.17%.Shares of Alphabet were up 1.06% on Monday. We note that the technology giant outperformed the ZacksInternet - Servicesindustry over the last one year. While the industry gained only 7.6%

column5: declining PC shipments and rising demand in Asian countries.We note that Microsoft has dominated the global OS landscape since the 1980s. Given the fact that Android entered the space just five years ago

column1: This Catalyst Can Take NVIDIA to the Cloud;4/3/2017;"The boom in data traffic is creating the need for stronger   cloud infrastructure
column2: forcing cloud service providers (CSPs) to   upgrade their data centers to process the increasing volume and   complexity of data. Gartner estimates that public cloud   infrastructure investments will grow almost 37% this year
column3: to   $34.6 billion
column4: thanks to investments fromAmazon
column5: Microsoft(NASDAQ: MSFT)
column6: andAlphabet's(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) Google to bring their data   centers up to speed.One way to tap this multibillion-dollar market is throughNVIDIA(NASDAQ: NVDA)
column7: as its Tesla graphics processing units (GPUs)   are helping the CSPs bring raw computing power to their data   centers. As it turns out
column8: the chipmaker's data center business   has taken off remarkably in recent quarters
column9: outpacing the growth   in other key segments.Data Source: NVIDIA. Chart by author.makeArticleAd();In fact
column10: the data center business is now NVIDIA's   second-largest revenue source
column11: and it is likely that it will   continue to get bigger given the company's recent moves in this   space.NVIDIA is gaining from GPU adoption in the cloudA huge amount of data is being generated thanks to connected   cars and other Internet of Things devices.IntelCEO Brian Krzanich believes that a single autonomous car could   generate 4
column12: 000 gigabytes of data daily if driven for just one   hour
column13: thanks to all the sensors and cameras installed.Machina Research
column14: on the other hand
column15: forecasts that the number of connected   devices will grow over fourfold
column16: to 27 billion
column17: by 2025.This is going to create a big challenge for CSPs in   transferring the data from the cloud to the data center
column18: with   Gartner forecasting that 25% of the data generated will go to   waste even before it is analyzed. NVIDIA
column19: however
column20: has a solution   for the CSPs with its Tesla GPUs that are specifically aimed at   this market.Image source: NVIDIA.The Tesla GPUs accelerate a data center's computing power
column21: enabling service providers to process huge data sets at a   fraction of the cost required to build a new facility
column22: which   would previously have been required to analyze the same amount of   data. NVIDIA does this by allowing service providers to replace   central processing units with its high-performance GPUs that can   deliver a fivefold boost in computational power and slash costs   by 60%.Not surprisingly
column23: Alphabet has decided to use the chipmaker's   Tesla K80 GPUs on the Google Cloud Platform to offer   deep-learning capabilities to its users. Google Cloud users can   now use up to eight GPUs to perform intensive tasks such as   high-performance data analysis
column24: seismic analysis
column25: and video   transcoding.Google is going to charge $0.70 per hour for each K80 GPU in   the U.S. and $0.77 per hour in Asia and Europe
column26: allowing users to   carry out deep-learning operations without any significant   capital investment. What's more
column27: Tencenthas also decided to use NVIDIA's Tesla P100 and P40 GPU   accelerators to give artificial intelligence (AI) computing   capabilities to its enterprise customers
column28: giving the chipmaker   access to China's booming public cloud-infrastructure market.NVIDIA is targeting AI cloud computingAI cloud computing is fast gaining traction thanks to the   advent of the Internet of Things and connected cars that require   autonomous decision making based on data generated
column29: and NVIDIA   does not want to miss the gravy train. The chipmaker recently   partnered with Microsoft to bring to market a hyperscale GPU   accelerator aimed at AI cloud computing applications.NVIDIA and Microsoft expect their framework -- the HGX-1 -- to   be used in healthcare
column30: self-driving cars
column31: and voice recognition
column32: among others
column33: as it is positioned as the standard architecture   for AI cloud computing. The HGX-1 is based on an open-source
column34: modular design
column35: indicating that it is scalable in nature since it   comes with eight Tesla GPUs that can connect to the central   processing unit depending on the workload.NVIDIA has made a smart move by tying up with Microsoft to   develop an AI cloud computing solution as the latter's Azure   cloud service is growing at a faster pace than the market leader.   Amazon Web Services -- the e-commerce giant's cloud computing   services subsidiary -- is currently the market leader in this   space
column36: but Microsoft's Azure cloud could overtake it in a couple   of years according to aMorgan Stanleysurvey.In all
column37: NVIDIA's data center business has a lot of room for   growth as the company's GPUs will play a mission-critical role in   cloud computing thanks to the chipmaker's deep-learning and AI   capabilities. More important

column1: GameStop: Is This Game Still Worth Playing?;4/3/2017;"Recently
column2: GameStop Corp.(GME) has taken a beating in the market with the release of some very unflattering news. As we all know
column3: the stock market is a very unforgiving place.GameStop came across my radar a few years ago when I was doing my regular screening looking for new opportunities. Until recently
column4: I had not pulled the trigger on the company
column5: but after digging into it a little more it appeared to be a great opportunity. In the light of recent news
column6: I am wondering if I made a good decision or walked into a value trap.I admit I was first attracted to the 6% dividend yield
column7: which was very enticing. In addition to the low price-earnings (P/E) ratio as well as other financial strengths
column8: it appeared this was a great opportunity.makeArticleAd();In this article
column9: I will take a look at my findings again
column10: re-evaluate my decision to buy and whether or not to stay in at this point or to sell and just cut my losses.Retail is a brutal environment and the competition can be fierce. With the recent announcement ofMicrosoft Corp.'s (MSFT) Xbox's subscription service
column11: there has been a lot of concern among GameStop investors in how this will affect the company long term.Let's take a look.Business overviewFounded in 1994 in Grapevine
column12: Texas
column13: GameStop operates more than 7
column14: 600 stores now. These stores are located in the U.S.
column15: Australia
column16: Canada and Europe.Gamestop's primary business is selling new and used video game hardware and software. This includes accessories such as gaming consoles
column17: controllers
column18: headsets and memory cards.Segments:Source: GameStop Investor PresentationVideo Game Hardware/Software: 49.58%Preowned: 22.34%Accessories: 7.83%Digital: 1.87%Technology Brands: 8.4%Other: 2.96%Obviously
column19: videos make up a very large percentage of sales with the current numbers being 71.92% of its total sales.In recent years
column20: GameStop has attempted to diversify the business. It has branched out into the consumer electronics business by selling smartphones and tablets.In addition
column21: it launched Spring Mobile
column22: where it recently became the largest owner ofAT&T(T) wireless retail stores outside of AT&T.GameStop also partnered withApple(AAPL) to open 72 Simply Mac stores
column23: which serve as tech support outlets for Apple products.The company now has a goal of reducing its reliance on video game sales to less than 50% of revenue. The company stated in its most recent earnings call that revenue from technology and collectibles make up 39% of its sales. So it is not there yet
column24: but is on the way.In 2016
column25: the company saw non-physical gaming revenues of over $2 billion. So while GameStop has changed its focus
column26: it is still tied to the physical gaming hardware
column27: which is now an industry that is in decline.Source: GameStop Investor PresentationIn addition to the increase in revenue from sources other than video games
column28: the company recently announced it will be reducing the store count by 150 stores. By eliminating underperforming stores
column29: it will cut overheads and other costs. Thus far
column30: this has worked.This is not unlike other retail stores
column31: who are all reducing store counts. Even mightyWal-Mart(WMT) is lowering its store count.In addition
column32: GameStop also owns a diverse portfolio of video game websites such as Ebgames.com
column33: Kongragate.com and Thinkgeek.com.All the changes in direction are a recognition by management that changes are needed if the company is going to survive. And they are implementing them
column34: although maybe not as fast as some investors would like.Business analysisFirst
column35: let's take a look at some of the numbers that have driven the price down recently.Source: Intrinsic Value FormulaSource: Intrinsic Value FormulaWith the sales growth pretty stagnant for the last six years and free cash flow stagnant as well
column36: there has been an increase in earnings per share and free cash flow per share because of the very aggressive share buybacks that have been instituted.Source: Intrinsic Value FormulaAs the company has reduced the share count
column37: it has helped elevate the earnings per share and free cash flow per share
column38: even when the real dollar amounts have not grown that much.Other bad news came during the latest earnings release. It was revealed that same-store sales were down 16.3% for fourth-quarter 2016 and down 11% for fiscal 2016. In addition
column39: adjusted EPS were down 0.8% at $2.38 for fourth-quarter 2016 and down 3.3% at $3.77 for fiscal 2016.Additionally
column40: GameStop guided down for 2017 as well
column41: with sales estimated down 2% and same-store sales down 5% to even. Net income and earnings per share were guided down to $320 million and $3.10 respectively. Also guided down were video sales and hardware.The big news recently was Microsoft announced its new Game Pass
column42: which will allow users to access 100 of the most popular older Xbox One and Xbox 360 games for a $9.99 monthly subscription.In addition to this news
column43: subscribers will also be able to buy these games at a 20% discount to their retail price.Of course
column44: this will hit GameStop right in the bottom line because it generates over 30% of its gross profit from older game sales.We all know the video game industry is shifting away from physical games and toward downloads. With Microsoft andSony(SNE) moving toward subscription services
column45: this is no surprise.The surprise was that Wall Street reacted very badly to this news and the price dropped 10% the day of the announcement.Good newsThe Technology Brands segment achieved its goal of adjusted operating earnings for 2016. It came in at 90.2 million
column46: which was a 216% increase over 2015.In addition
column47: the Collectibles business was able to meet its revenue target of $494.1 million in 2016.As stated previously
column48: the company is moving toward a goal of earnings from businesses beyond physical games of 50%. In 2016
column49: it achieved non-physical gaming businesses comprising 36.9% of total adjusted operating earnings.GameStop also acquired 511 Technology Brands stores
column50: ending the year with 1
column51: 522 stores and as AT&T's largest authorized retailer.Technology's brand sales increased 52.4% for the full year. Adjusted operating earnings grew 216.4%.Other good news was the newNintendo(TSE:7974) Switch sold out in the three major shipments the company received in a matter of hours.This is a prospect most people have not considered. The impact of new hardware releases by Sony and Microsoft and what they could do for the company over the next few years.Gamers do not want to order new consoles online
column52: they want it now or on launch day. They would rather get it in store than risk waiting for it to be delivered.Key risksGameStop's race to reinvent itself is the biggest risk it faces. It is competing against bigger
column53: better-capitalized companies like Microsoft and Sony in the realm of digital video game sales and rentals.There is also the turnaround to consider. GameStop is branching out into businesses that are no-moat
column54: highly commoditized ones.Selling smartphones and tablets did not work out so well for Radio Shack
column55: who tried the same strategy before filing for bankruptcy.In addition
column56: its efforts with the collectibles division are going to run into difficulties when competing againsteBay(EBAY). It will not be able to achieve the same kinds of scale or network effects eBay enjoys.Plus
column57: its efforts to compete in the digital video game subscription platforms are going to run into trouble. Because of the size of its competitors
column58: GameStop's only avenue is to compete on price
column59: which lowers the profit margins and drives free cash flow down.All of these efforts could come at the cost of profitability
column60: which could be catastrophic in the long run.The decrease in profitability has pushed the company into increasing its debt to help fund some of the turnaround efforts. With its junk bond rating of BB in this rising rate environment
column61: it means any increase in debt becomes that much more expensive.GameStop's long-term success hinges on its ability to complete the turnaround it has begun. But with the increased reliance on debt to help fund that turnaround
column62: it has led to an increased risk profile for the company.As the earnings and cash flows continue to decline
column63: the company's current tactic of taking on more debt to fund its turnaround will result in continued deterioration of its balance sheet. This forces GameStop to pay 6% to 7% interest on its bonds because of its junk bond rating.If the interest rates continue to rise
column64: it could make it extremely difficult to execute its turnaround plans.The last risk is a major liability it faces every year
column65: which would be rent payments for the retail stores it leases. GameStop has paid over $380 million per year in rental expenses each of the last three years.These leases are non-cancellable agreements that will be a drag on its efforts to establish a turnaround.State of the dividendWithout a doubt
column66: the dividend is one of the more attractive aspects of GameStop.The company is currently offering a dividend with a yield of 7.29%
column67: which is a reflection of the depressed stock price. The rate of the dividend is $1.52 a year
column68: which is quite generous for a company this size.GameStop has raised its dividend every year since it started paying one in 2012. It has risen from 80 cents a share in 2012 to the current rate of $1.52 a share. Indeed
column69: GameStop has raised the dividend 10.4% over the last three years.Additionally
column70: the payout ratio for the dividend is 44%
column71: which is a comfortable number given the state of the company. This payout ratio gives some comfort that the dividend is in no immediate danger of being cut.One note to be aware of. As the earnings and free cash flow margins continue to be squeezed with the declining sales
column72: you will likely continue to see rising payout ratios
column73: which could spell trouble for the dividend.Right now the balance sheet is strong
column74: but it has taken some hits in the last few years. GameStop has sufficient cash on the balance sheet to continue paying the current dividend for two years.All these factors lead me to believe the dividend is now not in danger of being cut or suspended. But it is worth keeping an eye on until the turnaround shows more signs of being successful.ValuationThe past year has been brutal for GameStop with Wall Street just hammering the stock. Shares have dropped 21% for the year compared to the 17% increase experienced in the market.This has led to GameStop being one of the cheapest stocks on Wall Street
column75: both from a P/E and dividend yield perspective.The trailing 12-month P/E is 6.45
column76: which is substantially lower than itshistoricalP/E of 10.8. In fact
column77: it is now lower than 93% of all specialty retailers.Currently
column78: the dividend yield is 6.92%
column79: which is quite a bit higher than the company's historical yield of 3.1%. In fact
column80: it doubles its historical yield. Some of that
column81: of course
column82: is due to the recent drop in share price.According to GuruFocus
column83: using a DCF based on free cash flow yields a price of $52.32. A DCF based on earnings yields a price $36.39.Using the earnings based valuation would give you a 40% margin of safety.Final thoughtsThere are certainly quite a few points to be made for a bearish case for GameStop
column84: and I am cognizant of those and understand all the points.Certainly Wall Street reacted very violently to the negative news that came out during the most recent earnings call. In fact
column85: the day of the news reports
column86: the stock was down 12% at one point in the day. No one should have been surprised by these results as the sentiment surrounding the company was terrible going into the earnings call.Ironically
column87: it rallied a few days later and is back to $21.95. One wonders if it will continue to rally to its earlier heights. As recently as last November
column88: it took a similar dive only to rebound shortly thereafter.Some points to keep in mind when considering this stock. First
column89: the company does not need to expand and become the next retail giant. It just needs to continue to keep its cash flows intact and survive this turnaround.Second
column90: the turnaround is well under way with the recent news the company has begun the change from a video game retailer to a more diversified company.There has been a lot of focus on the very poor holiday sales the company reported
column91: but as someone so astutely reported
column92: GameStop experiences a holiday season whenever a new console is released. This makes GameStop much more cyclical than your typical retailer and could help explain the poor holiday season sales.This a profitable company that has demonstrated it is shareholder friendly with the continued buybacks and dividend increases.There is some concern about the dividend being unsustainable
column93: but the current strength of the balance sheet should allow the company to continue the current payout ratio.These are just a few of the reasons why I remain bullish on GameStop. I am long the company and believe in its efforts to adapt the company to its current situation.I am also humble enough to understand it faces an uphill battle. This will not be easy
column94: but I believe it will accomplish the goal.I know there is some concern GameStop is headed in the same direction as Blockbuster. while that is certainly a possibility
column95: I think we should look at GameStop on its merits and the many ways it is developing to unlock value for its shareholders.GameStop's future returns will consist of dividends and earnings growth.2% sales growth based on analysts' reports7% dividend yield1% earnings growth from share repurchasesThanks in large to its very high dividend yield
column96: GameStop could generate 10% annualized returns even with the very poor earnings growth projections.Although I am long the company
column97: I am not immune to some of the warning signs that are looming out there. I believe the company has begun a turnaround
column98: however
column99: which is already well under way.As the company's price continues to flounder
column100: I will take advantage of any dips to add to my position.Disclosure: I am long GameStop. This article was written by me
column101: but I am not receiving any compensation for its creation from GameStop.Start afree 7-day trial of Premium Membershipto GuruFocus.Warning! GuruFocus has detected 4 Warning Sign with ABBV. Click here to check it out.ABBV 15-Year Financial DataThe intrinsic value of ABBVPeter Lynch Chart of ABBVPremium MembersThis article first appeared onGuruFocus."

column1: Microsoft to Shut CodePlex to Focus on Cloud Opportunity;4/3/2017;"Microsoft Corporation'sMSFTvice president for Cloud Developer Services
column2: Brian Harry announced in a blog post that the company will pull the plug on CodePlex
column3: a website for code sharing and project hosting. The move comes in the wake of intensifying competition from GitHub
column4: spam epidemic and a decline in the number of users over the last 30 days.CodePlex has discontinued the creation of new projects on the platform. Moreover
column5: the website will become a read-only platform by October
column6: followed by a complete shutdown on Dec 15
column7: 2017.However
column8: before the shutdown and the decommissioning of the CodePlex platform
column9: Microsoft will take a complete and final backup of the site that will allow users to browse through the published projects.Although shares of Microsoft were up only marginally (+0.23%) on Friday following the announcement
column10: we note that
column11: shares of the company have underperformed the ZacksComputer - Softwareindustry over the last one year. While the industry gained 19.7%
column12: the stock registered growth of 19.0%.The underperformance of the stock could be due to stiff competition in the cloud space and the PC market.However
column13: we expect the stock to rebound in the rest of 2017 given such strategical moves being made from the company's end.Focus Remains on CloudWith Satya Nadella at the helm
column14: Microsoft remains focused on its ""cloud first
column15: mobile first"" motto and the recent announcement is another step in that direction. The CodePlex shutter indicatesMicrosoft's focus on growing its core businesses i.e. cloud and Office 365.We believe that Microsoft's partnership with GitHub allows the company free-up resources previously engaged with the CodePlex.Moreover
column16: many open source codes are now being built to work in the cloud architecture
column17: which could drive the demand for Microsoft's cloud platform Azure.Notably
column18: during the last reported quarter

column20: worldwide spending on public cloud is estimated to reach a whopping $203.4 billion by 2020 at a CAGR of 21.5%. We hope that Microsoft's increasing collaborations with open source providers will help it to become a dominant player in the long run.However

column1: Apple Inc. (AAPL) Will Develop Its Own iPhone Graphics Chip;4/3/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) already designs its own CPUs for the iPhone
column3: iPad and iPod Touch. AAPL licenses the iPhone's PowerVR GPU - graphics processing unit - from British chipmakerImagination Technologies(OTCMKTS:IGNMF).makeArticleAd();Source: AppleDespite the long-term relationship (and Apple owning a stake in the company)
column4: AAPL has decided to go it alone on the iPhone graphics chip. Imagination Technologies confirmed the bad news this morning
column5: triggering a panic sell-off that saw the company's shares plummet by over 60%.AAPL's Long Relationship with Imagination TechnologiesApple has been licensing the iPhone GPU from Imagination Technologies since 2008. Its dependence on the company to provide the iPhone graphics chip led Apple to boost its investment in its graphics partner to a 10% stake in 2009.In 2014
column6: it was announced thatApple had signed an extended deal with Imagination Technologies
column7: agreeing to continue using its PowerVR GPUs in iPhones for a multiyear period. As the British chipmaker's largest client
column8: this was a big deal.However
column9: despite the new licensing deal
column10: the relationship between the two companies began to deteriorate. Last year
column11: MacRumorsreported Apple confirmed it hadbeen in talks to acquire Imagination Technologiesoutright
column12: but decided to pass. From there
column13: AAPL began hiring talent from the chipmaker
column14: and was rumored to be establishing a UK office to develop its own iPhone graphics chip.Apple to Design Its Own iPhone Graphics ChipThose rumors became fact this morning when Imagination Technologiesposted a statementon its website confirming Apple's move:""Imagination Technologies Group … has been notified by Apple Inc. (""Apple"")
column15: its largest customer
column16: that Apple is of a view that it will no longer use the Group's intellectual property in its new products in 15 months to two years time
column17: and as such will not be eligible for royalty payments under the current license and royalty agreement.""The fallout was immediate
column18: with Imagination Technologies stock dropping over 68% within hours.Designing a new iPhone GPU from scratch will be a challenge - especially without running into IP issues and while using a team with members from AAPL's former long-term partner. Imagination Technologies notes this on its statement
column19: saying: ""Imagination believes that it would be extremely challenging to design a brand new GPU architecture from basics without infringing its intellectual property rights.""However
column20: Apple designs its own A-series CPUs for iOS devices
column21: usingARM Holdingstechnology. Its success on this front shows that AAPL engineers can build customized chips that compete with the best. Ditching PowerVR for its own in-house iPhone graphics chip could give Apple a significant edge over the Android competition using off-the-shelf GPUs.The Apple Effect Can Turn Around and Bite You…As Imagination Technologies is discovering
column22: working with AAPL can be risky. There is potential for huge rewards. But there is also the danger that Apple will decide technology is too important to be left with a third party and bring it in-house. Countless app developers have found this out the hard waywhen iOS gains new features that effectively replaces them.GT Advanced Technologies(OTCMKTS:GTATQ) has seen the dark side of the Apple Effect. That company was tapped by AAPL to manufacture sapphire crystals for future iPhone use. The Apple deal meant a huge ramp-up for mass production. Unable to meet AAPL's demands
column23: rather than celebrate a big payday
column24: the company was forced todeclare bankruptcy in 2014.Trade Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock Before Its Major RallyThe worst-case scenario here for Imagination Technologies is that Apple does go it alone and develops its own in-house iPhone graphics chip. Half of the company's revenue disappears within two years. The most positive read is one that was spiked out on today's statement:""Apple's notification has led Imagination to discuss with Apple potential alternative commercial arrangements for the current license and royalty agreement.""In other words
column25: for Imagination Technologies the best case scenario is renegotiating its deal
column26: convincing Apple to stay be offering more favorable terms.Squeezing its suppliersis another move AAPL is well known for and this movecouldbe just a bargaining tactic. Either way -designing its own iPhone GPU or continuing to use the PowerVR chip for less money- Apple comes out ahead. It always does…As of this writing

(AAPL) Will Develop Its Own iPhone Graphics Chipappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Himax Technologies History: Everything Investors Need to Know;4/2/2017;"Himax Technologies(NASDAQ: HIMX) has been publicly traded since 2006
column2: and since   then thefabless semiconductor companyhas experienced a few massive stock price run-ups and a few   substantial drops as well. Investors who bought Himax right   when the company went public have seen their investment gain just   over 4%.To find out how the company might perform in the near future   let's take a quick look at what's caused Himax's stock to pop --   and dip -- and if the company is likely to experience more of the   same going forward.Image source: Getty Images.makeArticleAd();Himax's share price historyAs you can see from the chart below
column3: Himax's share price   history has been on a wild ride since mid-2013
column4: after   experiencing a slow decline following its IPO.Himax's stock price began skyrocketing in 2013 on news thatAlphabet's(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) Google was implementing some of   Himax's technology into its ill-fated Google Glass device. Google   even took a 6.3% stake in the company at the time
column5: with the   option of grabbing 14.8% of Himax if wanted it -- which Google   eventually decided against .Image source:YCharts.During that time the company's stock hit an all-time high
column6: only to plummet after things with Google and its Glass device   didn't pan out.Then
column7: near the beginning of 2016
column8: investors started getting   excited about Himax's prospects in the AR space again
column9: this time   on hopes thatMicrosoft's(NASDAQ: MSFT) Hololens would bring Himax's share price huge   gains. Unfortunately
column10: the company faced a similar situation as in   the past when the Hololens failed to bring huge gains for Himax.   Investors began dumping the stock after a few analysts cut their   buy ratings on news that Hololens shipments were lower than   expected.Looking aheadMuch of Himax's prospects are being built around the company's   ability to supply technology for its AR customers. On Himax's   recent earning call
column11: CEO Jordan Wu said that
column12: Having invested in related technologies for over 15 years
column13: we are uniquely positioned as the provider of choice for micro     display and related optics
column14: both of which [are] critical     enablers to AR devices.The company is ramping up for more sales of its liquid   crystals on silicon (LCOS) and wafer-level optics (WLO)   products for AR devices after ramping up production for both   later this year and into 2018.Himax says that the ramp-up is because its AR customers are   looking to their next generation devices
column15: and that Himax's tech   will benefit from that. While this certainly could be true
column16: it   also feels a little like 2013 all over again. Betting on AR --   which is still an unproven market -- could take a long time to   pay off for the company.Northland Capital Markets' Tom Sepenzis wrote in a recent   investor note (republishedon Barron's):Augmented reality remains the largest potential for HIMX     with its LCOS and WLO products
column17: but the market has hit another     stumbling block as prices remain prohibitive for consumers. We     believe that this will limit the number of new AR devices for     the next 12-24 months....AR is expected to be worth $117 billion by 2022
column18: according to   Markets and Markets research. Investors can look to Himax's past   share price volatility and see that betting on this stock's AR   future can turn out badly. A better approach may be to wait a   little while longer and see if Himax's technology investments   bare some fruit later this year and next
column19: and then see how well   that positions the company in the AR space.Right now
column20: investing in Himax looks like a bet on both its   unproven prospects in ARandthat the augmented reality market will grow quickly. Himax's   history has shown that investors can easily get caught up in the   stock's future potential
column21: while disregarding the hurdles the   company faces.10 stocks we like better than Himax     TechnologiesWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: Will This Overlooked Cloud Stock Grow 60% by 2018?;4/1/2017;"Shares of cloud storage providerBox(NYSE: BOX) rallied 35% over the past 12 months
column2: but the stock   hovers just 18% above its IPO price of $14. That's because after   hitting $23 on its first trading day in Jan. 2015
column3: Box plunged   below $10 last February before gradually recovering to the   mid-teens.Despite that lackluster performance
column4: Drexel Hamilton analyst   Brian White recently reiterated his ""Buy"" rating on the stock and   his price target of $26 -- which  represents a near-60%   rally from its current price. White claims that Box looks cheap   with an EV/Sales ratio of 3.3 based on its calendar 2018 (fiscal   2019) expectations. Is that ""low"" valuation enough to justify   buying Box
column5: or should investors ignore this overlooked cloud   stock?Image source: Getty Images.makeArticleAd();What are Box's key strengths?Box provides cloud storage and associated services to over   71
column6: 000 businesses
column7: including the majority of the Fortune 500   companies. Its major customers include industrial behemothGeneral Electricand  pharmaceutical giantAstraZeneca. That market presence is impressive
column8: since the cloud storage   market is filled with bigger players likeAmazon(NASDAQ: AMZN)
column9: Microsoft(NASDAQ: MSFT)
column10: andAlphabet(NASDAQ: GOOGL) (NASDAQ: GOOG) 's Google.Despite those challenges
column11: Box has posted double-digit sales   growth ever since its IPO. Its revenue rose  32% to $398.6   million in fiscal 2017
column12: and it expects another 25%-26% growth   this year. Much of that growth comes from the addition of new   customers
column13: the introduction of add-on cloud services (like   security and analytics) which boost its revenue per customer
column14: and   integration partnerships with companies like Microsoft
column15: Salesforce
column16: andIBM. Deferred revenue
column17: a key indicator of forward demand
column18: rose 30%   to $242 million at the end of fiscal 2017.What are Box's key weaknesses?Like many high-growth tech companies
column19: Box's robust revenue   growth doesn't trickle down to any profits. However
column20: its non-GAAP   loss narrowed from $1.16 per share in 2016 to $0.56. During that   period
column21: its GAAP loss narrowed from $1.67 to $1.19. That GAAP   loss was heavily weighed down by stock-based compensation   expenses
column22: which gobbled up 20% of Box's revenues during the   year.Wall Street expects Box to report non-GAAP losses this yearandnext year -- although those losses are expected to continue   narrowing. Box faces a dilemma which many cloud SaaS (software as   a service) companies face -- competition keeps price expectations   low
column23: but the cost of securing new customers and developing new   services remains high. We can clearly see that impact in its   operating margins:Source:YChartsThe ongoing cloud storage pricing war  between Amazon
column24: Microsoft
column25: and Google limits Box's ability to raise prices.   However
column26: all three companies can afford to use cloud storage   services as a loss leader to expand their ecosystems. Box has   neither the scale nor ecosystem to follow suit -- so it could   eventually lose customers to those tech giants' bundling   strategies.Box finished 2017 with a negative free cash flow (FCF) of   $24.8 million. That marked a big improvement from its negative   FCF of $116.3 million in 2016
column27: and Box achieved its first quarter   of positive free cash flow ($10.2 million) during the fourth   quarter. However
column28: Box isn't expected to achieve a full-year   positive FCF anytime soon
column29: and a negative FCF could prevent Box   from scaling up to widen its moat against bigger challengers.What do the valuations say?Drexel Hamilton's bullish view on Box is based on the notion   that an EV/Sales ratio of 3.3 is cheap for a company with its   growth figures. For example
column30: two other high-growth cloud service   stocks withcomparable sales growth--TwilioandVeeva-- have respective EV/Sales ratios of 4.6 and 8.2 based on   next year's projected revenues. It's also lower than the current   industry average of 4.8 for application software makers.Assuming that Box is ""fairly valued"" with an EV/Sales ratio   between Twilio and Veeva's
column31: it's certainlypossiblethat Box could rise to White's price target of $26. However
column32: what   bothers me about that estimate is that it's based on a long-range   forecast
column33: and a lot can change in the cloud storage industry   within two years. If Amazon
column34: Microsoft
column35: and Google continue   slashing prices and piling on more features
column36: Box could struggle   to retain its top customers.The key takeawayI think Box has solid sales growth
column37: and its growing list of   big enterprise customers indicate that it has a lot of staying   power. It also did a great job at adding more services and   partnerships
column38: narrowing its losses
column39: and achieving positive free   cash flow last quarter.However
column40: claiming Box can rise 60% based on next year's sales   estimates is a bit too optimistic. It's hard to tell how much   storage prices will fall over the following year
column41: and Box CEO   Aaron Levie even once admitted that  cloud storage would   likely be ""free and infinite"" in the future. Therefore
column42: investors   should temper their expectations for Box based on future   developments across the cloud market.10 stocks we like better than BoxWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column43: it can pay to listen. After all
column44: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade

column1: The King of Beers Joins the Renewable Energy Bandwagon;4/1/2017;"As politicians and interest groups debate the future of   climate change policies and renewable energy mandates across the   country
column2: a big power in the world of energy is making its   strategy well-known. The business community has made a big   commitment to transform their businesses to renewable energy
column3: which is now driving wind and solar investment around the   world.The latest to make a 100% renewable electricity commitment isAnheuser-Busch InBev(NYSE: BUD)
column4: the world's biggest beer maker
column5: which said on   Monday that it will make the transition by 2025. Make no mistake
column6: AB-InBev isn't suddenly an environmentally focused company.   They're making an economic decision to buy renewable energy. It's   a trend the corporate world is taking very seriously.Image source: Getty Images.makeArticleAd();AB-InBev's renewable playBelow is the infographic AB-InBev used to announce its   renewable energy commitment. It highlights the move from 7%   renewable energy to 100% by 2025 and shines a light on Mexico as   a focus.Image source: AB-InBev.The Mexico announcement is interesting because the country   held two renewable energy auctions in 2016 that got very   favorable terms. A year ago
column7: bids were announced at 5.07 cents   per kilowatt-hour (kWh) of electricity and by October bids   averaged 3.35 cents per kWh for clean energy. This compares to   average retail electricity prices of about 12 cents per kWh
column8: so   renewable energy is very economical for big companies.And these projects will be completed by the end of the decade
column9: so the price AB-InBev will pay by 2025 will be lower than the   contracts signed in 2016. In total
column10: the announcement says some 6   terawatt-hours
column11: or around 3 gigawatts (GW) of solar
column12: will produce   energy for AB-InBev.Corporate America loves renewable energyAB-InBev isn't the first company to take interest in renewable   energy. In the U.S.
column13: Target(NYSE: TGT) andWal-Mart(NYSE: WMT) are the two biggest corporate solar users
column14: with 147.5   MW and 145.0 MW
column15: respectively
column16: according toSEIA's Solar Means Business 2016 report.Microsoft(NASDAQ: MSFT) says it has been100% powered by renewable energy since 2014andAlphabet's(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) Google says it willreach that level in 2017.Companies aren't just looking at renewable energy as a PR   move; they're looking at it as a way to save money. Target   and Wal-Mart are primarily installing solar directly on their   rooftops
column17: reducing electricity bills from the utility. And data   centers byApple(NASDAQ: AAPL)
column18: Microsoft
column19: and Alphabet are now installing   renewable energy nearby so they can use renewable energy   directly. Apple has co-located nearly 100 MW of solar at data   centers in North Carolina and Nevada with another 100 MW in   development. Microsoft recently signed a deal to buy energy from   237 MW of wind farms in Wyoming and Kansas to power a Wyoming   data center. Alphabet has invested $2.5 billion in renewable   energy projects to power its business. This is becoming big   business for wind and solar companies.Corporate buys are the new renewable driverFor over a decade
column20: renewable energy has been driven by   mandates and subsidies around the world
column21: and in many places
column22: it   still is today. But costs have come down so far that corporations   are now looking at it as a way to save money on their operations   long-term. And that'll only drive more wind and solar   installations as more companies join the renewable energy   bandwagon.10 stocks we like better than Anheuser-Busch InBev     NVWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column24: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade

column1: This Top Stock Mutual Fund Cheers Retirement Investors With Gains;3/31/2017;"A tail wind has kicked up this calendar year behind $7.5   billion American Century Growth Fund (TWCGX). That's nice news for investors holding the fund inretirement accountsand other portfolios. The fund's 9.93% gain this year going   into Thursday topped 73% of the fund's large-cap growth rivals   tracked by Morningstar Inc. That's a step up from the 67% of   peers the fund outperformed over the trailing 12 months with a   16.40% return.Managers Gregory Woodhams and Justin Brown pick stocks   individually and not based on sectors
column2: but their sector weights   show where they expect to find leaders. Technology was their top   sector as of Jan. 31
column3: with a 34% weighting. Consumer   discretionary was next with 20%.Tech titansAlphabet(GOOGL)
column4: Apple(AAPL) andMicrosoft(MSFT) - the fund's first
column5: third and fifth largest holdings   - illustrate that appetite. Alphabet is up 7% so far this   year. Apple is up 24%. Microsoft is up 5%. Together they   account for about 14% of the fund's assets.makeArticleAd();Several top new buys as of Dec. 31 also belonged to the tech   sector. Among those was chipmakerBroadcom(AVGO)
column6: which is up 25% so far this year. The stock has a   highest-possible Comp Rating of 99.IBD'S TAKE:Broadcom is ranked No. 1 in the No. 37-rated     Electronics-Semiconductor Fabless industry group. It has four     quarters in a row of accelerating earnings per share growth.     See how its additional easy-to-understanding fundamental and     technical data stack up against rivals' atIBD's Stock Checkup.Another top new buy wasActivision Blizzard(ATVI)

column10: meaning that you had   to own shares before that to be eligible for its dividend. Its   dividend yield Monday was 0.6%.A negative: EPS growth has decelerated for two quarters
column11: from   315% to 152% and 11%. Analysts see EPS falling 9% in the current   quarter and 11% this year
column12: and then rising 21% in 2018
column13: in line   with its three-year growth rate.Financials were just the fund's sixth-largest sector
column14: with a   modest 4% weighting. One of those wasCitizens Financial(CFG)
column15: a top new buy whose EPS growth has accelerated for three   quarters in a row.Still
column16: the stock is down 3% this year after tumbling 13%   off its March 1 high. That pullback along with the broad market   reflects investors' concerns that Congress' failure to revise or   kill ObamaCare is a sign that additional Trump initiatives
column17: such   as corporate and individual tax cuts and lighter regulatory   burdens for banks
column18: may not be as likely as investors had   hoped.Shares ofCitrix Systems(CTXS)
column19: yet another newcomer to the portfolio
column20: surged March 13 on   rumors of a company sale. The company's business   software creates work spaces that provide access to   desktops
column21: apps
column22: data and communications on any device
column23: over   networks and in the cloud.As IBD recently reported
column24: Citrix has been pressured by activist   investor Elliott Management to make changes. On Feb. 1
column25: Citrix completed its spinoff of its GoToMeeting   business
column26: which then merged withLogMeIn(LOGM).GoToMeeting is a conferencing application that allows remote   access to personal computers.Citrix shares are up 20% this year. The cloud computing   company's most recent EPS report was for Q4
column27: in January.   It earned $1.61 a share on sales of $908 million. That   topped consensus for EPS of $1.50 and revenue of $900.8 million.   But the $1.61 was a decline of 3%.The company forecast 2017 EPS of $4.60-$4.65 and revenue of   $2.81 billion to $2.84 billion. Both are well below consensus for   $5.60 EPS and sales of $3.55 billion
column28: but Citrix's guidance   excludes GoToMeeting.VMware(VMW) is another new buy for the fund. The server virtualization   leader is up 17% this year. EPS grew 0%
column30: 12% and 13% the past   four quarters.VMware paid $1.3 billion to buy Niciria
column31: a software-defined   networking company
column32: three years ago. VMware said recently it   expects $1 billion in sales of NSX
column33: made possible by that   acquisition. NSX lets companies update networks through software   changes rather than the more costly path of replacing routers and   switching hardware.NSX is a challenge toCisco Systems'(CSCO) flagship networking software product
column34: called Application   Centric Infrastructure (ACI).In the consumer discretionary sector
