column1: Advanced Micro Devices
column2: Inc. (AMD) Stock Is a Rotten Apple;3/31/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsWithout a doubt
column4: if ever there was a candidate for a ""Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde"" stock
column5: it would beAdvanced Micro Devices
column6: Inc. (NASDAQ:AMD).makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockNot long ago
column7: on a CNBC roundtable segment
column8: an analyst proposed a ""buy"" recommendation on AMD stock. The other pundits laughed. And then they laughed some more. When the humor appeared to fade
column9: they laughed again
column10: just for good measure.It took a while
column11: but the joke was ultimately on the naysayers. Last year was a stunning turnaround for Advanced Micro Devices. From start to finish
column12: AMD stock returned long-suffering shareholders more than 300% in profits.To put that into perspective
column13: 2016 was the biggest year in its publicly traded existence. More impressively
column14: AMD eclipsed the performance of 2009
column15: when several stocks were clawing back from 2008's devastation.What's particularly endearing for both present stakeholders and prospective buyers is that Advanced Micro Devices is not slowing down. For 2017
column16: AMD stock is up just shy of 30%. That's enough for a very solid year for most people's portfolios.In fact
column17: if it keeps up this work rate
column18: AMD could challenge for yet another triple-digit return. That would make consecutive triple-digit returns
column19: something that hasn't happened for AMD stock since 1982 and 1983.Although the prospect for a history-making event is extremely enticing for investors
column20: we also have to remember the risks. Advanced Micro Devices has long played second-fiddle toIntel Corporation(NASDAQ:INTC) for a reason. It also gave a foothold for semiconductor rivals likeNvidia Corporation(NASDAQ:NVDA).The question is
column21: which AMD will show up this time around?Many Reasons to Love AMD StockCertainly
column22: I can respect the idea of Advanced Micro Devices pulling off another upset.It's running high on momentum
column23: and sometimes
column24: that's all you really need.But as InvestorPlace writer Tom Taulli asserts
column25: other substantive factors are working in favor of AMD stock.The 7 Best Stocks to Buy for an Income-Rich RetirementHaving a strong business is all about people. And AMD has apowerhouse leadership
column26: starting from the top. At the helm is CEO Lisa Su
column27: a phenomenal executive who has a doctorate's degree in electrical engineering from MIT. She has also served in high-level positions at renowned firmsFreescale Semiconductor Ltd(NYSE:FSL) andInternational Business Machines Corp. (NYSE:IBM).Along with great people are products. Historically
column28: this is one area that has tripped up AMD stock. Although
column29: it's always been cheaper in price compared to rival Intel's offerings
column30: AMD semiconductors have wrestled with the quality stigma.The company hopes to change that with itsRyzen CPUseries. Imbued with the latest technological firepower
column31: it can legitimately challenge Intel for the throne. True to its heritage
column32: the AMD units are priced lower than the competition. As Su succinctly states
column33: ""More performance
column34: half the price.""Finally
column35: the broader fundamentals are supportive of AMD stock. The supply glut that gutted the semiconductor industry is easing
column36: facilitating recoveries of left-for-dead tech firms.Don't Look Under the Hood!As great as the bullish argument for AMD stock is
column37: I still have my doubts. No one doubts the abilities of Advanced Micro Devices' CEO
column38: but Su is a genius
column39: not a miracle worker. In this case
column40: the problem is bigger than her or anyone else.Last time around
column41: I mentioned that AMD stock has shifted from onestate of distressto another. This assessment was based on the venerable Altman Z-Score indicator. And although it's improving in this department
column42: AMD has been distressed for the past six consecutive years.But the fine print is in which specific factors AMD is improving
column43: and not improving. TheZ-Scoreis aggregated from a list of five factors. By far
column44: the largest improvement is in the ratio between ""market value of equity"" and ""book value of total liabilities."" Although important
column45: this doesn't tell us much about company performance.What's Driving the Increase in Amazon.com
column46: Inc. (AMZN) Stock?What does illuminate performance are the Z-Score's earnings and sales generation factors. For both metrics
column47: AMD stock is still considered distressed. That likely won't change until the semiconductor firm can address the deep-seated problems that got it in trouble initially.As a small caveat
column48: I do think that the recovery in AMD stock is nothing short of remarkable. It might have some legs to go a little bit further. But to stake a major position on the back of exceptionally poor fundamentals? I'm crazy
column49: but I'm notthatcrazy.As of this writing
column50: Josh Enomoto did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace4 Tech Stocks That Are Breaking Out (Or Will Soon)10 Stocks You'd Be Foolish to Buy Right NowMicrosoft Corporation (MSFT) Will Sell You a Galaxy S8The postAdvanced Micro Devices

column1: AT&T Inc. (T) Stock Wins Contract to Build Network for First Responders;3/31/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsIf you're anAT&T Inc.(NYSE:T) stakeholder of any stripe
column3: you're either about to see your wallet get fatter and/or your connection get faster.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockWhile you might not have noticed by the less-than-rousing 60-basis-point gain
column4: AT&T scored a decisive victory Thursday - the FirstNet contract
column5: a 700 MHz LTE network to be used exclusively by our nation's first responders.The company plans to spend $40 billion (not including the $7 billion federal grant) over the life of the contract - 25 years - and will commercialize the spectrum along with four partners:Motorola Solutions Inc(NYSE:MSI)
column6: Sapient Corp
column7: General Dynamics Corporation(NYSE:GD) andInmarsat Plc
column8: London.Bernstein analysts including Pierre Ferragu see this as mostly bullish for all involved.Here's why:What Is FirstNet?FirstNet was first proposed after Sept. 11
column10: as a national wireless broadband network for police
column11: firefighters and all first responders of the United States. As Commerce Secretary Wilbur Rossput it
column12: it ""will change an untenable status quo by providing first responders with the tools they need to keep us safe"" and serves as a ""prime example"" of the power of partnerships between the government and the private sector.10 Stocks You'd Be Foolish to Buy Right NowWhen implemented
column13: FirstNet would free first responders from the tangles of everyday network congestion
column14: which is widely thought to have contributed to the chaos on the ground among rescuers during the Sept. 11 attacks. AT&T CEO and Board Chair Randall Stephenson has said that ""our first responders … deserve the very best technology"" and it's up to his company and ragtag assortment of telecoms to get it there.While initially recommended in 2004
column15: the legislation that got FirstNet off the ground began in 2012
column16: and it allows states the option to build their own networks. To work properly
column17: FirstNet would need state participation … and states can choose to opt out. And as theWall Street Journalwrites
column18: a""politically connected startup"" that lost out on the contract in favor of AT&T is lobbying to coerce states to do just that.Still
column19: the buildout of such an initiative is expected to create10
column20: 000 jobsover two years. This huge investment in the communications infrastructure in the U.S. will
column21: in theory
column22: aid 320 million people. It's a chintzy feather in the Donald Trump administration's cap
column23: and something we're likely to see President Trump himself trotting around the media.But what's in it for AT&T Inc. and T stock holders?What AT&T Gets Out of ItIn its fully functional form
column24: FirstNet seeks to be self-funded by subscription fees from the first responders themselves
column25: and subsidized through the sale of leftover spectrum by T to private companies. And AT&T gets some huge pieces of spectrum toplay around with
column26: including $6.5 billion toward its construction (awarded out as milestone-payments over five years).It's a blow toVerizon Communications Inc.(NYSE:VZ)
column27: as AT&T will have 25 MHz of spectrum allowed for use within its own commercial network
column28: yielding speedier connections for the telecom's customers and a solid marketing pitch to boot. That goes a long way toward attracting fresh blood to the T stock ecosystem.Further
column29: AT&T will be able to connect FirstNet users with its own network assets
column30: a value of $180 billion.AT&T's networkshould also provide""near real-time information on traffic conditions to determine the fastest route to an emergency
column31: and will facilitate the use of wearables and drones to capture high-quality
column32: real-time images of emergencies
column33: such as fires or floods. That could potentially widen the revenue streams for the telecom's own wearables.So if this is such good news for T stock holders then why did T stock react like a fish flopping around a wooden deck? Because it was already ""widely anticipated
column34: as Bernstein put it. It's not
column35: however
column36: a certainty that the FirstNet rollout goes over smoothly.Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Will Sell You a Galaxy S8Still
column37: it's a solid victory for AT&T
column38: and doubly so for the much-smaller MSI
column39: which Bernstein sees as reaping the most reward:""… this is positive news for our space - Important questions are still pending about the magnitude of the upside
column40: its timing and how it will flow through to our three companies. At this stage we see MSI as the most positively impacted
column41: closely followed byEricsson(NASDAQ:ERIC) and thenNokia Corp (ADR)(NYSE:NOK) as a likely third beneficiary
column42: although by a less certain and lower magnitude.""T stock is up 17 basis points Friday morning
column43: but still down 1.5% for the year. That said
column44: you could do a lot worse than this telecom right now.As of this writing

column1: Dividend Smackdown: IBM Stock vs MSFT Stock;3/31/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsRing the bell because it's that time again. We're putting two iconic dividend payers in the ring for an old-school dividend smackdown. The fighters: Two old-school tech giants
column3: Microsoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) andInternational Business Machines Corp.(NYSE:IBM).makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockAt first this might seem like a bout between two washed up has-beens. Both of these companies are ancient by tech company standards
column4: and neither gets the headlines they used to. Yet longevity in the tech space is something to take seriously. If you're able to survive decades in an industry known for rapid upheaval
column5: you're clearly doing something right.Yet no fighter's streak lasts forever. Even Mike Tyson eventually got knocked out
column6: by underdog Buster Douglas. And in our match today
column7: one company is well into a bona fide comeback
column8: whereas the other is at risk of getting knocked out … permanently.So with that
column9: let's go ringside in this battle between IBM stock and MSFT stock starting with the current dividend yield.Dividend YieldIn a world where theS&P 500yields just 1.9%
column10: both Microsoft and IBM have to be considered relatively high-yield stocks. Microsoft stock sports a dividend yield of 2.4% and IBM 3.2%. So
column11: in a head-to-head match up
column12: IBM is clearly the higher yielder.The 7 Best Stocks to Buy for an Income-Rich RetirementFurthermore
column13: at first glance
column14: IBM's dividend would appear to be more sustainable. IBM stock is only paying out 44% of current earnings per share
column15: whereas MSFT is payout out a much higher 69%.So
column16: in round one of this dividend smackdown
column17: we have a clear winner: Big Blue.Dividend Yield Winner:IBMDividend GrowthFor round two
column18: let's take a look at dividend growth. After all
column19: the current dividend yield only gets you so far
column20: as a dividend stock without a growing dividend is essentially just a riskier version of a bond. A good dividend stock should have both a respectable current yield and a dividend growth rate well in excess of inflation.Click to EnlargeWell
column21: both of our fighters qualify here. Microsoft has raised its dividend for 13 consecutive years
column22: and IBM has raised its dividend for 17.Over the past 10 years
column23: both stocks have been aggressive dividend raisers
column24: but one has clearly taken the lead. Microsoft has raised its payout by a cumulative 300%
column25: which would crush nearly any competitor other than IBM. Big Blue has managed to raise its dividend a cumulative 400%.Over the past five years
column26: MSFT stock has the edge
column27: beating out IBM stock by a cumulative 125% to 87%. But in round two
column28: I'm going to have to give the edge to IBM.Dividend Growth Winner:IBMFuture ProspectsThus far
column29: it has been a lopsided contest
column30: with IBM taking the first two rounds. So is the match over? Or is Microsoft about to mount a comeback worthy of Rocky Balboa?Let's take a look.Both companies are undergoing transformations of sorts.With sales of personal computers in a multi-year slump
column31: Microsoft is eager to move past the PC era to become a ""cloud and services"" company. Likewise
column32: IBM is transitioning away from its traditional business of selling hardware with long-term service contracts to companies and is instead focusing on growth in cloud services and analytics. Interestingly
column33: this means that these two companies - which have mostly operated in different  realms in their respective histories - are now increasingly direct competitors.The transition to the cloud has been disruptive to both companies
column34: but it's been particularly brutal for IBM. IBM has seen its revenues drop for19 consecutive quarters. That's just shy of five complete years of falling year-over-year sales. At this point
column35: you would expect to see sales grow
column36: if only because the comparable sales from the previous year were so horrendously bad. Yet IBM's sales continue to sag.4 Things Every Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Owner Should Worry AboutSo
column37: if revenues are falling … where is IBM getting the cash to fund its dividend?Unfortunately
column38: by borrowing it. IBM's long-term debt is up by 50% since 2011. It's also aggressively repurchasing shares
column39: and every share that is buys back is a share for which it doesn't have to pay a dividend. While that works as a short-term solution
column40: it's hardly a long-term plan. So unless sales recover in a hurry
column41: IBM stock is going to be on the ropes.Microsoft has had some revenue issues of its own
column42: as lack of PC sales growth has affected licensing revenues from Windows and Office. But Microsoft's cloud business has been unstopable
column43: and Microsoft is now considered by many to be second only toAmazon.com
column44: Inc.'s(NASDAQ:AMZN) AWS as a cloud services provider.Future Prospects Winner:MSFTBottom Line: MSFT Stock WinsMicrosoft comes from behind and delivers a devastating blow to IBM
column45: winning the final round … and the match.IBM looks better on paper
column46: with a higher dividend yield and higher dividend growth over the past 10 years. But IBM's business is suffering
column47: whereas Microsoft has already essentially done the hard work of reinventing itself.Charles Sizemore is the principal ofSizemore Capital
column48: a wealth management firm in Dallas
column49: Texas.More From InvestorPlaceThe 7 Best Dividend Stocks to Buy for the Second Quarter7 Dividend Stocks With Yields That Grow Like Weeds10 Safe Dividend Stocks to Own During the Next Market CrashThe postDividend Smackdown: IBM Stock vs MSFT Stockappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Bear of the Day: Gamestop (GME);3/31/2017;"makeZacksArticleAd();Gamestop Corporation(GME) continues to see a decline in same-store sales as sales of physical video games slide. This Zacks Rank #5 (Strong Buy) is closing 150 stores as it tries to cope.GameStop operates more than 7

column5: 522 Simply Mac
column6: Spring Mobile AT&T and Cricket stores.Terrible Holiday Quarter ResultsOn Mar 23

column8: reporting $2.38 versus the Consensus of $2.29.But that really wasn't the full story.The video game business continued to be weak. Total global sales fell 13.6% to $3.05 billion

column21: giving a range of -5% to 0.0%.Earnings are seen in the range of $3.10 to $3.40
column22: which was under consensus. As a result
column23: the analysts have been cutting 2017 estimates.The Zacks Consensus Estimate for fiscal 2017 has sunk to $3.25 from $3.90 in the last 90 days. That's an earnings decline of 13.7% as the company earned $3.77 last year.Shares SinkNot surprisingly

column25: actually
column26: cheap
column27: with a forward P/E of just 6.7.But the video game industry is changing. It's always risky for investors to be in industries with technology disruptions.If you want to invest in gaming

column29: instead. Best Buy is a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy) and Microsoft is a #3 (Hold).More Stock News: This Is Bigger than the iPhone!It could become the mother of all technological revolutions. column1: Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Will Sell You a Galaxy S8;3/31/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsThe big news this week was theSamsung Electronics Co Ltd(OTCMKTS:SSNLF) special event where theGalaxy S8 was finally launched.Microsoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) would like to sell you one.makeArticleAd();Source: SamsungNo
column3: not a Windows smartphone - although it still has a few of those gathering dust in its stores. Instead the company appears to be making the most of a bad situation by offering aMicrosoft Edition Galaxy S8in its stores.These versions of the Galaxy S8 will get loaded up with MSFT apps so that even if they aren't running Windows
column4: they're at least being used with Microsoft services.Windows Smartphone Ambitions Are in TroubleMicrosoft had grand plans for Windows smartphones. It bought the smartphone business fromNokia Corp (ADR)(NYSE:NOK) and released Windows 10 Mobile
column5: an ambitious operating system that brought much of the desktop Windows experience to smartphones. Neither of those moves have paid off
column6: though. The company eventually took a$7.6 billion write-offand laid off 7
column7: 800 phone business workers because of the Nokia venture.10 Stocks You'd Be Foolish to Buy Right NowMSFT has done little to convince consumers to buy a Windows smartphone
column8: not bothering to compete against Samsung orApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) on hardware. And Windows 10 Mobile has failed to capture its own die-hard audience as Apple and Google have with iOS and Android
column9: respectively.At this point
column10: Windows has dropped to a 0.3% shareof the smartphone market
column11: with MSFT selling just over one million Windows smartphones in Q4 2016 - down from about 4.4 million the year before.Earlier this week
column12: even as Samsung wasannouncing the Galaxy S8
column13: Verizon Communications Inc.(NYSE:VZ)pulled the Lumia 735off store shelves. This means the carrier no longer offers any Windows smartphone options.Is the Microsoft Edition Galaxy S8 a Solution?Microsoft has been pushing the importance of services
column14: and having its solutions available everywhere - whether that's Office on an iPad or Skype on an Android smartphone.When Samsung announced the Galaxy S8
column15: MSFT was there the next day promoting a customized Microsoft Edition Galaxy S8. Quoted inThe Verge
column16: a Microsoft spokesperson explained what this is
column17: exactly:""A Microsoft customization is applied to the Samsung Galaxy S8 and Galaxy S8+ Microsoft Edition when the devices are unboxed and connected to Wi-Fi. This customization ensures customers a best-in-class productivity experience with Microsoft applications such as Office
column18: OneDrive
column19: Cortana
column20: Outlook and more.""Confusing the situation slightly is the fact thatallGalaxy S8 phones will come bundled with basic Microsoft apps - Samsung and Microsoft have been doing that since the Galaxy S6. The Microsoft Edition Galaxy S8 is available for pre-order
column21: but only at Microsoft stores. Not online. And the cost will be the regular retail price for the Galaxy S8.So no special paint job or visual difference compared to a regular Galaxy S8
column22: no price discount and just a few additional apps that anyone can download to the Galaxy S8 on their own if they choose to do so. And you end up with three virtual assistants competing for your attention: Android's Google Assistant
column23: Samsung's Bixby and Microsoft's Cortana.Bottom Line on the Microsoft Edition Galaxy S8Why Bother?The move will get those Microsoft apps in a prominent position on a few more Android smartphones. column1: Is Amazon Following Microsoft's Lead in Augmented Reality?;3/31/2017;"Amazon(NASDAQ: AMZN) could be developing augmented reality (or AR)   features for its own chain of homewares stores
column2: according toThe New York Times. The report
column3: which cites a source ""briefed in the discussions
column4: indicates that shoppers at Amazon's brick-and-mortar homewares   stores could use devices or apps to ""project"" home furnishings   into digital images of their actual living rooms.This idea isn't really new. Back in 2013
column5: IKEAlaunched an  AR app which let customers project furniture   into their living rooms via a smartphone camera. Last year
column6: home   improvement retailerLowe's(NYSE: LOW) installedMicrosoft's(NASDAQ: MSFT) HoloLens mixed reality headset at  select   stores to let shoppers design virtual rooms.Image source: Getty Images.makeArticleAd();However
column7: Amazon's AR plans coincide with its recent moves into   the brick-and-mortar space with test bookstores
column8: grocery stores
column9: and now rumored homewares stores. Let's see what that push means   for Amazon
column10: and how it could boost demand for Microsoft's   HoloLens and holographic apps.What is Amazon up to?Amazon's brick-and-mortar expansion might seem   counterproductive
column11: since its online marketplace is forcing many   brick-and-mortar retailers to shutter stores and invest more   heavily in e-commerce. However
column12: Wal-Mart(NYSE: WMT) has proven that some customers still prefer placing   orders online and picking them up immediately to avoid wait times   and shipping fees.To cut overhead costs
column13: Amazon's grocery store model uses    a ""just walk out"" system called Amazon Go. The store tracks   the items taken by the customer and charges their Amazon accounts   once they walk out -- eliminating the need for checkout lines and   cashiers. Its bookstores offer special discounts to Prime   members
column14: and offers self-checkout via  the Amazon app.For the rumored homewares push
column15: the idea will likely be the   same -- to offer self-checkout for smaller items
column16: delivery for   larger items
column17: and discounts for Prime members. Assuming that you   have pictures of your living room
column18: you can potentially project   the home furnishings into your home like the IKEA app.Since these brick-and-mortar stores all give preferential   treatment to Prime members
column19: that expansion can boost the growth   of the Prime ecosystem. Last June
column20: research firm CIRP estimated   that  Amazon had 63 million Prime members in the U.S.
column21: a 19   million increase from a year earlier. It also estimated that the   average Prime member spent $1
column22: 200 annually at Amazon
column23: while   non-members spent just $500.Making sense of Amazon's AR investmentsThis isn't Amazon's first move into the AR market. However
column24: its previous moves have been all over the map. In late 2015
column25: it   patented an AR projection system
column26: similar to  Microsoft's   IllumiRoom
column27: which ""transformed"" living rooms into completely   different
column28: interactive environments. For example
column29: a user could   theoretically tap the wall and turn it into a TV screen
column30: or tap   the desk to open an e-book.Last year
column31: Amazon offered jobs for a virtual reality team. It   didn't say  much about the team's goals
column32: except that it   would focus on a platform for ""immersive storytelling"". Analysts   and investors speculated that Amazon could apply VR to games on   the Fire TV
column33: or add VR viewing options to Amazon Video. However
column34: the recent report about AR homewares indicates that the team   might actually be developing new AR features for the Amazon app   to enhance the shopping experience at its brick-and-mortar   stores.What does this mean for Microsoft and the AR     market?Amazon's rumored AR app or homewares stores might never see   the light of day
column35: since the company hasn't publicly said anything   about them yet. But Amazon's interest might get other retailers   interested in using AR tools in brick-and-mortar stores.A HoloLens demo at Lowe's. Image source: Lowe's.That would be great news for Microsoft
column36: since the HoloLens is   the most mature ""mixed reality"" headset today. The upcoming   Windows 10 Creators Update
column37: which will add easy-to-use   holographic tools for developers
column38: could also  make it much   easier for retailers to build custom apps for the HoloLens   without Microsoft's help. This wouldn't only apply to big box   retailers like Lowe's --Volvois also using the HoloLens in dealerships to let customers   virtually view cars which aren't in stock.Is augmented reality the next big thing?It's hard to tell if Amazon and Microsoft's early AR moves   into the retail space will ignite a major shift in how stores   showcase their products. However
column39: tech M&A advisory firm   Digi-Capital estimates that  the AR market will grow from   nearly nothing today to $90 billion by 2020
column40: with much of that   growth generated by sales of AR hardware
column41: e-commerce uses
column42: and   enterprise applications.If companies like Amazon and Microsoft lead this charge
column43: we   could see mainstream interest in AR evolve beyond early efforts   like Google Glass andPokemon Gotoward shopping apps. That shift could blur the lines between   ""showrooming"" and online purchases
column44: which could help tech giants   like Amazon straddle both markets.10 stocks we like better than MicrosoftWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column45: it can pay to listen. After all
column46: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade

That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even     better buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of February 6

column1: Why Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Is Still a Value Play;3/30/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsGotham Asset Management co-founder Joel Greenblatt certainly thinksApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) provides good value for buyers of AAPL stock.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockIn a recentinterview
column3: Greenblatt talked about how expensive the markets are at the present moment:""When we think about the S&P 500
column4: we go back over the last 26 years where we have good data and look at the entire market from a perspective of bottom's up valuation. Right now the S&P 500 is in roughly the 17th percentile of expensive during those 26 years
column5: meaning it's been cheaper 83% of the time.""To beat the index Greenblatt buys the cheapestS&P 500stocks and shorts the most expensive. And wouldn't you know it
column6: but AAPL stock is one of his largest holdings -31stout of925positions in a $7.8 billion portfolio - at 337
column7: 952 shares as of December 31
column8: 2016.For Greenblatt
column9: it's all about cash flow and the price you pay for it:""We've owned Apple for a long time … They generate lots of cash flow
column10: and we don't have to pay a big price for it. That's what's attracted recent investors like Warren Buffett
column11: where he's looking at both that mix between growth and value … We figure out what a business is worth and try to pay a lot less.""Is AAPL Stock a Value Stock?He believes the markets are still valuing AAPL stock as a hardware company when in fact it's very much a service business with iTunes
column12: App Store
column13: Apple Music
column14: etc. CNBC Mad Money host Jim Cramer also feels Apple's service business is underappreciated by investors
column15: thoughts I shared with readers in early February when Apple was trading around $129; up almost 10% since then.The 7 Best Stocks to Buy for an Income-Rich RetirementInvestorPlace contributor Chris Lau recentlydiscussedhow Apple stock hasn't come close to peaking. I couldn't agree more
column16: which is why I asked the rhetorical question back in February of how AAPL stock got to $200.Apple's service revenue accounted for about 9% of overall sales in Q1 2017
column17: growing 18% year-over-year to $7.2 billion. Annualize that and we're talking about almost $29 billion. That's huge when you consider Piper Jeffrey analyst Gene Munster estimated in 2016 that Apple's gross margins on its service revenues were60%and that operating margins could hit 50% in the coming year.If that's accurate
column18: Apple's operating profits in fiscal 2017 could be as high as $15 billion or $2.86 per share for this small part of its business.In fiscal 2016
column19: Apple had operating income per share of $10.90 ($60.0 billionin operating income divided by 5.5 billion shares outstanding); if it grows by 5% in 2017
column20: to $11.45 per share
column21: the services business would account for 25% of Apple's overall operating profit.Bottom Line on Apple StockUnder this scenario
column22: its iPhone business doesn't have to be a home run in order for its profits to keep growing and that's what drives Apple stock prices higher.Why Buying Valeant Pharmaceuticals Intl Inc (VRX) Stock Isn't NutsHowever
column23: it's one thing to suggest ways that AAPL stock might move higher
column24: but it's another to establish whether its stock is cheap. Free cash flow yield is a good way to determine a stock's relative value.Currently
column25: Apple stock's trailing 12-month free cash flow is $52.5 billion or $9.72 per share; an FCF yield of 6.9% based on its Mar. 27 closing price of $140.88. By comparison
column26: Microsoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) has free cash flow of $3.49 per share for the trailing 12 months or an FCF yield of 5.4% based on its Mar. 27 closing price of $65.10.The possibility of Apple's operating margins moving higher as a result of its growing services revenue combined with talk it's going to hike its dividend payout closer to its large-cap peers to50%from 25% of annual earnings along with expected free cash flow growth of 10% annually in the future suggests AAPL stock might still be a value stock.I believe Joel Greenblatt would agree.As of this writing
column27: Will Ashworth did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace10 Small-Cap Stocks That Could Double in the Next 3 Months10 Clobbered Stocks to Buy That Are About to Get Red-HotThe postWhy Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Is Still a Value Playappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Why Equal Weighted Mutual Funds Scoring Over Index Funds;3/30/2017;"Index funds that invest in different small
column2: mid and large-cap companies in the same proportion are specifically known as equal-weight index funds. Investing in equal-weight funds helps in reducing single stock risk and simultaneously generates attractive returns. Investors interested in maintaining a diversified portfolio might consider investing in equal-weight funds.Not Overly Dependent on Large CapsIndex funds saw strong investments in 2016. According to The Wall Street Journal
column3: index funds attracted a record $400 billion-plus investment last year. However
column4: index funds invest heavily in large-cap companies
column5: following which investors are more susceptible to individual company risk.Also
column6: significant exposure to mid and small-cap issuers might benefit investors of equal-weight mutual funds as these companies have the scope to outperform their large-cap counterparts in the long run. This is mostly because unlike mega-giant and large companies
column7: mid and small caps have enough room to grow in the market. Also
column8: any uncertainty in global markets will affect the behemoths first
column9: while mid and small-cap companies will remain unfazed with more domestic exposure.Mid-cap companies
column10: with market capitalization between $2 billion and $10 billion
column11: have a higher growth potential than the large-cap ones
column12: while small-cap companies
column13: which have market cap of less than $2 billion
column14: offer strong returns.In this respect
column15: investors should look beyond index funds and focus on equal-weight mutual funds as these provide better and diversified market exposure to investors.For example
column16: mutual funds like Vanguard 500 IndexVFINXand Schwab S&P 500 IndexSWPPXinvest in large-cap companies that fall within the range of the S&P 500 Index. The top three holdings of both VFINX and SWPPX are blue-chip companies
column17: Apple IncAAPL
column18: Microsoft CorpMSFTand Exxon Mobil CorpXOM. Given below is the percentage distribution of assets of the two index-based funds in the three Dow components.Fund NameAppleMicrosoftExxon MobilVanguard 500 Index3.57%2.43%1.65%Schwab S&P 500 Index3.17%2.47%1.92%On the other hand
column19: equal-weight fund
column20: Invesco Equally-Weight S&P 500 Fund Class RVADRXinvested all its assets in equal proportions in equity securities of more than 505 companies. Further
column21: as of the last filing
column22: VADRX's top three holdings were NVIDIA CorpNVDA
column23: Allergan PLCAGNand Eli Lilly and CoLLY. The percentage portfolio weight in all the companies ranging from large-cap companies to small-cap entities generally stays near 0.20%. This makes an equal-weight mutual fund a strong investment option because of its ability to diversify its investments in each company equally and offer a strong stock market exposure.Sector Distribution More or Less EvenFor the last one year
column24: equal-weight mutual funds garnered attention after the major equal-weight index outperformed the broader market. The S&P 500 Equal Weight Index returned 16.7% in the last one year
column25: better than the benchmark index S&P 500's one-year annualized return of 16%.An equal-weight fund is a good choice for investors seeking diversification across sectors and companies
column26: and focusing on gaining exposure to stocks that offer high level of returns. Investors with a strong risk appetite should pick these funds. In comparison to capital-weight funds that invest mainly in large-cap companies
column27: equal-weight funds focus more on small and mid-cap companies. While
column28: capital-weight funds invest around 45% of its assets in large-cap companies
column29: equal-weight funds invest only 12% of its assets. This clearly indicates that an equal-weight fund is less dependent on the top 25 companies on the S&P 500 index and has a well-diversified portfolio.Moreover
column30: it can be seen that index fund have invested around 18% of its assets in the tech sector. Also
column31: the top two holdings
column32: Apple and Microsoft
column33: in index funds are from the tech sector. In contrast to this
column34: equal-weight funds have invested in the key S&P 500 sectors
column35: with only 12% of its assets in the tech sector. For example
column36: Vanguard 500 Index invested more than 35% of its assets in the technology and financial services sectors
column37: whereas a major equal-weight fund
column38: Index Funds S&P 500 Equal Weight No Load SharesINDEX
column39: invested its assets in various cyclical
column40: sensitive and defensive sectors. Less exposure in any particular sector helps INDEX to overcome any sudden market uncertainty.Fund NameSectorsVFINXINDEXTechnology19.25%11.84%Financial Services16.46%13.64%Healthcare14.39%12.21%Consumer Cyclical10.84%15.47%Industrials10.49%14.10%Consumer Defensive9.53%8.31%Energy6.63%7.10%Communication Services4.05%1.85%Utilities3.19%5.81%Basic Materials2.89%4.51%Real Estate2.28%5.16%ConclusionEqual-weight mutual funds are the need of the hour. And why not? Unlike index funds that are biased toward large caps and specific sectors
column41: these types of funds minimize their risks by evenly distributing their weight across all caps
column42: including medium and small-sized companies. Such funds also stay invested across all sectors in a more-or-less equal proportion. Needless to say
column43: at a time of heightened uncertainly relating to whether Trump's pro-growth policies will get implemented or not
column44: equal-weight mutual funds have an undue advantage over their peers.Want to learn more about equal weight strategies? column1: Why Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock Needs an Innovative Edge;3/30/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News

column3: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN) has been on fire since the start of the year

column6: but that gain not only trails its tech rivals
column7: as the NASDAQ average is up 9.56%.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockHow bad is it? It's so bad that Amazon founder Jeff Bezos is threatening to overtake Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates as the world's richest man. He's just $10 billion behind after trade closed Mar 29.This is not down to any complacency on the part of CEO Satya Nadella and his team. If anything
column8: they're moving faster than ever. But Microsoft's days as a monopolist are over. Its products must all earn their way. They're all facing competition in the marketplace. A person or even a company can live without MSFT
column9: and while the company may see this as liberating
column10: some investors are treating it as a reason to worry.MSFT Stock: A Gaming CompetitorFor example
column11: Microsoft investors should be bullish at its efforts in gaming
column12: but there is plenty of competition.Gaming is where developers
column13: and customers
column14: are pushing the envelope on PC performance. People will spend a lot more for a game machine than for any other type of console device. MSFT stock is in the middle of it.10 Clobbered Stocks to Buy That Are About to Get Red-HotThe latest version of Windows 10
column15: called Creators Update
column16: will feature lots of new gaming features when itlaunches April 11
column17: butit's not the revolution the company promisedwhen they announced it last fall.Microsoft stock got into gaming through the Xbox console. The latest version brought in $9.1 billion last year and holds26% of the market.But it's not No.1
column18: as that honor goes toSony Corp (ADR)(NYSE:SNE) and its PlayStation 4. Nor is it the hottest new console. That's theNintendo Co.
column19: Ltd. (ADR)(OTCMKTS:NTDOY)Switch.MSFT has launched its own game streaming service
column20: Beam Streaming
column21: but that must compete with Amazon's market-leading Twitch service. Game delivery is a niche controlled by privately-heldSteam
column22: founded by former Microsoft employees in 1996 and now majority-owned by Gabe Newell.Still
column23: there is ample room for growth in gaming
column24: and Microsoft alone has a position in every important niche.Microsoft Stock's New Hope: AzureNadella made his name at Microsoft building Azure
column25: the company's cloud business. His strategy has been to put all of MSFT's offerings into Azure
column26: to offer its software directly to users through Azure
column27: and to use cloud-based applications to dominate the enterprise market.He can argue that it's working. Microsoft's revenue from Azure-fed businesses
column28: which now includes Office 365
column29: is $14 billion
column30: and Azure should deliver $2.5 billion in hosting revenueall by itself.While Amazon dominates the cloud infrastructure market with a share of over 80%
column31: what investors focus on is the growing competition between Azure andAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column32: NASDAQ:GOOGL)
column33: whichsome analysts think Google will win.That would be a disaster for Microsoft stock.Office 365 faces growing competition fromGoogle's G Suite
column34: and that in turn meansgrowing competition for PCs from Google Chromebooks
column35: which are especially gaining share in educationbecause they're cheaper
column36: with more of their functions online.Nothing comes easy anymore.The Bottom Line for MSFT StockAnalysts are generally positive about Microsoft stock
column37: but one-third have it off their buy lists. They expect 69 cents per share of earnings on $22.47 billion in revenue when the company reports April 27
column38: which would represent 10% more revenue and almost 50% more profit than the company delivered in the March quarter last year.Bullish on Snap Inc (SNAP) Stock? Then Answer This QuestionMicrosoft today is the third-largest company in the world
column39: by market cap
column40: at $505 billion. But its operations must race hard to stay in place. Google is ahead
column41: and Amazon is coming up from behind. Technology dominates the stock market
column42: and MSFT stock remains a part of most technology portfolios.Nadella has saved the company. It's no longer at risk to falling off pace likeInternational Business Machines Inc.(NYSE:IBM). Its price-to-earnings ratio of nearly 31 is slightly higher than Google's at 30
column43: and well ahead of Apple's at 17. But there's not one part of Microsoft that can afford to be complacent
column44: and that's a sea change.Dana Blankenhornis a financial and technology journalist. He is the author of the sci-fi novellaInto the Cloud
column45: available at the Amazon Kindle store. Write him atdanablankenhorn@gmail.comor follow him on Twitter at@danablankenhorn. As of this writing

column1: The 4 Best Dividend Stocks in Cloud Computing;3/29/2017;"Cloud companies often generate high sales growth with thin   margins. They aren't usually associated with dividends
column2: which   generally indicate that a tech company's high growth days are   over.Yet there are still a handful of stocks that expose investors   to the growing cloud market while paying dependable dividends.   Let's take a closer look at four such companies --Microsoft(NASDAQ: MSFT)
column3: IBM(NYSE: IBM)
column4: Oracle(NYSE: ORCL)
column5: andHewlett-Packard Enterprise(NYSE: HPE) .Image source: Getty Images.makeArticleAd();MicrosoftMicrosoft's commercial cloud business hit an annual run    rate of over $14 billion last quarter -- a 49% jump from a   year earlier. CEO Satya Nadella expects that figure to hit $20   billion
column6: or nearly a fifth of Microsoft's revenue
column7: in fiscal   2018. That business generates most of its revenue from three   cloud services -- Office 365
column8: Dynamics CRM (customer relationship   management)
column9: and the Azure cloud platform. Azure -- the second   largest cloud platform afterAmazon's(NASDAQ: AMZN) AWS (Amazon Web Services) -- hosts applications
column10: analyzes data
column11: and loans out computing power.Microsoft pays a forward dividend yield of 2.4%
column12: which is   supported by a payout ratio of 69%. The company has raised that   payout annually for 13 straight years. Analysts expect   Microsoft's revenue and earnings to respectively rise 5% and 7%   this year
column13: but its valuation looks a bit rich at 31 times   earnings.IBMIBM's cloud business achieved an annual run  rate of   $13.7 billion last quarter
column14: growing 35% from a year earlier and   accounting for 17% of its top line. Within that total
column15: its cloud   services had an annual run rate of $8.6 billion -- a 61% jump   from 2015. Big Blue bundles all its public
column16: private
column17: and hybrid   cloud services into a platform called the IBM Cloud. Notable   products in that suite include its AI platform Watson
column18: Blockchain   for digital transactions
column19: and the Bluemix platform
column20: which   competes against AWS and Azure.Big Blue pays a forward dividend yield of 3.2% with a payout   ratio of 44%. It's raised that dividend annually for 17 straight   years. Its P/E of 14 is much lower than its industry average of   21
column21: but analysts expect its revenue to fall 2% this year and for   its earnings to rise just 2%.OracleOver the past few years
column22: Oracle has grown its cloud businesses   to offset sluggish demand for its aging database and hardware   products. These products include a mix of SaaS
column23: PaaS (platform as   a service)
column24: and IaaS (infrastructure as a service) products --   which  achieved a non-GAAP annual run rate of $5 billion   last quarter. Last quarter
column25: Oracle's total cloud revenues rose   62% annually to $1.2 billion and accounted for 13% of the tech   giant's top line.Oracle's forward dividend yield of 1.4% is supported by a   payout ratio of just 28% -- indicating that the tech giant could   easily double its dividend if it wanted to. Nonetheless
column26: Oracle's   five straight years of dividend hikes have kept the yield well   below 2%. Analysts expect Oracle's revenue and earnings to both   rise just 1% this year
column27: but its multiple of 21 is well below the   industry average of 54 for application software makers.Hewlett-Packard EnterpriseHewlett-Packard Enterprise retained HP's enterprise hardware   and software businesses after splitting with the PC
column28: printing
column29: and imaging businesses in late 2015. Shortly after the split
column30: HPE   shut down  its Helion public cloud platform
column31: which couldn't   compete against larger rivals like AWS. But HPE continued   providing support for private and hybrid cloud deployments
column32: and   tethered those systems to AWS
column33: Azure
column34: and other leading public   cloud platforms. HPE's adjusted software revenue fell 1% annually   last quarter
column35: but within that business
column36: its cloud software as a   service (SaaS) revenue rose  6%.Image source: HPE.HPE's forward yield of 1.1% looks paltry
column37: but its payout ratio   of 13% suggests that there's plenty of room for growth. Wall   Street expects HPE's revenue and earnings to remain nearly flat   this year
column38: due to sluggish enterprise spending
column39: but its trailing   P/E of 12 makes it one of the cheapest large cap tech plays on   the market today.The key takeawaysMicrosoft
column40: IBM
column41: Oracle
column42: and HPE often showcase their cloud   growth
column43: but none of these mature companies are generating massive   growth. That's because they're relying heavily on cloud growth to   offset weakness as their older businesses -- like Microsoft's   Windows

column45: Oracle's database   systems
column46: and HPE's aging enterprise hardware and software.   Investors should weigh the pros and cons of these companies   before investing in them as cloud or income plays.10 stocks we like better than IBMWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column17: but instead of ''shares'' investors are actually buying and selling ''units''. These ''units'' can be traded back and forth just like stocks

column1: Why Nvidia Corporation (NVDA) Stock Will Keep Jumping Higher;3/29/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsEarlier this month
column3: Nvidia Corporation(NASDAQ:NVDA) announced the Jetson TX2
column4: which is the latest iteration of the TX1
column5: which NVDA describes as""the world's first supercomputer on a module.""The company designed the Jetson module as a tool to assist developers in advancing and creating new technology. Additionally
column6: in partnership withMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT)
column7: Nvidia announced development of theHGX-1 Hyperscale GPU Accelerator
column8: which promises improved performance and standardization for cloud-computing servers.makeArticleAd();Source: NvidiaThese tools will also serve NVDA stock investors (indirectly
column9: of course)
column10: as they further the company's rise to the top of the AI industry ladder.Android Centraldescribed the Jetson TX2 best
column11: saying:""The people who will build this technology of the future will need the tools to do so. In 2017
column12: NVIDIA is doing its part
column13: and the Jetson TX2 is the embodiment of this idea.""Simply put
column14: the Jetson TX2 is a mini supercomputer that can process massive amounts of data on the spot
column15: which can be a huge advantage for technology developers who would otherwise have had to upload all that data to an online server for cloud computing.10 Small-Cap Stocks That Could Double in the Next 3 MonthsWhat's more
column16: NVDA's Jetson TX2 is capable of ""edge"" machine learning
column17: a term that refers to the ability of the module to process
column18: interpret and analyze data without the need to first upload it to the cloud
column19: then download the resulting information and details. The TX2 has served its purpose quite successfully and it has helped Nvidia achieve its goal of simplifying developers' processes by reducing the number of steps required to garner important data.As far as the HGX-1
column20: NVDAbelievesthat:The HGX-1 hyperscale GPU accelerator will do for AI cloud computing what the ATX standard did to make PCs pervasive today. It will enable cloud-service providers to easily adopt NVIDIA GPUs to meet surging demand for AI computing.More Iconic Brands Rely on NVDA Than You Might RealizeHistorically
column21: Nvidia has been known for its industry-leading graphics cards. But
column22: NVDA stock is much more than a computer GPU maker. Sure
column23: the company still produces some of the most advanced GPUs that make hardcore gamers drool
column24: but graphics processors are actually capable of much more.While high-end GPUs will
column25: obviously
column26: improve PC video quality and reduce or eliminate that annoying screen lag when you're playing a first-person shooter game
column27: they're also used for a surprising number of non-visual applications.For instance
column28: Alphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column29: NASDAQ:GOOGL) andTesla Inc(NASDAQ:TSLA) use Nvidia GPU technology in the development of their respective driverless cars.Volkswagen AG (ADR)(OTCMKTS:VLKAY) andDaimler AG's(OTCMKTS:DDAIF) Audi brand have also been using Nvidia GPU units in their own driverless vehicle development projects. These companiesuse the NVDA Drive PX2- which
column30: according toForbes
column31: shares the renowned Tegra Parker silicon as the Jetson TX2.Beyond just autonomous vehicles
column32: though
column33: Nvidia GPU devices have been used by medical scientists and pharmaceutical companies to investigate and better understand the effects of aging. Using GPUs made by NVDA
column34: biotech companies such asInSilicoemploy AI to analyze large data sets and""emulate human brain function""in an attempt to combat diseases related to old age and reduce the cost of healthcare.Why the Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock Comeback Is Just BeginningSimilarly
column35: at its annual Open Compute Project summit earlier this month
column36: Facebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB) announced a cutting-edge AI server dubbed Big Basin
column37: which features""no less than eight Nvidia Tesla P100 GPU accelerators.""Bottom Line on NVDA StockAll things considered
column38: Nvidia stock's meteoric rise in the field of artificial intelligence shows no signs of slowing. With the release of the Jetson TX2 module
column39: coupled with the upcoming HGX-1 accelerator
column40: NVDA stock has addressed - seemingly quite successfully - mobile/field R&D as well as the cloud computing needs of AI developers.For Nvidia stock
column41: this is a solid sign that the past year's 213% gains will continue.As of this writing
column42: Greg Gambone did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace10 Clobbered Stocks to Buy That Are About to Get Red-HotThe 7 WORST Stocks to Buy Right NowThe postWhy Nvidia Corporation (NVDA) Stock Will Keep Jumping Higherappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: AT&T (T) to Shut Down U-Verse and Shift Users to DIRECTV;3/29/2017;"Per a recentFierceCablereport
column2: U.S. telecom behemothAT&T Inc.Tis planning to completely phase out its long-standing U-verse brand by May 30. The brand consists of fiber-based triple-play video (TV)

column1: Is the Microsoft Xbox Game Pass Worth $10 per Month?;3/28/2017;"Microsoft(NASDAQ: MSFT) recently jumped on the subscription service   bandwagon with the announcement of Xbox Game Pass. For $10 per   month
column2: Xbox One owners can have access to over 100 Xbox One and   backward compatible Xbox 360 games.One of the attractive features of the service is the ability   to download the full game directly to the Xbox One console
column3: so   players can enjoy each title without worrying about internet   connectivity issues. The service also allows gamers to buy   games at a discount.On the flip side
column4: titles included with the service will be   cycled in and out on a monthly basis
column5: which will limit the   selection and potentially the service's overall popularity.makeArticleAd();Game Pass will not appeal to everyoneXbox Game Pass will not appeal to gamers interested in new     releases. Image source: Microsoft.Xbox Game Pass does not offer new releases -- no service will   likely ever offer that to gamers at just $10 per month. And while   there is no information available regarding the terms Microsoft   negotiated with publishers
column6: they are obviously not going to sell   a new release for $10 or less when a full game download typically   ranges from from $30 to $60.In some cases
column7: I have seen people compare Xbox Game Pass to   other entertainment streaming services like Spotify orNetflix. Although Xbox Game Pass offers the same convenience
column8: it   falls short of other popular entertainment services on the   breadth of selection. Netflix
column9: AppleMusic
column10: Spotify
column11: andAmazonPrime cost about the same price per month
column12: but these services   usually offer subscribers access to massive libraries
column13: including   new and original content.Microsoft targets used game buyersThe new Xbox service appears to be takingdirect aimatGameStop's used game business. GameStop believes it is the largest   retailer of pre-owned games in the world. In each of the   last three years
column14: GameStop has generated approximately $1 billion   in gross profit from pre-owned game sales -- accounting for   nearly half of its gross profit each year.  As physical   game sales fade
column15: some of that $1 billion will begin flowing back   to publishers and console makers
column16: but it may not happen   overnight.While Xbox Game Pass will likely lure some customers away from   Gamestop
column17: I don't expect Microsoft to deal a death blow -- at   least not yet. The transition will ultimately be driven by the   quality of games includes with the service.But all of the games shown in the image on Microsoft's   announcement are at least one year old. A few high profile games   listed in theannouncementareHalo 5andNBA 2K16. Consumers can buy those titles pre-owned from Gamestop for $15   to $30. Once they play it for a month or two and trade it back to   the store
column18: gamers would net about the same cost with Xbox   Game Pass as going the used game route. GameStop also has a   slight edge over the Microsoft service considering the   month-to-month cycling of the Game Pass catalogue.Image source: Microsoft.Leading game developers shun the servicePart of the problem with Game Pass' limited selection is the   lack of support fromElectronic Arts
column19: Ubisoft Entertainment
column20: andActivision Blizzard-- three giant publishers. Electronic Arts has its own   subscription service -- EA Access -- exclusive on Xbox
column21: so it's   likely we will never see EA join Xbox Game Pass unless its own   offering falters.In aninterviewwith Gamespot
column22: head of the Xbox business Phil Spencer said it   took two or three years to launch Xbox Game Pass due to   challenges
column23: including signing deals with third-party   publishers:It's taken so long because Microsoft had to get the     under-the-hood
column24: technical specifics worked out
column25: while the     company also had to sign business deals with third-party     publishers.If Microsoft wasn't able to recruit Activision or Ubisoft over   several years
column26: it's unlikely those companies are going to sign up   any time soon. Activision Blizzard is focused on making new
column27: major releases that allow the company to deliver a steady flow of   downloadable content to millions of players. Releasing older   games to Game Pass could potentially steer players to those   titles where Activision is generating less revenue.As a result of these shortcomings
column28: Xbox Game Pass will only   appeal to subscribers interested in having access to older games.   But at just $10 per month and with new titles regularly being   added to the library (and the potential for future partnerships   with other developers)
column29: both casual and hardcore gamers can   probably find something to like in this service.10 stocks we like better than MicrosoftWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column30: it can pay to listen. After all
column31: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade
column32: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column33: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and Microsoft wasn't one of     them! That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even     better buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of February 6

column35: Amazon
column36: Apple
column37: and     Netflix. The Motley Fool has the following options: long     January 2018 $90 calls on Apple
column38: short January 2018 $95 calls     on Apple
column39: and short April 2017 $28 puts on GameStop. The Motley     Fool recommends Electronic Arts. The Motley Fool has adisclosure policy."

column1: Is Apple Looking to Expand in the Augmented Reality World?;3/28/2017;"Apple IncAAPLis accelerating its efforts in the AR space
column2: reports The Financial Times. However
column3: it adds that a retail launch is unlikely to happen in the near future.There have been quite a few rumors regarding Apple's AR efforts
column4: as CEO Tim Cook has emphasized on developing the technology time and again in the last few months. Cook had reiterated the company's AR efforts for the first time at its third quarter fiscal 2016 earnings conference call. He has been quoted saying ""AR can be really great
column5: and we have been and continue to invest a lot in this. We are high on AR for the long run. We think there are great things for customers and a great commercial opportunity."" In fact
column6: he has been quoted by media reports saying not VR but AR will be ""the larger of the two
column7: probably by far"".In November last year
column8: Bloomberg stated that Apple was mulling over venturing into the wearable headsets space but is unlikely to initiate ""mass production"" as it has just ordered a small number of near-eye displays for testing purposes from a supplier. Bloomberg also claimed that if all goes well then AR glasses will wirelessly connect to an iPhone and will display information and images directly in front of the user's field of view.Moreover
column9: in January this year
column10: tech blogger
column11: Robert Scoble
column12: citing a Carl Zeiss employee
column13: stated that Appleis working on AR/mixed reality headsets and has partnered with the renowned lens maker. He was more optimistic about retail launch as he stated that the glasses could hit stores as early as this year.Apple Inc. PriceApple Inc. Price|Apple Inc. QuoteHowever
column14: Apple has refrained from commenting on any of these rumors. The company has a habit of maintaining secrecy regarding its new products.Apple is under tremendous pressure to introduce new offerings
column15: as it's most important growth driver-the iPhone-faces decelerating demand. iPhone alone contributed about 70% of Apple's total revenue in the first quarter of fiscal 2017.Better-than-expected iPhone 7 and 7 Plus sales have definitely come as a respite. But the macroeconomic headwinds remain for now
column16: especially in China
column17: one of its high-growth regions. Apple revenues declined around 12% year over year in the Greater China region to $16.2 billion. Also
column18: competition from local players has been hindering iPhone's growth in this region. Slowdown in demand from key regions like China
column19: if continued
column20: can significantly impact Apple's financials going ahead.Apple has been exploring newer growth avenues to boost its topline. With so much buzz created by AR/VR and AI technologies
column21: the company has started to focus on its development. These are fast emerging as lucrative business opportunities. According to a recent IDC report
column22: global revenues of the AR/VR market are expected to grow at a CAGR of 181.3% from $5.2 billion in 2016 to over $162 billion in 2020.  Bloomberg
column23: which quoted Global Market Insights figures
column24: reported that the global market for AR products will surge 80% to $165 billion by 2024.Per Bloomberg
column25: Apple has built a team combining people who have experience in working on Facebook'sFBOculus and Microsoft'sMSFTHoloLens. The company has also acquired several smaller firms with expertise in AR hardware
column26: 3D gaming and virtual reality software. These include Flyby Media
column27: Emotient
column28: TupleJump
column29: Turi
column30: Metaio and PrimeSense.Not only Apple
column31: but all tech giants-right from AlphabetGOOGL
column32: Facebook to Microsoft-are scrambling to grab a share of this lucrative market. Facebook had acquired Oculus in 2012 to fuel the company's ambitious VR efforts. Moreover
column33: media reports add that Facebook is likely to unveil four consumer hardware products at this year's F8. These include drones
column34: brain scanning technology
column35: AR and next gen cameras. In March 2016
column36: Microsoft started shipping its AR headset
column37: HoloLens.Zacks Rank & Stock Price MovementAt present
column38: Apple carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold). You can seethe complete list of today's Zacks #1 Rank (Strong Buy)   stocks here.Apple's shares have marginally outperformed the broader market over the past one year. Shares of Apple have registered growth of 33.95%

column12: which totaled $2.41 billion. Backlog increased 28% over fiscal 2016 to more than $2.7 billion.Red Hat closed more than 280 deals over $1 million

column15: shares of Red Hat increased 5.3% in after-hour trade yesterday. Shares are also up 5.6% today in thepre-market tradingsession.We note that Red Hat has outperformed the ZacksComputer-Softwareindustry on a year-to-date basis. Red Hat has returned 23.3% as against the industry's gain of 10.2% over the same time frame.We expect the strong results to back the momentum in shares going ahead.Revenue DetailsSubscription revenues (89% of revenues) increased 16.7% year over year to $559.6 million. Subscription revenues for application development related and emerging technologies surged 40% year over year to $125 million.Training & services revenues (11% of revenues) increased 8.4% from the year-ago quarter to $69.3 million.Red Hat entered into 30 big deals in the fourth quarter with valuation of $1 million or more. Management noted that 16 deals were greater than $5 million. Out of these deals four were more than $20 million.Red Hat's emerging technologies continued to gain momentum. Approximately one-third of the biggest deals contained an OpenStack private cloud component
column16: approximately one-third had an OpenShift container platform component and more than a third of the deals contained Ansible
column17: the company's automation management technology.OpenStack collaborations continue to expand and now include the likes of HP and Huawei. The company recently inked an expanded cloud computing partnership with International Business MachinesIBMto sell Red Hat's distribution of OpenStack as a private cloud offering to their customers.Red Hat Inc. - Earnings Surprise |     FindTheBestDuring the quarter
column18: Red Hat won several deals in the telecommunications vertical including a $100 million contract. column20: partially offset by higher sales & marketing expense.Adjusted operating income grew 29% year over year to $101.5 million. Further

column1: Twitter Is Looking to Diversify Its Revenue With a Paid Subscription;3/28/2017;"Twitter's(NYSE:TWTR) struggles to keep growing ad revenue have led it to search for   alternative revenue streams. Its most recent idea is a paid   subscription for ""a new
column2: more enhanced version of Tweetdeck
column3: a   Twitter spokesperson toldThe Verge. Twitter bought Tweetdeck in 2011
column4: and it allows users to manage   multiple accounts
column5: view responses and activity
column6: create   collections of tweets
column7: and more.The paid product would be aimed at marketers
column8: journalists
column9: professionals
column10: and anyone else that wants to ""find out what is   happening in the world quicker
column11: to gain more insights
column12: and see   the broadest range of what people are saying on Twitter
column13: according to a survey Twitter sent out. It would also get rid of   ads for those users.Twitter provides a lot of value to journalists and marketers
column14: and it could take a tip fromMicrosoft's(NASDAQ: MSFT) LinkedIn for developing paid solutions to their   problems. Most of LinkedIn's revenue
column15: in fact
column16: comes from its   paid services. With Twitter's ad revenue expected to decline this   year
column17: a new revenue stream could be a huge boost for Twitter.makeArticleAd();Image source: Getty Images.Making it easier to use TwitterWhen Jack Dorsey reassumed the role of CEO at Twitter
column18: he   said
column19: ""The product remains too difficult to use."" He was mostly   referring to the steep learning curve for new users
column20: but even   power users could be left wanting.Management continuously touts how news breaks on Twitter   before the major news networks pick it up. If Twitter can make it   easier for journalists to find breaking stories
column21: gather comments   from interested parties
column22: and put an entire report together
column23: that's providing a real value to journalist -- a value they (or   their employers) might be willing to pay a monthly subscription   price for.Many marketers already pay for third-party analytics to see   what's working with the accounts they manage and what doesn't. If   Twitter can provide those insights and content suggestions all   from its own dashboard
column24: marketers may be willing to pay for that   service.Following in LinkedIn's footstepsTwitter could do for journalists what LinkedIn did for   recruiters.LinkedIn's professional network is an unmatched asset. It   monetizes that asset by selling access to recruiters. LinkedIn's   2016 run rate for its hiring solutions products was $2.1 billion   before Microsoft bought the company in the fourth quarter. For   reference
column25: Twitter's total 2016 revenue was $2.5 billion.But Twitter's job is a little more difficult than providing   access. It already does that
column26: twice over. Its data licensing   business provides its firehose of data to various outfits that   use it to analyze anything from consumer sentiment to the stock   market. Its basic free product also offers access to just about   anyone you might be interested in hearing more from.For Twitter to sell a paid service
column27: it will have to offer   better ways to organize and analyze all the information people   are sharing on its network. And it will have to do it better than   anyone else is. That's a tall order
column28: but nobody is better   positioned to do it than Twitter itself.The need for a new revenue streamTwitter is expected to suffer a revenue decline this year   afterde-emphasizing some of its ad products. Twitter is most focused on video and video advertising
column29: spending heavily on content deals and developing new technology.   While video ads are generally higher-priced and higher-margined
column30: Twitter faces significant competition in the video ad space from   other social networks. It has a much better advantage as a source   for news information.If Twitter can successfully launch a paid service
column31: it would be   a huge boon to Twitter and its investors if it can develop a   product where it has a much more significant competitive   advantage than it does in video advertising.It could also take the focus off Twitter's stagnant user   growth
column32: and shine a light on the value of its core power   users.A premium version of Tweetdeck is by no means a sure thing --   we don't even know if Twitter will actually release such a   product. But Twitter needs to find a way to diversify beyond   advertising besides just providing wholesale licenses to its   stream of data.10 stocks we like better than TwitterWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column33: it can pay to listen. After all
column34: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade
column35: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column36: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and Twitter wasn't one of     them! That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even     better buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of February 6

LinkedIn is owned by     Microsoft.Adam Levyhas no position in any stocks mentioned. The Motley Fool owns     shares of and recommends Twitter. The Motley Fool has adisclosure policy."

column1: GameStop (GME) Closes 150 Stores As Videogame Industry Turns Digital;3/27/2017;"The shift of consumer behavior has affected all retail industries. After some of the biggest retailers
column2: such as J.C. PennyJCP
column3: Macy'sM
column4: SearsSHLD
column5: and many others
column6: reported nationwide store closures
column7: GameStopGME
column8: the world's largest video game retailer
column9: is the next to join the list.The Texas-based company reported its fourth quarter and fiscal 2016 earnings on Thursday. GameStop reported a positive earnings surprise for the fifth straight quarter; however
column10: it also missed the sales estimates for the third consecutive quarter.The company posted adjusted earnings of $2.38 per share
column11: beating the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $2.29 per share. Revenues of $3.05 billion fell short of the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $3.12 billion. (For the complete report on GameStop's Q4 earnings report
column12: check out this Zacks article:GameStop (GME) Tops Q4 Earnings
column13: Stock Tumbles on Drab View)GameStop's stock tanked 16% on Friday and closed with the day at $20.70 per share after it announced that it plans to shutter at least 150 stores and expand nongaming business in earnings.""As our non-gaming business drove gross margin expansion and significantly contributed to our profits
column14: said CEO Paul Raines. ""Meanwhile
column15: the video game category was weak
column16: particularly in the back half of 2016
column17: as the console cycle ages.""The physical video game market was hit hard as a whole. GameStop's competitor Best BuyBBYalso noted in its latest earnings report that video game sales were down. The decline in sales is most likely the result of consumers' shift to buying games digitally.Piper JaffrayPJCanalyst Michael Olson told TheStreet
column18: ""We're seeing more games being sold digitally
column19: as 25% of the games are sold as full-game downloaded."" He expects video game purchasing eventually will be ""100% download and streaming
column20: with the increase of Internet speed and greater storage capacity on gaming consoles.The moneymakers of GameStop also aren't performing as well as it did. The new gaming consoles from Microsoft Corp.MSFTand Nintendo Co.NTDOYthis year might not provide as much as they once did. The sales from reselling used games
column21: which has better margins than for new games or hardware
column22: have not been doing well either because of the rise of digital download that produces no physical disc to be swapped later.For game publishers
column23: the transformation to digital download is great news. The profit is more lucrative from full-game download than packaged games. Video game console makers also see this as a profitable trend for them. Both Microsoft and SonySNEintroduced video game subscriptions
column24: which allow users to pay a fee per month for unlimited access to games online.While GameStop's traditional moneymakers have been suffering
column25: the company's collectible store hopes to ligthen investors' worry. Their collectibles operation saw sales surge almost 60% in fiscal 2016 and is expected to increase another 30% to 40% for 2017. As of Jan 28
column26: there are 86 collectible stores
column27: and the company looks to open 35 more this year.As the trend of full-download and e-commerce continues
column28: GameStop's legacy in video game brick-and-mortar business might soon be different.GameStop is trading at $20.85 per share
column29: up 0.72% on Monday.Interested in the video game industry? Check out the special edition of Zacks Friday Finish Line

column31: the CEO of PureFunds
