column1: Why AT&T Inc. (T) Stock Will Run Much Farther Than You Think;3/27/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsUsually
column3: it's not a good thing when the first adjective that comes to mind about a particular investment is ""boring."" That descriptor conjures up images of retirement homes
column4: bingo games
column5: and amateur golf tourneys that frequently go over par. It's the exact opposite of what you want to sell if you were an up-and-coming stockbroker. ButAT&T Inc. (NYSE:T) is that rare animal that wears boredom well.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockFirst and foremost
column6: when discussing T stock
column7: we have to acknowledge the AT&T andTime Warner Inc(NYSE:TWX) merger.As InvestorPlace's Lawrence Meyers notes
column8: it's a done deal. TWX shareholders have approved the merger
column9: which makes T stock compelling again. He furtherstatedthat ""in a matter of two years
column10: AT&T stock has gone from moribund telecom play with a great dividend to a media powerhouse with a great dividend.""Then there's the matter of T's acquisition of DirecTV. Regularly squaring off against rivalDISH Network Corp(NASDAQ:DISH)
column11: DirecTV deliversbetter content
column12: particularly if you're a sports fan. As a side note
column13: DISH is off more than 22% from its highs of 2014. T stock
column14: in sharp contrast
column15: is just a few cents short of its all-time high (on an adjusted basis).But this brings us to an important question. Is T stock still worth buying at these elevated levels? Just a few years ago
column16: AT&T was something more appropriate for ""widows and orphans
column17: according to Meyers. No one - even those with deep pockets - wants to be caught holding the bag.T Stock Is Built Like a TankFortunately
column18: I don't think it's possible to hold the bag on AT&T. Of course
column19: you never say never - I've been burnt before with premature ramblings. I certainly don't want to repeat the mistakes of occasionally misguided youth. But a select group of companies do exist that are too big and frankly
column20: too boring to fail.More From InvestorPlace7 Consumer Stocks That Will Lead Your PortfolioIt's often said that when people flip the switch on
column21: they expect to see light. When that doesn't happen
column22: as in the case of power outages
column23: people go a little crazy. Extend the blackout for a prolonged period of time
column24: and you will have a major crisis on your hands. It's cynical
column25: but that's why utility companies will always be in business. You can be grossly negligent likeTohoku Electric Power Co.
column26: Inc. (Japan)(OTCMKTS:TEPCY) and still get away with it.The same analogy can be carried over to the telecommunications industry. People need their internet
column27: and access to other digital devices. No internet and no TV is tantamount to a powder keg ready to burst. And AT&T has gotten so big that it's probably not possible for it to totally implode into oblivion. That's one reason why T stock is largely considered worry-free investing.The other reason is that AT&T is unlikely to become irrelevant. InvestorPlace feature writer James Brumleystatesthat the company ""is already capable of delivering broadband to millions of houses and businesses across the nation
column28: and it's also capable of providing 4G wireless (soon to be 5G wireless) from coast to coast."" Even with this advantage
column29: AT&T is nearing implementation of its AirGig technology - essentially
column30: internet through electric utility lines.So no
column31: bag-holding on the fundamentals is definitely not a concern.AT&T Stock: The Trend Is Your FriendOf course
column32: investment profits and losses are realized via the markets. It doesn't matter how great the fundamentals are if the technicals won't follow suit. Naturally
column33: buying near all-time highs will cause any investor to take a step back before pulling the trigger.However
column34: T stock is bolstered by a number of attributes that makes it distinct from other opportunities. First
column35: outside of rare exceptions
column36: AT&T stock does not incur devastating
column37: double-digit volatility. Aside from 2001
column39: the average down years measures only 6.7%. Chances are
column40: if you pick T stock at an inopportune moment
column41: you should recover fairly quickly.Buy Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock Without All the RiskClick to EnlargeThe second factor favoring AT&T stock is its upward bias. During the first quarter
column42: returns for T stock are poor
column43: averaging losses of 0.4% from the start of January to March end. Things pick up over the next three quarters
column44: returning slightly over 13% so far.Finally
column45: you just have to trust the long-term trend for T stock. And that's really no step of faith. Since 1984
column46: only two pronounced periods of bearishness are evident: the collapse of the tech bubble
column47: and the Great Recession. Since we're not going to suffer through macro-level pessimism all the time
column48: AT&T stock is as reliable as a benchmark index fund.Buying any company at all-time highs is never preferable. But holding onto preference could stymie profitability. T stock isn't the flavor of the week. It's built for the long-term
column49: and for that purpose
column50: AT&T has few genuine competitors.As of this writing
column51: Josh Enomoto did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace10 Small-Cap Stocks That Could Double in the Next 3 MonthsThe 7 Best Dividend Stocks to Buy for the Second QuarterThe postWhy AT&T Inc. (T) Stock Will Run Much Farther Than You Thinkappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Are Oracle Corporation (ORCL) Stock’s Cloud Promises Just Empty Rhetoric?;3/27/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsOracle Corporation(NASDAQ:ORCL) Chairman Larry Ellison may be one of the best trash talkers in Silicon Valley if not in all of corporate America.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockDuring the software company's latest earnings call
column3: Ellison set his sights onAmazon.com
column4: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN)
column5: the market leader in the fast-growing cloud market. He noted that Oracle workloads run ten times as fast as Amazon and are cheaper to boot.""As a result
column6: some of our largest customers' are negotiating huge infrastructure-as-a-service contracts to move all their databases to the Oracle cloud
column7: the cantankerous billionaire said. ""You can expect some of those big deals to be announced in the coming weeks.""Of course
column8: he didn't name any names
column9: nor did he offer any specifics. Investors need to view Ellison's boasts with skepticism because ORCL is still a small fish in the big pond that is the cloud market.During its latest quarter
column10: ORCL reported $1.01 billionin cloud software as a service (SaaS) and platform as a service (PaaS)
column11: a year-over-year increase of 11 percent. Infrastructure as a service (IaaS) sales were $178 million
column12: up 2 percent.7 Consumer Stocks That Will Lead Your PortfolioTotal cloud revenue rose 62 percent to $1.2 billion in the most recent quarter and is forecast to slow down to 29 percent in the current quarter. Co-CEO Safra Catz's has forecast that cloud revenue ($3.2 billion over the past nine months) would overtake license revenue ($3.7 billion during that same time.). The company gave an estimated run-rate for the business of about $5 billion.AMZN
column13: though
column14: has a huge head start on ORCL as do other rivals. The e-commerce giant'sAmazon Web Servicescloud division surged 47% in 2016 to $3.5 billion
column15: indicating a run of about $14 billion. Sales forMicrosoft Corporation's(NASDAQ:MSFT) Intelligent Cloud rose 8% (10% in constant currency) to $6.9 billion in its latest quarter. The Redmond
column16: Wash.-based company has forecast a ""commercial annualized revenue run rate"" topping $14 billion.International Business Machines Corp.(NYSE:IBM)
column17: for its part
column18: reported $13.7 billion in cloud revenue last year.Keep in mind that these company all likely define ""cloud revenue"" differently than one another
column19: but even among the most optimistic of scenarios
column20: it appears as though ORCL is in no position to catch Amazon or any other major cloud players for years if ever.What This Means for ORCL StockDoes that mean that investors should dismiss Oracle's cloud boasts? No.Remember that ORCL has deep relationships with enterprises of all sizes. The company's database software is what's known as ""sticky"" in the tech world
column21: meaning that it would be a huge pain to get rid of it. Chief Information Officers would rather deal with the devil they know
column22: as ORCL is a horned creature with which they know intimately. ORCL will be able to bundle its software and services with cloud offering
column23: driving down the price of cloud services for all.Moreover
column24: Ellison has never been shy about making acquisitions to ""buy"" growth in fast-growing areas like the cloud.Walt Disney Co (DIS) Stock Is Still More Beast Than BeautyShares of ORCL have been on a roll this year
column25: gaining more than 16%
column26: outperforming rivals such as IBM and MSFT
column27: both of which posted single-digit increases. The shares are trading at about 6% discount to their average 52-week price target of $47.97. Though the valuation isn't particularly appealing now
column28: the stock might be worth picking up if there is a pullback.After all
column29: Wall Street has underestimated Ellison for years.As of this writing
column30: Jonathan Berr doesn't own any shares of any of the stocks mentioned above.More From InvestorPlaceThe 7 Best Dividend Stocks to Buy for the Second Quarter9 Cheap Stocks to Buy Now Under $9 a ShareThe postAre Oracle Corporation (ORCL) Stock's Cloud Promises Just Empty Rhetoric?appeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Interesting January 2018 Stock Options for MSFT;3/27/2017;"Consistently
column2: one of the more popular stocks people enter into theirstock options watchlistat Stock Options Channel is Microsoft Corporation (Symbol: MSFT). So this week we highlight one interesting put contract
column3: and one interesting call contract
column4: from the January 2018 expiration for MSFT. The put contract our YieldBoost algorithm identified as particularly interesting
column5: is at the $52.50 strike
column6: which has a bid at the time of this writing of $1.40. Collecting that bid as the premium represents a 2.7% return against the $52.50 commitment
column7: or a 3.3% annualized rate of return (at Stock Options Channel we call this theYieldBoost).Selling a put does not give an investor access to MSFT's upside potential the way owning shares would
column8: because the put seller only ends up owning shares in the scenario where the contract is exercised. So unless Microsoft Corporation sees its shares decline 18.8% and the contract is exercised (resulting in a cost basis of $51.10 per share before broker commissions
column9: subtracting the $1.40 from $52.50)
column10: the only upside to the put seller is from collecting that premium for the 3.3% annualized rate of return.makeArticleAd();Worth considering
column11: is that the annualized 3.3% figure actually exceeds the 2.4% annualized dividend paid by Microsoft Corporation
column12: based on the current share price of $64.72. And yet
column13: if an investor was to buy the stock at the going market price in order to collect the dividend
column14: there is greater downside because the stock would have to lose 18.82% to reach the $52.50 strike price.Always important when discussing dividends is the fact that
column15: in general
column16: dividend amounts are not always predictable and tend to follow the ups and downs of profitability at each company. In the case of Microsoft Corporation
column17: looking at the dividend history chart for MSFT below can help in judging whether the most recent dividend is likely to continue
column18: and in turn whether it is a reasonable expectation to expect a 2.4% annualized dividend yield.Turning to the other side of the option chain
column19: we highlight one call contract of particular interest for the January 2018 expiration
column20: for shareholders of Microsoft Corporation (Symbol: MSFT) looking to boost their income beyond the stock's 2.4% annualized dividend yield. Selling the covered call at the $70 strike and collecting the premium based on the $2.22 bid
column21: annualizes to an additional 4.2% rate of return against the current stock price (this is what we at Stock Options Channel refer to as theYieldBoost)
column22: for a total of 6.6% annualized rate in the scenario where the stock is not called away. Any upside above $70 would be lost if the stock rises there and is called away
column23: but MSFT shares would have to advance 8.2% from current levels for that to happen
column24: meaning that in the scenario where the stock is called
column25: the shareholder has earned a 11.7% return from this trading level
column26: in addition to any dividends collected before the stock was called.The chart below shows the trailing twelve month trading history for Microsoft Corporation
column27: highlighting in green where the $52.50 strike is located relative to that history
column28: and highlighting the $70 strike in red:The chart above
column29: and the stock's historical volatility
column30: can be a helpful guide in combination with fundamental analysis to judge whether selling the January 2018 put or call options highlighted in this article deliver a rate of return that represents good reward for the risks. We calculate the trailing twelve month volatility for Microsoft Corporation (considering the last 252 trading dayMSFT historical stock pricesusing closing values
column31: as well as today's price of $64.72) to be 19%.Top YieldBoost MSFT Calls »"

column1: Buy Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock Without All the Risk;3/27/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsThere's good reasons to be bullishly optimistic onMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) these days. But for investors
column3: there's less reason to be exposed to unnecessary risks both off and on the Microsoft stock price chart. The good news is you don't have to be. Let me explain.makeArticleAd();Source:Mike Mozart via Flickr (Modified)MSFT stock may not be the go-go growth stock it was back when dial-up internet services and Socks.com were still vying for investors' attention. But that's not entirely bad news for Microsoft investors.For a company still somewhat synonymous with the ubiquitous Windows OS and PC market
column4: great strides beyond those legacy businesses have been made - strides which
column5: overall
column6: continue to bode well for Microsoft stock.Where Microsoft StandsThe fact is
column7: Microsoft has captured strong market share and is enjoying robust growth in budding markets such as the cloud
column8: artificial intelligence and augmented reality which should support the company's reboot for the next quarter of a century and beyond.Some of the solid rebuild has been organic and under the stewardship of Microsoft's well-respected CEO Satya Nadella and whose ""Mobile First
column9: Cloud First"" philosophy and technological vision is a major driver.There have also been smart acquisitions and alliances which should benefit MSFT stock investors going forward. For one
column10: last year's $26 billion buyout ofLinkedIngives Microsoft access to the world's most dominant player in the business networking space.7 Consumer Stocks That Will Lead Your PortfolioWith LinkedIn's membership nearing a half-billion users and Microsoft integrating the service into its Dynamics CRM platform
column11: the impact should ensure more growth in this market and act as yet another support for Microsoft stock and its shareholders.More recently
column12: last week it was officially announced Microsoft andAdobe Systems Incorporated(NASDAQ:ADBE) willcollaborate in this marketand one increasingly reliant on the use of artificial intelligence for stronger productivity.The partnership integrates Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Adobe Experience Manager to this end. Customers can now better manipulate information and obtain stronger client outcomes. As standalone platforms
column13: this wasn't possible earlier and should help Microsoft compete against business rivalsSalesforce.com
column14: Inc.(NYSE:CRM) andOracle Corporation(NYSE:ORCL).Bottom line
column15: Microsoft stock continues to look quite promising for delivering shareholder value beyond healthy stock buybacks and dependable dividend payouts as the reboot of Microsoft 2.0 continues to offer growth opportunities off the chart.Microsoft Stock Weekly ChartOn the MSFT price chart and since writing aboutMicrosoft stock in mid-February
column16: not much has changed in the bank accounts of shareholders. But that's far from a bad thing. Microsoft stock is up about .75% over the last several weeks and has continued to trade in a tight consolidation.More specific
column17: a bullish
column18: flat-and-tight inside base of eight weeks has developed on top of a very constructive longer-term technical picture. Now and as stochastics flirts with an oversold condition
column19: MSFT stock's uptrend is looking quite friendly for intermediate-minded investors to enter into a collar position.MSFT Stock Collar StrategyReviewing the MSFT options board
column20: I like using a collar on Microsoft stock for positioning as part of a core holding within a portfolio.Specifically and with MSFT at $64.98
column21: an investor can sell the April $67.50 call and simultaneously buy the April $62.50 put for a debit of 10 cents. In conjunction with the purchase of shares
column22: the collar costs $65.08.In my last article
column23: the suggestion was for Microsoft investors to incorporate the sale of the $60 put. At the time and with shares at $64.38
column24: this created an even-money
column25: modified collar. Now though
column26: and with the put trading for a measly 7 cents and earnings embedded in the April contract
column27: it's a less sensible risk.Should an investor purchase the regular collar
column28: for the extra 10 cents premium paid
column29: downside risk is contained to less than 4%. Having that kind of protection in place through earnings
column30: andeven the occasional anomaly
column31: is nice insurance to have.The real cost of the collar would be if MSFT produced an abnormally large upside reaction following the earnings event. Profits are initially capped at just under 4% and matching the downside risk.Trade Twitter Inc (TWTR) Stock While the Market Is SubduedThe good news is the likelihood of MSFT moving more than 4% to 5% by a substantial amount is historically small. Throw in an expensive overall market and MSFT not being impervious to those pricing concerns either
column32: and it's a risk thought worth taking.Lastly
column33: if Microsoft shares did surprise with a stock reaction through the sold call strike
column34: the trader can continue to roll the collar up and out and trend trade the stock for additional gains.Investment accounts under Christopher Tyler's management do not currently own positions in any of the securities or their derivatives mentioned in this article. The information offered is based upon Christopher Tyler's observations and strictly intended for educational purposes only; the use of which is the responsibility of the individual. For additional market insights and related musings
column35: follow Chris on Twitter@Options_CAT.More From InvestorPlace10 Clobbered Stocks to Buy That Are About to Get Red-Hot9 Cheap Stocks to Buy Now Under $9 a ShareThe postBuy Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock Without All the Riskappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Better Than Cash: 8% Payouts “Hedged” Against a Market Pullback (QYLD
column2: EOS);3/27/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsIf you're worried about a pullback
column4: I don't blame you. But don't sit in cash and earn nothing when you can hedge your portfolio AND collect yields up to 8%.makeArticleAd();Let's talk about a couple of funds that use a well-worn options tactic - writing ""covered calls"" - that can generate generous yields typically between 7% and 9%. Conveniently
column5: you never have to deal with the complications of options contracts - these funds do all the work for you!But
column6: why covered calls
column7: and why now?Covered calls are an options strategy in which you sell call option contracts against stocks you hold. Selling the call options generates income
column8: called a ""premium."" From there
column9: a couple things can happen. If your stock reaches the strike price of the call option
column10: you're obligated to sell your shares to the call buyer (but you still keep the premium). If your stock stays below the strike price
column11: you still keep the premium
column12: and you can keep your shares - and from there
column13: if you'd like
column14: you can keep selling covered calls against them for more income.Ziegler Capital Management
column15: a specialty investment bank out of Chicago
column16: extols the virtues of covered calls (emphasis mine):""Investors often consider the income from the sale of the call option as a form of downside protection. As a result of this income
column17: covered call strategies have historically generated impressive results compared to the S&P 500 Index in terms of risk mitigation and volatility reduction. … Over a market cycle
column18: covered call strategies have tended to produce equity-like returns with lower beta and lower volatility.""10 Mutual Funds You Can Buy and Hold ForeverThis strategy does limit your upside during raging bull markets
column19: but whether we're about to fly into some market turbulence
column20: or on the slim chance that a significant downturn is nigh
column21: covered calls are the place to be.And if you don't want to deal with the complexity of trading options
column22: don't worry. column1: Better Than Cash: 8% Payouts “Hedged” Against a Market Pullback;3/27/2017;"By Brett OwensIf you're worried about a pullback
column2: I don't blame you. column3: you never have to deal with the complications of options contracts - these funds do all the work for you!makeArticleAd();But
column4: why covered calls
column5: and why now?Covered calls are an options strategy in which you sell call option contracts against stocks you hold. Selling the call options generates income
column6: called a ""premium."" From there
column7: a couple things can happen. If your stock reaches the strike price of the call option
column8: you're obligated to sell your shares to the call buyer (but you still keep the premium). If your stock stays below the strike price
column9: you still keep the premium
column10: and you can keep your shares - and from there
column11: if you'd like
column12: you can keep selling covered calls against them for more income.Ziegler Capital Management
column13: a specialty investment bank out of Chicago

column15: covered call strategies have historically generated impressive results compared to the S&P 500 Index in terms of risk mitigation and volatility reduction. ... Over a market cycle
column16: covered call strategies have tended to produce equity-like returns with lower beta and lower volatility.""This strategy does limit your upside during raging bull markets

column1: Current and Future Nvidia Corporation (NVDA) Stock Owners
column2: Keep an Eye on This;3/27/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsLast week
column4: chipmaker - and graphics processing specialist -Nvidia Corporation(NASDAQ:NVDA) unveiled some encouraging but perhaps unusual news. That is
column5: Chinese internet powerhouseTencent Holdings Ltd(OTCMKTS:TCTZF) hasselected Nvidia as the providerof its core hardware needed to make Tencent's artificial intelligence ambitions a reality.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockIt was odd
column6: simply because that's not what Nvidia does. A more conventional computer processor and chipset name likeAdvanced Micro Devices
column7: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMD) orIntel Corporation(NASDAQ:INTC) would make more sense serving as the backbone for a new AI system.Thing is
column8: this isn't the first time owners of NVDA stock have heard of the company's hardware being selected as the centerpiece of an artificial intelligence system. Just two weeks ago
column9: Nvidia was tapped byMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) topower the next generationof its AI offering.What gives?As it turns out
column10: traditional computer processors like Intel's Core and Pentium CPUs or AMD'sRyzenaren't necessarily best-suited for the ultra-high-speed processing needs the rise of AI has created. Investors - and not just NVDA stock holders - would be wise to note the nuance
column11: as AI is expected to become a$16 billion marketby 2022
column12: andgrow to $36 billionby 2025.GPU Technology vs. CPU TechnologyHistorically
column13: while the hardware and firmware supporting a computer's (or laptop's) display screen was a key part of its performance
column14: a device's heart and soul was its processor
column15: or CPU. It operates… well
column16: everything at blazing fast speed
column17: with more RAM (memory) helping out.7 Consumer Stocks That Will Lead Your PortfolioThe graphics processing unit
column18: or GPU
column19: wasn't a dealmaker or a dealbreaker.As computers have become faster and more powerful
column20: though
column21: and performance expectations have swelled
column22: GPUs have become very
column23: very impressive
column24: in many cases fully taking on the display-management role that was otherwise taken on by the CPU. Indeed
column25: a GPU is some4thing of a mini-computer in itself…… and they're very
column26: very fast. That makes them perfect for high-speed artificial intelligence applications
column27: where the quantity of computations is more important than the depth or complexity of those computations.An entry posted at the Nvidia corporate blog in the middle of last year not only served as something of an omen to the tech world
column28: but to savvy owners of Nvidia stock as well.It explains:""Computer programs contain commands that are largely executed sequentially. Deep learning is a fundamentally new software model where billions of software-neurons and trillions of connections are trained
column29: in parallel. Running DNN algorithms and learning from examples
column30: the computer is essentially writing its own software. This radically different software model needs a new computer platform to run efficiently. dlboost-3-webAccelerated computing is an ideal approach and the GPU is the ideal processor. As Nature recently noted
column31: early progress in deep learning was ""made possible by the advent of fast graphics processing units (GPUs) that were convenient to program and allowed researchers to train networks 10 or 20 times faster.""That's what Microsoft knew a couple of weeks ago when it asked Nvidia to provide the computing power for its HGX-1 hyperscale GPU accelerator
column32: specifically for cloud-based artificial intelligence applications.Nvidia CEO Jen-Hsun Huangadded of the new Microsoft/Nvidia venture:""AI is a new computing model that requires a new architecture. The HGX-1 hyperscale GPU accelerator will do for AI cloud computing what the ATX standard did to make PCs pervasive today. It will enable cloud-service providers to easily adopt NVIDIA GPUs to meet surging demand for AI computing.""ATX
column33: short forAdvanced Technology-eXtended
column34: is motherboard configuration that paved the way for the proliferation of PCs thereafter by standardizing how they would be assembled and what sort of hardware could be connected to them.The biggest leap forward since ATX was unveiled would be a game-changer indeed. With Tencent and Nvidia now taking another step down that road
column35: Nvidia is emerging as a key player in a market few expected it to be in.The Core of Alphabet Inc (GOOGL) Stock Is at RiskNvidia's deep-learning technology is also part of its autonomous driving platform
column36: though it remains to be seen exactly what its future looks like on that front.Bottom Line for Nvidia StockFor all intents and purposes
column37: Nvidia stock is still mostly an investment in tech company that makes computer displays work. That's not apt to change anytime in the immediate future. Given time though
column38: artificial intelligence is positioned to be a big piece of the company's revenue pie. Current and would-be shareholders need to add the subject of AI to the company's future report cards.As of this writing
column39: James Brumley did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceThe 7 Best Dividend Stocks to Buy for the Second Quarter9 Cheap Stocks to Buy Now Under $9 a ShareThe postCurrent and Future Nvidia Corporation (NVDA) Stock Owners

column1: 3 Top Augmented Reality Stocks to Buy in 2017;3/24/2017;"The augmented reality (AR) market
column2: which includes products   that project digital overlays atop real world images
column3: is often   overshadowed by the virtual reality (VR) market. Yet tech M&A   advisory firm Digi-Capital still believes that the  AR   market will grow from nearly nothing today to $90 billion by   2020
column4: compared to just $30 billion for the VR market.The firm believes that although the AR market will be   fragmented among products for various entertainment
column5: enterprise
column6: and e-commerce purposes
column7: it will reach more users than the VR   market
column8: which will be primarily focused on gaming and video.Image source: Getty Images.makeArticleAd();There aren't many publicly traded ""pure plays"" on the AR   market today
column9: but investors can take a closer look at three   companies that may benefit from its future growth --Microsoft(NASDAQ: MSFT)
column10: Himax Technologies(NASDAQ: HIMX)
column11: andApple(NASDAQ: AAPL) .The innovator: MicrosoftMicrosoft's biggest investment in the AR market is the   HoloLens
column12: a ""mixed reality"" headset that projects digital images   onto real world surfaces. In previous demos
column13: Microsoft showed   that the HoloLens could be used to play games likeMinecrafton coffee tables
column14: enable retail customers to virtually test out   products that aren't in the store
column15: and even ""teleport"" another   person  into the room via a holographic projection.The HoloLens isn't prepped for a commercial launch yet
column16: but   Microsoft has alreadysold ""thousands""of $3
column17: 000 development kits to early adopters. The upcoming   Windows 10 Creators Update will also add 3D image capture and    editing tools to the OS
column18: which will enable developers to   create 3D objects that can be viewed in the HoloLens. Microsoft's   upcoming VR headsets
column19: which will be developed by hardware   partners
column20: will also utilize similar voice and gesture commands as   the HoloLens -- so they could be considered ""training wheels"" for   the headsets.Image source: Microsoft.AR won't become a major revenue driver for Microsoft anytime   soon
column21: but HoloLens and the Creators Update could eventually make   Windows a major platform for next-gen AR apps.The supplier: Himax TechnologiesHimax is a Taiwanese supplier of display drivers for monitors
column22: tablets
column23: and smartphones. But in recent quarters
column24: Himax has   aggressively expanded into ""non-driver"" components for AR
column25: VR
column26: and 3D-sensing devices. In particular
column27: Himax's LCOS (liquid   crystal on silicon) products use highly reflective liquid   crystals that either reflect or block light for clearer digital   images -- which make them ideal for AR and VR headsets.In 2016
column28: Himax's non-driver revenues rose 23% annually and   accounted for 20% of its top line. That growth offset softer   sales of its display drivers for tablets and phones
column29: and boosted   its full year revenues by 16%. However
column30: analysts expect Himax's   revenue to fall 3% this year due to weaker seasonal demand for   display drivers and lower revenues from its AR/VR-related   businesses.Despite that hiccup
column31: which was likely caused by AR/VR demand   coming in below market expectations
column32: some analysts remain bullish   on Himax's long-term prospects in these next-gen markets. Nomura   Securities
column33: Morgan Stanley
column34: and Northland Securities all recently   upgraded the stock
column35: citing the growth potential of its display   drivers among newer TVs and growing demand for LCOS products for   AR/VR devices. Many analysts also believe that Himax will provide   a 3D-sensing chip for this year's iPhone. Mizuho estimates that   the iPhone design win could  account for  5% of Himax's   2017 earnings and 15% of its 2018 earnings.The wild card: AppleThat brings us to the unlikely third pick
column36: Apple. Apple   clearly needs to diversify its top line away from its core   iPhone
column37: iPad
column38: and Mac businesses
column39: and many analysts have   speculated that the company's next big hardware product will be   an AR device.In addition to Himax's rumored 3D-sensing chip for the next   iPhone -- which could enable it to project AR overlays on   surfaces like the HoloLens -- Apple has aggressively expanded   into the AR space over the past few years. It acquired AR/VR   firms like Metaio
column40: Faceshift
column41: Emotient

column1: Is India the Next Big Market for Apple's (AAPL) iPhones?;3/24/2017;"Indians will soon seeApple Inc.'sAAPLiPhone 6 and 6S models packaged with a tag line of 'Assembled in India'. Yes
column2: it's true.PerThe Wall Street Journal
column3: the company's Taiwanese supplier - Wistron - is likely to start making the aforesaid models in the next four to six weeks at its manufacturing facility in Bengaluru
column4: India. It should be noted that Wistron
column5: in late Dec 2016
column6: sought permission for expansion of its manufacturing facility from the Indian government.Though
column7: Apple's shares were down 0.4% yesterday
column8: it has gained 21.6% so far this year. Notably
column9: the stock's year-to-date return is almost in line with the Zacks categorizedComputer-Miniindustry's gain of 21.5%.Why is Apple Highly Focused on India?Since 2016
column10: Apple has been increasing its focus on India to claim a greater share of the vast smartphone market in the country
column11: of which it reportedly holds only 2% as of now. Apple has been facing a slowdown in iPhone demand in most regions
column12: either because of stiff competition or regulatory hurdles (China) or market saturation (the U.S). Thus
column13: it makes sense for the company to solidify/fortify its position in India
column14: which is projected to become the second largest smartphone market in the world.Notably
column15: in fiscal 2016
column16: Apple sales in India surged approximately 50% over the prior fiscal. Moreover
column17: during its last quarterly earnings conference call
column18: the company revealed that its smartphone sales in the country registered 51% year-over-year growth in the first three quarters of fiscal 2017.Apple
column19: of course
column20: is not the only tech player eyeing India for growth. Given the potential of this market
column21: Silicon Valley's interest is well understood. From Microsoft Corp.MSFTto AlphabetGOOGL
column22: to Facebook Inc.FB
column23: all remain laser focused on the Indian market.Furthermore
column24: a younger and skilled population
column25: along with increasing investment in broadband network by the government
column26: makes India an attractive growth opportunity for Apple over the long run. In fact
column27: the Indian government
column28: under Prime Minister Narendra Modi
column29: is eager to bring foreign capital and boost manufacturing facilities in the country.The recently outlined FDI policy by Indian government also bodes well for the company as it eliminates the requirement to locally source products for at least a three-year period. This will enable Apple to open its solely-owned retail stores in India. Thereafter
column30: the company will have to comply with the rule. In addition
column31: company has partnered with telecom company - Reliance - which is providing its Jio (a unique all-IP network) service for free with the new iPhones.Last year
column32: Tim Cook was on a charm offensive in India. Besides meeting Modi
column33: he also announced the opening of an iOS App Design and Development Accelerator in Bengaluru
column34: as well as a map development office in another Indian city - Hyderabad - in collaboration with regional firm RMSI. He was also seen hobnobbing with industrialists and movie stars during his maiden visit to the country.Will the Move Aid Apple's Cause?Per analysts
column35: the lion's share of Apple's revenues in the country comes from devices
column36: which are a couple of generations old. Newer models have relatively low demand given the hefty price tag. According to reports
column37: the Apple team in India is trying to increase revenues to $3 billion by fiscal 2017-18. Also
column38: by local assembling operations
column39: the company can start operating its own retail outlets and avail a 10% tax benefit. This
column40: in turn
column41: is likely to lower prices.However
column42: a Forbes analyst observes that even if Apple starts production locally
column43: the prices might not come down as much. This is because
column44: at present
column45: only assembling operations can be carried out in India as the country lacks a robust supply chain like China. Furthermore
column46: the analyst argues that though labor cost in the country is cheaper than China
column47: productivity is relatively better in China. Simple assembling may not drastically bring down prices. However
column48: if India can ""spark"" a creation of local supply chain like China
column49: then it will be a big positive.Moreover
column50: another analyst observes that Apple's lack of focus on regional customers' demand is a pressing concern. India is categorized by handsets that work on dual SIMs. Apparently
column51: Apple is not keen on making dual SIM handsets. This could be a very big impediment to growth in the country. The iPhone manufacturer is already late to the party. Its rival Samsung has long been in the market
column52: and with reportedly 23% share
column53: it is currently the leading player in the country.Bottom LineDespite Modi's historic move of demonetizing Rs 500 and Rs 1000 currency notes to combat corruption
column54: the company registered all-time record revenue figures in third-quarter fiscal 2017
column55: while its various competitors were hurt by the same. In our opinion
column56: this shows Indians' immense love for Apple's products.However
column57: the company lags behind its competitors on the pricing front. We believe that the latest move will allow Apple evade import duty tariffs. This will enable it to price its smartphones more competitively.Furthermore
column58: by manufacturing iPhone models in India
column59: Apple will be able to capture considerable market share in one of the world's fastest growing economy
column60: where it has a meager presence when compared with other rivals such as Samsung
column61: Micromax etc.Despite the pros and cons
column62: Apple is expected to continue its expansion drive in India. The company will be taking up a lot more initiatives this year. However
column63: whether those initiatives yield desirable results remains a wait and watch story.Currently
column64: Apple carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold). You can seethe complete list of today's Zacks #1 Rank (Strong Buy) stocks here.More Stock News: This Is Bigger than the iPhone!It could become the mother of all technological revolutions. Apple sold a mere 1 billion iPhones in 10 years but a new breakthrough is expected to generate more than 27 billion devices in just 3 years

column1: Revenue Growth is No SNAP for TWTR;3/23/2017;"makeZacksArticleAd();Snap Inc(SNAP) recently has seen new coverage from a few brokerages and today is the first day that is has a Zacks Rank.  The stock started off like a lot of recent IPO's with a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold).Yesterday I wrote an article about the pending flood of research we can expect on the recent IPO.  In that article I discussed who will initiate coverage
column2: who has already started coverage and some recent target prices placed on the stock.  I also guess at potential target prices from the lead in the IPO.A Prime ComparisonAs I try to wrap my head around SNAP
column3: I want to look at a good comparison.Twitter(TWTR) was once a social media darling - an technically it probably still is
column4: but the stock is anything but.CEO and other management issues including a massive brain drain have left the company in a tight spot.  I know that the CEO Jack Dorsey and new Chairman of the Board Omid Kordestani deserve some time to get things rolling
column5: but the outlook just isn't that good.Going For GrowthI am a growth guy and I want to see revenues expanding so much that even Mr. Wonderful himself Kevin O'Leary would blush.  SNAP has those sorts of numbers and I will review that idea later in another article
column6: but a major competitor just doesn't have it.Take a look at this chart of the revenues and expected revenues for Twitter:Do you see what I see?  Year over year revenue DECREASES for the next three quarters.  After all those declines
column7: what will they do in the fourth quarter of this year?  Well it is an increase
column8: but not much of one… 1%.Portfolio Manager's ViewImagine you are the growth portfolio manager at some mega fund.  I know you are on the hunt constantly for stocks that will post big revenue increases and you have to know that SNAP is at least going to be showing some solid growth when it comes out of the gate.One of the stocks that might have been competing for investment dollars is Twitter
column9: but after looking at the above chart
column10: are you the person that wants TWTR over SNAP?  I didn't think so.What About The Book?It wouldn't be fair to TWTR to just say that SNAP is in there taking away its revenue.  I mean there is another big social media stock out that that seems to be getting a lot of investor attention
column11: right?Facebook(FB) is a monster and has seen revenue growth accelerate in 2016 comparted to 2015.  Most projections call for some deceleration on the topline
column12: but some of these numbers are just astonishing:My ViewRevenue growth to me is key and as long as it is not present inTwitter(TWTR) I am not really interested in their stock.Facebook(FB) on the other hand has plenty of revenue growth.  We will get some big numbers next week for what Wall Street is looking for from SNAP.  Stay tuned to see what comes next from what could be the next mega growth story in tech.Be sure to view this article on Zacks.com and hit the follow the author button to see more from Brian Bolan.  Also
column13: be sure to follow him onTwitter at @BBolan1Facebook

column1: Twitter (TWTR) Suspends Thousands of Terrorist Accounts;3/23/2017;"Twitter Inc.TWTRhas taken a strong step to counter terrorism by flagging accounts linked with terrorism on its platform. According to Twitter's latest bi-annual transparency report
column2: the company has banned 636
column3: 248 accounts on grounds of violent extremism between Aug 2015 and Dec 2016.The company announced that out of the 636
column4: 248 accounts suspended so far
column6: 890 accounts linked with terrorism are pulled down between Jul 2016 and Dec 2016. Consequently
column7: this move raised the daily suspension rate by 80% compared with the last year.Moreover
column8: 74% of these accounts were identified by the internal spam fighting tools of the company. One-third of the blocked accounts were automatically detected by these spam fighting tools as there is no specific algorithm to detect the terrorist related accounts.Twitter's proactive stance in eliminating terrorist activities on its platform will surely boost its brand value
column9: which will attract advertisers eventually driving up top-line growth.Twitter

column1: International Business Machines Corp. (IBM) Stock Has More Room to Grow;3/23/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsInternational Business Machines Corp.(NYSE:IBM) has never been the first company the IT community thinks about when it comes to cloud computing. Its market position lags the better-known ""computing-as-a-service"" platform fromAmazon.com
column3: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN)
column4: Alphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column5: NASDAQ:GOOGL) andMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT). That's all right: At maybe $3 billion
column6: pure cloud services don't even drive 4% of the venerable company's annual top line.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockBut the transition from physical corporate data to cloud ""available anywhere"" approaches is enough of a game-changing story that IBM stock's fourth-place finish becomes extremely interesting to investors.And as the hoopla around a recent note from Morgan Stanley reveals
column7: it doesn't take more than a toehold in a fast-growing market to move the needle on an otherwise mature stock.Sure
column8: AMZN might have 40% of the global cloud business sewn up right now
column9: versus at best 6% to 8% for IBM. AMZN grabbed the early opportunity and is reaping the rewards. However
column10: the game now is all about bigger and more recalcitrant enterprise data pools shifting to cloud environments
column11: and that's where the real long-term money is going to come from.Why IBM Stock Can Do Well Wtih the CloudAmazon's cloud business is growing fast
column12: but its share of the overall market has plateaued. IBM stock has more room to come up from behind as it leveragesFortune500 relationships into more lucrative contracts.10 Small-Cap Stocks That Could Double in the Next 3 MonthsSo while AMZN is directly cannibalizing traditional premise-based computing relationships that once belonged to companies likeOracle Corporation(NYSE:ORCL)EMC Corporation(NYSE:EMC) orHewlett Packard Enterprise Co(NYSE:HPE)
column13: IBM is doing what it always does: Transforming the entire data ecosystem in order to keep the money coming in.It's not so much about an immediate return on investment here for customers as it's opening up new strategic capabilities that tie into IBM's artificial intelligence and advanced infrastructure. Once you graduate to the AMZN cloud
column14: you can migrate around the cloud universe to find the vendors that work best; once you tie in with IBM
column15: you're there for life.And as Morgan Stanley's analysts rightly pointed out
column16: that premise is almost entirely discounted in IBM stock's share price. Too few investors take the dark horse seriously
column17: crowding instead into AMZN where the cloud story seems more or less baked in - it would take pretty amazing news for this piece of the company to budge the stratospheric stock price much from here.At minimum
column18: MS thinks IBM's cloud is worth another $35 per share. We might argue a little about the specific numbers
column19: but it's not bad to be in fourth place at the moment. The company doesn't even have to try harder. It's just that there's still value for investors to buy IBM stock now and be rewarded down the road. Strip away all the high-tech jargon and that's the classic market opportunity: buy your diamonds when the rest of Wall Street is chasing shinier rocks.Hilary Kramer is the editor ofGameChangers

column1: Frontier Communications Corp (FTR): This 20% Yield Will Vanish (FTR);3/23/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsShares of troubled telecomFrontier Communications Corp(NASDAQ:FTR) are continuing to crash today
column3: with FTR stock off another 5% in the wake of a Wednesday downgrade.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockFor those of you keeping track
column4: that's a nearly 60% loss over the past year or so of trading
column5: putting FTR stock around the $2 per share range. On the upside
column6: that has driven Frontier's yield up to more than 20%.Best of luck if you go speculating on that.Specifically
column7: Goldman's Brett Feldman warned that Frontier may opt to suspend its dividend after the first quarter of this year for liquidity purposes
column8: as the company has significant debt maturities coming in 2020 through 2022. He continues:""With the stock's dividend yield nearly 2x peers'
column9: we believe the market is pricing in a 50% cut. We do not view this as sufficient to drive long-term delevering and have removed the dividend from our model after 1Q17.""In other words
column10: Frontier might cut the dividend in half
column11: which if it does
column12: would still mean a dividend yield of about 10% for FTR stock at current prices. In fact
column13: you can bet that yield will tick up even more
column14: because a dividend cut will almost surely spark additional selling.10 Safe Dividend Stocks to Own During the Next Market CrashFeldman's warning came amid a downgrade of other regionals
column15: includingWindstream Holdings
column16: Inc.(NASDAQ:WIN) andCenturylink Inc(NYSE:CTL). The trio all received ""sell"" ratings. However
column17: while all three have been suffering - WIN and CTL are down more than 20% in the past year - none are doing worse than Connecticut-based Frontier.To its credit
column18: Frontier has been growing its top line like a weed
column19: from $4.76 billion in 2013 and $4.77 billion in 2014 to $5.6 billion in 2015 and $8.9 billion last year. However
column20: income has been steadily dropping thanks to increased expenses - while the company was soundly profitable in 2013 and '14
column21: it flipped to a $319 million loss in 2015 that ballooned to nearly $600 million last year.FTR's cash position has been nearly halved since last year
column22: and sits at just $522 million - a pittance compared to nearly $18 billion of total debt
column23: which is more than double what it carried just three years ago.Buy Tesla Stock
column24: Just Not for the CarsWhile cash flow has been enough to cover the dividend
column25: those debts are mounting and need addressed. Back in November
column26: Thomas Byrne of Wealth Strategies & Management instead suggested the bonds for protection against a dividend cut:""The bonds give you three-quarters of the yield of the equity
column27: less duration risk and a higher place on the capital structure. If FTR runs into financial difficulties
column28: down the road
column29: dividends would be sacrificed to pay the debt.""The S&P 500 has already dropped Frontier from its ranks. For now

column1: The Future of Virtual Reality: 5 Things to Know;3/22/2017;"Virtual reality (VR) and augmented reality (AR) technologies   have gotten a lot of attention over the past few years.Sony's PlayStation VR headset is shining a spotlight onthe viability of VR gaming
column2: whileAlphabet's(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL)  Google Cardboard and new   Daydream View headsets are pushing mobile VR into the mainstream.   The unexpected success of Pokemon Go last year showed that   smartphone users are ready and willing to adopt augmented   reality. AndMicrosoft's(NASDAQ: MSFT)  development of its HoloLens goggles aim to   prove that the virtual and augmented worlds will soon become a   part of our reality.Investors looking to benefit from these two intertwined   markets should keep these five things in mind:Image source: Google.makeArticleAd();1. The future of VR could be our next computing     platformMuch of the attention surrounding virtual reality right now   has to do mainly with how it will be used for gaming
column3: filmmaking
column4: or other entertainment content. ButFacebook(NASDAQ: FB) CEO Mark Zuckerberg believes that VR could surpass   all of these categories.He said in a Bloomberginterviewlast year that VR is ""a good candidate to be the next major   computing platform."" Zuckerberg thinks it'll take a while for us   to get there (more on that later)
column5: but he's optimistic that VR   could be a primary form of communication technology in the near   future:Photos are richer than text; video
column6: much richer than photos.     But that's not the end
column7: right? I mean
column8: it's like this     indefinite continuum of getting closer and closer to being able     to capture what a person's natural experience and thought is
column9: and just being able to immediately capture that and design it     however you want and share it with whomever you want.2. It will take a while for VR to gain     tractionVR is still in its very early stages
column10: and it's likely that it   will take many more years before it becomes mainstream --   Zuckerberg has put the timeframe at five to 10 years.Adding to the slow pace is the fact that some hyped   technologies
column11: like Magic Leap's AR headset
column12: have recently been   found to be behind schedule.The Informationreported(subscription required) at the end of the last year that Magic   Leap -- which has raised $1.4 billion in funding in about three   years -- pivoted away from some of its earlier fiber optic   technologies and now trails the image quality of Microsoft's   HoloLens.And even the HoloLens
column13: which currently costs $3
column14: 000 and is   mainly for developers
column15: has sold only thousands of units. Roger   Walkden
column16: Microsoft's HoloLens commercial lead
column17: recently toldThe Inquirerthat
column18: ""We're not trying to sell hundreds of thousands or millions   or anything
column19: it's expensive
column20: and it's not in huge numbers. So   we're happy with the level of sales that we've got -- I can't   tell you anything about the numbers
column21: but it's in thousands
column22: not   hundreds of thousands
column23: and that's fine. That's all we need.""While Microsoft may be pleased with those numbers
column24: it's still   a clear indicator that VR and AR have a long way go before they   become mainstream.And then there's the recent news that Facebook's Oculus is   shutting down 200 of its 500 demo sites within Best Buy   stores
column25: reportedly due to thelack of public interest. The future may be virtual
column26: but we're getting there slowly.3. It offers a new way of seeing our worldJason Pontin
column27: the editor of MIT'sTechnology Review
column28: recentlyinterviewedJessica Brillhart
column29: a filmmaker for virtual reality at   Google
column30: and talked with her about how VR is currently used and   what it might become in the near future. When asked if   people will eventually use VR to record home videos
column31: Brillhart   responded that we probably would but that it might not be a good   thing
column32: Think of everything you forget about a birthday party when     you're a kid. But now the rig would capture everything. You     could watch someone you loved respond the way she used to
column33: or     eat cake a certain way. It is going to be interesting to see     what happens when we aren't able to forget anything     anymore.The interview is a good reminder that VR is still in its early   stages and it's still unclear how this platform will be used
column34: and   whether or not we'll like exactly how it turns out.4. Virtual reality could eventually impact all of the     sensesRight now
column35: VR is limited to a user's visual and auditory   senses
column36: but in the future this will likely be enhanced.   The general manager of Dell's gaming PC manufacturer   Alienware
column37: Frank Azor
column38: said thisin an interviewwith TIME last year:Once you begin catering to the rest of the senses
column39: like what     we feel body-wise
column40: temperature-wise
column41: and smell
column42: the reality     factor of virtual reality [becomes] stronger and the virtual     piece begins to fade.Breaking the barrier between the virtual world and the   physical world with high-end touch sensors could be the next step   in virtual reality
column43: and it won't be here for a while
column44: but VR   hardware and software makers are already thinking about how this   technology can go from immersive to fully interactive.5. The market potential for both AR and VR could be     hugeThe virtual reality market was worth about $1.9 billion in   2016
column45: but that's expected to climb to $22.4 billion by 2020.   Those numbers include both software and hardware sales. And when   you factor in AR sales
column46: the market skyrockets even higher. The   combined AR and VR market will be worth $121 billion by 2021
column47: according to Digi-Capital.In that same year
column48: IDC estimates more than 99 million AR and   VR headsets will be shipped
column49: up from just 10 million last year
column50: which represents a 58% compound annual growth rate between 2016   and 2021..The good news for investors is that companies are just getting   started with AR and VR
column51: which meansthe opportunities to benefit haven't passed. There are still plenty of unknowns
column52: but as more companies rally   around these new technologies and make the necessary investments   to get them off of the ground
column53: we're likely to see the future of   AR and VR develop substantially over the next few years.10 stocks we like better than FacebookWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column55: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade

column1: Oracle Launches Retail Merchandising Solution Over the Cloud;3/22/2017;"Oracle CorporationORCLhas recently announced the availability of its Oracle Retail Merchandising Solutions over its cloud platform - Oracle Cloud.The offerings are targeted at helping the retailers drive growth through optimizing mobility
column2: improving customer engagement and enhancing user experience
column3: thereby paving the way for a scalable and flexible business environment.However

column5: shares of Oracle have underperformed the Zacks Computer - Software industry over the last one year. While the industry gained 21.1%
column6: the stock increased only 8.4%.The underperformance of the stock could be attributed to the short-term headwinds resulting from the transition to the cloud from its on-premise licensing business model. However
column7: the company's prospects seem to be looking up and we expect the stock to rebound in the rest of 2017.Oracle Gaining Traction in SaaSDuring the last reported quarter
column8: Oracle's top-line growth benefited from the ongoing cloud-based momentum. Total cloud revenues (13.6% of total revenue) soared 70.7% to $1.26 billion in the reported quarter.Cloud software-as-a-service (SaaS) and platform-as-a-service (PaaS) revenues increased a significant 84.6% year over year to $1.08 billion
column9: which was within the management's guided range of 82-86%.Oracle Corporation Revenue (TTM)Oracle Corporation Revenue (TTM)|Oracle Corporation QuoteOracle continues to gain traction on its cloud endeavors. Specifically
column10: the company's offerings in SaaS and PaaS have gained significant momentum in the past few quarters
column11: which improves its competitive position.The company is gradually shifting its focus on a subscription-based business model from its earlier licensing based business model. This is because it offers the scope to have a recurring revenue stream which augurs well for the company in the long run.Per an IDC report
column12: the SaaS market is expected to surge over $112.8 billion by 2019
column13: which is currently growing at a CAGR of 18.3%. Given the gargantuan growth prospects the sector has to offer
column14: competition is intensifying.Currently
column15: the enterprise SaaS landscape is being dominated by salesforce.comCRM
column16: followed by MicrosoftMSFT
column17: AdobeADBEand SAP SE. However
column18: with Oracle's gradual transition from licensing to the cloud
column19: the company looks poised to take on the competition head on and carve a niche in the space in the coming years.Zacks RankAt present

column1: Close Update: Wall Street Recovers With S&P
column2: Nasdaq Advancing on Technology Strength;3/22/2017;"The main U.S. markets ended the mid-week session mostly higher
column3: as investors bought up shares on the Nasdaq Composite and the S&P 500 following sharp declines a day earlier. The Dow Jones Industrial Average
column4: however
column5: was kept in check by a steep loss in Nike (NKE)
column6: which reported revenue that was shy of expectations.Technology shares led the day's gains
column7: advancing 0.8% in the strongest increase among the S&P sectors. On the Dow
column8: Microsoft (MSFT)
column9: Intel (INTC) and Apple (AAPL) all headed higher in moves that also helped lift the Nasdaq
column10: and were among the nearly two-thirds of the blue chips that increased. But Nike's 7% plunge kept the overall index fluctuating between gains and losses before ultimately ending little changed at the bell.As trading opened
column11: stocks added to Tuesday's losses as investors worried that a failure by the GOP to pass the American Healthcare Act on Thursday would jeopardize President Donald Trump's plans to lower taxes
column12: reduce regulations and increase infrastructure spending.makeArticleAd();White House Press Secretary Sean Spicer said Trump remains confident of the bill passing
column13: but some Republican lawmakers cast doubt on whether there's enough support to get the measure through.A reported terrorist attack in London that left four people dead and many more injured drove the FTSE 100 lower just ahead of the close in the British capital
column14: with losses spilling into the other European bourses.Retailers were jolted by a warning from Sears Holding (SHLD) that it had doubt it can continue as a going concern
column15: although the chief financial officer later said the department store is focused on executing its transformation plan and will continue to take actions to ensure competitiveness and the ability to meet financial obligations. Some retailers recouped losses
column16: although Macy's (M) and J.C. Penney (JCP) were still in the red by the close.While Thursday's health care vote is capturing the political agenda
column17: investors will keep an eye on Federal Reserve Chair Janet Yellen
column18: speaking early at 8:45 a.m. ET at a Community Development Conference. If she addresses policy

column1: Why the Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock Comeback Is Just Beginning;3/21/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) has gotten some of its moxie back. Granted
column3: the growth is nowhere near the pace of the glory years of the 1980s and 1990s. But then again
column4: the shareholder returns have been impressive. During the last 5 years
column5: Microsoft stock has logged a gain of nearly 100%. By comparison
column6: International Business Machines Corp.(NYSE:IBM) has a loss of 13% andQualcomm
column7: Inc.(NASDAQ:QCOM) lost about 11%.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockBut it does seem like the opportunity may be mostly gone for Microsoft stock. Let's face it
column8: the valuation is far from cheap.Consider that the price-to-earnings ratio is about 30X and MSFT stock is near an all-time high. Yet
column9: I think there remains more upside. The fact is that Microsoft stock is a great way to play the cloud megatrend
column10: which is likely to see growth for many years.Why MSFT Stock Is a Good BetThis technology has many benefits that are just too critical to ignore
column11: such as the ability for real-time analytics
column12: better integration with other systems and seamless updates. The business model is also fairly predictable
column13: since it is based on ongoing subscriptions.According toAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column14: NASDAQ:GOOGL) Cloud Chief Diane Greene
column15: only about5% of the world's data is in the cloud. She thinks that ultimately the market could hit a stunning $1 trillion.7 Small-Cap Tech Stocks on the Cutting EdgeBut there is another important driver: In today's world
column16: just about all companies need a strong digital presence to be successful. Simply put
column17: customers have come to expect that they should go to a site or app - and quickly get what they want.So to provide this service
column18: companies will need to rely on cloud services. And for now
column19: the two main players include MSFT andAmazon.com
column20: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN).But Microsoft stock may be in the best position. The company has a trusted global brand
column21: a massive global infrastructure
column22: a network of millions of developers as well as thousands of partners and a wide assortment of enterprise software products. Oh
column23: and there is a massive customer base that uses productivity apps like Office.Such advantages are extremely tough to replicate.Bottom Line on Microsoft StockBut what's also important for MSFT stock is that the company has essentially gone all-in with its cloud efforts
column24: such as integrating features among its products and engaging in aggressive M&A.For example
column25: the company has acquired MileIQ
column26: Xamarin and SwiftKey to bolster its mobile footprint. And more recently
column27: MSFT has been acquiring companies in the Artificial Intelligence space. Some examples include Genee (AI-powered scheduling) and Maluuba (natural language processing).Chesapeake Energy Corporation (CHK) Stock Is an Absolute Steal Right NowYet the $27 billion purchase for LinkedIn will perhaps be the most significant for Microsoft stock. With the deal
column28: MSFT gets the global leader in professional online networks - there are over467 million members- that should allow for powerful synergies with existing assets. Already
column29: the company has added LinkedIn services with the Dynamics CRM platform.So yes
column30: it should be no surprise that the quarterly reports from MSFT reflect lots of momentum. In the latestquarter
column31: the company's Azure service
column32: which is similar to Amazon Web Services
column33: saw revenues spike by 93%. In fact
column34: the annual run-rate for the total cloud segment is at over $14 billion.It's true that the cloud market is getting increasingly competitive
column35: as seen with the efforts of companies like IBM
column36: Oracle Corporation(NYSE:ORCL) andHewlett Packard Enterprise Co(NYSE:HPE)
column37: but they are all really playing catchup and they do not have the breadth of services that MSFT has. In other words
column38: when it comes to playing the cloud
column39: Microsoft stock remains a great option for investors.Tom Taulli runs the InvestorPlace blogIPO Playbookand is the author of various books
column40: includingTaxes 2017: Saving A Bundle.Follow him on Twitter at@ttaulli. As of this writing
column41: he did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace10 Clobbered Stocks to Buy That Are About to Get Red-Hot7 Dividend Stocks With Yields That Grow Like WeedsThe postWhy the Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock Comeback Is Just Beginningappeared first onInvestorPlace."

Comparing the most recent share price to the 200 day moving average can also be a useful technical analysis technique --learn more about the 200 day moving average ».makeArticleAd();Exchange traded funds (ETFs) trade just like stocks
column17: but instead of ''shares'' investors are actually buying and selling ''units''. These ''units'' can be traded back and forth just like stocks
column18: but can also be created or destroyed to accommodate investor demand. Each week we monitor the week-over-week change in shares outstanding data
column19: to keep a lookout for those ETFs experiencing notable inflows (many new units created) or outflows (many old units destroyed). Creation of new units will mean the underlying holdings of the ETF need to be purchased
column20: while destruction of units involves selling underlying holdings
column21: so large flows can also impact the individual components held within ETFs.Click here to find out which 9 other ETFs had   notable inflows »"

column1: Apple Inc. Launches New Red iPhone 7
column2: New iPad;3/21/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsWe got the first hintApple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) was up to something last night
column4: when the Apple Store went down for maintenance. Then the ""We've got something special for you"" notice showed up. At 8:30 a.m. ET
column5: we learned what AAPL was up to overnight.makeArticleAd();Source: AppleThe rumored red iPhone 7 has been added along with a new iPad to replace the iPad Air 2.Here's what you need to know about Apple's latest product releases.Red iPhone 7Apple's product launches this morning
column6: apparently didn't warrant a special event. But thered iPhone 7is a first. It's part of the company's (PRODUCT)RED line that contributes to the Global Fund to Fight Aids. Going red is a way to stretch interest in the current iPhone 7 lineup until the new iPhone 8 is ready to go in September.When it comes to strategies for sparking new interest in an old device

column16: its new app for shooting short

column18: complete with special effects and soundtracks. Clips is made for those who live to share funky videos through social media.What About That April Special Event?All signs had been pointing to anApple Event in April. Presumably

The company wants to make a splash about Apple Park
column20: and its Steve Jobs Theater - which is intended to be the site for Apple product launches going forward.Why I Sold Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock (And You Should

column22: a near bezel-free display and a virtual Home button among them.Those new iPad Pros could well be the first new product launch at the Steve Jobs Theater and would provide AAPL the opportunity to hint at what's to come with the new iPhone 8 in September. Evenhintsabout the iPhone 8 could help to take some of the shine off rival Samsung's Galaxy S8 launch.In the meantime

column1: 5 Excellent ETFs for Your IRA;3/20/2017;"With the tax filing deadline of April 18 a little over four weeks away
column2: investors still have some time to make contributions to their individual retirement accounts (IRAs) for the 2016 tax year. While some prefer traditional IRAs
column3: many others favor Roth IRAs; both these retirement products provide amazing tax benefits.makeAd('4'
column5: 'mktsnews'
column6: 'vanguard'
column8: '');IRAs allow investors to buy individual stocks
column9: bonds
column10: ETFs or mutual funds.  ETFs are becoming increasingly popular with investors due to their low cost
column11: transparency and tax efficiency. (Read:6 Solid Reasons to Buy Financials ETFs Now)ETFs are excellent tools for retirement investors as well since they provide an easy way to build a diversified portfolio at a low cost. Further
column12: income paying ETFs are better placed in an IRA as income is sheltered from taxes.Before investing for retirement
column13: investors need to assess their investing goals
column14: time horizon and risk tolerance. They need to remember that performance of an investment portfolio depends mostly on asset allocation
column15: i.e. how an investor allocates money among major asset classes such as stocks
column16: bonds
column17: alternative assets and cash.Low-cost
column18: broad
column19: diversified funds are more suitable for retirement investors as core
column20: long-term investments rather than costly
column21: narrow-focused or niche ETFs
column22: which should mainly be used as shorter-term tactical trading vehicles. (Read:Sector ETFs to Win or Lose Post Jobs Data)Expense ratio of an ETF should be an important consideration in retirement investing
column23: as in the long-term
column24: cheaper funds can significantly outperform their more expensive counterparts
column25: other things remaining the same.Below we have highlighted five ETFs that are excellent long-term investments for retirement accounts.iShares Core S&P Total U.S. Stock Market ETF (ITOT)ITOT is a convenient way to get exposure to the entire US stock universe
column26: ranging from some of the smallest to largest companies at an extremely low cost of just 3 basis points. It holds more than 3
column27: 600 stocks in its basket and should be a core holding in any long-term focused portfolio. (Read:Why Do Equal Weight ETFs Outperform?)Apple (AAPL)
column28: Microsoft (MSFT) and Johnson & Johnson (JNJ) are its top holdings.Vanguard Dividend Appreciation ETF (VIG)VIG is the most popular ETF in the dividend space with AUM exceeding $24 billion. The fund holds high quality stocks that have a record of increasing dividends over the past decade. The product currently holds 185 securities in its basket.The ETF charges just 9 bps in annual fees while its dividend yield is 2.00%.Schwab U.S. Large-Cap Value ETF (SCHV)Numerous academic studies have shown that value stocks have delivered higher returns with lower volatility compared with growth stocks over the long term in almost all the markets studied. Given their proven performance over long term
column29: value stocks and funds should be a predominant part of any 'core' portfolio.SCHV provides broad exposure to large-cap U.S. stocks with value style characteristics.It has an expense ratio of just 4 basis points
column30: while the dividend yield at 2.5% is quite attractive.Goldman Sachs ActiveBeta US Large Cap Equity ETF (GSLC)GSLC was the first in a series of smart beta ETFs that track Goldman Sachs's proprietary indexes. This product is based on four factors--good value
column31: strong momentum
column32: high quality and low volatility.These factors usually outperform in different market conditions and in fact
column33: value and momentum tend to complement each other. By combining those different factors
column34: this ETF has a good chance of producing superior results over the long term.Further
column35: with an expense ratio of just 9 basis points
column36: it is one of the cheapest products in the smart beta space.Vanguard Intermediate-Term Corporate Bond ETF (VCIT)VCIT is an excellent option for fixed income investing focused on long-term. I like it better than the total bond ETFs like AGG and BND in the current rising rate scenario since total bond ETFs have outsized exposure to Treasuries. Further
