column1: Why Shares of GameStop Dropped Today;2/28/2017;"What happenedShares of video game retailerGameStop(NYSE: GME) slumped on Tuesday afterMicrosoft(NASDAQ: MSFT) announced a subscription service that gives Xbox   One owners full access to over 100 older games. The potential for   this service to hurt sales of both new and used physical game   discs sent GameStop stock down 10% by 2:45 p.m. EST on   Tuesday.So whatXbox Game Pass is set to launch this spring. The subscription   service will cost $9.99 per month and give gamers the ability to   download more than 100 Xbox One and backward-compatible Xbox 360   games. The catalog of games available will change month to month
column2: but subscribers will be able to purchase any game in the catalog   at a 20% discount to the retail price.Image source: Microsoft.makeArticleAd();This new subscription service from Microsoft has the potential   to depress physical game sales
column3: which is bad news for GameStop.   During the third quarter
column4: GameStop generated 31.5% of its revenue   from new game sales and 24% of its revenue from used and value   game sales. Used and value games are a big cash cow for GameStop
column5: with the category's gross margin nearly double that of new   games.Used and value game sales may end up being the hardest hit if   Xbox Game Pass is a success
column6: which would take a big bite out of   GameStop's bottom line. It could also triggerSonyto launch a similar service in the future. Sony already offers   PlayStation Now
column7: which streams games from the cloud
column8: but being   able to download games directly side-steps the issues inherent in   that approach.Now whatGameStop has been diversifying beyond physical games in an   effort to survive in a world where console games are increasingly   going digital. The company sells digital games as well as   electronics and collectibles
column9: which collectively generated nearly   20% of revenue during the third quarter
column10: but GameStop remains   heavily dependent on physical game sales.Xbox Game Pass represents another step on the way toconsole games going completely digital. GameStop's vast store base is supported by physical game sales
column11: so any shift toward digital games is ultimately bad for the   company.10 stocks we like better than GameStopWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: Amazon To Sell Gaming Content On Subsidiary Twitch;2/28/2017;"AmazonAMZNacquired video game streaming company Twitch in 2014 for $1 billion and the online retailer is now looking to further capitalize on the $100 billion video gaming industry.Twitch is a platform similar to YouTube where video game fans can watch their favorite games being played live by other video-gamers; an added form of interaction is available through the options of commenting and posing questions on the site.When the deal took place
column2: it raised eyebrows. Not many understood Amazon's intentions of having Twitch's services as a subsidiary. The move is now clear.Coming this spring
column3: games and game features will be available for purchase right on Twitch's site. Games from companies such as UbisoftUBSFYand Telltale Games will be available. However higher profile developers
column4: such as Electronic ArtsEAand ActivisionATVI
column5: will be missing.The incentive is a double-edged sword
column6: as Amazon will get a 25% cut of content sold and the streamer
column7: who is the person playing the game
column8: will get a 5% cut.Amazon views this platform as a way to compete with game consoles such as Microsoft'sMSFTXbox and Sony'sSNEPlayStation. However
column9: the prominent revenue stream for PC games is different than consoles. On PCs
column10: leading revenue is generated from game features rather than the game itself. Features include add-ons which enhance gaming experience.Twitch's vice president of commerce
column11: Matt McCloskey
column12: hopes the site's 10 million daily viewers will be encouraged to purchase content while viewing their favorite gamers play. He stated
column13: ""Ultimately
column14: the principle is if you can watch it on Twitch
column15: you can buy it on Twitch.""A Full-Blown Technological Breakthrough in the   MakingZacks' Aggressive Growth Strategist Brian Bolan explores autonomous cars in our latest Special Report

column1: Facebook Inc's Chatbots Hit a 70% Failure Rate;2/28/2017;"Facebook(NASDAQ: FB) is reportedly scaling back its chatbot efforts on   Messenger after the programs failed to fulfill 70% of users'   requests.The Informationreports that those requests couldn't be handled without human   agents
column2: and bots built by outside developers ""had issues"" because   the ""technology to understand human requests wasn't developed   enough.""So instead of building a large ecosystem of chatbots
column3: Facebook   will train Messenger bots to handle ""a narrower set of cases
column4: so   users aren't disappointed by the limitations of automation.""   Let's see what this strategic shift means for Facebook's AI   efforts
column5: and whether or not chatbots will ever become meaningful   tools for the social network.Image source: Getty Images.makeArticleAd();Understanding Facebook's AI strategyArtificial intelligence plays a vital role in helping Facebook   track users and deliver targeted ads. By using AI to scan a   user's status updates
column6: photos
column7: videos
column8: check-ins
column9: likes
column10: linked   apps
column11: and other data
column12: Facebook generates digital profiles of   users which help it deliver targeted ads to their News Feeds. In   2013
column13: Facebook launched the FAIR (Facebook Artificial   Intelligence Research) unit to continuously upgrade those AI   capabilities.That's where Messenger comes in. In 2014
column14: Facebook forced   users to download the stand-alone Messenger app to keep chatting.   That move -- whichclearly mirroredTencent's(NASDAQOTH: TCEHY) WeChat -- laid the foundations for Messenger   to become a ""platform"" which could eventually offer ride hailing
column15: mobile payments
column16: deliveries
column17: games and other services from a   single app.Facebook's Messenger app. Image source: Google Play.That move would give Facebook an ""OS within an OS"" to counter   the iOS App Store andAlphabet's(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) Google Play. Facebook's next   step would be toreplaceapps with Messenger chatbots
column18: which were introduced last April.   If that effort works
column19: it could turn the entire mobile app store   model upside down.The premature rise of the chatbotsIn theory
column20: a business chatbot could answer questions
column21: make   purchase suggestions
column22: process orders
column23: and send shipping updates   to customers. For customers
column24: having ""conversations"" with these   bots would feel more natural than scrolling and clicking through   a mobile app. Companies could  also cut costs by reducing   the number of human customer service representatives.Facebook tethers those bots to Messenger for Business
column25: which   provides a live customer service chat channel for a large number   of businesses. Businesses can choose to put a human or a chatbot   to handle queries on their end. This idea attracted a lot of   early adopters -- 30
column26: 000 Facebook bots were already active on   Messenger as of last September.But just as Google struggled with low-quality apps over the   years
column27: Facebook's ecosystem quickly became bogged down with   poorly produced chatbots. Badly made bots could annoy customers   and tarnish a company's image -- so the company decided it's a   better idea to send the bots back to the drawing board than   expand the overall ecosystem.Facebook should've seen this comingThe limitations of AI-powered bots were already clear when   Facebook launched its chatbot APIs last year. For example
column28: Microsoft(NASDAQ: MSFT) launched its chatbot Tay onTwitteras an experimentlast March. Within 24 hours
column29: Tay started tweeting racist and   sexist comments
column30: forcing Microsoft to abruptly pull the plug and   issue an  apology. Tencent has also struggled to  purge   spam and scam bots on WeChat since it started letting millions of   accounts create their own bots.Facebook's AI tech also wasn't that impressive prior to the   arrival of its chatbots. Its News Feed struggled to discern fake   news headlines from real ones
column31: and its Messenger-based virtual   assistant M hasn't gained much  ground against Google Now or   Siri.Edison Investment analyst Richard Windsor -- who    recently called Facebook a ""laggard in AI"" compared to   Google -- stated that ""when Facebook tries to automate its   systems
column32: things always go wrong."" He also pointed out that while   Facebook has hired plenty of AI talent
column33: it simply hasn't been   working on AI ""for nearly long enough"" to challenge market   leaders like Google.So what's next for Facebook's AI efforts?Despite those missteps
column34: Facebook probably won't stop investing   in chatbots anytime soon. The company is expected to introduce   new AI plans at its F8 conference in April
column35: which will likely   include ways to boost the quality
column36: not quantity
column37: of its Messenger   bots. It could also introduce more ways to tether bots into other   Messenger features -- like payments and games -- to increase the   app's appeal as a stand-alone platform.10 stocks we like better than FacebookWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: Alphabet Suing Uber Over Self-Driving Car Technology;2/28/2017;"Uber badly needed self-driving car technology because it was in danger of getting pushed out of the market if many cheaper ride-hailing services using self-driving technology (no human driver) were to enter the market. So it assumed a not-so-honest way of getting it. That's what AlphabetGOOGLis claiming after discovering the theft of its technology by a former Googler.The Technology in QuestionGoogle has for long held that its technology
column2: which includes hardware and software components
column3: is superior to others. The company
column4: which originally used LiDAR based systems from Velodyne
column5: later developed a number of such systems for close-range
column6: mid-range and long-range ""vision"" of self-driving cars. These systems generate millions of laser images per second that offer a much clearer picture of the area surrounding the car and helps it take more accurate decisions.Additionally
column7: the company recently announced that it had devised a more economical system that would take its cost from $75
column9: to $7
column11: thus making it commercially viable.The AccusedAnthony Levandowskihas been accused of downloading 14
column12: 000 highly confidential files (9.7GB of data)
column13: including Waymo's LiDAR circuit board designs to an external disk drive using specialized software. He then downloaded a new OS to his company-supplied laptop that effectively deleted information
column14: in a rather elaborate attempt to erase his activity. Strangely
column15: Levandowski didn't use the laptop much after the new OS was installed.After quitting Google
column16: Levandowski set up a self-driving trucking company calledOtto
column17: wooing fifteen other Waymo engineers
column18: who brought additional supplier lists
column19: manufacturing details and other trade secrets.Otto quickly sold itself toUberfor $680 million.Uber's ResponseUber remains partners with Google for other technology despite their increased competition on the self-driving front. As an initial response
column20: a Uber representative said
column21: ""We take the allegations made against Otto and Uber employees seriously and we will review this matter carefully.""Later
column22: this changed to: ""We are incredibly proud of the progress that our team has made… We have reviewed Waymo's claims and determined them to be a baseless attempt to slow down a competitor and we look forward to vigorously defending against them in court. In the meantime
column23: we will continue our hard work to bring self-driving benefits to the world.""Other DetailsThe discovery of theft was intriguing: A Uber supplier had inadvertently copied a Google executive in a mail titled ""Otto files."" The mail was being sent to people at Uber that Google thinks were involved with Uber's self-driving technology.Google found that the replicated technology
column24: the diagrams of which were attached to the email
column25: bore a close resemblance to its proprietary technology and was based on Waymo trade secrets. ""Moreover
column26: the Replicated Board is specifically designed to be used in conjunction with many other Waymo trade secrets and in the context of overall LiDAR systems covered by Waymo patents
column27: the complaint reads.Upon inquiry with the Nevada Governor's Office of Economic Development and Department of Motor Vehicles
column28: it was found that Uber said its technology was internally developed.The Big PictureAs a Bloomberg report points out
column29: Levandowski didn't start out at Google. He has been working on autonomous vehicles for some time
column30: founding a startup called 510 systems in 2001 that he later sold to Google. The technology this startup brought is the foundation of Google's technology.At the end of the day
column31: engineers do like to move around because it's more profitable and allows them liberties that aren't available for sticking around at a big corporate house like Google. This is neither the first nor last time companies have whisked away people from competitors. All the major tech companies including Google itself
column32: MicrosoftMSFT
column33: FacebookFB
column34: TwitterTWTR
column35: AppleAAPL
column36: you name it
column37: have done likewise.Engineers are the life blood of companies like Google while on the other hand
column38: the big companies are the only ones that can make engineers rich. So while Google could win this battle
column39: the war will go on.A Full-Blown Technological Breakthrough in the   MakingZacks' Aggressive Growth Strategist Brian Bolan explores autonomous cars in our latest Special Report

column2: What's Happening With Advanced Micro Devices Stock?;2/28/2017;"Unless you closely follow the stock
column3: you probably had no idea   shares ofAdvanced Micro Devices(NASDAQ: AMD) are up a gaudy 620% since March 2016 in the last 12   months. That is not a typo.makeArticleAd();AMDdata byYCharts.The ongoing rally in AMD shares has been perhaps one of the   least discussed but most impressive investing storylines in tech   in the past year. In fact
column4: AMD's share-price surge is about three   times larger than the incredible run inNVIDIAstock over the last year. So what's driving this wild
column5: newfound   bullishness in AMD stock? Let's take a look.Understanding AMD's stock rallyAMD's business has enjoyed something of a turnaround in recent   quarters. After seeing sales fall for seven consecutive quarters
column6: AMD has produced positive sales growth in each of its three most   recent quarters. Investors anticipate company-specific and   industrywide trends will allow AMD to expand its business   presence in each of its two core operating segments in the years   to come.On the gaming side of its business
column7: MicrosoftandSonywill each refresh their respective consoles in the coming years   to enable next-generation graphic capabilities like 4K video   quality and virtual reality (VR) gaming. AMD is the main supplier   of semi-customer system-on-a-chip (SOC) for both Microsoft's Xbox   and Sony's Playstation gaming consoles; Sony and Microsoft each   consistently account for more than 10% of AMD's annual sales.. Microsoft has already announced its latest Xbox iteration
column8: dubbed Project Scorpio
column9: which will arrive in time for the 2017   holiday season. Sony has yet to announce its response to Scorpio
column10: but major console releases tend to closely follow one another.   Many industry observers believe this new upgrade cycle will   create a corresponding surge in new revenue for AMD that will   help extend its current sales growth momentum.In its computing and graphics unit
column11: AMD should enjoy an   opportunity to catch up withIntel(NASDAQ: INTC) in CPUs and NVIDIA in GPUs to a certain   extent. AMD's forthcoming 14 nm Ryzen CPUs
column12: due to launch by   March
column13: offer more powerful performance than Intel's i7 chips.   Similarly
column14: AMD's Vega chips appear to be a legitimate challenger   to NVIDIA's GeForce high-end gaming GPUs. So there's certainly a   fair case to be made that sales  will indeed   improve at AMD in the coming year.All of this is to say that things are generally looking up at   AMD. At the same time though
column15: a few important points cause me to   question whether its rally can continue.Image source: Getty Images.How much is too much?Though business conditions are indeed improving at AMD
column16: it   isn't as clear that this longtime ugly duckling has permanently   transformed into a swan
column17: for a few reasons.A key piece of AMD's bull thesis is that its current 14 nm Zen   server chips have closed the gap with Intel's 14 nm Broadwell   server microprocessors this year
column18: largely the result of Intel's   decision to not shift its CPUs to a 10 nm die shrink
column19: codenamed   Cannonlake
column20: until the second half of 2017. Bullish analysts see   AMD catching Intel at the 14 nm level as creating a window for it   to steal server market share from Intel
column21: which indeed seems   plausible. However
column22: with Intel moving to 10 nm by the latter half   of this year
column23: AMD's parity with Intel server chips seems likely   to be short-lived
column24: making this large market-share gain difficult   to sustain.Equally important
column25: it isn't necessarily clear whether   meaningful sales growth will translate into actual profits for   AMD and its investors. Though the company has gone through two   separate cost-structure overhauls
column27: its margin   structure has continued to deteriorate. For example
column28: its gross   margins fell from 27% in 2015 to 23% in 2016
column29: even as it saw its   revenue increase 12%. This suggests AMD's business model lacks   the kind ofoperating leveragethat could allow it to quickly return to profitability if sales   continue to rise.In a nutshell
column30: ongoing success is by no means assured at AMD.   The company has done an admirable job capitalizing on its various   opportunities in recent years. However
column31: as we saw above
column32: several   structural reasons exist that may make it difficult to sustain   this kind of success over the long term.10 stocks we like better than Advanced Micro   DevicesWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: Xbox Live Games With Gold for March 2017;2/27/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsMicrosoft Corporation's(NASDAQ:MSFT) March selection of Xbox Live games with Gold has been unveiled.makeArticleAd();Source: MicrosoftThe companyreleases four gamesthat are available for download free of charge granted that you are signed up to its exclusive Xbox Live Gold service. There are usually four games - two Xbox One titles and two Xbox 360 ones - that you can pick from and the price of the service varies depending on what option you choose (the 12-month option will set you back $46.89).Layers of Fearis available for the entire month of March and it is a psychological horror where you control a mentally disturbed patient working on his masterpiece. It's an Xbox One title.Xbox 360 owners will be able to playBorderlandfrom March 1 until March 15. The game is an action role-playing game

column4: and it will be available from March 16 until March 31. It is a side-scrolling shoot-'em-up game.Finally

column6: and it is a first-person shooter title.MSFT stock lost 0.8% Monday.More From InvestorPlace9 Top Pharmaceutical Stocks to Buy for the Dividends9 Best Cheap Stocks to Buy Now Under $9.997 Ultra-Cheap Value Stocks to Buy NowThe postXbox Live Games With Gold for March 2017appeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Is Bitcoin Finally a Serious Currency -- or Maybe Even a Solid Investment Vehicle?;2/27/2017;"The computer-driven currency known as Bitcoin has been through   a few rough years. After peaking at $1
column2: 216 per Bitcoin at the end   of 2013
column3: conversion prices plunged all the way to $200 in just 16   months. Today
column4: Bitcoin values have surged back above $1
column5: 100 and   might set fresh all-time highs someday soon.The Bitcoin boom in 2013 turned into a total rout. Is the   currency headed for another meltdown
column6: or should you take Bitcoin   more seriously this time around?Chart source:Bitcoin Charts. License:Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0makeArticleAd();What was the problem last time?Four years ago
column7: Bitcoin found itself in a global spotlight.   Having started as a hobby project in 2009
column8: the crypto-currency   had surged from ""basically worthless"" to a value of hundreds of   dollars per currency unit. Investors
column9: speculators
column10: and downright   gamblers were trying to find ways to profit from this new thing.   On the back end
column11: hobbyists gave way to serious number-crunchers   who used special math-processing chips to process the   exponentially increasing number of bitcoin blocks.What followed was a series of scandals. Critics called the   Bitcoin increase a ""bubble
column12: undermining trust in the currency.   Perception is reality
column13: or at least a significant part of the real   value in tradeable assets that aren't backed by gold reserves orgovernmental guarantees.So Bitcoin prices started falling. The crash accelerated when   a currency exchange known as Mt. Gox declared bankruptcy and shut   down while managing some 70% of all Bitcoin transactions   worldwide. The CEO of that exchange was later arrested and   charged with embezzling $390 million from the service. Other   exchanges shut their doors or suffered hacking attacks
column14: often   with a side of insider embezzling charges. Each embarrassment   sparked another selling spree
column15: andBitcoin values plungedon heavy trading volumes.Image source: the Bitcoin Symbol project
column16: under theFree Art License 1.3.So
column17: what's different now?I could argue that the crash that started in 2014 was a   necessary evil. It shook out several weak hands from the Bitcoin   game
column18: cementing a new set of leading trade exchanges and a   heightened sense of security threats. We probably haven't seen   the last Bitcoin embezzling scandal yet
column19: but then again
column20: no other   currency is entirely free from misuse and occasional   scandals.More importantly
column21: businesses and government regulators have   started to treat Bitcoin as a serious and valuable resource.Goldman Sachs(NYSE: GS) has invested millions in a Bitcoin transaction manager   in the hope of making money on the transactional side of this   thing. Other banks and financial powerhouses are planning to   introduce Bitcoin-based exchange-traded funds at some point
column22: assuming that the SEC would approve this idea.The major credit card issuers may not be working Bitcoin   itself into their services
column23: but they are thinking hard about how   to leverage Bitcoin-like technologies to improve their   transaction management. That's not a long step away from tapping   into the Bitcoin market directly.Elsewhere
column24: you can use Bitcoin to pay for an increasing   collection of real-world products and services.Microsoft(NASDAQ: MSFT) accepts it as payment for digital content and   games in the online stores for Windows
column25: Xbox Games
column26: Xbox Music
column27: and more. Want to subscribe toSports Illustrated
column28: Time
column29: orFood & Wine?Time(NYSE: TIME) takes Bitcoin as payment for magazine subscriptions.   Computer hardware seller Newegg not only accepts the   currency but also offered a 10% discount for   Bitcoin-financed purchases for a while. And the list goes on.Most of these retailers haven't quite elevated Bitcoin to the   full status of a real currency
column30: like dollars or euros. It's more   like a new type of gift card at this point
column31: managed by somebody   else. Returns on Bitcoin-financed purchases are typically given   in the form of store credit -- or not at all. But even so
column32: these   are votes of confidence in the Bitcoin system

column1: Microsoft’s Productivity Segment and AWS Share a Common Characteristic;2/27/2017;"Microsoft Corp.(MSFT) has been on a steady march towards revenue growth as the company has smartly turned its focus toward multiple product lines and cloud
column2: while slowly pushing Windows to the back burner. The technology giant has created a solid portfolio of products that it sells using the as-a-service cloud-delivered model.The company's push into the enterprise software segment is built around Office 365
column3: which is part of the Productivity and Business Processes segment. Although we do not exactly know how much its IaaS offering Azure brings in
column4: recent estimates suggest it could be around $2.7 billion dollars in 2016. If that assumption is true
column5: then a large bulk of its cloud revenue is coming from SaaS products because the annualized commercial cloud run rate crossed $14 billion during the most recent quarter.Considering the rate at which Office 365 has been growing
column6: it is not really a surprise that the SaaS lineup is bringing in revenues in the billions. Office 365 commercial revenue has been growing above 50% for the past several quarters
column7: with the latest quarter growth coming in at 47%. Dynamics 365
column8: Microsoft's product to address the growing ERP and CRM segment
column9: also witnessed 9% revenue growth during the second quarter.makeArticleAd();Revenue from Productivity and Business Processes grew 10% during the second quarter to reach $7.4 billion. More than the revenue growth rate
column10: Microsoft's management must be extremely happy with the margin levels offered by the productivity segment. During the second quarter
column11: the segment reported an operating income of $3.256 billion with an eye-popping margin of 44.10%
column12: while the margin for the first two quarters was 45.41%.Source: MicrosoftQ2-17Press ReleaseThe software segment is inherently a high-margin business
column13: but above 40% margins is not something you come across often. It shows the pricing power Microsoft has and is a clear sign it is at the top of the segment. Even if the competition were to catch up to it
column14: Microsoft has plenty of room to move in the event of a price war.Microsoft's SaaS office collaboration products are possibly in the same position asAmazon(AMZN) Web Services' products in the IaaS world - way ahead of the rest of the pack.Office 365 and AWS both have the size and scale of multibillion-dollar businesses
column15: but they still keep adding service after service to their offerings
column16: making it extremely difficult for the competition to enter the market
column17: let alone play catch-up.It is not easy to drag either unit into a price war because they both enjoy the fattest margins possible. Moreover
column18: it is not easy to create a better product because they are relentless in expanding existing functionality and enhancing performance
column19: all while continuously keeping a finger on the pulse of pricing.Both companies have no reason to slow down and should continue to enjoy robust growth in their respective segments. One has a very strong enterprise productivity business
column20: while the other has a fast-growing IaaS unit.If you are watching Microsoft and Amazon
column21: these two segments should get as much attention from you as their core businesses of software and retail.Disclosure:I have no positions in the stock mentioned above and no intention to initiate a position in the next 72 hours.Start afree 7-day trial of Premium Membershipto GuruFocus.IJR 15-Year Financial DataThe intrinsic value of IJRPeter Lynch Chart of IJRPremium MembersThis article first appeared onGuruFocus."

column1: The 5 Best Dividend Stocks for Beginning Investors;2/27/2017;"According toFinviz.com
column2: there are currently more than 3
column3: 500 publicly traded stocks that   pay a dividend. That's an overwhelming number that can make it   difficult for a new investor to get started.To help you narrow down your selection
column4: we asked a team of   Fools to each pick a stock they think is a great choice for a   beginner. They chooseWaste Management(NYSE: WM)
column5: Microsoft(NASDAQ: MSFT)
column6: American Express(NYSE: AXP)
column7: Cisco Systems(NASDAQ: CSCO)
column8: andCostco(NASDAQ: COST) . Read on to find out why.Image source: Getty Images.makeArticleAd();The benefits of buying disruption-proof     businessesTyler Crowe(Waste Management):One of the things beginning investors should learn when making   their first dividend investment is how to identify companies in   essential functions of our everyday lives with nearly   insurmountable competitive advantages over their competition.   These are the kinds of companies that will have the pricing power   to grow revenue and profits for decades to come
column9: and return   considerable value to shareholders.One company that fits this mold incredibly well is refuse   handler Waste Management. The company is the largest refuse   collection company
column10: and it has a large network of landfills
column11: disposal centers
column12: and recycling facilities across the U.S. The   waste-handling business inherently has lots of competitive   advantages for its well-established players. It's extremely   capital-intensive to build out a fleet of waste collection   vehicles
column13: there are lots of regulatory hurdles involved in   opening new landfills and maintaining existing ones
column14: and it's   extremely difficult to disrupt how humans generate and handle   waste. These things combine to give Waste Management a very   favorable operating environment where it can pass along rising   costs to customers pretty easily and generate a steady stream of   profits.For years
column15: Waste Management has taken these competitive   advantages and turned them into a very shareholder-friendly   business. For more than a decade
column16: the company has steadily raised   its dividend payments and bought back shares to generate high   rates of return in what many would consider a slow-growth   business.WM Return on Equity (TTM)data byYCharts.For beginning investors
column17: companies with huge competitive   advantages like Waste Management are a great lesson in why it   pays to hang onto stocks for the long term. The company's share   price gains will never blow anyone's socks off
column18: but its high   rates of return in an industry that will likely be around for   decades will reward those who hold onto their position.The transition is workingBrian Feroldi(Microsoft):I'm a firm believer that new dividend investors should seek out   big
column19: highly profitable companies for their first investment. That   criteria perfectly describes Microsoft
column20: which is why I think it's   a fantastic stock for beginners.Microsoft has been cranking out profits for decades thanks to   its stranglehold on the software industry. Products such as   Windows and Office are cash cows that have been a dependable   source of revenue for decades. That should hold true for a long   time to come.However
column21: Microsoft's stock stagnated for years over worries   that the ever-changing tech world would render this company's   products obsolete. Thankfully
column22: that worry got put to rest when   Satya Nadella took over the top chair in 2014. CEO Nadella   has placed an emphasis on moving Microsoft's products into the   cloud
column23: a decision that's paying off handsomely as revenue from   products like Azure
column24: Office 365
column25: and Dynamics CRM Online are   surging. When you add in the growth of other product lines such   as Xbox
column26: Bing
column27: and Surface
column28: Microsoft's bottom line has been   posting healthy gains in recent years.Looking ahead
column29: market watchers believe Microsoft's bottom line   will grow by more than 9% annually over the next five years. That   seems realistic when combining the growth in cloud product sales   with its recently completed acquisition of LinkedIn. Add to that   the company's rock-solid dividend yield of 2.4%
column30: and I can't help   but think Microsoft is a terrific stock for new dividend   investors to buy.Buy one of Buffett's favorites at a great valueJasonHall(American Express):Warren Buffett first bought shares of American Express when the   company's stock was selling for bargain prices. Decades later
column31: those shares are worth almost 10 times whatBerkshire Hathawaypaid -- but that's only the tip of the iceberg of what American   Express means for Buffett and Berkshire today.At the current $0.32 per share quarterly dividend
column32: American   Express will pay Berkshire almost $195 million in dividends in   2017. That may seem like a paltry yield on its $12 billion stake
column33: but when we look at the yield on cost -- that is
column34: how much   American Express' dividend pays based on the original investment   -- the math is much better: Berkshire gets paid a roughly 15%   yield on its cost for those AmEx shares. And with its prospects   and track record
column35: that payout is likely to keep growing for years   to come.There's a wonderful lesson for beginning investors: Don't skip   the small-yielding stocks if you're looking for dividends.   Sometimes your best choice is one like American Express
column36: which   has spent far more time yielding below 2% of its market price   than above 3%
column37: but it has steadily and regularly raised its   dividend for decades:AXP Dividenddata byYCharts.Don't let today's paltry yield cause you to miss an excellent   dividend growth stock. American Express stock is cheap today
column38: trading near 14 times last year's earnings. And with its track   record of dividend growth
column39: it could be paying you 15% or more on   your original investment in a couple of decades.The company at the core of our digital worldChuck Saletta(Cisco Systems):Cisco is the ubiquitous networking giant responsible for many of   the high-speed routers and switches that move financial   transactions
column40: videos
column41: pictures
column42: and text all over the internet.   It's also establishing itself as a strong dividend player with   both a decent history of increasing its dividend and reasonable   room to continue raising it going forward. That combination sets   it up as a great potential investment for someone just now   dipping into the realm of dividend investing.Cisco paid its first dividend of $0.06 per share per quarter   in 2011
column43: and it has been increasing it since then. The company's   current yield is almost 3.5%
column44: which is a decent premium over   the general market. It recently raised its dividend from $0.26   per share per quarter to $0.29
column45: an increase of 11.5%. Even with   that increase
column46: Cisco pays out only around half of its earnings in   the form of dividends
column47: which gives it room to continue increasing   those dividends as its business grows over time.Speaking of that growth
column48: over the next five years
column49: analysts   expect Cisco to be able to increase its earnings by almost 11%   per year. If it does manage to grow at that pace
column50: and its   dividends follow suit
column51: investors will receive around $0.48 per   share per quarter five years from now. That's the true power of a   strong dividend investing strategy.Learn from a greatJordan Wathen(Costco):Warehouse retailer Costco is neither cheap nor especially   high-yielding
column52: but it is the kind of company I'd recommend to a   friend as a company to follow and learn from.Costco has more traits of the ""greats"" than perhaps any other   company. For one
column53: it has the advantage of efficient scale
column54: which   results from the fact it generates about $120 billion in revenue   from just 4
column55: 000 products
column56: thus frequently making Costco its   suppliers' single-largest customer. That gives it power at the   negotiating table.It's also ridiculously good at managing its balance sheet.   Costco manages to sell its inventory before the bill even comes   due.Oh -- and it somehow created a cult following thatForbesonce dubbed ""Costcoholics"" for the fact that its loyalists visit   the store several times a week to see what's new. Not many   retailers have rabid fans of their off-label brands
column57: but Costco   does.Let's get back to the dividend. Costco's current yield of 1%   understates its heft as a dividend stock. I think it's likely   that dividends will grow at a double-digit clip for years to   come
column58: as its earnings power increases and it pays out a greater   percentage of earnings to its shareholders. What's more   important
column59: especially for beginner investors
column60: is the opportunity   to use the company as a case study to learn about what separates   the good businesses from the great businesses.10 stocks we like better than Costco WholesaleWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column62: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade

column1: Xbox Live Games With Gold for March 2017;2/27/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsMicrosoft Corporation's(NASDAQ:MSFT) March selection of Xbox Live games with Gold has been unveiled.makeArticleAd();Source: MicrosoftThe companyreleases four gamesthat are available for download free of charge granted that you are signed up to its exclusive Xbox Live Gold service. There are usually four games - two Xbox One titles and two Xbox 360 ones - that you can pick from and the price of the service varies depending on what option you choose (the 12-month option will set you back $46.89).Layers of Fearis available for the entire month of March and it is a psychological horror where you control a mentally disturbed patient working on his masterpiece. It's an Xbox One title.Xbox 360 owners will be able to playBorderlandfrom March 1 until March 15. The game is an action role-playing game
column3: as well as a first-person shooter that marks the first iteration of a popular series with multiple sequels.Heavy Weaponis the other Xbox 360 title on the list as part of Xbox Live games with Gold
column4: and it will be available from March 16 until March 31. It is a side-scrolling shoot-'em-up game.Finally
column5: Evolve Ultimate Editionis an Xbox One game that will also be available all month. It is an asymmetrical multiplayer game where five characters battle against each other in a foreign planet
column6: and it is a first-person shooter title.MSFT stock lost 0.8% Monday.More From InvestorPlace9 Top Pharmaceutical Stocks to Buy for the Dividends9 Best Cheap Stocks to Buy Now Under $9.997 Ultra-Cheap Value Stocks to Buy NowThe postXbox Live Games With Gold for March 2017appeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Is Bitcoin Finally a Serious Currency -- or Maybe Even a Solid Investment Vehicle?;2/27/2017;"The computer-driven currency known as Bitcoin has been through   a few rough years. After peaking at $1
column2: 216 per Bitcoin at the end   of 2013
column3: conversion prices plunged all the way to $200 in just 16   months. Today
column4: Bitcoin values have surged back above $1
column5: 100 and   might set fresh all-time highs someday soon.The Bitcoin boom in 2013 turned into a total rout. Is the   currency headed for another meltdown
column6: or should you take Bitcoin   more seriously this time around?Chart source:Bitcoin Charts. License:Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0makeArticleAd();What was the problem last time?Four years ago
column7: Bitcoin found itself in a global spotlight.   Having started as a hobby project in 2009
column8: the crypto-currency   had surged from ""basically worthless"" to a value of hundreds of   dollars per currency unit. Investors
column9: speculators
column10: and downright   gamblers were trying to find ways to profit from this new thing.   On the back end
column11: hobbyists gave way to serious number-crunchers   who used special math-processing chips to process the   exponentially increasing number of bitcoin blocks.What followed was a series of scandals. Critics called the   Bitcoin increase a ""bubble
column12: undermining trust in the currency.   Perception is reality
column13: or at least a significant part of the real   value in tradeable assets that aren't backed by gold reserves orgovernmental guarantees.So Bitcoin prices started falling. The crash accelerated when   a currency exchange known as Mt. Gox declared bankruptcy and shut   down while managing some 70% of all Bitcoin transactions   worldwide. The CEO of that exchange was later arrested and   charged with embezzling $390 million from the service. Other   exchanges shut their doors or suffered hacking attacks
column14: often   with a side of insider embezzling charges. Each embarrassment   sparked another selling spree
column15: andBitcoin values plungedon heavy trading volumes.Image source: the Bitcoin Symbol project
column16: under theFree Art License 1.3.So
column17: what's different now?I could argue that the crash that started in 2014 was a   necessary evil. It shook out several weak hands from the Bitcoin   game
column18: cementing a new set of leading trade exchanges and a   heightened sense of security threats. We probably haven't seen   the last Bitcoin embezzling scandal yet
column19: but then again
column20: no other   currency is entirely free from misuse and occasional   scandals.More importantly
column21: businesses and government regulators have   started to treat Bitcoin as a serious and valuable resource.Goldman Sachs(NYSE: GS) has invested millions in a Bitcoin transaction manager   in the hope of making money on the transactional side of this   thing. Other banks and financial powerhouses are planning to   introduce Bitcoin-based exchange-traded funds at some point
column22: assuming that the SEC would approve this idea.The major credit card issuers may not be working Bitcoin   itself into their services
column23: but they are thinking hard about how   to leverage Bitcoin-like technologies to improve their   transaction management. That's not a long step away from tapping   into the Bitcoin market directly.Elsewhere
column24: you can use Bitcoin to pay for an increasing   collection of real-world products and services.Microsoft(NASDAQ: MSFT) accepts it as payment for digital content and   games in the online stores for Windows
column25: Xbox Games
column26: Xbox Music
column27: and more. Want to subscribe toSports Illustrated
column28: Time
column29: orFood & Wine?Time(NYSE: TIME) takes Bitcoin as payment for magazine subscriptions.   Computer hardware seller Newegg not only accepts the   currency but also offered a 10% discount for   Bitcoin-financed purchases for a while. And the list goes on.Most of these retailers haven't quite elevated Bitcoin to the   full status of a real currency
column30: like dollars or euros. It's more   like a new type of gift card at this point
column31: managed by somebody   else. Returns on Bitcoin-financed purchases are typically given   in the form of store credit -- or not at all. But even so
column32: these   are votes of confidence in the Bitcoin system
column33: and these   companies seem interested in riding or even shaping the wave of   bringing it into common usage.The big takeawayYes
column34: things really are different this time.Bitcoin is still not quite as dependable as gold bullion or a   roll of dollar bills
column35: and not as useful in day-to-day use as cash   or credit cards. But it's much closer to that status than it was   a few years ago. Assuming that the biggest and nastiest back-end   scandals have already been dealt with
column36: the next couple of years   should see fewer massive value drops and a more stable Bitcoin   value in general.You shouldn't pour your life savings into Bitcoin buys
column37: of   course. The risks may be smaller now
column38: but they still can't be   forgotten. Andcurrency trading is not a serious investmentin the first place -- even if you're limiting your moves to   respected world currencies like the dollar
column39: the yuan
column40: and the   euro.But a little bit of Bitcoin exposure could be useful and   instructive nowadays. I have a tiny bit of skin in the game   myself
column41: having bought roughly one-fifth of a Bitcoin when it was   cheap two years ago. The value of that tiny position has   increased fivefold
column42: even as I've used the funds for sending   donations to Wikimedia and other online services. Not making me   rich by any means
column43: but it's enough to keep me interested and   informed.10 stocks we like better than MicrosoftWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column45: the newsletter they have run for   over a decade

column2: Inc. (CSCO) Is in a Rut
column3: and Income Investors Love It;2/27/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column4: Stock Advice & Trading TipsCisco Systems
column5: Inc.(NASDAQ:CSCO) has justdelivered second-quarter FY17 earningsthat beat expectations on Wall Street
column6: but once again proved that Cisco stock will not be returning to growth any time soon.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockCisco reported fourth-quarter revenue of $11.6 billion
column7: $50 million above Wall Street consensus estimate
column8: but -1.7% year-over-year. That marked the fifth straight quarter that the company has posted falling revenue.Sadly
column9: things appears set to remain that way for at least the next few quarters. After all
column10: Cisco guided to revenue growth of -2% to breakeven for the current quarter
column11: and sees non-GAAP per-share earnings coming in at 57 cents 59 cents
column12: in line with Wall Street's consensus of 58 cents.Oddly enough
column13: Cisco stock has tucked on gains of 6% since the earnings call
column14: reversing the selloff that happened immediately after the results. Cisco stock is now up a solid 13.3% year-to-date. So why
column15: pray
column16: are investors celebrating Cisco's revenue tailspin?Business Model Transition for Cisco StockCSCO is stuck in the throes of a serious business model transition. Since its early days
column17: the company has been in the business of selling switches and routers that move data around the internet. That's still true in a big way since the company still derives more than 40% of its revenue from this networking business.But with more and more companies relying on rented computing services from the likes ofMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) andAmazon.com
column18: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN)
column19: they are buying less and less of Cisco's hardware for their data centers.Even worse is the fact that when they do buy
column20: they are upgrading to newer devices less often. Further
column21: Cisco is increasingly facing tougher competition and cheaper offerings from the likes ofArista Networks Inc(NYSE:ANET)
column22: a company that was founded by former top Cisco executives.Throw in the fact that more companies are experimenting with software-defined networking (SDN)
column23: and Cisco is finding itself caught between a rock and hard place. Last quarter's results say it all: Cisco's switching and routing revenue for the quarter fell 5%  and 10% to $3.3 billion and $1.8 billion
column24: respectively.But CSCO has
column25: over the past few years
column26: been working on a grand plan that involves pushing for a recurring subscription-based revenue model. This essentially means developing businesses that will protect it from the vagaries of the boom-and-bust cycles of its core business.Chief executive Chuck Robbins is optimistic that Cisco can leverage the lessons gleaned from its subscription-based businesses
column27: such as Meraki cloud-controlled WiFi
column28: Security software and Collaboration to build a solid subscription revenue businesses. Cisco's Security segment was the brightest spot in the earnings report after growing 14% to reach $528 million. Meanwhile the Collaboration business grew 4% to hit $1
column29: 062 million.Investors were pleased with Cisco's latest report is because it showed that the company is making progress discovering new recurring revenue streams. The company announced that product deferred revenue related to software and subscriptions grew 51% to reach $4 billion. Meanwhile
column30: 10% of its $9 billion Product sales is now of a recurring nature
column31: up from virtually zero a couple of years ago.Cash Cow and Dividend MachineFor all its troubles
column32: Cisco remains by far the most dominant player in the networking business
column33: something that has helped the company preserve its fat margins. During the last quarter
column34: the company's Product gross margin decreased from 63.4% to 61.1%
column35: but its Services gross margin increased from 65.1% to 67.7%. Improving margins is a good sign that the company's pricing power remains undiminished.Healthy margins have allowed CSCO stock to become a cash cow
column36: with annual free cash flow approaching $13 billion. Cisco spends a lot of this cash on M&A activity. During the latest earnings call
column37: Cisco announced that it was taking AppDynamics off the IPO table by doling out $3.7 billion for the application performance management startup. But income investors need not worry - in the same vein
column38: Cisco announced that it was hiking its quarterly dividend by 3 cents to 29 cents.Cisco stock now yields a generous 3.5%
column39: among the highest yields in theDow Jones Industrial Average.Bottom Line for Cisco StockCisco instituted the dividend six years ago when it declared a quarterly payout of 6 cents
column40: good for a modest 1.4% yield. Since then
column41: the company has hiked dividends at least once every year.Cisco is also sitting atop a cash hoard north of $60 billion
column42: most of it stashed in overseas accounts. With the Trump administration looking to quickly enact legislation to lower corporate tax from 35% to 15% to 20%
column43: Cisco will be in a position to repatriate at least some of that cash and continue rewarding investors.Mobile World Congress: Apple Inc. (AAPL) vs. Everyone ElseThe 10-year Treasury note has been rising
column44: but at 2.52% remains well below the yield by Cisco stock. With such a healthy backdrop
column45: Cisco stock remains a prime long-term holding especially for income investors.As of this writing
column46: Brian Wu did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceThe 10 Best Stock Charts on Wall Street Right Now7 Food Stocks That Will Deliver Tasty ReturnsThe postCisco Systems

column1: The Next Big Thing for Amazon.com
column2: Inc. (AMZN): Productivity Software;2/27/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsAmazon.com
column4: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN) has taken on some unexpected targets lately. None more ambitious - and unforeseen - than sticking its Alexa personal assistant in the Amazon Echo smart speaker.makeArticleAd();Source: AmazonThat move has paid off with a big lead in the race to become the hub of the smart home
column5: despite AMZN's complete lack of smartphone presence.Per a report inThe Information
column6: Amazon is readying another bold move. If sources are correct
column7: AMZN is preparing to take onMicrosoft Corporation's(NASDAQ:MSFT) Microsoft Office andAlphabet Inc.'s(NASDAQ:GOOGL) Google G Suite with its own cloud-based productivity suite.Report: Amazon.com Is Working on a Productivity SuiteThe Informationbroke the news that Amazon.com isworking on its own productivity suiteto take on Microsoft and Google. The website says AMZN's Amazon Web Services - AWS - unit has told some of its ""large corporate customers"" of its plans to offer a new suite of productivity apps that will compete against the two dominant players.7 REITs That Should Be CondemnedMicrosoft Office has always been considered a cash cow for the company. The productivity suite quickly became the industry standard
column8: the applications of choice for enterprise
column9: schools and home PC users. To make its software seem more affordable
column10: to break free of the boom bust cycle between major versions of Microsoft Office
column11: and to address the growing threat of Google's free Google Apps suite
column12: five years ago
column13: the company began pushing Office 365.This subscription version of Microsoft Office brought recurring monthly revenue and other advantages. Microsoft expanded into Office apps for mobile devices likeApple Inc.'s(NASDAQ:AAPL) iPad and began to sell online storage for Office 365 users
column14: with OneDrive.Google Apps/G SuiteGoogle wasn't sitting still
column15: though
column16: refining Google Apps intoG Suite
column17: a full-on competitor to Office 365
column18: with paid monthly subscription plans and online storage options. The company has also leveraged Google Apps and its lightweight Chrome OS into Chromebooks - ultra-low-cost laptops that have been giving Microsoft fits
column19: especially in the education market.That education market is where the potential for disruption is really playing out. With its free Google Apps and low-cost Chromebooks
column20: Google upended the education market. By the end of 2015
column21: more than half of all device in U.S. classrooms were Chromebooks. This has repercussions beyond the classroom
column22: as those students turn into young professionals who are more comfortable with Google's productivity software than with Microsoft Office.I've seen the effect first hand. My kids do everything at school using G Suite
column23: despite Microsoft offering free Office 365 subscriptions to students and computer labs full of Windows PCs. They ignore Microsoft Office and Apple's Pages/Numbers on our home computers
column24: and instead log onto G Suite for doing homework.If Google could quickly make waves in one of Microsoft's key strongholds
column25: why couldn't Amazon.com march in and disrupt both companies?Why Amazon Would Take On Microsoft OfficeThis is a key question. Taking on the Google and Apple in the smart home with the Amazon Echo made sense because the smart speaker was a Trojan horse. It offers a growing number of ""Skills"" that let it control other smart devices by voice command
column26: or interact with online services.That ropes consumers into buying it. But Alexa is a voice-activated path to effortlessly order products directly from Amazon.com
column27: and gives an incentive to buy other Amazon products and services like Amazon Music Unlimited and Amazon Fire TV.Where's the win for AMZN in offering productivity software
column28: other than to tweak Microsoft and Google?For the answer
column29: look to AWS. Amazon Web Servicesdominates the market for cloud infrastructureand the profit from this division is a big driver of Amazon's overall growth. Amazon already has the servers in place and it has several of the components needed for a productivity suite
column30: including its WorkDocs and WorkMail apps and the recently announcedAmazon Chimevideo conferencing software. Stitch these together with a few additional components and Amazon could have its Microsoft Office and Google G Suite competitor.Google charges $5 to $10 per month for G Suite
column31: while Microsoft Office 365 has several tiered options starting at $5.99 per month.AMZN could charge a competitive rate for its new offering
column32: adding more subscription-based revenue to its bottom line while taking advantage of its existing cloud muscle. The base monthly fee could be supplemented by charging for additional online storage for enterprise customers - something it has plenty of.Productivity software could also become another free perk of Prime membership. Prime members that start using Amazon's productivity software could put pressure on their employers to invest in a subscription
column33: in an effect like Google's approach that sees students graduate and look to their employers to provide G Suite access.The Dow Jones Industrial Average Keeps Rising
column34: But a Correction Is ComingAMZN isn't commenting andThe Information'ssources say all of this is still in the early stages
column35: but the move makes sense. Amazon has been aggressively expanding beyond its role as an online retailer
column36: AWS has the infrastructure needed to support the initiative
column37: the company has been creeping into enterprise software with apps like WorkMail
column38: and Google proved that the Microsoft Office behemoth isn't invulnerable. A productivity software suite from Amazon.com could well be the company's next big thing.As of this writing
column39: Brad Moon did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace3 High-Impact Tech Earnings: Tesla

column1: 21 Video Game Stats That Will Blow You Away;2/25/2017;"For decades
column2: video games have brought joy to countless   children around the world. And with more adults playing games in   recent years
column3: the industry has become truly massive in its size   and scope.The statistics that follow will help to give you a sense of   the awesome scale of the global video-game market.Image source: Getty Images.makeArticleAd();The stats1. There are more than 2 billion video game players worldwide
column4: according to market intelligence companyNewzoo.2. Here in the United States
column5: 63% of households have at least   one person who plays video games regularly (3 hours or more per   week)
column6: while 48% of U.S. households own a dedicated game console
column7: according to theEntertainment Software Association.3. And its not just kids who are playing these games; the   average game player age is 35 years old.4. In fact
column8: while 27% of game players are under 18
column9: 26% are 50   years old -- or older.5. As for gender
column10: 59% of game players are male
column11: while 41% are   female.6. In stark contrast to the image of an isolated gamer locked   away in a dark basement for hours on end
column12: gaming appears to have   a significant social element to it; 53% of the most frequent game   players say video games help them connect with friends
column13: and 42%   feel video games help them spend time with family.7. Moreover
column14: the most frequent gamers who play multiplayer and   online games spend an average of 6.5 hours per week playing with   others online
column15: and 4.6 hours per week playing with others in   person.8. In a sign that the industry has won increased parental   approval
column16: 68% of parents say video games are a positive part of   their child's life
column17: and 62% of parents whose children are gamers   play computer and video games with their children at least   weekly.9. There appear to be benefits to video game playing in   addition to just having fun. Of the most frequent gamers
column18: 75%   believe playing video games provides mental stimulation or   education. This coincides with astudyby Yale University that showed that students who played a   brain-training video game for 20 minutes three times a week for   four months performed better on reading and math tests than their   peers who did not.10. These perceived benefits are likely contributing to the   growth of the U.S. video game industry
column19: which saw video game   software sales rise 6% to $24.5 billion in 2016
column20: according to theESA.11. On a global basis
column21: the video game market reached $99.6   billion in revenue in 2016
column22: up 8.5% compared to 2015
column23: according   toNewzoo.12. China
column24: which
column25: like the U.S.
column26: accounts for nearly a quarter   of all global game revenues
column27: is expected to approach $29 billion   in game revenue by 2019
column28: up from $24.4 billion in 2016.13. Newzoo estimates that mobile gaming generated 37% of total   global video-game revenue in 2016
column29: rising 21.3% year over year   and surpassing PC revenue for the first time ever.14. Still
column30: PC and console-based gaming remain vital components   of the video-game market
column31: with each segment comprising more than   $31 billion in sales in 2016
column32: according toNewzoo.15. To date
column33: Sony(NYSE: SNE) hasdominated the console wars
column34: with sales of its PlayStation 4 recently surpassing 53 million   units worldwide. That's more than double the estimated 26 million   Xbox One unitsMicrosoft(NASDAQ: MSFT) has sold
column35: and triple the 15 million Wii U units   sold byNintendo(NASDAQOTH: NTDOY)
column36: according to research companySuperData.16. That's a valuable position for Sony -- and to a lesser   extent
column37: Microsoft -- to hold
column38: as consoles are increasingly   becoming an entertainment hub
column39: with 50% of people who own game   consoles using them to watch movies
column40: 28% using them to listen to   music
column41: and 21% using consoles to consume live and other content
column42: according to the ESA.17. Notably
column43: the growth in gaming appears to be coming at the   expense of other forms of entertainment. In particular
column44: gamers   who are playing more video games than they did three years ago   are spending less time playing board games (49% of gamers)
column45: watching TV (37%)
column46: and going to the movies (37%).18. Virtual reality appears to have a bright future within   gaming
column47: as 58% of the most frequent gamers who are familiar with   virtual reality intend to play games on VR
column48: and 40% say they will   likely purchase VR within the next year
column49: according to the   ESA.19. An even more powerful growth driver for the gaming   industry is the emergence of eSports. The global audience for   eSports surged 36.6% to 323 million in 2016
column50: and Newzooprojectsthat it will exceed 589 million worldwide by 2020.20. Global revenue in the eSports industry rose an even more   impressive 51.7%
column51: to $493 million
column52: in 2016 -- and isexpectedto approach $1.5 billion by 2020.21. All told
column53: Newzooforecaststhat the global video game market will exceed $118 billion in   total revenue by 2019.Investor takeawayThe growing attraction of gaming among people of nearly all   ages and the surging popularity of eSports are propelling the   already $100 billion video-game industry to ever-rising   heights.While some are attempting to profit from this trend by buying   stock in console makers such as Sony or Microsoft
column54: investors may   be best served by instead purchasing shares of the top video game   makers
column55: such asActivisionBlizzard(NASDAQ: ATVI) andElectronic Arts(NASDAQ: EA) .Activision makes some of the most popular eSports games
column56: includingHeroes of the Storm
column57: Call of Duty
column58: StarCraft
column59: andWarCraft
column60: while Electronic Arts is owner of two of the most popular   sports-based eSports franchises inMaddenandFIFA.While console makers often struggle with razor-thin margins
column61: video-game makers are benefiting from the trend toward digital   distribution
column62: which is boosting margins and overall profits for   bothElectronic ArtsandActivision.Perhaps most importantly
column63: Activision and EA are video-game   pure plays
column64: while Microsoft and Sony are much more diversified   businesses. As such
column65: investments in Activision Blizzard and   Electronic Arts are a direct way to profit from the growth of the   global video-game market -- a bet I expect will pay off   handsomely in the years ahead.Offer from The Motley Fool: The 10 best stocks to buy       nowMotley Fool co-founders Tom and David Gardner have spent     more than a decade beating the market. column1: Tech Most Popular Sector for Investment Fund Managers in 2017;2/24/2017;"Data show that Silicon Valley darlings once again captured the interest of stock fund managers looking to cash in on the sector's growth and dreams in the fourth quarter of 2016.In a ranking of the 20 S&P 500 stocks that U.S. funds managing more than $1 million bought the most
column2: tech companies took eight spots: Microsoft (MSFT)
column3: Apple (AAPL)
column4: Alphabet (GOOGL)
column5: Facebook (FB)
column6: Amazon (AMZN)
column7: Cisco (CSCO)
column8: Alphabet (GOOG) and Intel (INTC). Microsoft and Apple also saw the most buying in the S&P 500
column9: according to data compiled by GuruFocus.The results show U.S. investment fund managers packing into a market sector that already sprinted through last year
column10: gaining 23.5% in 2016 versus 9.54% in the S&P 500. So far
column11: it has not broken a sweat going into 2017
column12: rising 29.49% year to date versus 5.58% in the S&P 500. Only one sector has outperformed it
column13: financials
column14: which rose 44.90% year to date on the back of investor optimism in future tax cuts and interest rate hikes.makeArticleAd();Some research indicates investors can expect further growth for tech. Global information company The NPD Group forecasts 2% growth in technology industry sales in 2017 from 2016
column15: driven by innovation
column16: new products and low prices. A gaggle of fresh product categories is also slated to lure more buyers
column17: like drones
column18: virtual reality and home automation products
column19: in addition to seasoned products like TVs and PCs in the premium space.For just one product
column20: drones
column21: NPD researchers anticipate 177% in sales growth from 2016 to 2018
column22: led mainly by hobbyists. Less tech-savvy consumers may also begin to get on board with smart home devices
column23: where NPD predicts 80% growth over the same period.Other megatrends continue down the pipeline
column24: like cloud computing
column25: big dada and artificial intelligence
column26: but some market watchers see reason for worry.""Looking at the other side of these favorable long-term trends
column27: I remain wary of certain hardware companies whose products are becoming commoditized. For example
column28: in the personal computer market
column29: virtual reality headsets and computers are an opportunity for growth
column30: but so far
column31: demand has been largely anemic
column32: said one analyst
column33: Charlie Chai of Fidelity in a sector outlook.""""The smart-device market is increasingly saturated and lacks products capable of driving sustainable new excitement. On the enterprise hardware front
column34: there continue to be many technology disruptions
column35: which increase the long-term risks for some incumbents. Although valuations are generally low for enterprise hardware companies
column36: I continue to struggle with their challenging long-term outlooks.""Employment momentum has carried over into 2017
column37: indicating companies see these opportunities expanding. The tech industry added a net 9
column38: 000 jobs in the IT sector in January
column39: according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics. The highest employment growth occurred in software and technology services where 12
column40: 500 jobs were added
column41: extending growth of 73
column42: 900 jobs in 2016
column43: despite layoffs at numerous companies.Earnings growth has supported tech's rally. Of the 408 companies that had reported earnings as of Feb. 17
column44: tech led all sectors with a 12.1% increase year over year
column45: amounting to an additional $68.2 billion. Eight of the 11 sectors were expected to finish the quarter with improved earnings
column46: according to Thomson Reuters. Yet when removing sub-industries with the highest growth
column47: semiconductor equipment and electronic manufacturing services
column48: the growth rate declines to 11.1%
column49: more in line with financials and utilities.The S&P North American tech sector index had a trailing price-earnings ratio of 28.07 and projected price-earnings ratio of 20.47 as of Jan. 31. It also had a price-book ratio of 4.92%
column50: price-free cash flow ratio of 16.52 and dividend yield of 1.21%. Its largest constituents are Apple
column51: Microsoft
column52: Facebook and Alphabet.Microsoft
column53: favorite of most U.S. funds
column54: grew fourth-quarter revenue 1.23%
column55: operating earnings 2.5% and earnings 3.62% from the prior-year quarter
column56: on the strength of cloud and office products and services. Personal computing fell 5% primarily by a drop in gaming revenue and its feature phone business
column57: which it sold in November. During the quarter
column58: the company returned $6.5 billion to shareholders in share repurchases and dividends.Donald Yacktman(Trades
column59: Portfolio)'sYacktman Fund(Trades
column60: Portfolio)s commented on the company in its recent letter
column61: ""Microsoft's shares were solid contributors to fourth-quarter results as the company continues its remarkable transformation under CEO Satya Nadella. Microsoft could be a significant beneficiary of the new administration's proposed tax repatriation plan.""The biggest guru investor in Microsoft is Jeff Ubben (Trades
column62: Portfolio)
column63: who has 19.71% of his reported portfolio in the company.Apple's performance also shined in most categories
column64: with all-time sales record for its iPhone
column65: services
column66: Mac and Apple Watch. Fourth-quarter revenue rose 3.19%
column67: and EPS increased 2.44% to an all-time high. Earnings for the company struggled
column68: though
column69: falling 2.62% year over year
column70: as net and gross margins declined. Apple returned $15 billion to investors in share repurchases and dividends during the quarter. CEO Tim Cook also hinted at ""products in our pipeline.""A guru Apple shareholder
column71: David Rolfe (Trades
column72: Portfolio)
column73: commented in his Wedgewood Partners recent letter
column74: ""Clearly the Company does not need to spend $10-$15 billion per year to sustain the evolutionary upgrades to the iPhone
column75: iPad
column76: Apple Watch and/or new video streaming services. Apple's nascent automotive program Project Titan may not be at all about creating a complete autonomous driving car (Apple Car)
column77: but rather the creation of software that makes existing cars smarter - or even autonomous. Now that is a huge
column78: creatively disruptive opportunity.""Apple's top guru shareholder is David Einhorn (Trades
column79: Portfolio)
column80: whose Greenlight Capital has 11.56% of its assets in his reported long portfolio in the stock. Another famous shareholder
column81: Warren Buffett (Trades
column82: Portfolio)
column83: owns 1.09% of Apple's shares
column84: which make up 4.49% of Berkshire's portfolio. He added more than 42 million shares of the company in the fourth quarter.See more of fund manager's favorite S&P 500 stocks of the recent quarter here.Premium MembersThis article first appeared onGuruFocus."

column1: How Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock Can Squeeze $26B From LinkedIn;2/24/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsIt's been six weeks sinceMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) closed its $26.5 billion acquisition of LinkedIn
column3: the largest deal ever made by the Seattle tech giant. Since the acquisition was announced in June 2016
column4: there have been plenty of opinions surrounding the steep price paid for the business networking site - somepositive
column5: somenegative- and those question marks will continue to follow Microsoft and MSFT stock until LinkedIn is able to pay its own way.makeArticleAd();Source:Mike Mozart Via FlickrI'm a fan of Microsoft stock - in late December
column6: I predicted it would hit $80 in 2017- so I'm definitely rooting for LinkedIn to keep delivering the goods as it did in its Q3 2016 earnings
column7: its last report as an independent company.Its$1.18 earnings per shareon a non-GAAP basis - 27 cents higher than what analysts were expecting - on $960 million in revenue was a major victory for LinkedIn which also saw memberships grow 18% to 467 million compared to the same quarter a year earlier. Most important
column8: it actually made a small GAAP profit of $9.1 million in the quarter.MSFT is on a roll
column9: but it will have to maintain momentum if it's going to have any chance of extracting future shareholder value of $26.5 billion or more over the next few years.Sure
column10: the LinkedIn acquisition is about more than money
column11: but ultimately that's one of the key criteria for evaluating a deal's success or failure.7 Blue-Chip Stocks That Are Flush With CashHere are the three things I believe will make the LinkedIn acquisition a success.Estimated Monthly UsersWhile LinkedIn is considered the top social media site for business networking
column12: it has just 106 million monthly active users (MAU) out of 467 million members.Facebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB) has almost 18 times that
column13: with its1.86 billion MAU.Microsoft might have plans for LinkedIn that go beyond its user numbers but it's got to keep pushing the MAU metric higher because Facebook's not going to stop growing its user base
column14: especially when it comes to helping people find and secure new jobs.LinkedIn isn't going to capture anyone but the high-income segment of the workforce; currently
column15: 45% of those earning more than $75
column16: 000 use LinkedIn. That's got to be higher.Mobile Is KeyNielsen's2016 Social Media Reportreleased in January offered a really deep dive into the world of social media including mobile usage. Drawing data from 9
column17: 000 smartphone users 18 or older
column18: Nielsen was able to determine the number of unique mobile users for the top 10 social media platforms; Facebook had 178.2 million unique users compared to 60.1 million for LinkedIn or just three times the number.If LinkedIn wants to capture a bigger social media audience
column19: especially younger business professionals
column20: it's going to have to get very smart about its mobile game plan which it appears to have done delivering a revamped mobile site in 2016.""We are seeing good results with the core experience
column21: with our revamped mobile app driving significant engagement growth in 2016
column22: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella said during the company's Q2 2017 conference call. ""This quarter
column23: the sessions on LinkedIn grew more than 20% year over year
column24: a consistent level of growth throughout 2016. We also achieved record levels of mobile page view.""LinkedIn TalentThe best thing Microsoft has done to date regarding its purchase of LinkedIn ispromoting Kevin Scottto chief technology officer for the entire company. That suggests that Microsoft didn't just buy a great networking site but also got a lot of talented people including Scott
column25: who
column26: in addition to his existing roles at LinkedIn will lead Microsoft's technology plans as well.As CTO
column27: Scott will be empowered to continue to help grow Microsoft's cloud business by bringing it together with LinkedIn's network of professionals. Analysts see Microsoft's cloud businessgrowing by 33%annually over the next three years and accounting for 30% of Microsoft's overall revenue by the end of fiscal 2019.Apple Inc. vs. Alphabet Inc: Value or Growth?Often
column28: when companies merge
column29: the two businesses have vastly different corporate cultures creating turf wars between the different organizations. While early in the transition it appears that Nadella is very concerned about successfully integrating the LinkedIn team.Should this attitude remain
column30: Microsoft's got a great chance at reaping the rewards necessary to recoup its investment.Bottom Line on MSFT StockObviously
column31: it's way too early to assess the success or failure of the LinkedIn acquisition.However
column32: looking back at the last five fiscal years
column33: LinkedIn's best showing in terms of profitability was in 2012 when it had $56.9 million in operating profits on $972.3 million in revenue for an operating margin of 5.9%.If Microsoft can get LinkedIn to that operating margin within five years
column34: it will be generating approximately $354 million in operating profits on $6 billion in revenue (15% CAGR)
column35: a good start on the way to repaying the $26.5 billion.These three points will certainly help.As of this writing

column2: Intel

column5: IL - February 24
column6: 2017 - Zacks.com announces the list of stocks featured in the Analyst Blog. Every day the Zacks Equity Research analysts discuss the latest news and events impacting stocks and the financial markets. Stocks recently featured in the blog includeAlphabet(NASDAQ:GOOGL-Free Report)
