column9: Baidu(NASDAQ:BIDU-Free Report) andMicrosoft(NASDAQ:MSFT-Free Report).Today
column10: Zacks is promoting its ''Buy'' stock recommendations.Get #1Stock of the Day pick for free.Here are highlights from Thursday's Analyst   Blog:Google Finds 'Waze' to Build Self-Driving TechnologyWhen asked some time back about the use cases for self-driving cars
column11: Alphabet (NASDAQ:GOOGL-Free Report) executives said that they were exploring alternatives. Things have changed somewhat since then and we have slightly greater clarity on whether Google will maintain its own fleet
column12: renting out for delivery of goods
column13: food and/or passenger transport
column14: or whether it will rent vehicles from their makers and sell those services itself.My bet was always on the latter
column15: first because Google is primarily a technology company and thrives on making the kind of software that can take over our lives. Getting into the low-margin business of vehicle maintenance and renting just isn't its area of expertise.Furthermore
column16: the kind of investment that is going into getting these animals on the road isn't justified unless there is a lucrative business out there with a relatively quick payback time.So the company's initial step toward commercialization by getting key people on board and announcing the name of the unit as Waymo was heartening. The goal of this unit is to develop self-driving technology for car makers.How Does All This Tie In with the Waze Carpool   Service?Waze was an Israeli crowd-sourced mapping service providing users with information such as traffic
column17: road conditions and other helpful pointers
column18: so they could quickly decide their route. At least that's what it was in 2013 when Google acquired it for $1.15 billion.Today
column19: Waze is also a carpooling service that gets people travelling in the same direction to travel together and share the cost of gas. So yes
column20: there are headaches to availing the service like having to book way in advance or not having anybody to pick one up on occasion. It also doesn't allow anyone to become a driver
column21: so they can't make a living from it.All this goes to show that Google's plans in the area probably aren't crystallized and the service is a temporary measure to access that all-important thing these days called data. Data that can add to the treasure trove Google's already collecting through the test driving of its self-driving cars.The difficulties don't seem to have deterred users
column22: however
column23: because Google just announced the expansion of the service to unannounced locations in the U.S. and Latin America. And while not all Waze users are signing up for carpooling
column24: it's significant that their numbers have reportedly swelled from 45 million in 2013 to 75 million today. So even if a small percentage of this growing number of people goes for it
column25: it can still be a compelling number.Taxi Service Is What Uber
column26: Lyft Do WellThere's no doubt about it
column27: these two companies have been growing in leaps and bounds as the convenience and quality of service have attracted more and more people. So the prospect of other
column28: perhaps cheaper (because a self-driving car doesn't need a driver) services coming online certainly isn't good news.Google was an initial investor in Uber
column29: but when the company started developing self-driving technology to save its neck
column30: Google representative David Drummond removed himself from its board. Uber still uses Google mapping services
column31: but has increased investments to develop maps of its own.ConclusionUber and its pals have popularized the concept of ride-hailing/car-sharing services but now that the concept has caught on
column32: there will be new entrants. This is a big opportunity for car makers because this is the space where new cars will be deployed in the future.On the technology side
column33: there is the need for machine learning and cloud support
column34: mapping technology
column35: and sensors
column36: which have to be installed on cars built to house the technology. And that's exactly why companies like Intel (NASDAQ:INTC-Free Report) are tying up with companies like Mobileye
column37: while NVIDIA (NASDAQ:NVDA-Free Report) pairs up with Baidu (NASDAQ:BIDU-Free Report) and Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT-Free Report). Then of course there's Google. These companies are in turn testing the technology through collaboration agreements with automakers.But who will get there first? Industry watchers don't expect anything viable until 2020. Even if it's a couple of years out from there
column38: it does look like there will be more than one approach/technology driving the experience. And since the possibilities are tremendous
column39: there won't necessarily be a single winner.Google

column1: Microsoft Wants Tech Industry to Tackle $3 Trillion Problem;2/24/2017;"Cybercrime has impacted everyone from individuals who have   been hacked or had their credit cards compromised to the   countless businesses hit by large scale breaches. Digital   security does not even stop at the company level as we saw in the   recent United Stateselection.Microsoft(NASDAQ: MSFT) President and Chief Legal Officer Brad Smith   believes that the tech industry has both the ability and   responsibility to work together on protecting the world from   digital attacks/cybercrime. In a piece posted on aMicrosoft blogin advance of the annual RSA Conference
column2: which brings together   security professionals from around the world
column3: he laid out his   case for what he called a Digital Geneva Convention -- a   commitment by the technology industry to collectively work across   borders to keep the world safe from digital crime.""Just as the Fourth Geneva Convention recognized that the   protection of civilians required the active involvement of the   Red Cross
column4: protection against nation-state cyberattacks requires   the active assistance of technology companies
column5: he wrote. ""The   tech sector plays a unique role as the internet's first   responders
column6: and we therefore should commit ourselves to   collective action that will make the internet a safer place
column7: affirming a role as a neutral Digital Switzerland that assists   customers everywhere and retains the world's trust.""makeArticleAd();It's a bold idea that would sometimes force companies to work   against self-interest. For example
column8: one pillar of Smith's   proposed Digital Geneva Convention calls for companies to ""report   vulnerabilities to vendors rather than stockpile
column9: sell
column10: or   exploit them."" That may not be easy to get industrywide   cooperation on
column11: but Smith lays out a case that the need is very   strong.Cyber security has become a global problem. Image source:     Getty Images.How big is the problem?Nearly three quarters (74%) of the world's businesses expected   a cyberattack in 2016 with the economic impact of cybercrime   expected to reach $3 trillion by 2020
column12: Smith wrote. What's worse
column13: the Microsoft executive said
column14: is that crimes are not just being   carried out by rogue elements or even unscrupulous businesses
column15: they are now increasingly being carried out by nations.""TheSony(NYSE: SNE) attack by North Korea in 2014 was not the first   nation-state attack
column16: but it represented a visible turning point
column17: he wrote. ""While prior attacks had focused on economic and   military espionage
column18: the Sony attack in 2014 involved retaliation   for free expression in the form of a (not very popular)   movie.""That breach and subsequent release of data was followed in   2015 by ""even more visible international discussion about   nation-state attacks aimed at the theft of companies'   intellectual property
column19: wrote Smith. In 2016
column20: he added
column21: the issue   ""broadened again to include hacking incidents connected to the   democratic process itself.""What does Microsoft want done?Smith called on the world's governments to come together. He   wants them to agree on ""international cybersecurity norms that   have emerged in recent years
column22: adopt new and binding rules and get   to work implementing them."" That's a bold ask given how hard it   is to get consensus on anything on a global or at least   near-global level. The Microsoft executive breaks it down into   six major points:No targeting of tech companies
column23: private sector
column24: or critical     infrastructureAssist private sector efforts to detect
column25: contain
column26: respond     to
column27: and recover from eventsReport vulnerabilities to vendors rather than stockpile
column28: sell
column29: or exploit themExercise restraint in developing cyber weapons and ensure     that any developed are limited
column30: precise
column31: and not reusableCommit to nonproliferation activities to cyber weaponsLimit offensive operation to avoid a mass eventYou can see that this list is really just a bare bones   guideline. Restraint
column32: for example
column33: can mean different things to   different people. Still
column34: what Smith and Microsoft are proposing   would be a bold effort to engage the private sector in responding   to nation-state cyber attacks while also creating a framework for   how governments agree to use their own offensive digital attack   abilities.Why is this important to Microsoft?Governments cannot battle cybercrime effectively without help   from the private sector. Rogue nations however can do great   damage with cyber attacks.The Sony situation with North Korea involved a country using   digitally stolen material to lash back at a business over the   content of a movie. It was an event that showed that every   company is vulnerable whether it be through the release of   private communications
column35: the theft of intellectual property
column36: or   even the corruption of software or hardware to do things it's not   supposed to do (like spy on people
column37: record data including credit   card numbers
column38: or pretty much any other dastardly thing you can   think of).Because cyberspace is intangible
column39: it's not as easily   governable as the real world. Different rules need to be created   and that requires a much broader consensus between nations. Going   forward however Microsoft is right that a new level of   cooperation is required between both rival companies and the   governments of the world.Cybercrime
column40: hacks
column41: and digital attacks can potentially not   only cripple businesses
column42: but in theory change the fate of   nations. How the technology community and nations work in   fighting that together has to be worked out and ground rules   created before the next disaster strikes.10 stocks we like better than MicrosoftWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column43: it can pay to listen. After all
column44: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade
column45: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column46: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and Microsoft wasn't one of     them! That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even     better buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of February 6

column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsFacebook Inc(FB) stock apparently hit a ceiling when it touched yetanother record high- the second record high in less than a month.makeArticleAd();FB shares soared to $136.79 on Wednesday before retreating on Thursday. The previous all-time high for Facebook stock was $135.49
column3: which was set on February 2.Facebook's Stock Move is Just Part of a Wider Tech TrendFB shares also managed a new record closing price on Wednesday at $136.12
column4: ahead of the previous record set on February 8
column5: which was $134.20.As Facebook stock retreated on Thursday
column6: so did most of the other big tech names that have also set record highs this year.Microsoft Corporation(MSFT)
column7: Amazon.com
column8: Inc.(AMZN)
column9: Netflix
column10: Inc.(NFLX)
column11: Alphabet Inc(GOOG) andApple Inc.(AAPL) were all in the red at the time of this writing.And all these big tech names are rising and falling pretty much in tandem with major indices
column12: including theS&P 500
column13: NASDAQ CompositeandDow Jones Industrial Average.Facebook Stock Could Drop Off SoonSo will Facebook stock be able to keep up themomentumfor the near future?Apple Inc. vs. Alphabet Inc: Value or Growth?Seeking Alphacontributor Damon Verial warns that it might not
column14: particularly because it almost always loses in March. He describes himself as ""strongly bullish"" on the name but adds that he only feels ""the urge to write about"" it when he thinks it is overvalued.He says he did call a pullback in Facebook stock in the past when it fell $10 to $123 per share over the four days following his call. Then it fell to $115 over the next two weeks.Of course the stock rallied
column15: as he says it ""always"" will
column16: but he notes that anyone who held through that pullback ""missed a significant buyback opportunity that would have more than accommodated a transition from capital gains tax on long-term holdings to income tax on short-term holdings for most sizable positions.""Verial noted that Facebook Inc (FB) stock has been in overbought territory since the end of January
column17: which means it probably won't take much to set off a downward spiral. He pointed to seasonal patterns in data on the stock showing where it almost always goes in each month.According to him
column18: Facebook stock almost always ends January in the green
column19: and its highest Sharpe ratio also is in January. Average gains during the month stand at 10%.But in February
column20: he said the stock's Sharpe ratio has fallen to zero
column21: making the month neutral. Then in March
column22: the Sharpe ratio turns negative
column23: ""hinting at a significant opportunity cost."" He adds that even long-term holders may find it beneficial to avoid the stock during the worst months
column24: which includes March
column25: May and August. These months aren't usuallyearningsmonths anyway
column26: and they're well after the holiday season at a time when spending on digital advertising starts to fall.He does feel that long is the only ""logical"" position to take on Facebook when looking at it from a long-term fundamental perspective.The postFacebook Stock Pulls Back After Touching Another Record Highappeared first onValueWalk.Many academics claim investing is a ""random walk."" We believe this to be only partially true. It is our core belief that value investing can outperform the market
column27: hence the name ""ValueWalk."" column1: Apple Inc. Fesses Up to iPhone 6 Battery Issue
column2: Releases Fix;2/24/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsIf it seems as thoughApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) has been fighting with battery issues with the iPhone 6 and iPhone 6s for months
column4: that's because it has.makeArticleAd();Source: AppleThere was a limited recall of iPhone 6s batteries blamed on a manufacturing issue
column5: problems in China and recently reports of widespread iPhone 6 sudden shutdown issues that seemed battery related. The company always denied any widespread issue.Until now.AAPL has finally acknowledged a problem related to the iPhone 6 battery … and says it has released a fix.The iPhone 6 Battery Has Been … ProblematicIf there's one thing 2016 will be remembered for when it comes to consumer electronics
column6: it's the challenges of working with lithium-ion batteries.5 Income Tax Deductions You Can't Afford to MissThe poster child for just how wrong this technology can go isSamsung Electronic Co Ltd(OTCMKTS:SSNLF). Samsung had a terrible 2016 after its flagship Galaxy Note 7's lithium-ion batteries were implicated in multiple fires
column7: This led to a complete recall of the device
column8: an estimated $10 billion hit
column9: a seriously damaged reputation and anextensive investigation to pinpoint the cause.In comparison
column10: AAPL's iPhone 6 battery woes have been less spectacular
column11: but the cloud over Apple's previous two generations of phones has lasted just as long - if not longer. And they proved much more frustrating in terms of nailing down a cause
column12: or a fix. That's because there appear to be multiple issues at play. And just as Apple admits there's a problem and announces a solution
column13: another iPhone 6 battery issue seems to pop up.In 2016
column14: Apple had to deal with aninvestigation in Chinaover reports that iPhone 6 and iPhone 6s batteries were not only failing
column15: but leaving the devices with expensive damage. Apple's findings pointed to cheap knock-off chargers as the culprit. Then there were reports of iPhone 6s phones unexpectedly shutting down. Apple eventually pinpointed the cause as being a manufacturing defect in a batch of batteries. Abattery exchange programwas launched
column16: but that got off to a rocky start when Apple Stores were flooded by iPhone owners hoping for a replacement battery
column17: and a backlog of repairs.Just as that mess was being sorted out
column18: complaints began to rise of iPhone 6 sudden shutdown issues. This was a new iPhone 6 battery issue and seemed to affect a growing number of users. It also affected the iPhone 6s
column19: but not the iPhone 7.The problem got so bad that at one point in January
column20: rumors started thatApple was planning to launch a full-scale iPhone 6 battery exchange program. However
column21: AAPL continued to deny there was a widespread problem with iPhone and 6s batteries.Now
column22: Apple has come clean.Apple Releases Fix for iPhone 6 Shutdown IssueThe company finally admitted that iPhone 6 and 6s phones have been suddenly and randomly shutting down
column23: forcing owners to plug them into a charger before they can be restarted. But
column24: AAPL says it released a fix and it's effective.In a statement released toTechCrunch
column25: Apple says iOS 10.2.1 finally addresses the issue:""We're seeing a more than 80% reduction in iPhone 6s and over 70% reduction on iPhone 6 of devices unexpectedly shutting down.""So what happened?AAPL says the iPhone 6 battery (and in some cases the iPhone 6s as well) suffers from a limitation of all-lithium-ion batteries. As these batteries get older
column26: they sometime deliver power unevenly. This could trigger the iPhone's power management system to force an emergency shutdown to protect the device.Tesla Inc (TSLA) Stock Just Entered Dangerous TerritoryApple made changes to that system in iOS 10.2.1
column27: essentially making it less sensitive to minor fluctuations. It also added new functionality so that should an iPhone 6 sudden shutdown occur
column28: the user can restart their device without having to be connected to a charger. The company says it also will add a battery diagnostic screen to iOS that warns iPhone owners when their battery requires service.The fact this issue was directly related to aging lithium-ion batteries explains why it was the iPhone 6 battery being implicated more frequently than the 6s
column29: why the numbers seemed to keep growing and why the iPhone 7 hasn't yet been affected.Will this mark the end of AAPL's drawn out iPhone 6 battery saga? The company has been playing whack-a-mole trying to identify issues with its lithium-ion batteries. But this fix seems to be enough of an umbrella solution that it may finally be able to put this chapter behind it.And let Apple go back to the good old days when complaints were limited to wishing the iPhone lasted longer on a battery charge …As of this writing
column30: Brad Moon did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceWWDC 2017: Here's What Apple Inc. Might RevealIs Apple Inc. (AAPL) Preparing a Red iPhone 7?Report: Apple Inc. iPhone 8 Could Cost More Than $1

column1: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) First Quarter Earnings Beat Not Enough;2/24/2017;"Shares of Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) plunged as much as 7% Thursday
column2: falling to low of $23 in the after-hour session after the tech giant reported mixed first quarter fiscal 2017 result after Thursday's closing bell that showed despite the improvements HPE has made to grow in the realm of the cloud
column3: competition from the likes of Amazon (AMZN) and Microsoft (MSFT) aren’t going away.The Palo Alto
column4: Calif.-based tech giant stunned the market with more than 80% stock gains over the past year
column5: driven by its hybrid cloud initiatives. While the company’s transformation as a standalone entity since its separation from its printing arm
column6: Hewlett Inc. (HPQ)
column7: has enabled HPE to show better financial performance
column8: HPE on Thursday needed to account for the level of confidence investors have shown. In that regard
column9: the miss on revenue and tepid guidance wasn’t enough.In the three months that ended January
column10: Hewlett Packard Enterprise reported a net income of $267 million
column11: or 16 cents per share. On an adjusted basis
column12: when taking out one-time gains and costs
column13: earnings
column14: were 45 cents per share
column15: which beat Thomson Reuters forecast by a penny and above last year’s total of 41 cents per share.makeArticleAd();First quarter revenue of $11.41 billion
column16: meanwhile
column17: not only fell short of Street forecasts of $12.13 billion
column18: it marked a year-over-year decline of 10.4%. Notably
column19: this is the company’s third consecutive quarter during which it has missed on the top line. The company's focus on hardware for data centers instead of faster-growing software has posed a challenge. The market for the latter
column20: particularly cloud services is forecast to increase more than 20% annually.“I believe HPE remains on the right track
column21: ” said Meg Whitman
column22: President and CEO of Hewlett Packard Enterprise in a statement. “The steps we’re taking to strengthen our portfolio
column23: streamline our organization
column24: and build the right leadership team
column25: are setting us up to win long into the future.”Despite Whitman’s confidence
column26: the company
column27: which has placed long-term bets with investments in emerging markets
column28: reduced its fiscal 2017 earnings per share forecast to $1.88 to $1.98
column29: compared to analysts estimates of $2.03. Among other reasons for lowering forecast
column30: Whitman cited currency fluctuations
column31: higher commodities prices on items such as memory chips for servers and “near-term execution issues.”These issues aside
column32: the stock’s punishment Thursday seems like an overreaction — though not surprising
column33: given the strong gains over the past year. While I wouldn’t recommend jumping in to buy HPE stock at the moment
column34: these shares — currently around $23 — should be bought if they fall to $22."

column1: 7 Blue-Chip Stocks That Are Flush With Cash;2/23/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsCash is king. It not only drives growth
column3: but it permits flexibility. And it's the reason why so many blue-chip stocks are flush with it.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockBlue-chip stocks with tons of cash are more likely to survive downturns in business or the economy
column4: and can choose whether to deploy their greenbacks toward growth
column5: R&D
column6: share buybacks or dividends.When thinking about which stocks to buy for my forthcoming stock advisory newsletter
column7: The Liberty Portfolio
column8: blue-chip stocks with tons of cash are going to be important players.3 Covered Calls to Squeeze Dividends Out of Thin AirHere are seven blue-chip stocks to consider for your own portfolio that happens to have tons of cash.Blue-Chip Stocks: Apple (AAPL)Source: ShutterstockCash Balance:$247 billionWhat It Should Do:Increase dividendsApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) has to top the list of blue-chip stocks to buy with lots of cash. AAPL has $247 billion of cash on hand
column9: although most of it is stuck overseas.However
column10: we are in a new era
column11: and it is an era where President Trump and Congress may lower the corporate tax rate to 15%. If that happens
column12: the $230 billion of cash it holds overseas will be repatriated. That will leave Apple with $212 billion of cash.This insane amount of money will be partially used to bump the dividend
column13: probably by as much as $4 per share over time
column14: pushing AAPL stock into income stock territory.Blue-Chip Stocks: General Electric (GE)Source: ShutterstockCash Balance:$92 billionWhat It Should Do:M&A
column15: Share buybacksGeneral Electric Company(NYSE:GE) is not the company it once was
column16: and I recently wrote that I don't think you want to be buying GE stock at $30 per share. However
column17: it has about $92 billion in cash on hand
column18: and most of it is overseas
column19: as well.Repatriating that money would leave it with a sizable $77 billion cash hoard. GE is already loved by income investors
column20: so my guess is that GE would use the cash to continue making acquisitions and foolishly buying back stock.The 10 Best Stocks to Buy and Hold ForeverThat will boost per-share earnings and create inorganic growth that keeps the GE name alive as far as investing is concerned.Blue-Chip Stocks: Johnson & Johnson (JNJ)Source:Dawn Via FlickrCash Balance:$40 billionWhat It Should Do:Increase dividends
column21: R&D
column22: M&AI'm not keen onJohnson & Johnson(NYSE:JNJ) despite the fact that it is one of these blue-chip stocks that has recently hit all-time highs. I'm mystified because it isn't growing net income and is really struggling as a company.Still
column23: with about $40 billion in cash and more than $13 billion in fairly predictable annual cash flow
column24: JNJ should bump up its dividend by another $1 per share
column25: and plow the rest into R&D and acquisitions.3 Struggling Stocks That Could Make Epic RunsIt needs to grow
column26: and right now it's just a sitting duck that's insanely overpriced.Blue-Chip Stocks: Coca-Cola (KO)Source:Chris Nielsen via FlickrCash Balance:$25 billionWhat It Should Do:M&ATheCoca-Cola Co(NYSE:KO) is in a bit of trouble
column27: as the world moves away from sugary and unhealthy drinks. Because it has $25 billion of cash on hand
column28: about $8 billion in annual and predictable free cash flow and needs to find a vision
column29: it should deploy that cash by making a bold acquisition.It needs to buy some massive group of beverage companies that are growing organically and have caught consumers' taste. That's the only way this legend is going to be able to move into the future. Otherwise
column30: it can just settle into flat-growth mode and pay an increasingly uncompetitive 3.5% yield.Blue-Chip Stocks: Microsoft (MSFT)Source:Mike Mozart via Flickr (Modified)Cash Balance:$132 billionWhat It Should Do:Increase dividends
column31: M&A
column32: R&DMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) is in the enviable position of having about $132 billion of cash on hand
column33: while also having settled comfortably into Peter Lynch stalwart territory.MSFT only pays out less than half of its reliable $25 billion to $27 billion of free cash flow. It can easily bump its dividend by another $1 per share and push the yield up toward 4%
column34: and even higher if it wished to.7 Ultra-Cheap Value Stocks to Buy NowThen it could drop a huge chunk of money into a mega-acquisition that would push it into growth stock territory again. Or it could just keep trying to expand its footprint with big R&D spends.Blue-Chip Stocks: Alphabet (GOOGL)Source: ShutterstockCash Balance:$92 billionWhat It Should Do:NothingWe obviously must mentionAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column35: NASDAQ:GOOGL) here
column36: considering its $92 billion in cash and $26 billion in free cash flow this past year.GOOGL needs to move beyond being a digital billboard and venture capital incubator
column37: but I don't think it needs to rush to do anything because its core business is still growing nicely and it is undervalued.I say it should just hold onto that cash and wait until growth flags before making a bold move into a growth arena with a big acquisition. Right now
column38: though
column39: investors aren't even demanding a dividend
column40: so I say
column41: hold onto that cash.Blue-Chip Stocks: Pfizer (PFE)Source:Kojach Via FlickrCash Balance:$38 billionWhat It Should Do:R&DPfizer Inc.(NYSE:PFE) sits on almost $40 billion in cash
column42: yet it finds itself with a growth problem
column43: with earnings growth slogging along at 6.5% annually.It's trading at a ridiculous 12 times forward earnings multiple. Like its other pharma and biotech counterparts
column44: it needs a serious jump-start
column45: and the only real way for that to occur is to seriously ramp up R&D. It needs to find blockbuster drugs and it has the money to do so.The 3 Best REITs for Sky-High Total ReturnsIt can't just buy up little things here and there. A Pfizer for the future is a Pfizer that revisits what made it great in its past.Lawrence Meyers is the CEO of PDL Capital
column46: and manager of the forthcomingLiberty Portfolio stock newsletter. As of this writing

column48: and has written more than 1
column49: 600 articles on investing. Lawrence Meyers can be reached atTheLibertyPortfolio@gmail.com.The post7 Blue-Chip Stocks That Are Flush With Cashappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Google Finds 'Waze' to Build Self-Driving Technology;2/23/2017;"When asked some time back about the use cases for self-driving cars
column2: AlphabetGOOGLexecutives said that they were exploring alternatives. Things have changed somewhat since then and we have slightly greater clarity on whether Google will maintain its own fleet
column3: renting out for delivery of goods
column4: food and/or passenger transport
column5: or whether it will rent vehicles from their makers and sell those services itself.My bet was always on the latter
column6: first because Google is primarily a technology company and thrives on making the kind of software that can take over our lives. Getting into the low-margin business of vehicle maintenance and renting just isn't its area of expertise.Furthermore
column7: the kind of investment that is going into getting these animals on the road isn't justified unless there is a lucrative business out there with a relatively quick payback time.So the company's initial step toward commercialization by getting key people on board and announcing the name of the unit as Waymo was heartening. The goal of this unit is to develop self-driving technology for car makers.How Does All This Tie In with the Waze Carpool Service?Waze was an Israeli crowd-sourced mapping service providing users with information such as traffic
column8: road conditions and other helpful pointers
column9: so they could quickly decide their route. At least that's what it was in 2013 when Google acquired it for $1.15 billion.Today
column10: Waze is also a carpooling service that gets people travelling in the same direction to travel together and share the cost of gas. So yes
column11: there are headaches to availing the service like having to book way in advance or not having anybody to pick one up on occasion. It also doesn't allow anyone to become a driver
column12: so they can't make a living from it.All this goes to show that Google's plans in the area probably aren't crystallized and the service is a temporary measure to access that all-important thing these days called data. Data that can add to the treasure trove Google's already collecting through the test driving of its self-driving cars.The difficulties don't seem to have deterred users
column13: however
column14: because Google just announced the expansion of the service to unannounced locations in the U.S. and Latin America. And while not all Waze users are signing up for carpooling
column15: it's significant that their numbers have reportedly swelled from 45 million in 2013 to 75 million today. So even if a small percentage of this growing number of people goes for it
column16: it can still be a compelling number.Taxi Service Is What Uber
column17: Lyft Do WellThere's no doubt about it
column18: these two companies have been growing in leaps and bounds as the convenience and quality of service have attracted more and more people. So the prospect of other
column19: perhaps cheaper (because a self-driving car doesn't need a driver) services coming online certainly isn't good news.Google was an initial investor in Uber
column20: but when the company started developing self-driving technology to save its neck
column21: Google representative David Drummond removed himself from its board. Uber still uses Google mapping services
column22: but has increased investments to develop maps of its own.ConclusionUber and its pals have popularized the concept of ride-hailing/car-sharing services but now that the concept has caught on
column23: there will be new entrants. This is a big opportunity for car makers because this is the space where new cars will be deployed in the future.On the technology side
column24: there is the need for machine learning and cloud support
column25: mapping technology
column26: and sensors
column27: which have to be installed on cars built to house the technology. And that's exactly why companies like IntelINTCare tying up with companies like Mobileye
column28: while NVIDIANVDApairs up with BaiduBIDUand MicrosoftMSFT. Then of course there's Google. These companies are in turn testing the technology through collaboration agreements with automakers.But who will get there first? Industry watchers don't expect anything viable until 2020. Even if it's a couple of years out from there
column29: it does look like there will be more than one approach/technology driving the experience. And since the possibilities are tremendous
column30: there won't necessarily be a single winner.Google
column31: Microsoft
column32: Intel and NVIDIA all have a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) right now. But you can findthe complete list of today's Zacks #1 Rank (Strong Buy)   stocks here.Zacks' Top 10 Stocks for 2017In addition to the stocks discussed above
column33: would you like to know about our 10 finest buy-and-hold tickers for the entirety of 2017?Who wouldn't? Last year's market-beating Top 10 portfolio produced 5 double-digit winners. For example
column34: oil and natural gas giant Pioneer Natural Resources and First Republic Bank racked up stellar gains of +44.9% and +44.3% respectively. Now a brand-new list for 2017 has been hand-picked from 4

column1: Why Nokia Corp (NOK) Stock Should Make a BIG Comeback Soon;2/23/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsNokia Corp (ADR)(NYSE:NOK) announced its fourth-quarter results on Feb. 2 and it exceeded analysts' expectations. NOK's operating profits dropped by 27% from the prior-year quarter to 940 million euros
column3: or $1 billion. Analysts polled byReuterswere expecting profits of 788 million euros for Nokia stock.makeArticleAd();Source:Open Grid Scheduler / Grid Engine via Flickr (Modified)Given the better-than-expected results
column4: analysts at Morgan Stanley
column5: led by Francois Meunier upgraded Nokia stock to ""overweight"" from ""equal weight
column6: with a new price target of €5.70. Meunier particularly likes how NOK stock is improving its margins.In addition to improving margins
column7: I believe Nokia's return to the smartphone market should also bring optimism.NOK-Branded Smartphone Coming Back to the MarketThe story of Nokia's last ten years or so has been all about how the smartphone revolution swept the company into oblivion. It eventually sold its phone business toMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT)
column8: which eventually sold it to Foxconn and HMD Global in 2016.Following the transfer of phone assets
column9: HMD Global launched the Nokia 6 smartphone in China in January of this year. According to reports
column10: the smartphone is being bought so quickly that it created an impression that HMD Global was only doing flash sales. HMD Global hadto clarifythat quick sellouts were the reason it appeared as though it has been a flash sale.7 Ultra-Cheap Value Stocks to Buy NowHMD is expected to announce a few more Android-run Nokia phones at the Mobile World Congress in Barcelona later this month. According to reports
column11: HMD will be announcing the Nokia P1 and two Nokia D1C smartphones at the event. We expect the Nokia P1 to be a high-end smartphone
column12: with Nokia stockhinting at usingitsWeibo Corp (ADR)(NASDAQ:WB) account that an Android-powered Nokia phone with the Snapdragon 835 SoC is in the works.Other reports claim that the P1 phone will sport a 22.6 megapixel camera and IP68 water and dust resistance. Its pricing would range between $779 and $900
column13: depending on the storage size.On the other hand
column14: one of the Nokia D1C smartphoneswill be a mid-range smartphone
column15: sporting the Snapdragon 430 SoC
column16: 3GB RAM and a 16-megapixel rear-facing camera
column17: according to reports. It's expected to cost around $200. The other D1C smartphone is expected to be of lower spec with 2GB RAM and a 13-megapixel rear-facing camera.I decided to give a rundown of what's expected to point out that Nokia stock and its licensees are targeting every segment of the smartphone market with their pipeline. The P1 will compete at the high-end of the market; one of the D1C's will compete at the mid-level market
column18: while the other D1C will compete for low-end customers.I believe that this multi-pronged approach increases the chances that NOK stock will be somewhat relevant in the smartphone market - at least one of the consumer segments should find its phones attractive.I'm particularly optimistic about the low-end D1C smartphone. Variousreviews about affordable branded smartphoneshave carrier-locked iPhone 5s as the most affordable smartphone around. And that price is mostly limited to the U.S. Unlocked versions cost more. So in essence
column19: by the time the low-end Nokia D1C gets to the market
column20: it would be just about the most affordable branded smartphone there is.Bottom Line on Nokia StockWith such an offer
column21: I see an opportunity for NOK stock to capture the ""unbranded"" smartphone market. Higher affordability is a common feature of unbranded smartphones phones. With the low-end D1C
column22: Nokia will be offering customers who have been deterred by high price an opportunity to own branded phones at an affordable price.2 Reasons Alibaba Group Holding Ltd (BABA) Stock Is Even More EnticingThe seemingly high demand for Nokia 6
column23: which launched for 1699 Chinese Yuan (roughly $247) in China
column24: is proof that lower-end NOK stock phones stand a chance.But
column25: it should be noted that the company would only receive royalty payments on every sale of Nokia branded products. In other words
column26: only a portion of the money these phones generate will end up in NOK's books.Still
column27: this is high-margin revenue since the licensees bear the production costs and it will go some way to help Nokia stock fix its worsening revenue problem over the long-term.Overall
column28: while I believe that NOK stock is on the right way to recovery. However
column29: Nokia stock isn't for the faint-hearted. Although the reward could be great for long-term investors with a high risk-taking quotient.As of this writing
column30: Craig Adeyanju did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace7 Consumer Stocks That Will Knock Your Socks Off7 Stocks to Sell or Short Before the Bears StrikeThe postWhy Nokia Corp (NOK) Stock Should Make a BIG Comeback Soonappeared first onInvestorPlace."

Comparing the most recent share price to the 200 day moving average can also be a useful technical analysis technique --learn more about the 200 day moving average ».makeArticleAd();Exchange traded funds (ETFs) trade just like stocks
column14: but instead of ''shares'' investors are actually buying and selling ''units''. These ''units'' can be traded back and forth just like stocks
column15: but can also be created or destroyed to accommodate investor demand. Each week we monitor the week-over-week change in shares outstanding data
column16: to keep a lookout for those ETFs experiencing notable inflows (many new units created) or outflows (many old units destroyed). Creation of new units will mean the underlying holdings of the ETF need to be purchased
column17: while destruction of units involves selling underlying holdings
column18: so large flows can also impact the individual components held within ETFs.Click here to find out which 9 other ETFs had   notable inflows »"

column1: PowerShares QQQ Trust (QQQ): Short the Titans of Tech;2/23/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsThe rally inPowerShares QQQ Trust
column3: Series 1 (ETF)(NASDAQ:QQQ) has reached epic proportions as the tech rally moves relentlessly higher on a daily basis. Like all good things
column4: however
column5: it will eventually come to an end. And the end is nigh for the Nasdaq. I expect QQQ to have a meaningful pullback over the coming few weeks.makeArticleAd();QQQ is comprised of the top 100 Nasdaq stocks
column6: with the largest five holdings comprising nearly 40% of the index. These are the heavyweights of tech
column7: with names likeApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL)

column9: Amazon.com

column13: the biggest component of the QQQ
column14: is no longer the value stock is was a year ago. AAPL currently sports a price-to-earnings multiple over 16
column15: by far the highest over the past year.Click to EnlargeYear-to-date
column16: the QQQ is up a stunning 10%. To put that in a different context
column17: if the Q's maintained the torrid pace of the rally
column18: it would end up the year with a gain of 97.8%. Of the 34 trading days this year
column19: QQQ has been up 27 days and down only seven.In February
column20: there have been 12 up days and only two down days
column21: with the two down days only being 11 cents and 4 cents.Certainly might be difficult to sustain that type of pace going forward.7 Ultra-Cheap Value Stocks to Buy NowThe Q's are by far the most overbought in the past two years with a 14-day RSI reading over 85. Readings at these extremes are rare indeed
column22: especially for an index or ETF.Click to EnlargeImplied volatility (IV) is priced at the lowest levels over that time frame
column23: meaning option prices are cheap
column24: trading at only 4%. Yesterday saw notable put trading in the QQQ
column25: with an inordinate amount of put selling. This type of action is usually indicative of tops in the underlying shares.So with the Q's at grossly overbought levels and with option prices dirt cheap
column26: taking a bearish position using long put options makes a lot of sense.QQQ Trade IdeaBuy QQQ March $130 puts at $1.50 or better.These are the at-the-money puts and cost only 1.1% the price of the QQQ. With IV at low levels

column28: meaning these options are poised to move. A mere 2% pullback over the coming few weeks would result in a doubler for these options.Those wishing to defray some of the exposure could elect to sell shorter-term weekly options against the long traditional Mar $130 puts.As of this writing

column1: Why Twilio Inc (TWLO) Stock Is Still Too Expensive;2/22/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsApplication software supplierTwilio Inc(NYSE:TWLO) did not make much of a jump on the stock markets after reporting its fourth-quarter earnings. In fact
column3: Twilio stock is still far from the $70.96 high it reached last year in September 2016. Bearishness is extremely high
column4: as its short float stood at 66.3%. And despite all of this
column5: the company reported soaring revenue and smaller losses and projected Q1 figures higher than consensus. However
column6: these are not good enough reasons to pay over 10 times sales for TWLO stock.makeArticleAd();Source:Web Summit Via FlickrLast quarter
column7: Twilio reported 60% year-over-year growth
column8: or $82 million in revenue. The company broke even
column9: compared to expectations for a $0.05 per share loss. The company now forecast revenue of $82 million to $84 million
column10: above a consensus of around $78 million.For the full year
column11: Twilio still expects a loss of between $0.15 to $0.19 per share. The loss estimates are higher than the consensus for a drop of $0.10 per share.TWLO: Business MoatTwilio's moat is showing up in the financial results. Base revenue grew 73% YoY. Its platform business model added 2
column12: 000 new active customers in the quarter. Companies like Blue Cross Blue Shield
column13: Capital One Financial Corp.(NYSE:COF) and one of the largest airlines are only some of the customers TWLO added. Businesses need call center technology that supports the growing telephone volumes. These companies count on Twilio for its monitoring capabilities and platform scalability.Functionally
column14: Twilio's edge over competitors is providing the transformation from legacy hardware and physical networks to software. Although TWLO is losing money now
column15: its profit margin is higher in software. Revenue will eventually exceed costs.The 10 Best Stocks to Buy and Hold ForeverTwilio's solutions add efficiency for its customers and improve the customer experience. First
column16: the company added more offerings
column17: including dual-channel recording. Second
column18: it added private Ethernet and MPOS connections for customers to the cloud for VoIP (voice-over-IP). Third
column19: APIs allow customers to add users to the solution in an easy and automated way. TWLO's solution supportsMicrosoft Corporation's(NASDAQ:MSFT) Azure Bot Service andAmazon.com
column20: Inc.'s(NASDAQ:AMZN) Lex framework.Partners such as Zendesk andSalesforce.com
column21: Inc.(NYSE:CRM) both support Twilio's APIs.Despite the growing customer base and higher revenue
column22: Non-GAAP operating expenses were 59%
column23: or $48.2 million
column24: of total revenue. Although expenses are up from $34 million last year
column25: the company barely managed break-even (non-GAAP) earnings. For fiscal-year 2017
column26: TWLO still expects a non-GAAP loss of $17 million to $13 million
column27: due to hiring and upfront costs. It expects to break-even in the fourth quarter of 2017.Boeing Co: 2 Tailwinds That Could Propel BA StockOn theconference call
column28: Twilio pointed to artificial intelligence as one of the catalysts for top-line growth: ""within our partner ecosystem
column29: we are starting to offer AI powered solutions to our customers in the form of the marketplace that we launched last year where we do a revenue share with those partners between our customers.""To win customers
column30: TWLO relies on what the developer brings to the enterprise. The company does not spend too much from the sales and marketing. Still
column31: it will beef up that unit to win customers and grow revenue.Bottom Line on TWLO StockBy catering to developers through APIs
column32: Twilio is making it easy for customers to build a use case and scale a proof of concept. That accelerates adoption of Twilio's solution
column33: allowing the company to add thousands of customers by 155% last year. Yet the stock is not cheap: Short-sellers are betting the valuations will fall if growth slows sooner than thought. Chances are low that TWLO will face a slowdown this year. Beyond that
column34: investors risk downside if it reports just one bad quarter.As of this writing
column35: Chris Lau did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceThe 10 Best Oil Stocks to Buy Now for Big-Time Gains7 S&P 500 Stocks Poised For Explosive GrowthThe postWhy Twilio Inc (TWLO) Stock Is Still Too Expensiveappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Tech Stock Roundup: FB TV App
column2: AAPL Original Content;2/22/2017;"Technology stocks had a relatively quiet week although there were increased signs that companies like FacebookFBand AppleAAPLwere getting more serious about not just content acquisition but also content creation. While this may not be in direct competition with NetflixNFLXit does look like competition for Alphabet'sGOOGLYouTube
column3: Spotify and PandoraP. It's also definitely competition for eyeballs in what is limited free time for all-Facebook TV AppFacebook has launched a new TV app for Amazon Fire TV
column4: Apple TV and Samsung Smart TV
column5: with possible plans to further expand to other platforms like Microsoft Xbox
column6: Sony PlayStation and other streaming devices. While this will likely enable/support longer video formats
column7: Facebook has said its intention is not to compete with Netflix but rather to enable Facebook users to watch their preferred video on just about any screen of their choice (and that includes TV screens).Of course that's not the only video announcement Facebook made. The company says that henceforth
column8: videos will play automatically with the sound turned on by default (if the device sound is turned on) and the window will retreat to the bottom corner of the screen so you can keep watching the video while scrolling through your newsfeed. Facebook says that testing is showing a positive reaction from users
column9: although it's obvious that not everyone will be overjoyed.Facebook is also reportedly in talks with music labels to bring their content to the app
column10: which seems like an open challenge to YouTube
column11: Google's competing site. For labels
column12: the new distribution channel will increase their leverage against YouTube for more favorable terms. On the flip side
column13: the chances of piracy will increase given the nature of Facebook's free platform.The increased scope for advertising is also an indication that the company is gearing up to grab its share of TV ad dollars.Apple Getting Ready to Debut Reality ShowEddie Cue
column14: Apple's SVP of Internet software and services used the Recode Media Conference to express a lot of enthusiasm for Apple's soon-to-be released ""Planet of the Apps"" reality show on its music subscription service. Contestants will get 60 seconds to explain their idea on an escalator and could win up to millions in venture capital funding if judges will.i.am
column15: Jessica Alba
column16: Gary Vaynerchuk and Gwyneth Paltrow approve. This is the first attempt by Apple to create original content and will likely be joined by Carpool Karaoke in April (Apple bought out the unscripted version of this show in the summer of last year).Google Fiber RestructuringAlphabet has been trimming staff at its Access unit
column17: which is responsible for its high-speed Internet service called Fiber. But last week
column18: the trimming was more in the nature of hacking as it transferred hundreds of employees to other units
column19: retaining just enough to work in the field. The unit also has a new CEO in Greg McCray
column20: who was formerly CEO of Aero Communications and currently also serves on the board of telecom company CenturyLink.The changes while significant are not really surprising
column21: because Google has had a lot of trouble with Fiber not only because of the expense but also because of tussles with telecom companies over their control on telecom poles. In fact
column22: ever since its acquisition of WebPass last year
column23: speculation has been rife that the company will replace or reduce fiber deployment with a cheaper wireless service. That plan seems to have crystallized now as Google cuts staff but remains committed to expanding its Fiber service.CompanyLast WeekLast  6 MonthsAAPL+2.36%+22.12%FB+2.45%+7.12%GOOGL+1.79%+3.68%MSFT+0.50%+10.23%INTC-3.23%+0.86%CSCO+0.61%+1.61%AMZN+2.12%+7.94%Other stories you might have missed-CorporateAussie Banks Respond to Apple Statement: In response to Apple's contention that the Commonwealth Bank of Australia
column24: National Australia Bank Ltd.
column25: Westpac Banking Corp. and Bendigo & Adelaide Bank Ltd were looking for a free ride
column26: they have told the Australian Competition & Consumer Commission (ACCC) that on the contrary
column27: Apple's policies attempted to prevent competition in wallets. Because if Apple allowed them access to its NFC antenna
column28: they would pledge their participation in the Apple Pay rollout.Australian law allows such collective bargaining
column29: provided it is approved by the government. In its draft ruling
column30: the ACCC denied the banks' request. The final ruling is expected in March and in the meantime
column31: the Australian Retailers Association have backed the banks
column32: making their own submission that the collective negotiations would be beneficial for ""all banks
column33: merchants
column34: app developers and ultimately customers in Australia and overseas.""Facebook Seeks Independent Media Audit: Facebook has agreed to be audited by Media Rating Council
column35: an industry body that advertisers trust for ad measurement metrics. Ad prices on the social network have been rising despite the fact that Facebook has repeatedly come out with statements seeking to rectify viewership numbers.The company has therefore been under slight pressure to mend relationships with advertisers. The agreement should increase transparency and instill confidence in advertisers
column36: which are directly responsible for its bread and butter.Mark Zuckerberg Talks: The Facebook CEO wrote a long-winded essay sharing his long-term vision for the social network that mainly covered the importance of a global community in an increasingly individualistic world. The purpose of the ""mission statement"" wasn't really clear since most government bodies in the U.S. and elsewhere don't have a problem with people connecting on the social network and there aren't any bans as such on people connecting even if they later turn out to be terrorists. Of course Facebook has access to a boatload of data on people that governments might ask for (as they have been doing).New Technology/ProductsFacebook Gets into Recruitment Services: Facebook has found another use for its sprawling network: it is now connecting employers with employees. While LinkedIn (now part of Microsoft) has been around for a while
column37: the site is more popular with higher-income groups. Facebook on the other hand has people from every walk of life and employers of every kind on its network
column38: so it's in a very good position to corner a much larger section of the market than LinkedIn ever reached.Google Loon Tech Improves: Google's Project Loon may get to market sooner now that the company has found a way of moving them more efficiently. According to a blog post from Astro Teller
column39: head of its moonshots division called Google X
column40: the company now has the algorithms necessary to direct groups of balloons from their point of launch to their points of deployment (remote area where Internet access is required) within a few weeks. Earlier this took a few months.The announcement was made after the company successfully launched its Internet beaming balloons from Puerto Rico and directed them towards Peru. The loon project is already testing in Sri Lanka and Peru although testing in Indonesia
column41: the other country that has approved the project
column42: is yet to commence.Amazon Echo
column43: Google Home Taking Calls: The home automation devices from Google and AmazonAMZNmay soon be equipped with phone calling capabilities according to the WSJ
column44: which cited its sources. The idea is to keep users away from their phones as much as possible when in the house
column45: so they don't get distracted into using other services like Facebook. Or maybe it's just to help people get their calls even when they have both hands full.AWS Launches Chime: Amazon's AWS has launched a video conferencing software suite called Chime that competes with Microsoft's Skype for Business
column46: Cisco's WebEx and others. Other than the basic version for which it doesn't charge
column47: a Plus version with IT admin tools and screen-sharing comes for $2.50 per user per month and a Pro version that supports upto 100 attendees at $15. Microsoft charges $5 and $12.50 for the Office 365 Business Essentials and Business Premium packages
column48: respectively. Cisco charges $69 on the basis of the number of hosts
column49: irrespective of the number of attendees.HP-Sure Click: HP has collaborated with Bromium to introduce a hardware based security solution for unsafe Internet browsing. The solution
column50: called HP Sure Click is activated every time a user accesses the browser
column51: which then isolates the browsing session from other files/documents. So if malware or other malicious software opens up
column52: other tabs or the system itself remains uninfected.M&A and CollaborationsMicrosoft Collaborates with India's Tata Motors: The two companies have inked a technology collaboration deal that will see MicrosoftMSFTdeliver its connected vehicle technologies (artificial intelligence
column53: machine learning
column54: IoT) through Azure. In exchange
column55: Tata Motors customers will have a better experience
column56: whether by way of location-based points of interest
column57: shopping centers or route assistance
column58: or things like information on road conditions
column59: vehicle health
column60: etc.Some NumbersGoogle Leads in Digital Travel Ads: Based in part on a meeting with industry research firm Skift
column61: RBC Capital analyst Mark Mahaney believes that Google will never grow into an online travel agency
column62: i.e. it will never compete in travel fulfillment (including distribution and customer service). Skift estimates that Google accounted for 90% of travel ads in 2016
column63: generating $12 billion in revenue. The biggest spenders on Google are Priceline
column64: Expedia and TripAdvisor.Just Released - Driverless Cars: Your Roadmap to   Mega-Profits TodayIn this latest Special Report

He also spotlights 8 stocks with tremendous gain potential to feed off this phenomenon.Click to see the stocks right now >>Want the latest recommendations from Zacks Investment Research? Today

column1: Could Apple Inc. (AAPL) Be The First Ever $1 Trillion Company?;2/22/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsI stumbled across a prediction last week that would impress even Mad Money's Jim Cramer.makeArticleAd();According to a recent report from Oxfam
column3: an international charitable organization
column4: Bill Gates has a shot at becoming the world's first trillionaire. Oxfam speculates that if the returns on the tech mogul's $75 billion fortune in the next 25 years are similar to those in the last 25 years
column5: Gates has a shot at jumping the $1 trillion mark.That got me thinking
column6: if one man has a shot at becoming a trillionaire
column7: certainly one of theS&P 500′s biggest companies has a shot at becoming the world's first $1 trillion company?Turns out
column8: a few do.I see five S&P 500 companies with a shot at breaking the $1 trillion mark in the next five years.-Facebook Inc(FB) is the smallest company on the list with a market cap of $386 billion. Facebook's share price would need to hit $345
column9: up 159%.-Amazon.com
column10: Inc.(AMZN) has a market cap of $400 billion. Shares would need to hit $1
column12: up 125%.-Microsoft Corporation(MSFT) has a market cap of $498 billion. Shares would need to hit $130
column13: up 100%.-Alphabet Inc(GOOG) is currently worth $570 billion. Shares would need to hit $1
column15: up 70%.I believe every one of these companies will eventually be worth $1 trillion. However
column16: one other company will beat them all to it.Thanks to a variety of factors
column17: Apple Inc.(AAPL) is set to become the first $1 trillion company in the world in the next five years.The company has been on a roll. After beating fourth-quarter earnings by 4%
column18: shares just hit a new all-time high above $135.That gives Apple a market cap of $710 billion
column19: making it the largest company in the S&P 500. It has also placed Apple within striking distance of the $1 trillion mark. Shares of Apple would only need to climb 50% to $200 to give it a market cap of $1 trillion.7 Tech Stocks With Explosive Growth PotentialThat is well within reach.If its current valuation stayed the same
column20: Apple would need to grow earnings by 8% annually in the next five years to hit that target. As it stands
column21: Apple is expected to grow earnings by 8% this year and another 13% in 2018. Those two years alone get Apple almost half way to 50% earnings growth.But even if Apple's earnings grow slower than expected
column22: it has an ace up its sleeve.Apple Has $246 Billion In Cash On Its Balance SheetApple's cash position is larger than the GDP of most countries. In recent fourth-quarter results
column23: Apple's reported a cash position of $246 billion. Some of that cash is already accounted for in Apple's $700 billion valuation. But not all of it.Using as little as half of its cash balance to repurchase shares adds another $125 billion to Apple's market cap.Apple's Is One Of The Most Undervalued Stocks In The S&P 500Apple is one of the most undervalued stocks in the S&P 500. Its forward P/E ratio of 15 is a discount to the S&P 500s 20. That lower valuation exists despite the fact that Apple is projected to grow earnings faster than the S&P 500 in the next five years.Technically speaking that means Apple should be trading with a higher P/E ratio than the S&P 500. If Apple traded with the same P/E ratio as the S&P 500
column24: shares would shares would climb 25%
column25: giving Apple a market cap of $887 billion.Warren Buffett Just Made A Huge Investment In AppleApple's pursuit of the $1 trillion threshold has attracted the attention of the world's greatest investor. In recent regulatory filings
column26: Berkshire revealed it had quadrupled its ownership in Apple to 57 million shares. Buffett's stake was worth approximately $6.6 billion at the end of 2016.With shares of Apple already up 17% on the year
column27: Buffett has pocketed a quick $1.1 billion gain in less than six weeks.7 Dividend Stocks for the Retirement You DeserveRisks To Consider:Apple has struggled to launch new hits in the last few years. Although sales growth in its most important product the iPhone is still strong
column28: Apple isn't the innovative company it was under Steve Jobs.Action To Take:Apple is on pace to become the world's first $1 trillion company. Even though shares are trading at an all-time high
column29: I see plenty of growth and gains ahead. Buy shares anywhere below the all-time high and hold until Apple becomes the first $1 trillion company in the world.Editor's Note:Tech companieshave a history of turning stockholders
column30: secretaries and even janitors into ""overnight"" millionaires.In 2017
column31: innovations in virtual reality will do the same for owners of these 2 stocks…StreetAuthority's mission is to help individual investors earn above-average profits by providing a source of independent
column32: unbiased - and most of all
column33: profitable - investing ideas. Unlike traditional publishers
column34: StreetAuthority doesn't simply regurgitate the latest stock market news. Instead
column35: we provide in-depth research
column36: plus specific investment ideas and immediate action to take based on the latest market events. Visit us atStreetAuthority.com.More From InvestorPlace10 Super-Safe Dividend Growth Stocks to Buy Today7 Marvelous Mid-Cap Stocks to Buy for the Best of All WorldsThe postCould Apple Inc. (AAPL) Be The First Ever $1 Trillion Company?appeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Can Amazon's Chime Challenge Microsoft's Skype and Cisco's Spark?;2/21/2017;"Amazon(NASDAQ: AMZN) recently introduced Chime
column2: an  enterprise   collaboration service for online meetings
column3: video conferencing
column4: voice calls
column5: chat
column6: and content sharing. Chime's apps work on iOS
column7: Android
column8: Windows
column9: and Mac
column10: and the content is synchronized across   all platforms via Amazon Web Services (AWS).Chime comes in three versions -- Chime Basis
column11: for 1:1 voice   and video calls and chat; Chime Plus
column12: which adds screen sharing   and the integration of company directories; and Chime Pro
column13: which   adds tools for scheduling
column14: hosting
column15: recording
column16: and personalizing   meetings for up to 100 people.Image source: Amazon.makeArticleAd();These features indicate that Amazon is taking aim at   collaborative tools likeMicrosoft's(NASDAQ: MSFT) Skype andCisco's(NASDAQ: CSCO) Spark. But are those rivals already too deeply   entrenched in the enterprise market for Amazon to disrupt? Let's   take a closer look at Amazon's game plan to find out.Entering the crowded SaaS marketAmazon's AWS
column17: which has an annual run rate of $14 billion
column18: is   the  biggest cloud infrastructure platform in the world.   It's several times larger than its closest competitor
column19: Microsoft's Azure. But while AWS dominates the cloud platform   (infrastructure/platform as a service) market -- which hosts   storage space
column20: processing power
column21: and other tools for companies   and developers -- it doesn't have a major presence in the SaaS   (software as a service) market yet.The SaaS market is the crowded
column22: consumer-facing side of the   cloud
column23: which includes services like Microsoft's Office 365
column24: Dynamics CRM
column25: and Skype. The lion's share of Microsoft's   commercialized cloud revenue run  rate of $14 billion is   generated by those SaaS products instead of Azure. Microsoft has   also been expanding Skype's capabilities as an enterprise   collaboration tool with  Microsoft Teams
column26: which enhances   Skype's cloud-based communication features and tightly integrates   the service into Office 365.Microsoft Teams. Image source: Microsoft.Meanwhile
column27: networking giant Cisco aggressively bundles   software and security products with its routers
column28: switches
column29: and   unified computing systems. Those bundles include collaboration   tools like Spark
column30: the cloud-based platform for  messages
column31: meetings
column32: and calls it launched in late 2015. Last quarter
column33: Cisco's collaboration revenues rose 4% annually to $1.06 billion   -- making it its third largest business after its  core   businesses of router and switches.But Microsoft and Cisco aren't the only players in the crowded   field of cloud-based collaborative tools.Alphabet's Google has been promoting Hangouts to enterprise customers   over  the past year
column34: Boxhas added collaborative tools on top of its cloud storage   platform
column35: andLogMeInacquiredCitrix's GoToMeeting video conferencing platform for the same purposes.   However
column36: all these challengers notably lack Microsoft and Cisco's   clout in the enterprise market.That's why Amazon believes it can succeedBut like Microsoft and Cisco
column37: Amazon also has leverage -- the   growing importance of AWS to enterprise customers. Amazon likely   believes that by offering Chime as an extension of AWS   (especially with its 30-day free trial) to its enterprise   customer base
column38: it can gain a foothold in the crowded ""unified   communication"" platform market.Amazon previously launched enterprise SaaS products like    WorkSpaces
column39: WorkDocs
column40: and WorkMail
column41: but it hasn't ever   released official growth figures for those products. However
column42: most industry watchers believe that those products are still   dwarfed by comparable solutions from Microsoft and Cisco. This   strongly indicates that AWS' dominance of the PaaS/IaaS markets   doesn't guarantee that Chime will become a Skype or Spark killer   anytime soon. Chime Pro also  costs more than Skype for   Business -- so it doesn't look like Amazon plans to undercut its   way into the market.The key takeawayChime sounds like a logical way for AWS to straddle the   PaaS/IaaS and SaaS markets
column43: but it's easier said than done. The   market for cloud-based unified communication platforms is   incredibly crowded
column44: and it's doubtful that a new service -- even   one bundled with AWS -- can claim a meaningful slice of the   market. However
column45: Amazon investors should still keep an eye out   for future SaaS products to see if the company can eventually   challenge heavyweights like Microsoft and Cisco.10 stocks we like better than MicrosoftWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column46: it can pay to listen. After all
column47: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade

column49: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and Microsoft wasn't one of     them! That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even     better buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of February 6

column1: Why 42% Of Schwab Investors Are On The Prowl For Stocks;2/21/2017;"Investors know what they like
column2: and they liked the November election results and December's interest-rate increase by the Federal Reserve.Those events prompted a jump in investors who have retail accounts withCharles Schwab(SCHW) to declare themselves bullish. In a fourth-quarter survey of those investors
column3: Schwab found 42% of them said they now feel bullish. That was a big jump up from the 34% who felt that way in Q4 a year earlier.makeArticleAd();""As a result of the election
column4: clients saw an increased prospect for a reduction in personal and corporate tax rates
column5: an increased likelihood of spending on infrastructure
column6: and an increased likelihood of a reduction in regulatory burdens for some industries
column7: said Myhanh Hoskin
column8: a Schwab financial consultant
column9: who is based in Seal Beach
column10: Calif. ""The rate increase was a sign of growing strength in the economy.""Amid that widespread perception that the stock market had become increasingly worth investing in
column11: Schwab investors did as much buying as selling in the quarter.The top five U.S. holdings among all Schwab stock mutual funds wereApple(AAPL)
column12: Microsoft(MSFT)
column13: Exxon Mobil(XOM)
column14: Johnson & Johnson(JNJ) andJPMorgan Chase(JPM) as of Feb. 16
column15: according to Morningstar Inc.Apple is up 17% year to date
column16: while Microsoft is up 4%
column17: Exxon is down 10%
column18: Johnson & Johnson is up 3%
column19: and JPMorgan is up 5%.In Schwab's survey of its clients
column20: the general balance between buying and selling bodes well for the market in additional ways. ""It shows there isn't a sense of euphoria
column21: Hoskin said. ""It shows caution by many investors. And that suggests that we're not seeing a market top. That is a good thing. When you have too many people doing the same thing
column22: that tends to be a contrarian indicator.""On the other hand
column23: only 13% of investors said their top concern about the market is that it appears overdue for a correction
column24: suggesting a tone of overconfidence.In contrast
column25: a whopping 88% said they are confident about reaching their financial goals.Allocations And OutlookInvestors had 41.3% of their money in stocks
column26: 21.1% in cash
column27: 18.8% in mutual funds
column28: 11.9% in exchange traded funds
column29: and 6.9% in fixed income.And 21% of those investors said they planned to move more money into stocks during the current first quarter.Stocks were the most popular planned destination for additional allocations.ETFs were the second most popular target asset
column30: with 17% of investors saying that's where they planned to put more money.Mutual funds were the third most popular
column31: with 15% of investors saying they would move money into them in Q1.Investors were more inclined to get help in making investment decisions. The number of clients seeking planning advice rose 10% from a year earlier.RELATED:How This Mutual Fund Is Lighting Up Retirement AccountsAre Fidelity's Recent Stock Buys And Sells Retirement Account Hot Sauce?"

column1: These Are the 10-Most Admired Companies in the World;2/21/2017;"When the public votes for something the results can skew based   on perception
column2: emotion
column3: or sometimes even the desire to mess with   the outcome.That's how a $300 million state-of-the-art British polar   research ship earned the name ""Boaty McBoatface."" The question of   the ship's name was put to an internet vote
column4: and while over 7
column5: 000   names were submitted
column6: according toCNN
column7: ""Boaty McBoatface"" won easily with 124
column8: 109 votes. Votes being   open to the public have given us many questionable
column9: past-their-prime Major League Baseball all-stars
column10: as well as a   whale being tracked by Greenpeace being named Mr. Splashy   Pants.These are all ridiculous votes skewed by a playful public
column11: but   they illustrate that sometimes open voting can produce less-than   reliable results. In creating its annualMost-Admired Companies ListFortune does not leave the question open to a public vote
column12: instead the publication works with its partner Korn Ferry Hay   Group to build a list and then survey executives from the   companies that make the initial cut.makeArticleAd();Image source: Getty.After starting with about 1
column13: 500 candidates (the 1
column14: 000 largest   U.S. companies ranked by revenue
column15: along with non-U.S. companies   in Fortune's Global 500 database that have revenues of $10   billion or more)
column16: the selections are cut down to the   highest-revenue companies in each industry. That leaves 680   companies in 28 countries
column17: and 3
column18: 800 insiders affiliated with   those companies voted on the list.""To determine the best-regarded companies in 51 industries
column19: Korn Ferry Hay Group asked executives
column20: directors
column21: and analysts to   rate enterprises in their own industry on nine criteria
column22: from   investment value and quality of management and products to social   responsibility and ability to attract talent
column23: Fortune explained.   This
column24: as you can see
column25: is not a fan vote
column26: but an insider's   perspective on which companies are most admired by their own   executives
column27: competitors
column28: and people who should actually know.Apple topped the list of most-admired companies. Image     source: Apple.Which companies are the most admired?Apple(NASDAQ: AAPL)Amazon.com(NASDAQ: AMZN)Starbucks(NASDAQ: SBUX)Berkshire Hathaway(NYSE: BRK-A) (NYSE: BRK-B)Disney(NYSE: DIS)Alphabet(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL)General Electric(NYSE: GE)Southwest Airlines(NYSE: LUV)(Tie)Facebook(NASDAQ: FB) /Microsoft(NASDAQ: MSFT)Why is making this list important?While there's no definitive benefit to making a list             like this
column29: there's a clear value in being well-regarded             by industry insiders. The 10 companies above are not             only successful
column30: but those best-placed to judge are             saying they admire them
column31: which should be taken as a             strong positive by shareholders and potential             investors.""Having the respect of your peers and your             competitors is absolutely crucial in business and             almost everywhere else
column32: said Fortune's Assistant             Managing Editor Nicholas Varchaver in avideothat accompanied the list. ""Fortune's World's             Most-Admired Company's List is a list that embodies             precisely that idea.""This isn't a popularity contest or a thrown-off             quick vote. It's a fairly in-depth look at the             companies most-admired by business leaders. Making the             list suggests that these are brands that do things the             right way
column33: companies with solid foundations likely to             not only be around for the long haul
column34: but to continue             to thrive.Being held in this type of high regard by your             competitors may also come with actual advantages.             In-demand workers are likely to want to work for             companies they admire. The brands on this list likely             have an easier time recruiting top talent because they             are thought of this way and in competitive markets like             coders
column35: top technology executives
column36: and sales leaders
column37: that can be the difference between staying on top and             slipping to the back of the pack.10 stocks we like better than AppleWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a               stock tip

column39: the               newsletter they have run for over a decade
