column1: Attunity Ltd. - Big Data Enabler With 84% Upside;2/15/2017;"ByCobiaman:Share Price - $8.00Market Cap - $140 millionEnterprise Value - $131 million2016 Revenue - $54.5 million2017E Revenue - $66.9 million (23% growth)2018E Revenue - $82.5 million (23% growth)EV/2016 Revenue - 2.4xEV/2017E Revenue - 1.9xEV/2018E Revenue - 1.6xAttunity Ltd. (ATTU) provides software to enterprises used to replicate and integrate heterogeneous data sources into a single data lake
column2: which provides the basis for creating data warehouses used for Big Data analysis. The company has been in existence for 20 years
column3: first providing software used to integrate mainframe data and then adding more data sources as they became available in the market. Current data sources include Oracle (Oracle)
column4: Microsoft (MSFT)
column5: SAP (SAP)
column6: Amazon Redshift (AMZN)
column7: Teradata (TDC)
column8: Hadoop
column9: and modern streaming data sources. The company has OEM relationships with Microsoft and Amazon where the companies embed Attunity's solution into their own when data replication is called for.Attunity's revenue grew quickly in the 2014-2015 time frame
column10: with 43% growth in 2014 and 36% growth in 2015. This growth was driven by the need to gather data from various corporate sources and assemble it into data warehouses for analysis. Attunity has a simple but powerful solution that enables a much faster time to analysis for its customers. Attunity is admittedly a smaller player in the market facing bigger competition in Informatica (INFA) and IBM (IBM)
column11: but its solution is robust and has proven successful for its customer base. In 2014 and 2015
column12: Attunity mostly sold into smaller opportunities of $1 million or less with six to nine month sales cycles. By 2016
column13: Attunity's success and increasing name recognition began to attract larger deals with longer sales cycles and different sales team requirements. The company found that some of its sales force was not up to the task and revenue only grew 11% as some large deals slipped during the year.makeArticleAd();Attunity management acknowledged the problem and swapped out 15 of its weaker sales hands and replaced them with more experienced enterprise software sales people. Our work suggests that the company's problem in 2016 was indeed company-specific as the market for its type of software remained robust. Management is convinced that the worst of its sales issues are behind it and this was borne out by a beat and raise December quarter. The company notched sales of $15.6 million versus expectations of $14.3 million. Guidance for 2017 was set at $62-65 million
column14: above consensus of $60 million.We believe that after the company's tough 2016
column15: management is guiding more conservatively for 2017 than it did last year. The market seems to be supportive of growth rates seen in 2014 and 2015
column16: yet neither the management team nor the analysts want to get ahead of themselves at this point. Given the very high gross margins in this business (90%)
column17: there is a ton of operating leverage once revenue gets moving. Management guided to 5-8% operating margins in 2017 but these could go much higher
column18: especially in 2018
column19: if revenue ramps ahead of plan.We value ATTU on an enterprise value to revenue basis based on 2018 numbers. Based on our current 2018 revenue forecast
column20: ATTU trades at 1.6x revenue. We believe it should trade at a substantially higher multiple of 3x. The closest public comp
column21: Talend SA (TLND) trades at 4x 2018 numbers and operates in essentially the same market. At 3x
column22: ATTU would be worth $14.72
column23: or 84% higher than its current trading price.In terms of an endgame
column24: Attunity could grow organically for an extended period in this large market
column25: but it could also present an interesting acquisition target for a larger strategic or financial player. The CEO
column26: Shimon Alon
column27: is the largest shareholder with 8% of the stock
column28: so he has a considerable financial interest in the company's future. Interestingly Microsoft
column29: as an OEM partner
column30: has right of first refusal for any acquisition proposed by another party. This demonstrates the importance of ATTU to Microsoft and presumably to its other OEM partner.Attunity is a bit of a relic in its perpetual license revenue model. While most software companies today are in the Software-as-a-Service ((SAAS)) model
column31: Attunity's customer base demands ownership of its software products
column32: so it sells to them in a perpetual fashion. This business model is a two-edged sword as revenue above/below forecast drops to the bottom line and causes large EPS beats/misses. The main risk for Attunity is that some deals slip out of a quarter causing a revenue and earnings shortfall.See alsoBuffett Fleeing Wal-Mart: Beginning Of The End For The Giant Retailer?on seekingalpha.com"

column1: Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock Could Win Big With ‘Windows Cloud’;2/15/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsNot long ago
column3: Apple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) perfected the art of the big reveal. New Apple product announcements would be shrouded in mystery for weeks
column4: and then the late Steve Jobs would get up on a stage and wow consumers and investors alike with the first-ever iPhone
column5: the first-ever iPad or the first-ever iPod. AAPL stock would get an automatic 10% to 15% bump in the days that followed. CouldMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) have a similarly secretive catalyst in its so-called Windows Cloud product?makeArticleAd();Source:Mike Mozart via Flickr (Modified)Windows Cloud is a mysterious operating system that was revealed via leaks
column6: prompting a ""nothing to share"" response from Microsoft last week.What Is the Windows Cloud?A couple websites posted screen shots of Microsoft's yet-to-be-announced operating system
column7: which would only run Windows Store apps designed to run on both desktop computers and mobile devices. The thought is that the Windows Cloud would supplement
column8: not replace
column9: the company's Windows 10 platform
column10: which is only 18 months old.The Windows Cloud is already being viewed as Microsoft's answer toAlphabet Inc's(NASDAQ:GOOG
column11: NASDAQ:GOOGL) Chrome OS. And by utilizing only its own apps
column12: the platform could have a security advantage over Chrome
column13: which uses non-native apps. That could position Windows 10 as a more appealing option to public institutions like schools
column14: where protecting students' computers from outside apps or games can be difficult.Not much else is known about the Windows Cloud platform. And that's probably how Microsoft likes it. Although Wall Street didn't immediately embrace the top-secret new product by snatching up MSFT stock in droves
column15: the real test will be when the company actually does its big Windows Cloud reveal. Will the platform impress enough to have an AAPL-like effect on Microsoft stock?7 Dividend Stocks Rewarding Shareholders With a RaiseClick to EnlargeFirst
column16: let's look at how MSFT stock has been behaving lately.There was  big spike in MSFT stock last month has since been followed by a sharp retreat; however
column17: the stock is still hovering above its 25- and 50-day moving averages
column18: as well as two-month support in the $62-range.What you don't see is any kind of Microsoft stock price movement in the days since the Windows Cloud leak occurred. That means investors aren't quite sure exactly what the Windows Cloud is and how it could affect MSFT's business
column19: which is why there has been no sudden rush to buy MSFT.If more details leak out
column20: that could potentially move the needle. For now
column21: though
column22: the Windows Cloud remains a relative mystery that likely has Wall Street more confused than excited.MSFT Stock Is Strong Even Without the 'Cloud'In the meantime
column23: Microsoft looks good on its own merits. MSFT stock is up nearly 30% in the last year
column24: nearly 50% in the last two years
column25: still trades at less than 20 times forward earnings estimates
column26: and is expected to grow earnings-per-share by more than 6% this year and more than 9% next year. Sprinkle in a potential game changer in the Windows Cloud
column27: and there's no reason to suspect Microsoft stock is going to suddenly backtrack.On the contrary
column28: the recent mini-dip is a prime buying opportunity
column29: so long as it holds above those short-term moving averages. I'd buy MSFT stock right here
column30: with the hope that a future Windows Cloud unveiling could spark a quick run-up the way Apple's secret product launches used to.As of this writing
column31: Chris Fraley did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace10 Super-Safe Dividend Growth Stocks to Buy Today7 Tech Stocks That Could Implode at Any MinuteThe postMicrosoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock Could Win Big With 'Windows Cloud'appeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Should I Buy Qualcomm
column2: Inc. (QCOM) Stock? 3 Pros
column3: 3 Cons;2/15/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column4: Stock Advice & Trading TipsA few years ago
column5: Qualcomm
column6: Inc.(NASDAQ:QCOM) seemed like a sure bet. Hey
column7: with its CDMA platform
column8: the company was at the heart of the fast-growing mobile market. QCOM stock was essentially a cash machine.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockYet lately the company has been in a slump. Since the summer of 2014
column9: QCOM stock has lost about a third of its value. Of course
column10: the tech industry is chock-full of examples of darlings that fell on hard times.And yes
column11: it can take time to get back into growth mode again. Although
column12: when this happens
column13: the gains can certainly be standout. Just look at the comeback ofMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT)
column14: which is up about 90% during the past couple years.So in the case of Qualcomm stock
column15: is there much upside or should investors remain wary? Let's take a look at three pros and three cons and find out:QCOM Stock ProsMobile Powerhouse:The roots of QCOM go back to the mid-1980s
column16: when seven engineers teamed up to capitalize on the mobile industry. At first they focused on technologies to provide location-based services and messaging for the trucking industry. Then after a few years
column17: QCOM would go big - that is
column18: develop a standard
column19: called CDMA
column20: which would allow for better cellular communications.The business model was to license the technology
column21: which would mean getting aggressive with patents. While success was not immediate
column22: QCOM was determined to make CDMA a critical part of the mobile industry. And of course
column23: this wager ultimately paid off handsomely. For example
column24: just some of QCOM's marquee customers includeApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL)
column25: Samsung Electronics(OTCMKTS:SSNLF)
column26: XiaomiandAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOGL
column27: NASDAQ:GOOG).7 Tech Stocks That Could Implode at Any MinuteMegatrends:The mobile market is expected to grow at a nice pace
column28: which should mean continued demand for Qualcomm offerings. There are currently about 4 billion 3G/4G connections using CMDA systems and this is expected to increase to6.4 billion by 2020. But there should also be substantial benefits from the emergence of 5G technologies. These will allow for better performance for the Internet of Things (IoT)
column29: wearables
column30: autonomous vehicles
column31: virtual reality and even remote medical procedures. While QCOM's R&D investments will be vital for capitalizing on these trends
column32: the company has also ramped upped its deal-making. No doubt
column33: the most notable example of this isthe proposed $38 billion acquisitionofNXP Semiconductors NV(NASDAQ:NXPI). Note that the company is one of the top players in the fast-growing market for self-driving cars.Financials:Granted
column34: QCOM's revenues are not growing at a fast clip. In the latest quarter
column35: there was a4% increase. But then again
column36: the company is fairly mature
column37: so it can be tough to churn out strong growth. Yet QCOM remains a highly profitable business
column38: with fiscal 2016 net income coming to$6.7 billion. The company has also been shareholder friendly. Keep in mind that the current yield is at an attractive 4%.QCOM Stock ConsLitigation:Because of the extensive patent portfolio
column39: QCOM collects a hefty royalty from most sales of smartphones across the globe - even for those devices that do not even include any of the technology! So as should be no surprise
column40: there is much concern about this. The Chinese governmentchallenged QCOM's practices
column41: and the case was eventually settled.But there are other major cases that are in the early stages
column42: such as in South Korea
column43: Europe and the U.S. Oh
column44: and Apple has also launchedseveral major lawsuits against QCOM. The company certainly has tremendous resources to wage a brutal fight. Now as with any legal dispute
column45: it is tough to predict the outcome. But if QCOM ultimately loses
column46: then its core business model will be in jeopardy and this could certainly have horrendous consequences. Keep in mind that the company gets about80% of its pretax profits from licensing.Trump Factor:A key part of the president's agenda is to get tough against China
column47: which Trump considers a currency manipulator. He has also called for stiff tariffs and sanctions. So if there is a trade war
column48: the impact is likely to be adverse to U.S.-based companies that derives substantial revenues from China. Let's face it
column49: the government is cracking down
column50: favoring domestic-based operators over foreign ones. All in all
column51: this poses material risks for QCOM. After all
column52: about57% of revenuescome from China and Hong Kong.Competition:It is intense. Some of the tough rivals includeBroadcom Ltd(NASDAQ:AVGO) andTexas Instruments Incorporated(NASDAQ:TXN). There are also a variety of startups that are gunning for the mobile market. YetIntel Corporation(NASDAQ:INTC) may ultimately be the biggest threat to Qualcomm. Last year
column53: Intel entered an agreement with Apple to supply chips. Before this
column54: QCOM was thesole supplier.In other words
column55: if the legal battles go against the company
column56: Intel may be in a better position to snag more and more business.Bottom Line on QCOM StockWith the recent slide in Qualcomm stock
column57: the valuation is definitely attractive. Consider that the forward price-to-earnings multiple is only about 11.5X.3 Reasons Sears Holdings Corp (SHLD) Stock Is Heading to ZeroBut this may not matter much. For the most part
column58: the impact of the litigation is far from clear - and of course
column59: legal disputes often move at a glacial pace. So in light of this
column60: it's probably best to avoid QCOM stock for now.Tom Taulli runs the InvestorPlace blogIPO Playbookand also has his own free iOS app to estimate your tax refund
column61: which is atPathwayTax.com.Follow him on Twitter at@ttaulli. As of this writing
column62: he did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace5 Utility and Telecom Stocks That Yellen Just Clipped3 Marijuana Stocks That Don't Need U.S. LegalizationThe postShould I Buy Qualcomm

column1: Should I Buy General Motors Company (GM) Stock? 3 Pros
column2: 3 Cons;2/15/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsGeneral Motors Company(NYSE:GM) has certainly made a tremendous comeback since 2008
column4: after having to declare bankruptcy. But there has been little for investors to cheer about. Back in late 2010
column5: the company pulled off its IPO at $33 a share. But now GM stock is at only $37.20.makeArticleAd();Source:William Oliver via Flickr (Modified)To put things into perspective
column6: InvestorPlace.com'sDana Blankenhorn has noted: ""Ever since the 2008 crash and government bailout
column7: General Motors stock has been treated like dirt. No matter what GM does
column8: it can't get out of first gear.""I actually think this is an understatement!Of course
column9: Wall Street can be inexplicable. Yet eventually investors will recognize the value. Hey
column10: this has happened with other stocks that languished for a long time
column11: such asMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT)
column12: right?OK then
column13: so would GM stock be a good play right now? Or should investors hold off? Well
column14: to see
column15: let's take a look at 3 pros and cons on General Motors:3 Pros On GM StockMomentum: For the past two years
column16: General Motors has posted record earnings
column17: net revenues
column18: EBITDA and free cash flows. As forlast year
column19: revenues increased by 9.2% to $166.4 billion and free cash flows came to $6.9 billion
column20: up $4.7 billion from the previous year.7 Tech Stocks That Could Implode at Any MinuteThen again
column21: General Motors has continued to pump out popular cars
column22: with global sales at 10 million (making the company the No. 3 player). A big part of this has been the continued success in North America. But of course
column23: China remains a major factor as well. Last year GM reported3.87 million car sales in the country. Keep in mind that the company sells more in China than any country
column24: including the U.S.But GM has also been judicious with discounts and promotions. For the most part
column25: GM is focused on making sure it makes profits
column26: not just on increasing marketshare.Innovation: One of the hottest categories in technology is the auto industry
column27: as seen with the efforts with operators likeAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOGL
column28: NASDAQ:GOOG)
column29: Apple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) andTesla Inc(NASDAQ:TSLA). The good news is that GM has been ramping up its investments. To this end
column30: the company made a $500 million investment inLyft(a top ride-sharing startup) as well as a $1 billion acquisition ofCruise Automation(a developer of autonomous car systems).Already there are signs that GM is getting traction. For example
column31: the company is testing over 40 autonomous Bolt EVs. But there are also some other innovations
column32: like Maven. This is a mobile platform that allows a person to search and reserve a car and unlock it with a smartphone. According toGM: ""With more than 25 million customers around the world projected to use some form of shared mobility by 2020
column33: Maven is a key element of our strategy to changing ownership models in the automotive industry.""It's important to note that GM has the advantage of leveraging its experience with OnStar
column34: which has been around for two decades. In fact
column35: during this time
column36: the system has logged about1.5 billion customer interactions.Yield & Valuation: GM has certainly been shareholder friendly. Last year
column37: the company returned a hefty $4.8 billion - in a combination of share buybacks and dividends. In fact
column38: GM stock has a nice yield of 4.1%.But the valuation is also attractive. Consider that the forward price-to-earnings ratio is at a lowly 6.1X. True
column39: this may be deserved for a company that is showing declining growth. But as for General Motors
column40: the company expects to increase the top line for 2017.In other words
column41: the stock does look like a great value play right now.3 Cons on GM StockCompetition: The environment is brutal. And with more dealmaking
column42: things will only get more intense. An example of this is the alliance ofRenault SAandNissan Motor Co Ltd (ADR)(OTCMKTS:NSANY) - which also involved the purchase of a large stake inMitsubishi Motors. With this
column43: the companies were able to realize significant cost savings and also hit a global sales number of nearly 10 million last year.Although
column44: accordingFiat SpA(ADR)(OTCMKTS:FIATY) CEO Sergio Marchionne
column45: an automaker may need to reach levels of15 million cars sold annually to be competitive! The reason is that R&D will inevitably increase because of the enormous costs of new technologies.As a result
column46: a company like GM may have little choice but to look for a similar alliance or a transformative acquisition
column47: which would definitely be risky and expensive.Politics: The election of Donald Trump is a wild card for the auto industry. On the one hand
column48: there are potential positives
column49: such as with lower corporate tax rates and less onerous regulations.But these may not offset the issues with Trump's anti-trade bent. If there is a border tax
column50: this could hurt GM because of its substantial production in Mexico. Actually
column51: about 20% of light production is in the country. So if there is a border tax
column52: it could mean higher prices in the U.S. - and yes
column53: lower sales. According to theWall Street Journal: ""Even a more modest border tax under consideration would wipe out a quarter of GM's regional profit.""Global Issues:While the markets in China and North America have been robust for GM
column54: there has been much softness in many other areas
column55: such as in Europe and South America. Granted
column56: there are signs of improvement - but the progress has been fairly slow. For example
column57: in South America
column58: GM has been able to cut back on the losses. But there was still $374 million in red ink last year.As for Europe
column59: the growth has been sluggish across the continent. It also does not help that England has enacted the Brexit
column60: which has caused a lot of uncertainty. As a result
column61: GM lost $300 million in Europe last year and it appears there will not be break-even until 2018. To put things into perspective
column62: the company has not seen a profit in the region since 2000!Bottom Line On GM StockPerhaps the biggest issue facing GM stock is the uncertainty regarding Trump's trade actions. Although
column63: given the importance of the auto industry to the US economy
column64: it does seem reasonable that any moves will likely be taken with care. Besides
column65: General Motors CEO Mary Barra has been savvy to meet with Trump several times already.Gas Up With Chesapeake Energy Corporation (CHK) StockIn the meantime
column66: she is doing a great job managing the core operations of the company. Note that there will be 18 new or refreshed models for five main brands in 2017
column67: up from 13 last year. And yes
column68: Barra has been aggressive with investments in new technologies.OK
column69: so is GM stock a good buy right now? I think so
column70: especially given the rock-bottom valuation.Tom Taulli runs the InvestorPlace blogIPO Playbookand also has his own free iOS app to estimate your tax refund
column71: which is atPathwayTax.com.Follow him on Twitter at@ttaulli. As of this writing
column72: he did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace9 Top Pharmaceutical Stocks to Buy for the Dividends10 Super-Safe Dividend Growth Stocks to Buy TodayThe postShould I Buy General Motors Company (GM) Stock? 3 Pros

Comparing the most recent share price to the 200 day moving average can also be a useful technical analysis technique --learn more about the 200 day moving average ».makeArticleAd();Exchange traded funds (ETFs) trade just like stocks
column14: but instead of ''shares'' investors are actually buying and selling ''units''. These ''units'' can be traded back and forth just like stocks
column15: but can also be created or destroyed to accommodate investor demand. Each week we monitor the week-over-week change in shares outstanding data
column16: to keep a lookout for those ETFs experiencing notable inflows (many new units created) or outflows (many old units destroyed). Creation of new units will mean the underlying holdings of the ETF need to be purchased
column17: while destruction of units involves selling underlying holdings
column18: so large flows can also impact the individual components held within ETFs.Click here to find out which 9 other ETFs had   notable inflows »"

column1: How Citrix Systems Inc. Is Repositioning Itself for Future Growth;2/15/2017;"Desktop virtualization services providerCitrix Systems(NASDAQ: CTXS) has made two big moves this year to shuffle its   product portfolio. First
column2: it acquired application management   company Unidesk to shore up its core offerings. Then
column3: it   completed thespinoffof its GoTo business toLogMeIn.Citrix has made these moves to streamline its product   portfolio
column4: increasing its focus on its enterprise offerings and   becoming a pure-play software-as-a-service company. The spinoff   of GoTo and the acquisition of Unidesk will enable Citrix to ramp   up product development efforts in its two biggest segments by   revenue -- workspace services and delivery networking.Image source: Citrix Systems.makeArticleAd();Falling behind the competitionCitrix revenue has grown at a compound annual rate of 4% over   the past four fiscal years. That's way lower than the 33% annual   growth seen in the virtualization desktop infrastructure market   from 2009 to 2016
column5: according to ABI Research. And that means   Citrix has failed to take advantage of the rapid industry   growth.Evidently
column6: the company needs to reshuffle its offerings
column7: as   there are still a lot of opportunities in the desktop   virtualization market. But to do so
column8: it will need to focus   aggressively on the core businesses that drive the majority of   its top line.Workspace services and delivery networking businesses account   for 72% of total revenue
column9: but they've grown at a very slow pace   in the past four years -- the former at just 2.3% annually and   the latter at 5.2%. To make more significant progress in these   segments
column10: Citrix needs to spend more time and money on product   development to fight off competition from the likes ofVMware.In fact
column11: Citrix has lost its innovative edge in this space to   VMware
column12: which has a better strategy to tap the end market. IDC   ranked VMware as the leader in its magic quadrant chart because   of its acquisition strategy
column13: while Citrix came in second.How Citrix is gearing up for growthCitrix should now be able to scale its core businesses by   giving them more time and R&D dollars. For example
column14: the   company will incorporate Unidesk's layering technology into its   XenDesktop and XenApp services.Layering is an application packaging and management technology   that allows users to separate enterprise-related applications   from the operating system. This feature will enable Citrix   customers to manage the apps on their employees' devices from a   single location
column15: without the need for physical inspection. Since   Unidesk is the only provider of full-stack layering technology
column16: Citrix has made a smart move with this acquisition.Citrix is also partnering withMicrosoft(NASDAQ: MSFT) on the Azure cloud computing platform. Azure is   Citrix' preferred cloud platform for service delivery
column17: which is a   big positive for investors
column18: since Microsoft's cloud service has   seen rapid growth in adoption. In the second quarter of fiscal   2017
column19: Azure revenue increased a massive 93% year over year
column20: which   pushed the revenue from Microsoft's commercial cloud business to   $14 billion.Microsoft is now ranked second in the public cloud afterAmazonWeb Services
column21: and the rapid growth in Azure adoption has led to a   revenue increase at the company's channel partners. Citrix
column22: for   its part
column23: has been enhancing its offerings on Microsoft Azure by   making improvements to its XenDesktop service.Last month
column24: Citrix introduced XenDesktop Essentials for   Microsoft Azure to deliver the Windows 10 software. Using this   service
column25: Azure customers can deliver apps to devices running on   the platform in a secure manner. What's more
column26: Citrix will   continue to enrich its Microsoft Azure offerings by adding more   apps such as Secure Web and Secure Mail.These moves should allow Citrix to attract more clients as it   focuses on offering a comprehensive suite of solutions. In fact
column27: Citrix' product-development moves are bearing fruit already
column28: as   it won 96 new contracts with a value of more than $1 million each   in the fourth quarter. In comparison
column29: there were 81 such   transactions in the year-ago period.In all
column30: Citrix closed 850 contracts in virtual client   computing last quarter itself
column31: up from 800 last year. The company   should be able to sustain this growth in the long run as the   desktop virtualization market gets bigger. For perspective
column32: TechNavio forecasts that the virtual desktop infrastructure   market will grow at an annual pace of 11% from 2017 to 2021.Citrix is gearing up to take advantage of this potential   growth by repositioning its portfolio under the leadership of CEO   Kirill Tatarinov
column33: who was hired last year. Tatarinov's plan for   Citrix is to encourage cloud adoption among enterprises by   reducing complexity and offering enhanced security. The company's   recent moves clearly indicate that the CEO is taking concrete   steps in this direction by streamlining its offerings to power   long-term growth.10 stocks we like better than Citrix SystemsWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column34: it can pay to listen. After all
column35: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade
column36: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column37: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and Citrix Systems wasn't one     of them! That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even     better buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of January 4
column38: 2017Teresa Kersten is an employee of LinkedIn and is a member     of The Motley Fool's Board of Directors. LinkedIn is owned by     Microsoft.Harsh Chauhanhas no position in any stocks mentioned. The Motley Fool owns     shares of and recommends Amazon. The Motley Fool recommends     VMware. The Motley Fool has adisclosure policy."

column1: Warren Buffett's Huge Stake in Apple: What He May See In AAPL;2/15/2017;"Warren Buffett and Berkshire Hathaway (BRK-A
column2: BRK-B) have long been adverse to investing in technology companies. That mantra started to change in 2011
column3: when Berkshire startedinvestingin IBM (IBM).Since then
column4: his investment manager lieutenants
column5: Todd Combs and Ted Weschler
column6: have added to Berkshire's investment portfolio
column7: buying up stakes in technology companies
column8: but never to the size and scope of the IBM investment
column9: which was $11 billion at the time.Now
column10: it looks as if Buffett is doing it again -- this time with Apple (AAPL).makeArticleAd();In a recently released SEC filing
column11: Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway revealed it now owns a sizable stake in the Cupertino
column12: Calif.-based tech giant. At the end of the fourth-quarter
column13: it owned  57.4 million shares
column14: up from 15.2 million shares in a previous filing. At current prices
column15: the stake is worth just over $7 billion
column16: likely making the stake with Buffett's approval
column17: if not done himself.Without putting words into his mouth
column18: the Apple stake is likely similar to IBM in Buffett's eyes
column19: as the venerable iPhone maker is becoming a services company
column20: one with steady revenue coming from dependable subscriptions.Buffett's investment isn't about what technology is the ""next big thing
column21: whether augmented reality is asbigas Apple thinks it will be or whether Apple is really making a car or not. It's pure and simple economics and the attractiveness of the subscription model.In Apple's fiscal first-quarter
column22: itgenerated$7.1 billion in Service revenue
column23: from things like Apple Music
column24: iTunes
column25: the App Store
column26: Apple Pay and more. It's the healthiest portion of Apple's business
column27: one that's growing at 18% year-over-year. CEO Tim Cook hassaidthat Apple's Service business will be the size of a Fortune 500 company sometime this year
column28: indicating that growth isn't slowing down anytime soon.Yes
column29: Apple is still beholden to sales of the iPhone
column30: iPad and the Mac for the majority of its revenue
column31: but the Service business is slowly
column32: but surely
column33: making Apple's revenue smoother and less lumpier from a quarterly perceptive. Visible
column34: growing revenue is worth significantly more than revenue from hardware that acts like a roller coaster
column35: with ups and downs.All investors need to do is look at the earnings multiples for companies like Salesforce.com (CRM)
column36: Microsoft (MSFT) and others to see the positive impact. Companies that have enormous subscription-based revenue
column37: which put off tremendous amounts of operating cash flow in a predictable manner are ultimately more valuable than ones that do not.The company has a goal of doubling its Service revenue by 2020
column38: which is an admittedly large task. But with a user base of over 1 billion active devices
column39: Apple should be able to continue to grow parts of its Service business
column40: like Apple Music and the App Store
column41: as it continues to add new features (namely
column42: TV shows for Apple Music).It's likely we will hear more about Buffett's Apple stake in the days and weeks to come. If we do get commentary from the Oracle of Omaha himself
column43: expect Services and predictable revenue to be a big part of the line of thinking.I know it would be for me."

column1: Why Amazon.com
column2: Inc. (AMZN) Stock Could Fly to $1
column3: 000 in 2017;2/15/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column4: Stock Advice & Trading TipsI've said it before
column5: and I'll say it again:Amazon.com
column6: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN) will take over the world. While the general public obsesses over bad hair and the color orange
column7: I think we face a bigger threat. Amazon's drones and their uncanny way of doing business will fundamentally alter commerce as we know it. Note that I didn't say ""e-commerce."" When you dominate as much as AMZN stock has
column8: your industry no longer requires a qualifying prefix.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockAnybody that doubts that AMZN stock could hit the$1
column9: 000 marksimply needs to peruse theircustomer serviceoptions.If you ever encounter an issue using Amazon
column10: the company will take care of you promptly. Should you need immediate
column11: on the spot assistance
column12: AMZN will take you to a special menu screen. From there
column13: you enter your phone number
column14: and literally within seconds
column15: you will be directed to a company representative.We all know firsthand how frustrating most customer service experiences are. I wouldn't be surprised if some companies deliberately promote poor service just so you won't call them. This of course is just another reason why Amazon stock is so special. They could rest on their laurels. They could kick back and relax
column16: knowing that their status as king is unchallenged. Yet they still have the same hunger that they did back in the late 1990s.Maybe that's why AMZN stock is one of the greatest investments in history
column17: while generational internet peersNetscapeandLycosarehistory.AMZN Stock Teeing Up for An Explosive 2017I can go on a full-blown rant listing all the reasons why every investor should at least consider Amazon stock
column18: but a recent development in the markets really solidified the bullish argument. As you know
column19: AMZN stock didn't do so well when Donald Trump won the general election on Nov. 8. Within a few days
column20: shares had fallen by as much as 9%. This is understandable considering the bitter and contentious political campaign season.10 Super-Safe Dividend Growth Stocks to Buy TodayEven by the end of 2016
column21: AMZN stock was conspicuously lower than its pre-election result close. However
column22: that changed dramatically at the start of the new year. Amazon stock gained some much-needed traction
column23: and shot above the $800-mark. Since breaching that psychological barrier
column24: AMZN has yet to fall back below it. And for January
column25: Amazon saw a robust 9% return.This is important because January is typically not a good time for Amazon stock. Of all the opening months going back to 1998
column26: shares average an extremely pedestrian 0.6%. However
column27: annual returns from 1998 through 2016 average 84%.Such huge discrepancies made me wonder - are there indicators in January that predict how AMZN stock will do later?Click to EnlargeThe answer is a resounding yes.This past January's performance for AMZN stock was the fourth best overall. Of the three other times that Amazon stock posted better opening months
column28: investors later saw average annual returns of 120%. Inclusive of every positive January
column29: AMZN still nets an amazing average annual return of 100%.That's not all. Of the seven years in which Amazon took a loss
column30: six had Januarys that also incurred red ink. The one exception occurred in 2001
column31: during the immediate aftermath of the tech bubble bursting. As long as January holds up
column32: it's highly unlikely to be on the losing end.Amazon's Fundamentals Look Great Too!I don't recommend making a decision on an opportunity on the basis of a sole metric or indicator. The same can be said about statistical data. Even the best-reasoned and logical calculations can't account for every variable. Just like the election of President Trump
column33: there are certain elements of unpredictability that can and will bite you.Another Take - Amazon.com Inc. (AMZN): Is It Time to Start Worrying?However
column34: with AMZN stock
column35: I think investors have a little more buffer to play with thanks to its solid fundamentals. Primarily
column36: Amazon is still innovating. We saw a bit of that during the Super Bowl commercial featuring Amazon Prime Air. It's also a dominant player in cloud computing
column37: frustrating companies likeMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT)
column38: SAP SE (ADR)(NYSE:SAP)
column39: International Business Machines Corp.(NYSE:IBM) andOracle Corporation(NYSE:ORCL).And while I acknowledge it's risky for AMZN stock if it doesn't work out
column40: I like Amazon's venture into groceries. Granted
column41: I'm not crazy on possible rumors that the company is thinking about rolling out2
column42: 000 stores. But if they do this right - particularly in trendy places like their Seattle hometown - AMZN could have another winner on its hands.These underlying drivers provide the confidence for investors willing to bet that Amazon stock will hit quadruple digits. However
column43: what can't be denied is the momentum. When AMZN gets hot
column44: it almost always stays hot. For many
column45: that will be the nudge they need to make their final decision.As of this writing
column46: Josh Enomoto did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace7 Tech Stocks That Could Implode at Any Minute12 Stocks That Will Live and Die by Donald Trump's PenThe postWhy Amazon.com

column1: Apple Inc. (AAPL) Tips its Hand on iPhone 8 Wireless Charging;2/14/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsThere are always plenty of rumors flying around aboutApple Inc.'s(NASDAQ:AAPL) coming iPhone releases. Usually
column3: these are based on information leaked from the AAPL supply chain
column4: but on a very few occasions
column5: Apple itself inadvertently tips its hand.makeArticleAd();Source: Wireless Power ConsortiumThat appears to be the case with the iPhone 8. For several months
column6: the 10th anniversary release has been rumored to feature wireless charging. Thanks to an AAPL move
column7: that now seems like a lock.AAPL Joins the Wireless Power ConsortiumBusiness Insiderbroke the newsthat Apple has joined the Wireless Power Consortium (or WPC). WPC is an industry association that oversees Qi
column8: the most widely used wireless charging technology. That puts AAPL in a group with over 220 other companies that are members
column9: including smartphone rivalSamsung Electronic(OTCMKTS:SSNLF)
column10: whose Galaxy S7 supports Qi wireless charging.Apple does already use Qi wireless charging for the Apple Watch
column11: but the company tweaked its implementation so it's not compatible with standard Qi chargers. And it never bothered to join WPC - until now. That move is a very strong indicator that AAPL is planning to incorporate Qi wireless charging on a larger scale
column12: and that points to the iPhone 8.7 Dividend Stocks for the Retirement You DeserveApple confirmed it had joined WPC (although the confirmation isn't really necessary given that it's nowlisted as a memberon the organization's website)
column13: but it did so by trying to minimize the implications. A company spokesperson toldBusiness Insider:""Apple is an active member of many standards development organizations
column14: as both a leader and contributor. Apple is joining the Wireless Power Consortium to be able to participate and contribute ideas to the open
column15: collaborative development of future wireless charging standards. We look forward to working together with the WPC and its members.""What WPC Membership Means for iPhone 8 Wireless ChargingDespite AAPL's attempt to position its move as business as usual
column16: joining WPC is a strong indication that rumors about the iPhone 8 offering wireless charging have been on the mark. However
column17: Qi isn't the advanced
column18: over-the-air wireless charging many people had been hoping AAPL would implement.Instead
column19: Qi - which has been in use since 2011- uses inductive charging. Rather than plugging an iPhone into a charger with a Lightning cable
column20: it would be placed on a charge pad. So there's still a recharger that requires physical contact
column21: and that recharger is still plugged into the wall.And it seems very plausible that wireless charging would be supported by the iPhone 8
column22: but only offered as an extra at an additional cost. There has already been speculation that AAPL would useoptional wireless chargingto further drive up the amount consumers spend on a new iPhone purchase. In this case
column23: they would have to add an Apple wireless charger to the tab (somethingSamsung charges an additional $49.99 forwith the Galaxy S7).Couldn't iPhone 8 buyers simply buy one of the many Qi charge pads already on the market? They would undoubtedly be less expensive than Apple's version.Well
column24: there's also a good chance that AAPL could pull a move like it did with the Apple Watch
column25: tweaking its Qi implementation slightly so someone buying the new iPhone couldn't simply use a standard third-party Qi charger.Will Qi Wireless Charging Make the iPhone 8 More Desirable?IHS Technology noted thepopularity of wireless charging with consumers
column26: suggesting it was a feature AAPL couldn't ignore with the iPhone 8:""The success of wireless charging adoption from Apple's competitors is something that Apple can no longer ignore. IHS Technology consumer survey data shows over 90% of consumers want wireless charging on their next device.""Consumers may be expecting somethingmorefrom the iPhone 8
column27: though.Qi wireless charging is mainstream now
column28: and there were hopes Apple would adopttruewireless charging
column29: going with over-the-air technology instead of following the pack. Many smartphone buyers skip Qi charging altogether (the charge pad can actually be larger and more cumbersome than a plug-in charger)
column30: especially if it's an additional cost.The ability to set a device on furniture or other accessories like speaker systems ordesk lamps that have integrated QI charge padsis cool
column31: but if AAPL chooses to go with a non-standard implementation
column32: those probably wouldn't work with the iPhone 8.Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock Is on Cloud 9It may end up that wireless charging on the iPhone 8 is essentially a marketing move - a way to make extra money from those who care
column33: and a bullet point on the features list that keeps the new iPhone on par with the competition. Or maybe AAPL engineers will pull off something unexpected.Either way
column34: now that Apple has officially joined the WPC
column35: you can expect Qi wireless charging on the iPhone 8.As of this writing
column36: Brad Moon did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace9 Top Pharmaceutical Stocks to Buy for the Dividends10 Super-Safe Dividend Growth Stocks to Buy TodayThe postApple Inc. (AAPL) Tips its Hand on iPhone 8 Wireless Chargingappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock Is on Cloud 9;2/14/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsSome market prognosticators may tell you it's high time to get your head out of the clouds. But ifMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) is part of the conversation
column3: cloud-chasing with a modified
column4: hedged position in Microsoft stock has rarely looked this good.makeArticleAd();Source:Mike Mozart via Flickr (Modified)It has been a few months since my last writing aboutMicrosoft stock's bullish prospectsboth off and on the price chart. Gains of around 8% in shares have been good
column5: though not entirely impressive given theS&P 500's9% andNasdaq's8.5% increases over the same period.But this strategist continues to believe MSFT stock has only just begun to scratch the surface for investors when it comes to delivering shareholder value beyond healthy stock buybacks
column6: dividend increases and the like.Not that those factors should be dismissed
column7: but the real narrative in Microsoft stock worth paying attention to is the company's continued strong execution in growth areas outside of the PC market.For one
column8: Microsoft's commercial cloud business continues to support better-than-expected top- and bottom-line results at the corporate confessional each quarter. In fact
column9: with double-digit revenue growth and annual sales of $20 billion expected by next summer
column10: Microsoft's cloud is big business.9 Top Pharmaceutical Stocks to Buy for the DividendsAnd we're not alone in thinking Microsoft's cloud acumen is not being fully appreciated.CNBC'sJames Cramer said as much Mondaywhen discussing the company as far more than a software and PC shop and saying it's time to take notice of Microsoft's cloud business.Other investors think there'smuch
column11: much more to Microsoftunder the driven stewardship of CEO Satya Nadella as well. His ""Mobile First

column1: Bitcoin Meets Starbucks: iPayYou's Bold Bet Goes Live;2/14/2017;"By Michael ScottWith 2017 in full motion
column2: Bitcoin’s price climb to the mid-$900 range and beyond continues to raise eyebrows. For many
column3: this milestone is just one signal of cryptocurrency’s growing repute as a legitimate store of investment value.Little attention
column4: however
column5: has been given to Bitcoin’s utility as a day-to-day method of payment. Practical use cases involving consumer adoption
column6: in fact
column7: are rarely talked about. This is despite the well-documented cost
column8: efficiency and security advantages of the Bitcoin payment network for both consumers and businesses alike.makeArticleAd();A new U.S.-based startup company aims to change this through an effort to accelerate the everyday use of Bitcoin for consumers worldwide. Launched in May of 2016
column9: iPayYouis an online platform and digital wallet that promotes the viability of Bitcoin as a method of payment. It immediately saw early success through a unique feature known as Pay-by-Twitter — the first online platform site for peer-to-peer payments over Twitter (TWTR).Now in a bold bet sure to deliver a caffeine jolt to the retail sector
column10: iPayYou this past December introduced Bitcoin Direct to Starbucks (SBUX)
column11: a new way for coffee aficionados to pay for those espressos and other drinks through the use of Bitcoin.This feature allows users to seamlessly transfer bitcoins from their existing iPayYou Bitcoin wallet to their Starbucks mobile app. They select how much (in USD) they wish to transfer before prompting Bitcoin Direct to Starbucks to automatically withdraw that amount from their iPayYou account. Once deposited into that person’s Starbucks account
column12: purchases can be made via the mobile app at any Starbucks location.This latest addition to the iPayYou platform comes on the heels of iPayYou’s recent gift card integration
column13: allowing Bitcoin to be used for instant gift card purchases from retailers like Amazon (AMZN)
column14: Best Buy (BBY) and iTunes (AAPL).These creative payment applications are the mastermind of founder and CEO Gene Kavner
column15: former Worldwide Director of Amazon Associates. With extensive experience in the world of commerce
column16: including prominent positions at Microsoft (MSFT) and Expedia (EXPE)
column17: Kavner developed iPayYou with the intention of establishing a easy-to-use Bitcoin wallet with simple features and low costs.Regarding the strategic collaboration with Starbucks
column18: Kavner remarks: “The broader significance of this move is that iPayYou is able to encourage Bitcoins to be spent in ways that its creators intended — for everyday purchases from popular merchants without needing a bank account to do so. This arrangement with Starbucks allows coffee lovers to replenish their primary Starbucks account with their Bitcoin holdings.  We’ve accomplished this feat without Starbucks having to directly accept Bitcoin. Our hope is that through this demonstration Starbucks will soon begin accepting Bitcoin directly
column19: sooner rather than later.”In terms of advantages for Starbucks regulars
column20: Kavner continues: “We intend to show that Bitcoin is not only a great investment but is also becoming quite useful in everyday life. Because so many of us are addicted to coffee
column21: being able to use Bitcoin to purchase anything at Starbucks is an enormous win for everyday consumers. And Starbucks will benefit too due to the amount of Bitcoin users who will now become customers.”Over time
column22: Kavner believes that initiatives like this will encourage merchant acceptance of Bitcoin. “Probably the most important metric that every merchant looks at when deciding what methods of payment to accept is how many new customers will it help attract. A key reason for the slow merchant adoption of Bitcoin has been the relatively limited amount of people who wanted to use Bitcoin for POS transactions. Now
column23: I believe that more and more will.”In terms of what’s next for Bitcoin Direct for 2017 and beyond
column24: Kavner is optimistic: “We’re going to continue to make Bitcoin easier
column25: safer and more useful over 2017 and beyond. We are planning on expanding to enable more merchant adoption as well as adding many features that every Bitcoin wallet should have. At the same time
column26: we’ll make Bitcoin simple to understand
column27: not just to those of us who know and love Bitcoin already but for the everyday consumer who may not even know what Bitcoin is. We’ll continue to innovate to make Bitcoin easier and more useful for everyone.”"

column1: 3 Stocks That Turned $10
column2: 000 Into at Least $3.68 Million;2/13/2017;"The dream of every investor is to purchase the nextAppleorJohnson & Johnsonas a small-cap stock and watch it bloom into one of the leading   companies within its industry. But companies that have the   ability and opportunity to grow their valuations from the   millions into megacap territory are quite rare.Furthermore
column3: even when investors find one of these profit   powerhouses
column4: they often have a hard time sitting still for the   long period of time required to let their investment thesis fully   pan out. Information is now constantly at our fingertips
column5: and   with the rise of the internet and trading algorithms
column6: holding   time frames have seemingly been on the decline for years.Image source: Getty Images.makeArticleAd();However
column7: there are a select few companies that have turned   modest nest eggs into veritable treasure chests over the past 30   years or so. Had you invested $10
column8: 000 in any of the following   three companies in May 1986
column9: you'd have at least $3.68 million   today. Best of all
column10: one of them is a company I can almost   guarantee you've never heard of before.Balchem36
column11: 784% return
column12: equating to $3.68 million from a $10
column13: 000       investment.If I asked for a show of hands to see how many investors had   heard ofBalchem(NASDAQ: BCPC) before
column14: chances are
column15: not too many hands would be   raised. Balchem
column16: which is still just a midcap company today even   after its 36
column17: 784% romp higher
column18: provides animal nutrition   products
column19: food flavorings
column20: and specialty ingredients to the   industrial and pharmaceutical industry.What has allowed Balchem to thrive isn't so much its business   diversity as its innovation (and a little bit of luck). As the   story wastold byThe Wall Street Journallast year
column21: Balchem was nearing a point of reckoning in the   mid-to-late 1990s
column22: when it was losing money hand-over-fist on a   new nutrient coating. Thankfully
column23: management and Balchem workers   were able to double production without raising costs
column24: and found   ancillary revenue channels for existing products.Image source: Balchem.An example the article gave was choline salts
column25: which are   traditionally developed for food supplement purposes. A staff   engineer at Balchem realized that choline salts could also   stabilize clay deposits. That eventually opened a new revenue   channel for the company
column26: as fracking for oil and gas requires the   stabilization of clay deposits. Interestingly
column27: though
column28: fracking   didn't become a major technology in the energy sector until years   after the engineer's discovery. These innovative pursuits have   expanded Balchem's product portfolio organically
column29: allowing it to   wildly outpace theS&P 500.Today
column30: Balchem looks to be fairly valued
column31: if not a bit pricey;   but I guess that's to be expected after a nearly 37
column32: 000% run!   Valued at 31 times next year's estimated profit per share
column33: Balchem would have to produce a major surge in animal and human   nutrition and health sales to reasonably support a higher   valuation.Monster Beverage50
column34: 843% return
column35: equating to $5.09 million from a $10
column36: 000       investment.Innovation was also the driving force forMonster Beverage(NASDAQ: MNST)
column37: which has delivered nearly 51
column38: 000% gains since   May 1986. Monster's claim to fame are its energy drinks
column39: which   have only grown in popularity over the years with young   adults.Over the past 12 months
column40: Monster has generated nearly $3   billion in revenue
column41: practically all of which was tied to its   namesake brand of energy drinks. By comparison
column43: it   generated only $606 million in full-year sales. This isn't to say   the company hasn't had its hiccups. In 2012
column44: Monster was the   subject of a Food and Drug Administration investigation into the   deaths of five people who'd consumed its energy drinks
column45: which   quelled sales for a short period. However
column46: as you can clearly see   based on its latest sales numbers
column47: those health safety issues   have been put in the rear view mirror.Image source: Monster Energy.In recent years
column48: Monster's biggest catalyst has been a   partnership withCoca-Cola(NYSE: KO) . Under the agreement
column49: Coca-Cola agreed to contribute   its energy drink portfolio to Monster
column50: and Monster in turn sent   its non-energy product portfolio to Coca-Cola. The deal also   allowed Coca-Cola to take a 16.7% equity investment in Monster   Beverage
column51: giving it access to the fast-growing energy drink   market. Finally
column52: distribution agreements between the two   companies were amended
column53: and since 2014 Monster's gross margin has   leaped from 54.4% to 62.8% on a trailing 12-month basis. The   result was a better-than-doubling of its net income over the past   three years for Monster.Monster Beverage isn't cheap after its run higher -- its   shares now sell for 30 times forward earnings -- but unlike   Balchem
column54: it has the potential for double-digit percentage sales   and profit growth for years to come. Though I'd expect the gains   to be substantially more modest
column55: Monster remains an intriguing   investment opportunity.Microsoft64
column56: 633% return
column57: equating to $6.47 million from a $10
column58: 000       investment.Last
column59: but not least
column60: we have the operating system kingpin
column61: Microsoft(NASDAQ: MSFT)
column62: which has generated a better than 64
column63: 600% return   over the past 30 years and change.It's certainly not hard to understand why Microsoft has been   so dominant. Despite numerous efforts during the emergence of   desktop and laptop computers to unseat it as the dominant   operating system provider
column64: Microsoft dug in and ceded very   little
column65: if any
column66: market share. Today
column67: Microsoft's Windows OS is so   dominant in the PC market
column68: it's almost frightening.Image source: Microsoft.According to NetMarketShare.com
column69: as of January 2017
column70: Windows 7   and Windows 10 combined accounted for 72.5% of all desktop   operating systems. Group the less-popular XP
column73: Vista
column74: and   NT together
column75: and they kick in nearly another 19%. That gives   Microsoft a desktop OS market share of about 91.5%
column76: and as you   might have surmised -- correctly -- a lot of pricing power comes   with a veritable monopoly on desktop operating systems.But Microsoft hasn't been without its faults. Its Achilles'   heel
column77: perhaps
column78: has been its acquisitions; its big purchases have   included some notable duds throughout the years. For example
column79: Microsoft's acquisition ofNokia's handset business and aQuantive were both disasters. Its   $8.5 billion acquisition of Skype has netted the network a lot of   customer usage
column80: but very little in the way of financial   benefits.Nonetheless
column81: Microsoft remains a dominant force in PC   operating systems
column82: is regularly generating $23 billion to $26   billion in annual free cash flow thanks to its substantial   operating margin
column83: and recently acquired LinkedIn
column84: which will   hopefully open new channels of revenue for the company. With   annual EPS growth throughout the remainder of the decade forecast   to be roughly 10%
column85: Microsoft may still offer modest upside to   patient investors.10 stocks we like better than MicrosoftWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column87: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade

column1: Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock Can Double Your Money;2/13/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) has been a premier tech giant for decades. Sure
column3: it has had its fair share of flubs - many people still cringe at the failure that was the Zune - but overall
column4: management is solid
column5: and MSFT stock isn't too dependent on any one individual.makeArticleAd();Source:Johannes Marliem Via FlickrBill Gates has created a diversified cash cow system that diffuses impacts of potential errors.Technically
column6: the daily short-term chart suggests that more upside in MSFT stock price is likely. But I have to acknowledge that the longer-term weekly chart is more pessimistic than the daily chart.Click to EnlargeSo the theme for today's trade idea? ""Don't overstay your welcome.""How to Trade MSFT Stock HereThe bet:Buy the Mar $65/$67.50 debit call spread for 60 cents per contract to open. This is the maximum I can lose.The 10 Best Stocks to Buy for 2017: The Experts' PicksBuying a spread near the money always statistically carries a coin-flip odds structure for winning. But on the flip side (pun intended)
column7: as soon as Microsoft stock rallies
column8: I start gaining. Furthermore
column9: if the rally retests recent highs
column10: I stand to double my money.To mitigate my risk
column11: I can sell downside premium against MSFT stock to lower my out-of-pocket expense. I only do this in stocks that I believe have a solid base that most buyers would be willing to buy on dips.The hedge (optional):Sell the MSFT Oct $52.50 put for $1.10 to open.By selling a naked put
column12: I commit to buying Microsoft stock at the sold strike. Statistically
column13: the 18% buffer from current price gives me a 90% theoretical chance of success. If MSFT stock falls through my strike sold before mid-October
column14: I would be put the stock at $52.50 per share. If so
column15: anything below $51.40 would accrue losses for me.I can restructure the hedge trade to better suit more conservative traders.The twist (optional):Sell the MSFT Oct $55/$52.50 credit put spread. This is also a bullish trade for which I collect 45 cents per contract to open. This has a slightly smaller buffer from current price but not too aggressively so. If successful
column16: this trade would yield 20% on money risked.If the MSFT stock price stays above my sold put strikes
column17: then any premium I recapture by selling the debit calls spread would be pure profit. This means I don't need Microsoft to rally for me to profit. I simply need it to stay above my sold downside risk.Why Facebook Inc (FB) Stock Holders Shouldn't Sweat SnapchatI am not required to hold my Microsoft options open through expiration. I can close any of them for partial gains or losses at any time.Nicolas Chahine is the managing director ofSellSpreads.com. As of this writing
column18: he did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities. You can follow him on Twitter at@racernicand stocktwits at@racernic.More From InvestorPlaceNvidia Corporation (NVDA) Stock Has Become a Short TargetGo Long Advanced Micro Devices
column19: Inc. (AMD) Stock ... With Insurance!7 Marvelous Mid-Cap Stocks to Buy for the Best of All WorldsThe postMicrosoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock Can Double Your Moneyappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Console Wars 2017: Will Sony or Microsoft Win?;2/10/2017;"Sony PlayStation controller. Image source: Pixabay.Sony(NYSE: SNE) andMicrosoft(NASDAQ: MSFT) have been battling each other in the gaming   industry for 16 years. Gaming is far more important to the   livelihood of Sony than Microsoft
column2: and therefore the stakes are   much higher for Sony.makeArticleAd();The console war between Sony's PlayStation (PS) and   Microsoft's Xbox has grown more heated with time. The first round   was no contest. Sony's PS2 -- launched in 2000 -- outsold the   original Xbox by more than 100 million units. In the next cycle
column3: the PS3 barely edged out the Xbox 360. So far in the current   cycle
column4: Sony's PS4 has dominated
column5: selling over 50 million units   compared to Microsoft Xbox One's 28 million.But Microsoft is planning a major counterattackThings started going Microsoft's way in 2016
column6: when Xbox One   began to outsell PS4. To a degree
column7: this may stem from some games   receiving higher ratings on Xbox One than PS4.However
column8: Microsoft's momentum was halted in its tracks in the   fall when Sony released two new versions of its console -- the   PS4 Slim and PS4 Pro. The Slim is cheaper than the launch version   and is more compact
column9: while the PS4 Pro features enhanced   processing power in order to display games in 4K resolution.The console landscape will change again later this year when   Microsoft launches a new console codenamed ""Scorpio."" Reports   show Scorpio's technology to be far superior to PS4 Pro. A   developer for some Microsoft exclusive games has even claimed   that Scorpio is not an intermediate upgrade like Sony's console   and instead Scorpio is taking a much bigger leap and is a   full-blown
column10: next-generation console.How can Sony defend its lead?Typically
column11: there is not much that differentiates competing   consoles. If you set up a PS4 and Xbox One on two TVs side by   side
column12: you would be hard pressed to notice a difference while   viewing the same game.The way console makers differentiate themselves is mainly   through exclusive first-party games. Arguably the three best   franchises that are exclusive to Microsoft's Xbox areHalo
column13: Forza
column14: andGears of War. However
column15: Sony's exclusive game portfolio is generally   considered more attractive than Microsoft's; this is possibly   partly why Microsoft's Xbox has never managed to outsell   PlayStation through an entire cycle.A console is a hit or flop based on the breadth of quality   games available for it. With this in mind
column16: there are several   titles Sony has in development for release in 2017 that could   keep gamers choosing PlayStation over Xbox.Three in particular areHorizon Zero Dawn
column17: Gran Turismo Sport
column18: and a new installment in the popularUnchartedseries. There's a long list of others
column19: but these three games   could each be contenders for Game of the Year.In contrast
column20: Microsoft doesn't have anything in its arsenal to   match this lineup. In fact
column21: one of Microsoft's most anticipated   exclusive games in development was recently canceled. It might   have been better planning to releaseGears of War 4(released this past fall) in fall 2017 to give Microsoft a   quality exclusive game to show off Scorpio's graphical prowess.   In the end
column22: I wouldn't put it past Sony to discount the PS4 Pro   around the time of Scorpio's launch.So this begs the question: What kind of financial impact can a   hit game provide Sony?Let's take a look atUncharted 4
column23: a Sony exclusive
column24: which was released in May 2016 and was one of   the year's top-rated games. For the quarter it was released
column25: Unchartedhelped Sony's gaming segment drive year-over-year revenue growth   of 14.5%
column26: and operating income more than doubled to 44 billion   Japanese yen.This isn't to say that the games releasing this year will each   turn out likeUncharted 4. We can't know for certain how well each game will sell. But   Sony appears to have several exclusive titles scheduled for 2017   that are designed to sell more PlayStations and provide a buffer   against the invasion from Microsoft's Project Scorpio.Gaming is in Sony's DNAWith other Sony divisions struggling
column27: Sony is highly dependent   on its PlayStation business. It's crucial that Sony invest in a   steady stream of high-quality exclusive games
column28: and this involves   high risk. To a great extent
column29: Sony's past success at beating   Microsoft
column30: in both game development and console sales
column31: can be   explained by Sony's dependence on gaming.Therefore
column32: my bet is Sony will hold its own in the ongoing   console wars.10 stocks we like better than SonyWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column33: it can pay to listen. After all
column34: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade
column35: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column36: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and Sony wasn't one of them!     That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even better     buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of January 4
column37: 2017Teresa Kersten is an employee of LinkedIn and is a member     of The Motley Fool's Board of Directors. LinkedIn is owned by     Microsoft.John Ballardhas no position in any stocks mentioned. The Motley Fool has no     position in any of the stocks mentioned. The Motley Fool has adisclosure policy."

column1: The Next iPhone Wants to Look Into Your Eyes;2/10/2017;"Expectations for the 2017 iPhone are running high
column2: given the   fact that it will be the 10th-generation ofApple's(NASDAQ: AAPL) most important product. As always
column3: a steady   stream of supply-chain leaks are stoking speculation as to what   features the Mac maker may or may not include. The most expensive   feature-packed model may even set customers backover $1
column4: 000. Today's rumor comes from the notoriously hit-or-missDigiTimes
column5: which says that in addition to an OLED display and wireless   charging
column6: the device will also include iris-scanning   technology.A boulder of saltAs always
column7: investors should treat any and all iPhone rumors   with a healthy bit of skepticism. That's especially true since   we've heard similar reports before. Apple first started exploring   iris-scanning technology back in 2014
column8: andDigiTimessaid in July 2016 that the iris-scanning feature wouldn't be   included until the 2018 iPhone. A month later
column9: the same outlet   said 2017 would be the year Apple would debut the technology   after placing orders for iris-recognition chips with Taiwan-based   Xintec.Separately
column10: there are conflicting reports that Apple may   instead prefer to use some type of facial recognition system
column11: as   Apple has filed numerous patents around bio-recognition   methods.makeArticleAd();Biometrics are all the rage right nowIt makes sense that Apple is exploring iris-recognition   technology; what's less clear is the timing of when Apple will   pull the trigger. Iris recognition would be a strong complement   to Touch ID
column12: adding another layer of biometric security. Iris   scanning is even more secure than fingerprint scanning since it's   harder to fake. You may remember when researchers cracked Touch   ID shortly after the feature's launch in 2013
column13: although it still   stands that Touch ID is still vastly superior to alpha-numeric   passwords.Imagine Apple Pay using iris recognition. Image source:     Apple.Beyond logging in
column14: it's also easy to imagine how Apple may   wish to add another layer of biometric security to Apple Pay
column15: making the company's mobile payment service even more secure.Everybody's doing itThis is an area rivals have already been exploring.Microsoft(NASDAQ: MSFT) included an iris scanner and Windows Hello
column16: Microsoft's biometric login functionality
column17: in 2015's Lumia 950   and 950 XL. The software giant has yet to bring iris recognition   to other Windows Hello-enabled devices
column18: although many Windows 10   PCs can use facial recognition technology.Samsung's Galaxy Note 7 from last year also included an iris scanner
column19: which in addition to its propensity to spontaneously combust was   a differentiating feature from Samsung's other flagship devices   from 2016 like the Galaxy S7 or S7 Edge. While the South Korean   company's initial efforts to popularize iris-scanning technology   went down in literal flames
column20: the forthcoming Galaxy S8 is   expected to feature an iris scanner. Samsung also launches its   Galaxy flagships in the spring
column21: and the S8 is expected to be   unveiled in March ahead of an April launch.Apple cares little about being the first -- it just wants to   be the best. If it can implement iris scanning in a more seamless   and integrated way than rivals
column22: it could accelerate the   popularization of biometric security better than anyone else.10 stocks we like better than AppleWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column23: it can pay to listen. After all
column24: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade
column25: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column26: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and Apple wasn't one of them!     That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even better     buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of February 6
column27: 2017Teresa Kersten is an employee of LinkedIn and is a member     of The Motley Fool's Board of Directors. LinkedIn is owned by     Microsoft.Evan Niu
column28: CFAowns shares of Apple. The Motley Fool owns shares of and     recommends Apple. The Motley Fool has the following options:     long January 2018 $90 calls on Apple and short January 2018 $95     calls on Apple. The Motley Fool has adisclosure policy."

column1: 4 Technology Stocks Well Poised to Beat Earnings Estimates;2/10/2017;"The fourth-quarter earnings season has been reasonably well for 13 out of 16 Zacks categorized sectors
column2: with overall earnings up +5.8% from the same period last year on +4.5% higher revenues. As per the latest ZacksEarnings Outlook
column3: this growth rate is much better than +2.8% earnings growth on +2.0% revenue growth for this same group of companies in the third quarter.makeArticleAd();Notably
column4: 319 S&P 500 members (76.3% of the index's total membership) have already reported their results. Of this
column5: 69.6% stocks have beat earnings estimates and 54.5% have come ahead of revenue expectations. However
column6: positive surprises are tracking below the 75.5% and 58.9% earnings and revenue beat percentages for this same group of companies in the preceding quarter
column7: respectively.Overall
column8: earnings are now anticipated to grow +7.3% on +3.9% higher revenues on a year-over-year basis. The anticipated figures mark a solid improvement over the third quarter earnings growth of 3.7% on the back of 2.2% higher revenues. Moreover
column9: the earnings growth figure is the highest since the fourth quarter of 2014.Technology: A Standout Sector in Q4Technology has been one of the standout sectors in the fourth quarter. Almost 86.1% of the sector's total market capitalization has already reported. Total earnings for these companies are up +7.8% from the same period last year on +6.0% higher revenues
column10: with 70.5% beating EPS estimates and 75% beating revenue estimates.The strong growth reflected solid performance from industry giants like Intel Corp
column11: Microsoft(MSFT) andAlphabet(GOOGL). Contrary to the third quarter
column12: Apple's(AAPL) big earnings beat also helped results this time.The rapid adoption of cloud was the common growth factor for these companies. Additionally
column13: growing acceptance of artificial intelligence (AI) technology
column14: personal assistants and Internet of Things (IoT) drove overall results.We believe the rapid adoption of cloud-based technologies will be the key catalyst going ahead. Per IDC
column15: IT spending on cloud infrastructure - servers
column16: enterprise storage
column17: and Ethernet switches for the enterprise private cloud and co-location services - will increase 18.2% in 2017 to $44.2 billion. The growth rate is particularly noticeable when compared with spending on traditional IT
column18: which is expected to decline 3.3% in 2017.How to Make the Right Pick?With the existence of a number of industry players

It provides the percentage difference between the Most Accurate estimate and the Zacks Consensus Estimate.Our research shows that for stocks with this combination

column1: SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY): The Quick Guide to SPY;2/10/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsThe U.S. exchange-traded fund (ETF) business is more than two decades old
column3: and there are currently more than 2
column4: 000 exchange-traded products listed in U.S. But even with the industry's exponential growth
column5: the king of U.S. ETFs remains theSPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust(NYSEARCA:SPY).makeAd('4'
column7: 'mktsnews'
column8: 'vanguard'
column10: '');In recent years
column11: ETFshave become an important part of everyday trading on U.S. exchanges
column12: with some well-known funds seeing turnover rise to the point that many of the most heavily traded securities in the U.S. are ETFs.The SPY ETF embodies the rising importance of these funds
column13: as highlighted by average daily volume of over 84 million shares. By comparison
column14: Apple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) - the largest holding in traditional cap-weighted S&P 500 ETFs like SPY - has average daily turnover of about 31.3 million shares.SPY's popularity among institutional investors and traders helps bolster the ETF's liquidity. In fact
column15: traders of all stripes should not expect to see the S&P 500 ETF's bid/ask spread deviate beyond a penny. For example
column16: SPDR's S&P 500 tracker currently trades around $229 per share
column17: so investors should expect their brokers to quote $229.01 on the offer and $229 on the bid.About the SPY ETFAs its name implies
column18: SPY tracks the S&P 500
column19: which is probably the most widely equity index in the world. SPY's primary competitors are theiShares Core S&P 500 ETF(NYSEARCA:IVV) and theVanguard S&P 500 ETF(NYSEARCA:VOO)
column20: both of which feature lower expense ratios than SPY. The SPDR S&P 500 charges 0.0945% per year
column21: or about $9.45 on a $10
column22: 000 stake. IVV charges just 0.04% a year.The 10 Best Low-Cost Index Funds to Buy NowSPY's holdings are weighted by market value
column23: meaning the U.S. company with the biggest market capitalization will be the ETF's largest holding and so on down the line. Apple isSPY's top holdingfollowed byMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT). Technology is the largest sector allocation in the S&P 500 at 21.4% followed by financial services at 14.5%.Underscoring the importance of technology stocks to the SPY ETF and the U.S. equity market in general
column24: the weights of consumer staples
column25: energy
column26: materials and utilities
column27: the S&P 500's sixth through ninth sector weights
column28: would need to be combined to arrive at a number larger than technology's weight.Another important note about SPY is its structure. While it is commonly referred to as an ETF
column29: this fund actually is structured as a unit investment trust (UIT). An advantage of the UIT structure for SPY is that it limits tracking error
column30: or how much the fund deviates from the performance of the S&P 500. The primary disadvantage is that itsdividends cannot be reinvestedas they can be in IVV or VOO.As of this writing
column31: Todd Shriber was long VOO.More From InvestorPlaceThe 10 Best ETFs on the PlanetThe 7 Most Popular Vanguard Funds for 401k PlansThe postSPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY): The Quick Guide to SPYappeared first onInvestorPlace."
