column1: Why Fitbit Inc (FIT) Needs to Wise Up Before It Can Win Again;2/9/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsFitbit Inc(NYSE:FIT) may be great to improve your health
column3: but as for Fitbit stock
column4: it has been lethal for investors. During the last 12 months
column5: FIT stock is off a horrendous 60%. This is certainly another case study of how high-profile IPOs can quickly come undone.makeArticleAd();Source:Via FitbitBut what about the future? Is there hope for Fitbit stock? Might there be a value play here?As I've written various times for InvestorPlace
column6: it's probably not a good idea to be hopeful. For example
column7: FIT is a company that develops a product that really is not a must-have. According to a recent study fromGartner
column8: the abandonment rate on fitness trackers is 30%. The most common reasons for this include: users either get bored or the device breaks!The conclusion from the report: ""Dropout from device usage is a serious problem for the industry. The abandonment rate is quite high relative to the usage rate. To offer a compelling enough value proposition
column9: the uses for wearable devices need to be distinct from what smartphones typically provide. Wearables makers need to engage users with incentives and gamification.""The Other Problems for FIT StockBut this is definitely not the only major issue with Fitbit stock. Let's face it
column10: the competitive environment remains intense. The company must fight against tough rivals likeGarmin Ltd.(NASDAQ:GRMN)
column11: Samsung(OTCMKTS:SSNLF) andMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT). Although
column12: the biggest threat isApple Inc.'s(NASDAQ:AAPL) Apple Watch
column13: which is still in the early phases.7 Stocks That Will Drop by 10% or More This QuarterIn light of all this
column14: is it any wonder that Wall Street is concerned with FIT stock? Of course not.More importantly
column15: the company is already reporting major problems
column16: as seen with the latest warning on fourth-quarter earnings. Fitbit's guidance calls for a loss of 51 cents to 56 cents a share on revenues of $572 million to $580 million. By comparison
column17: the prior forecast was for earnings of 14 cents to 18 cents a share and revenues of $725 million to $750 million. Overall
column18: it looks like the holiday season turned out to be a disaster for the company.Unfortunately
column19: the bad situation isexpected to continue. The full-year prediction is for revenues of $1.5 billion to $1.7 billion and a loss of 22 cents to 44 cents a share on FIT stock. Wall Street
column20: on the other hand
column21: was looking for a much more robust $2.38 billion on the top-line and profits of 64 cents a share.Bottom Line on Fitbit StockTo deal with the challenges
column22: FIT has a plan that looks weak. The company expects to reduce the workforce by mere 6% and to take other vague efforts to reduce operating costs
column23: leverage data and launch products into new categories. Interesting enough
column24: Fitbit wants to focus more on the smartwatch market
column25: but this will likely mean more expenses.3 Reasons Amazon.com
column26: Inc. (AMZN) Stock Is STILL the KingEven worse
column27: CEO James Parksaidthat the issues with the company were ""temporary"" and the ""performance is not reflective of the value of our brand
column28: market-leading platform
column29: and company's long-term potential.""Huh? Well
column30: this really does seem like the talk of someone who is out-of-touch. And this should definitely be ominous for holders of FIT stock.Granted
column31: perhaps there may be a buyout. But when it comes to broken hardware companies
column32: this may be wishful thinking. For example
column33: think about how long the rumors for a purchase of the beleagueredBlackBerry Ltd(NASDAQ:BBRY) have existed.For the most part
column34: Fitbit stock may not be very interesting to a suitor. And this is not because the products are sub-par. Instead
column35: it could be as simple as that the market has hit maturation levels and that big players like AAPL stand to capture a big part of what's available.Tom Taulli runs the InvestorPlace blogIPO Playbook. He is also the author ofHigh-Profit IPO Strategies
column36: All About Commodities
column37: andAll About Short Selling. Follow him on Twitter at@ttaulli. As of this writing
column38: he did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace12 Stocks That Will Live and Die by Donald Trump's Pen7 Gold Stocks That Will Shine Under TrumpThe postWhy Fitbit Inc (FIT) Needs to Wise Up Before It Can Win Againappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Watch User Engagement When Twitter Inc (TWTR) Stock Reports Earnings;2/8/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsTwitter Inc(NYSE:TWTR) is either a buyout target worth at least 20 percent more or is trading at roughlyfair valuein the $13 billion - $16 billion market cap range. Last year
column3: rumors thatSalesforce.com
column4: Inc.(NYSE:CRM) orMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) might buy it sent the stock trading at unsustainable levels.makeArticleAd();Source:Freestocks via UnsplashThe market has since removed any takeout premium from its stock price. Good fourth-quarter engagement numbers could therefore have a positive influence on the stock price.Previous Quarter Highlighted TWTR Stock's GrowthCEO Jack Dorsey stressed evidence of accelerating growth with its audience. Introducing new products and encouraging higher audience engagement are two goals for Twitter for this year. And last quarter
column5: it focused on live events.By delivering on a better user experience
column6: TWTR stock has a good chance of reporting higher engagement numbers. This includes DAU (daily active users)
column7: MAU (monthly active users) and time spent on the site. If these numbers are up
column8: advertisers will willingly spend more per click and campaign.7 Tech Stocks With Explosive Growth PotentialAnalysts have low expectations for TWTR revenue and expect sales growth of only 4.2% year-over-year. The average revenue estimate is $740.13 million (the range is $713.4 million - $769.8 million. Yet for the full year
column9: analysts expect sales growing 15% but just 9.3% next year.Also expect strong user engagement from the live events. TWTR launched the live initiative last September. It syndicated the experience to its partners
column10: includingYahoo! Inc.(NASDAQ:YHOO)
column11: AOL
column12: SBNationandSports Illustrated. Its TV partners
column13: which includedApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL)
column14: Microsoft andAmazon.com
column15: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN)
column16: were also channels for Twitter's platform.Presidential Election TweetsTwitter's 10.4% jump in the last week may already show the benefit of tweet volume increasing during the U.S. elections. Advertisers likely bid higher rates for exposure on the platform in that time.That could mean TWTR's revenue beats analyst expectations. Twitter noted that debates will help DAU numbers
column17: but the platform requires constant live content tosustainquarterly active user growth:""We want to really leverage this nationally and globally recognized content on live to build awareness of underserved so that we do have a dependable place to find live content. So we're very encouraged by those events
column18: but for them to have an impact over a 90-day period our live strategy has to be more fully rolled out. And we're on the process of doing that.""Live events will fuel Twitter's fourth-quarter revenue growth
column19: although management gave no forecast on what it expects. Last quarter
column20: the company cut its sales force. The restructuring from three channelsdown to twowill disrupt the short-term business results. In the next few quarters
column21: expect improved operating efficiency to add meaningfully to profit margin.SNAP IPO Casts Shadow Over TwitterSnapchat's upcoming IPO
column22: whichFortune Magazinesays may be the mostexpensivetech IPO ever
column23: will cast a shadow on Twitter. Not only will markets ignore the lofty valuations for SNAP
column24: but the company's cash injection will give SNAP the resources to invest in R&D and staff.Take a Free Ride on Lockheed Martin Corporation (LMT) StockInvestors may also ignore the non-voting rights for Snapchat's shares. As SNAP stock soars
column25: more investors will speculate on it
column26: taking the attention away from Twitter.Twitter's earnings report on Feb. 9 should bring no negative surprises. The company cut expenses and turned its focus on live events. By doubling down on its strength of delivering live-tweeting in real time for sports events
column27: user engagement likely improved. That news is good enough to send the stock higher.As of this writing
column28: Chris Lau did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace7 Stocks That Will Drop by 10% or More This Quarter9 Best Cheap Stocks to Buy Now Under $9.99The postWatch User Engagement When Twitter Inc (TWTR) Stock Reports Earningsappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Technology ETFs Hitting All-Time High;2/8/2017;"Most of the sectors have been shining this year on proposed Trump policies and stronger earnings and
column2: technology is no exception. In fact

column21: '');Exchange traded funds (ETFs) trade just like stocks
column22: but instead of ''shares'' investors are actually buying and selling ''units''. These ''units'' can be traded back and forth just like stocks
column23: but can also be created or destroyed to accommodate investor demand. Each week we monitor the week-over-week change in shares outstanding data
column24: to keep a lookout for those ETFs experiencing notable inflows (many new units created) or outflows (many old units destroyed). Creation of new units will mean the underlying holdings of the ETF need to be purchased
column25: while destruction of units involves selling underlying holdings
column26: so large flows can also impact the individual components held within ETFs.Click here to find out which 9 other ETFs had   notable inflows »"

column1: Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock Is Still Finding Growth;2/7/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsMicrosoft Corporation(NYSE:MSFT) used to be a one-trick
column3: maybe two-trick pony less than 10 years ago. My how things have changed.makeArticleAd();Source:Mike Mozart via Flickr (Modified)Under founder Bill Gates
column4: DOS and then Windows operating systems were on virtually every computer that wasn't anApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) machine. And that dominance continued unabated until the dotcom bubble burst.It wasn't the ensuing crash that hurt
column5: it was the fact that tech had reached a point of inflection.From then on
column6: it wasn't just about owning a fiber-optic switching company with a triple-digit price-to-earnings ratio. One of the sayings from those heady times was
column7: if it doesn't have a triple digit P/E
column8: it's not worth buying.The crash meant the internet and tech itself was growing up. There was plenty of consolidation that happened after the dotcom crash. Some worked out
column9: some didn't. But it was necessary for companies that were going to survive to find a way to pivot into the new marketplace.9 Best Cheap Stocks to Buy Now Under $9.99It was also around that time that Microsoft was embroiled in a major antitrust case with the U.S. Government. This meant that MSFT had to change on many levels
column10: just to survive. It was crucial to find a way out of this
column11: because most of the government computers were running Windows
column12: and if Microsoft couldn't find a bright path through the case
column13: it may well lose a very lucrative long-term contract.By 2006
column14: Gates was out of day-to-day operations and his No. 2
column15: Steve Ballmer
column16: took over. While he started strong
column17: it wasn't long until it was apparent that doing the same thing a little differently was not going to cut it as technology was expanding rapidly and interconnections were popping among different tech fields.In 2014
column18: the current CEO
column19: Satya Nadella
column20: took the helm and began to completely reorganize the company
column21: shedding unprofitable and unwieldy divisions and focusing on the future of the company. That meant cleaning up the mess created by the acquisition of the mobile phone business ofNokiaand building a robust cloud-based business for both operating systems and for client storage.It certainly helped that he was previously head of MSFT R&D. But some were still skeptical of his approach
column22: especially in the early days
column23: when the new divisions weren't getting much traction and the established businesses were left wanting - remember Windows 8?Now three years into his role
column24: Nadella has gone from potential goat to real hero. And the most recent earnings number prove out his strategy. He has remained focused and disciplined
column25: and it has paid off.Microsoft has committed $1 billion into cybersecurity investment for its services as well as R&D. The company is reporting 600
column27: 000 attacks a week
column28: up from about 20
column29: 000 just three years ago. But it's not as much the threat as the opportunity. According to tech sitetechemergence.com
column30: there's an artificial intelligence-based cybersecurity market that will be worth $8.3 trillion market by 2035 in the U.S. alone.And given the fact that the U.S. government is one of MSFT stock's biggest clients
column31: security is crucial.Why GoPro Inc (GPRO) Stock Deserves More PatienceGoing hand in hand with this is the impressive growth of Azure
column32: Microsoft's cloud-based operating and storage system. Revenue growth year over year is running around 93% and Azure is getting big enough to compete with Amazon Web Services
column33: the cloud division ofAmazon.com
column34: Inc(NASDAQ:AMZN).Recent earnings were solid overall and there's no reason to think MSFT stock has seen its best days already. And while its 30 P/E may look expensive
column35: AMZN is trading at a P/E of 185. And MSFT also delivers a solid 2.4% dividend as well.Richard Band'sProfitable Investingadvisory service helps retirement savers outperform the market without losing a minute of sleep along the way. His straightforward style and low-risk value approach has won seven Best Financial Advisory awards from the Newsletter and Electronic Publishers Foundation.More From InvestorPlaceThe Top 10 Dow Dividend Stocks for February5 Stocks to Buy to Defy a Weak FebruaryThe postMicrosoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock Is Still Finding Growthappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Why GoPro Inc (GPRO) Stock Deserves More Patience;2/6/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsShares ofGoPro Inc(NASDAQ:GPRO) have been under pressure
column3: plunging as much as 14% Friday after the action camera maker reported fourth quarter fiscal 2016 earnings results Thursday afternoon that missed Wall Street's revenue expectations. But it's tough to ignore how GPRO stock
column4: which is trading near 52-week lows
column5: looks attractive from a risk versus reward perspective.makeArticleAd();Source:ETC-USC via Flickr (Modified)GoPro stock closed Friday at $9.58
column6: down 12.7%. Even with Friday's punishment
column7: the stock is still up 10% year-to-date
column8: besting the 2.3% rise in theS&P 500index.Indeed
column9: the fact that the company lowered guidance for the current quarter may have created a ceiling for the GPRO stock. For the current quarter
column10: GoPro
column11: which did not issue an earnings-per-share forecast
column12: expects revenue of $200 million
column13: up 9% year-over-year. This compares to Wall Street's estimates for $264 million.However
column14: while the market focused solely on the the revenue miss and guide-down
column15: investors ignored that not only did GoPro's profit margins improve
column16: the company's adjusted EPS of 29 cents beat estimates by 7 cents. Notably
column17: the $115.7 million loss the company posted in the fourth quarter
column18: much of the total was due to a tax charge of $102 million.Plus
column19: despite revenue of $540.6 million missing consensus estimates
column20: it was nonetheless encouraging that GPRO managed to grow quarterly revenues by 24%. And with the company resuming Karma sales recently
column21: there could also be a near-term floor on GoPro stock. Not to make light of the headwinds the company faces with a slowing market for cameras
column22: but GPRO still has a dominant retail presence
column23: which gives it an advantage over its competitors.Two Questions for GPRO StockAt the same time
column24: GoPro is cutting costs to improve profitability. However
column25: two main questions remain: How deep will the cuts go and can GoPro execute the cuts to achieve both revenue and profit objectives. In that regard
column26: at some point CEO Nick Woodman
column27: who promised last year that GoPro would be profitable in the fourth quarter
column28: may now want to consider ""exploring strategic alternatives.""7 Tech Stocks With Explosive Growth PotentialThat is another way to say
column29: a possible sale of the company should be on the table
column30: which could free GPRO stock.More to the point
column31: it's no longer a certainty that Goodman and gang can be trusted to lead GoPro out of this rut. Despite the many advantages GPRO has had as a brand
column32: there have been too many missteps by management and self-inflicted wounds. Setbacks from the Hero5 camera and the Karma drone
column33: which was recalled because of in-flight battery problems
column34: are glaring examples.Microsoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) andFacebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB) are two names with significantly better management that I think can take GoPro stock to the next level. Microsoft
column35: which already has success with consumer products
column36: such as the Xbox
column37: should be able to leverage GPRO's cameras andsoftware toolsto enhance its AR and VR ambitions with HoloLens.As for Facebook
column38: GoPro's drones and camera's would be ideal for Facebook's live video ambitions and 360 degree technology. And with GPRO's market cap now valued at just $1.35 billion and an enterprise value of $1 billion
column39: it would be a drop in the bucket for either company. As for GoPro
column40: with $225 million in cash on the balance sheet and zero debt.As of this writing
column41: Richard Saintvilus did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace10 Stocks to Buy That Already Make America GreatThe Top 10 Dow Dividend Stocks for FebruaryThe postWhy GoPro Inc (GPRO) Stock Deserves More Patienceappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column2: Earnings
column3: European Weakness;2/6/2017;"The Dow Jones Industrial Average continued to straddle the 20
column4: 000 mark as the struggle between buyers and sellers leaves the blue-chip index nearly unchanged from Friday's close.The uncertainty surrounding U.S. fiscal policy
column5: remaining Q4 corporate earnings and pressure on European equities encouraged a cautious tone on Wall Street with all three benchmark averages slightly in the red.While equities trade defensively
column6: the U.S. Treasury market was seeing yields pull back amid a safe-haven play
column7: primarily in the belly of the yield curve. The 5-year and 10-year Treasury notes were both 6 basis points richer from Friday at 1.87% and 2.43%
column8: respectively.makeArticleAd();The risk-off trade is weighing on the dollar against the yen
column9: however
column10: driving USD/JPY to its lowest level since November.Economic data was quite light on Monday with only the January Labor Market Conditions Index. The LMCI advanced to 1.3 last month from an upwardly revised 0.6 in December (previously reported as -0.3).European bourses were all lower Monday as political uncertainly in France fueled a 1% loss in the CAC-40. National Front leader Marine Le Pen kicked off her campaign to be the next president of France by pledging a ""return to monetary sovereignty"" by proposing to split up the euro into a basket of national currencies
column11: and curtailing the independence of the European Central Bank. The exodus from French securities into safe-havens drove the yield spread between French OATs and German bunds to its highest level in four years.And although the UK's FTSE-100 was insulated from the heaviest selling pressure as a result of the country's impending divorce from the European Union
column12: the contagion across the Euro-zone permeated UK stocks
column13: sending the FTSE-100 lower.Crude oil was down $0.59 to $53.25 per barrel. Natural gas was down $0.02 to $3.05 per 1 million BTU. Gold was up $10.50 to $1

column1: Here’s How Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Can Hit $200;2/6/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) delivered excellent earnings news Jan. 31 that pushed Apple stock to its highest level since the summer of 2015.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockThat's great news for long time owners of Apple stock who've had to suffer through a deluge of naysayers proclaiming its lack of innovation. More than a few have even suggestedinvestors dump AAPL stockand buyMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) stock in its place.Hey
column3: I like Microsoft and I think what it'sdoing in the cloudis going to help it continue to grow over the next decade
column4: but it's not in the same league when it comes to revenue and profit growth. Microsoft does
column5: however
column6: have a business model that's transitioning from one-time product sales to ongoing monthly recurring revenue
column7: something many observers have noted is happening at Apple.Yes
column8: Apple did sell more than78 millioniPhones in the first quarter
column9: roughly five million more than it sold in the same quarter a year earlier
column10: but it was the service revenue that had everyone in a tizzy.Jim Cramer likened the Apple business model tothe Gillette business model
column11: where consumers buy a single razor and keep buying new razor blades; only in Apple's situation the iPhone is the razor and services such as the App Stores are the razor blades.You gotta love recurring revenue. Cramer does:""What has dogged Apple's stock for ages
column12: what has kept its share price so low
column13: at least in terms of its valuation
column14: is the 'Blackberry-ization' issue
column15: Cramer said onMad MoneyFeb. 1. ""The notion that in the end
column16: the iPhone is just a device and device companies eventually get wasted asBlackBerry Ltd(NASDAQ:BBRY) did.""7 Tech Stocks With Explosive Growth PotentialThere's no question recurring revenue is good for a company's top and bottom line and should be welcome news for owners of Apple stock
column17: but is it enough to drive Apple stock through its all-time high of $134.54 and upward to $200?That's debatable.While Apple's services revenue hit$7.2 billionin the first quarter
column18: 18% higher than a year earlier
column19: it's still only 9% of the company's overall revenue
column20: or 100 basis points higher than a year earlier.By comparison
column21: Microsoft's second quarter saw its service and other revenueincreased 29.7% to $7.5 billion. The only problem with that for Microsoft is the gross margins are 40% compared to 67.5% for its product revenue
column22: which accounted for 68.5% of its overall revenue.You want your recurring revenue gross margins to be higher than your product margins
column23: not lower; because if that's the way the world is headed
column24: both stocks are looking at lower profits in the future.Apple doesn't break down its gross margins between products and segments. Overall
column25: its gross margin in Q1 2017 was 38.5%
column26: 160 basis points less than in Q1 2016. Microsoft's overall gross margin in its latest quarter was 58.9%
column27: considerably higher than Apple's.That would seem to suggest Microsoft's in a better position when it comes to service revenue. It is both growing this aspect of its business faster than Apple and making more from every dollar of revenue. From this perspective
column28: Apple is doomed.A quick look farther down the income statement
column29: however
column30: provides some clarity: Apple's operating margin in Q1 2017 was 29.9%; Microsoft's Q2 2017 operating margin was 25.7%
column31: or 420 basis points less than Apple.The biggest reason for this difference: Microsoft spends about three times as much per year on research and development as Apple does; Apple spent 4.7% of its revenue in the trailing 12 months on R&D compared to 14.4% for Microsoft. And when you're talking about billions of dollars of annual revenue
column32: the difference adds up quickly.Which brings us back to Apple's growing service revenue: InvestorPlace contributor Brad Moon highlightedthe positives of Apple's services revenuerecently. A couple of his points stick out for me.Don't Bet Against the Dow Jones Industrial AverageFirst
column33: the App Store had $3 billion in revenue in December - a record. Secondly
column34: Apple paid out more than $20 billion to developers in 2016. Extrapolate December's App Store sales over 12 months and you get $36 billion in revenue. Subtract $20 billion paid to developers in 2016 and that leaves a gross profit of $16 billion and a gross margin of 44%
column35: which is pretty darn healthy considering very little R&D is required to keep that up and running.Can recurring revenue take Apple stock to $200? I believe it can. When
column36: however
column37: is another story.As of this writing
column38: Will Ashworth did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace3 Big Buyout Deals That Could Crush Investors9 Best Cheap Stocks to Buy Now Under $9.99The postHere's How Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Can Hit $200appeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Tech Companies Take a Stand Against Trump's Immigration Ban;2/6/2017;"Immigration has been a driving force behind many of the   leading technology companies in the United States.Some
column2: includingMicrosoft(NASDAQ: MSFT)
column3: are led by CEOs who were not born in this   country while over 200 companies on the Fortune 500 were started   by immigrants or their children. In addition most top tech brands   are global
column4: with offices all over the world
column5: and talent working   domestically that was not born in the U.S.At least partly because of that nearly 100 technology   companies including Microsoft
column6: Apple(NASDAQ: AAPL)
column7: Alphabet(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL)
column8: Facebook
column9: Twitter
column10: and many others have filed a legal brief in the U.S. Court of   Appeals for the 9th Circuit opposing President Donald Trump's   temporary immigration ban keeping people from seven predominantly   Muslim countries from entering the U.S. In the brief the   companies argue that the ban ""inflicts significant harm on   American business.""makeArticleAd();Trump signed an executive order banning immigration from     seven predominantly Muslim countries. Image source: Getty     Images.What are they opposing?In one of his first acts as president
column11: Trump signed an   executive order banning refugees and visa-holders from seven   predominantly Muslim countries from entering the United States.   That order has been stayed by aU.S. District judgeand an appeals courtdeclined to immediately reinstatethe presidential order. The technology companies
column12: many of which   operate and employ workers in and from the impacted countries   filed their brief to show their opposition to the president's   actions.""Immigrants make many of the Nation's greatest discoveries
column13: and create some of the country's most innovative and iconic   companies
column14: the brief states. ""America has long recognized the   importance of protecting ourselves against those who would do us   harm. But it has done so while maintaining our fundamental   commitment to welcoming immigrants -- through increased   background checks and other controls on people seeking to enter   our country.""The companies that signed the brief acknowledged what Trump   was
column15: at least on the surface
column16: trying to accomplish with the   executive order.""We share your goal of ensuring that our immigration system   meets today's security needs and keeps our country safe
column17: said a   draft of that letter obtained byBloomberg News. ""We are concerned
column18: however
column19: that your recent Executive Order   will affect many visa holders who work hard here in the United   States and contribute to our country's success.""Tech requires global talentPutting aside any political questions
column20: the tech industry   opposes Trump's immigration ban in part because it takes global   talent to compete. The U.S. simply does not produce enough   workers -- specifically coders who write the software that powers   the products made by these companies -- to meet demand.To fill those needs companies across the U.S. use H1B visas to   receive special dispensation to hire workers who otherwise would   not be able to legally work in the country. A H1B visa
column21: according   toMyVisaJobs.com
column22: allows U.S. employers to temporarily employ foreign   professionals in specialty occupations for three years
column23: extendable to six years. ""To qualify for H1B Visa
column24: the foreign   professional must hold a bachelor's or higher degree from an   accredited college or university in the specialty occupation
column25: according to the site. In some cases specialized training can be   substituted for a degree.Technology companies dominate the list of employers using   workers on H1B visas. Data compiled by MyVisaJobs.com shows that   in 2016 Infosys held the top spot
column26: having sponsored 25
column27: 405 visas.   while Microsoft
column28: Apple
column29: and Alphabet were all in the top 25.It's about more than self interestIt's easy to see the business reasons behind why these   technology companies oppose Trump's immigration restrictions.   Most
column30: if not all of the companies that filed the brief would be   impacted by having employees unable to travel and in some cases   the executive order would impact hiring.For at least some of these companies
column31: however
column32: the opposition   goes beyond pure business logic. Many of these brands were either   founded by immigrants or by the children of immigrants and   immediate business concerns aside
column33: they simply want a world where   new immigrants to the U.S. can be free to move here and found the   next Microsoft
column34: Apple
column35: or Alphabet.10 stocks we like better than MicrosoftWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column36: it can pay to listen. After all
column37: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade

column39: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and Microsoft wasn't one of     them! That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even     better buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of January 4

column1: Get Bullish on Salesforce.com
column2: Inc. (CRM) Stock Sooner Than Later;2/6/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsSalesforce.com
column4: Inc.(NYSE:CRM) has been on quite a run lately
column5: with the stock up 17% since the beginning of the year. Yet even given the torrid rally
column6: large repeat call buying continues in CRM stock.makeArticleAd();Source:TopoI6 Via FlickrSalesforce also is poised at a critical technical breakout level and has been the topic of takeover talk in the past. Given all that
column7: now might be the time to follow along with the big call buying and take a bullish position in Salesforce stock.As an options analyst
column8: I look to identify situations where unusual option activity is evident. Many times these big option trades are done by ""informed"" institutional buyers who may have insider-type knowledge. They use calls to gain the potentially enormous leverage that options can provide in addition to their stock positions.Over the past few weeks
column9: there has been large
column10: repeat call buying in CRM options. Some of the more notable trades are highlighted below:20
column11: 000 May 90 calls on Jan. 2525
column12: 000 March 85 calls on Jan. 3016
column13: 000 May 90 calls on Jan. 3111
column14: 839 Apr 90 calls on Feb. 1These four trades alone account for over 72
column15: 000 call contracts
column16: which control over 7.2 million shares of CRM stock. That's most assuredlynota small stake.9 Best Cheap Stocks to Buy Now Under $9.99From a technical standpoint
column17: Salesforce is at a critical juncture. As the chart shows
column18: CRM stock is trying to break out past the crucial $80 level
column19: which could lead to a further move to all-time highs in the stock.Click to EnlargeSalesforce has has been the subject oftakeover chatterin the past.Microsoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) andOracle Corporation(NYSE:ORCL) have beenpotential rumored suitors
column20: though obviously no deal has come to fruition yet.The enormous call buying has also had a big effect on option prices. Implied volatility (IV)
column21: which normally lessens as a stock rises
column22: is now at the highest level over the past three months. Current IV levels of 36% percentile far exceed historic volatility (HV) levels of only the 6% percentile.Click to EnlargeWith earnings not due out for another couple of weeks
column23: it is highly unlikely the big-time call buying that is centered in April and May options is earnings-related.Since options prices (IV) are comparatively expensive
column24: option selling strategies are favored. To position bullishly along with the big-time call buyers
column25: selling out-of-the-money puts makes intuitive sense.How to Trade CRM Stock HereSell the CRM May $75 puts at $3.50 to openSell one put for each 100 shares of Salesforce stock you would be comfortable owning. The short $75 strike price is 6% below the $80.21 closing price of CRM.If Salesforce closes above $75 on May 19 expiration
column26: you keep the $350 premium per put sold. If Salesforce closes below $75
column27: you will be assigned the stock and end up buying shares at a net cost of $71.50.To avoid assignment
column28: close out the trade if CRM stock is below $75 near expiration.As of this writing
column29: Tim Biggam did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities. column1: See Which Of The Latest 13F Filers Holds Microsoft;2/6/2017;"AtHoldings Channel
column2: we have reviewed the latest batch of the 21 most recent 13F filings for the 12/31/2016 reporting period
column3: and noticed that Microsoft Corporation (Symbol: MSFT) was held by 11 of these funds. When hedge fund managers appear to be thinking alike
column4: we find it is a good idea to take a closer look.Before we proceed
column5: it is important to point out that 13F filings do not tell the whole story
column6: because these funds are only required to disclose theirlongpositions with the SEC
column7: but are not required to disclose theirshortpositions. A fund making a bearish bet against a stock by shorting calls
column8: for example
column9: might also be long some amount of stock as they trade around their overall bearish position. This long component could show up in a 13F filing and everyone might assume the fund is bullish
column10: but this tells only part of the storybecause the bearish/short side of the position is not seen.makeArticleAd();Having given that caveat
column11: we believe that looking atgroupsof 13F filings can be revealing
column12: especially when comparing one holding period to another. Below
column13: let's take a look at the change in MSFT positions
column14: for this latest batch of 13F filers:FundNew Position?Change In Share CountChange In Market Value($ in 1000's)Tradewinds Capital Management LLCExisting-8

column1: Amazon.com
column2: Inc. (AMZN) Prime Air Drones Surprise in Super Bowl Ad;2/6/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsIf you were one of the estimated 100 million+ viewers of Super Bowl 51
column4: you saw some drones. There were the 200 quadcopters fromIntel Corporation(NASDAQ:INTC) that were part of Lady Gaga's halftime show. Those we were expecting
column5: but another drone that showed up was a surprise.Amazon.com
column6: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN) chose the Super Bowl to tease Amazon Prime Air - packages delivered to your home by AMZN drones.makeArticleAd();Source: AmazonA big part of the Super Bowl experience is the advertising. This is the one time of year when viewers actuallywantto see commercials. And with those viewersestimated at over 100 million
column7: companies that forked out over $5 million for a 30-second spot make a big splash.Heck
column8: even in Canada
column9: the networks wereforced to run American adsinstead of substituting local commercials.And those 100 million-plus viewers saw a very short teaser commercial with anAmazon drone hoveringoutside the window of a woman who had just ordered some snacks: Amazon Prime Air.10 Stocks to Buy That Already Make America GreatAccording to the voice of Alexa
column10: AMZN's personal digital assistant
column11: we can ""Look for delivery soon.""History of Amazon Prime AirHow can you talk about the history of a service that doesn't yet exist? In the case of Amazon Prime Air and its use of Amazon drones
column12: there's already a big backstory to talk about. AMZNhas a websitewhere it describes the services
column13: shows off a number of Amazon drone videos and even has an FAQ section that spikes out many of the details about Amazon Prime Air.""We're excited about Prime Air - a delivery system from Amazon designed to safely get packages to customers in 30 minutes or less using unmanned aerial vehicles
column14: also called drones. Prime Air has great potential to enhance the services we already provide to millions of customers by providing rapid parcel delivery that will also increase the overall safety and efficiency of the transportation system.""The Amazon Prime Air storykicked off in 2013
column15: when AMZN CEO Jeff Bezos took the wraps off a top secret project with Amazon drones on60 Minutes. Delivery of items under five pounds that would fit in the quadcopter's bucket would take place in under 30 minutes. At the time
column16: Bezos told viewers to expect Amazon Prime Air within four to five years.Last December
column17: a milestone was reached when AMZN claimedthe first Amazon drone delivery- an Amazon Fire TV and a bag of popcorn. As part of an Amazon Prime Air trial in the U.K.
column18: the company's drones had begun autonomously delivering packages to a very small group of consumers.Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Has a New Hero: Services!At the end of the year
column19: the company hit the news again when it was discovered it hadfiled a patent for a flying warehousethat would serve as an airborne base for Amazon drone deliveries.When Can You Expect an Amazon Drone atYourWindow?Despite the Super Bowl ad and Alexa's promise that Amazon Prime Air is coming soon
column20: it's a little early to get excited yet. In particular
column21: there are regulatory hurdles to overcome. FAA restrictions on drones that aren't flying in line-of-site operation were the primary reason why the Amazon drone trial is taking place in the U.K. instead of here. AMZN even put up a small disclaimer on its ad:""Prime Air is not available in some states (or any really). Yet.""But the fact that it spent the big Super Bowl ad bucks and showed off that Amazon drone to millions of viewers shows AMZN is serious about this. Amazon Prime Air may not be launching tomorrow
column22: but the company is determined to get people excited about drone delivery. The campaign to turn Amazon drone delivery into the next big thing has officially begun.As of this writing
column23: Brad Moon did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceIs Nvidia Corporation (NVDA) Ending the Age of Intel (INTC)?Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Steps on Amazon and Google's TurfThe postAmazon.com
column24: Inc. (AMZN) Prime Air Drones Surprise in Super Bowl Adappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Mega Cap ETF (XLG) Hits New 52-Week High;2/6/2017;"For investors seeking momentum
column2: Guggenheim S&P 500 Top 50 ETXLGis probably on radar now. The fund just hit a 52-week high
column3: and is up roughly 23.3% from its 52-week low price of $130.63/share.makeArticleAd();But are more gains in store for this ETF? Let's take a quick look at the fund and the near-term outlook on it to get a better idea on where it might be headed:XLG in FocusThis fund offers exposure to mega cap securities with key holdings in information technology. As such
column4: it has significant concentration on the top two firms - AppleAAPLand MicrosoftMSFT- with a combined 12.4% share while other firms hold less than 3.7% of assets. The product charges investors 20 basis points in fees (see:all the Large Cap ETFs here).Why the Move?The mega cap space of the broad U.S. stock market has been an area to watch lately given that the major bourses are again hovering around record levels. Trump's policy for the financial sector acted as a major catalyst for the stock market after a slew of anti-trade policies. Further
column5: encouraging earnings reports and upbeat job data also supported the rally. In particular
column6: the Q4 earnings season is faring better than recent years
column7: with earnings growth not only on track to reach the highest level in two years but total earnings set to hit a new quarterly record.More Gains Ahead?Currently
column8: XLG has a Zacks ETF Rank of 3 or 'Hold' rating with a High risk outlook. Therefore
column9: it is hard to get a handle on its future returns in one way or the other. However

column4: Stock Advice & Trading TipsThe U.S. stock market will seek to rebound following a series of disappointing results in the early days of Donald Trump's presidency.makeArticleAd();Several companies made headlines over the weekend
column5: includingAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG

column8: GOOGL)Alphabet has been ordered to surrender emailsoutside the U.S.by a federal agency.The tech company has received an FBI warrant that U.S. Magistrate Judge Thomas Rueter signed. The judge said the move would not be considered to be a seizure.9 Best Cheap Stocks to Buy Now Under $9.99""Though the retrieval of the electronic data by Google from its multiple data centers abroad has the potential for an invasion of privacy
column9: the actual infringement of privacy occurs at the time of disclosure in the United States
column10: Rueter said.It is still unclear whether or not the ruling will stand asMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) faced a similar situation in which a judge ruled against emails being handed over.GOOG stock is up 3.8% year-to-date
column11: while GOOGL shares are up 3.5% YTD.The Coca-Cola Co (KO)Coca-Cola releaseda Super Bowl adthat appears to have backfired.The commercial was a rerun of an ad that was released in 2014
column12: featuring ""America the Beautiful"" which was written by Katharine Lee Bates. The new version of it has the song performed in numerous languages.In order to promote diversity
column13: the song is performed in English
column14: Spanish
column15: Keres
column16: Tagalog
column17: Hindi
column18: Senegalese
column19: French and Hebrew. The video shows a diverse group of people.While the company was attempting to send a message in support of people of all creed
column20: many criticized it as it appeared to simply be a commercial using diversity to sell the product.The hashtag #BoycottCoke soon followed on Twitter. Meanwhile
column21: others supported the ad and criticized those who chose to see the commercial purely for advertising purposes.KO shares are down 4.5% over the last six months.Tiffany & Co. (TIF)The Tiffany CEOhas stepped downas boss.The news came as the company announced that its upcoming earnings call will reveal disappointing results. Previous CEO Michael Kowalski will serve as the new boss on an interim basis.Kowalski said the company will continue to focus on ""enhancing the customer experience

column24: … all while efficiently managing our capital and costs.""Should You Buy Whole Foods Market

column1: Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock Still Relies on Office and Windows;2/6/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsThere is a newfound sense of optimism towardMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT)
column3: and MSFT stock. Microsoft stock touched an all-time high over $65 last week after the company's fiscal second-quarter earnings report. Yet
column4: earnings haven't really budged the last five years
column5: as lower PC sales have pressured Microsoft revenue from its legacy Windows and Office products.makeArticleAd();Source:Mike Mozart Via FlickrOf late
column6: however
column7: Microsoft has shown growth in newer products. The Surface product line and cloud computing
column8: led by the Azure platform
column9: are posting impressive growth rates. And
column10: Surface and Azure are driving much of the optimism that has led MSFT stock to increase nearly 150% in a little over four years.But
column11: lost in that optimism toward MSFT seems to be the fact that most of Microsoft's business is relatively unchanged from what it was three to four years ago - if not worse. Windows is a declining platform. There are multiple competitors trying to take down Office
column12: and the cloud shift is cannibalizing some of Microsoft's SQL Server business.So
column13: while there's a reason to see growth coming from Microsoft's new opportunities
column14: investors in Microsoft stock need to remember that most of the business isn't nearly as attractive.Azure and Surface Are Driving Microsoft Stock HigherThere is reason for optimism toward Azure and Surface. The Surface line garners rave reviews
column15: and sales have been strong. Microsoft has an impressive opportunity to drive commercial sales
column16: with the company calling out a major contract with the U.K. Customs Service on its Q2 conference call.5 Stocks to Buy to Defy a Weak FebruaryGrowth in Azure has been even more impressive. Revenue increased 93% in the second quarter and 104% in the first half of FY17. Microsoft remains well behindAmazon.com
column17: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN) and its Amazon Web Services business. But
column18: it has a clear opportunity to get to at least second place in what should be a large
column19: fast-growing end market. That portends years of growth in Azure
column20: a potential driver for MSFT stock.At the same time
column21: however
column22: Microsoft is a huge company
column23: with trailing twelve-month revenue over $85 billion. And
column24: neither Azure nor Surface represents a significant portion of those overall sales. Microsoft still doesn't break out Azure sales
column25: but estimates suggest roughly $3 billion in fiscal 2017 - less than 4% of overall revenue.Per the MSFT 10-K
column26: Surface sales were about $4.2 billion in fiscal 2016
column27: and those sales actually declined 2% year over year in the second quarter. Some of that weakness came from the company's phasing out of Surface 3
column28: and gross margins have improved. But
column29: Azure and Surface combined are still less than 10% of total revenue. Even adding cloud computing as a whole
column30: the figure barely gets to one-quarter next year
column31: as MSFT is targeting a $20 billion run rate for commercial cloud.Simple math shows that it's tough for Microsoft to grow as a whole if only a small portion of revenue is driving that growth. Indeed
column32: that's been the case this year. Overall revenue grew just 1.2% in the second quarter
column33: and 0.8% for the first half. Excluding phone sales - where Microsoft has all but has exited the business - top-line growth was still under 5% in Q2 and Q1.Yet MSFT stock now is priced as a growth stock. That might be aggressive.MSFT Earnings Still Rely on Office and WindowsThe problem for MSFT stock is that so much of Microsoft's business still comes from its better-known products. The More Personal Computing segment generated nearly 50% of first half sales. That includes Windows revenue - which was almost 20% of FY16 sales - along with Xbox
column34: Search
column35: and devices (including Surface).Surface aside
column36: that's not a particularly attractive group. Windows revenue seems likely to decline over the long term and has declined in each of the last two fiscal years. Bing has performed well of late
column37: but in part because Microsoft has spent up to attract traffic. The Productivity and Business Processes segment is almost one-third of sales. Prior to Microsoft's acquisition ofLinkedIn Corp
column38: it consisted primarily of Office and Dynamics
column39: MSFT's CRM solution.First-half growth has been impressive
column40: growing about 7%
column41: excluding the contribution from LinkedIn. But
column42: that comes after revenue in the segment declined between FY14 and FY16. While Office 365 sales growth looks solid
column43: much of that growth is simply coming from a shift to ""on-premise"" Office licenses.Bottom Line on Microsoft StockThere are two concerns about the long-term growth prospects of Microsoft stock. The first is that some of the recent headline growth in categories such as cloud and office is simply coming from existing products. Some Azure sales are coming from customers switching away from Microsoft SQL Server. Office 365 sales aren't going to new customers who didn't have word processing software; rather
column44: most subscribers are former users of disk-based Office products.A Trade War With China Puts These Stocks at RiskThe second concern is that so much of the business is stagnant (though bulls might say ""stable"" instead). That makes overall growth tough: if 20% of the business grows 20%
column45: and the rest is flat or declining
column46: overall growth rates stay in the 4% range.With MSFT stock steadily appreciated due almost solely to multiple appreciation
column47: rather than earnings growth
column48: investors are clearly expecting sales to pick up. But
column49: it's important to remember that Azure and Surface won't be able to drive that acceleration on their own.As of this writing
column50: Vince Martin did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace7 Stocks to Sell as Fear Returns to the Market5 Safe Dividend Stocks to Buy for RetirementThe Top 10 Dow Dividend Stocks for FebruaryThe postMicrosoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock Still Relies on Office and Windowsappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Amazon (AMZN) Q4 Earnings Beat
column2: Revenues Miss Estimates;2/3/2017;"Amazon.com'sAMZNfourth-quarter 2016 earnings per share (EPS) of $1.54 cents surpassed the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $1.40.However
column3: revenues of $43.74 billion lagged the consensus mark of $44.87 billion. The stock was down 4.15% in Thursday's after-hours trading in response to the lower-than-expected revenues
column4: higher operating expenses and weak guidance.Over the last one year
column5: the stock has however outperformed the Zacks  Electronic Commerce industry. It has gained 56.63% compared with the industry's gain of 47.98%.Last quarter
column6: despite an increase in operating expenses
column7: the company showed much better financial discipline. The spike in operating expenses was due to buildout of fulfillment centers
column8: and increased spending on original TV shows and movies. Amazon Web Services (AWS) and India expansion-related expenses also resulted in higher spending.The North America and AWS segments contributed to profits while investments in international continued. Improvements in AWS were the result of operating efficiencies and increased utilization of assets.The numbers in detail-RevenuesAmazon reported revenues of $43.7 billion
column9: up 33.7% sequentially and 22.4% from the year-ago quarter. Quarterly revenues were at the mid-point of the guidance range of $42-$45.5 billion.For the full year
column10: revenues were $136 billion
column11: up 27% from $107 billion in 2015.Both product and service sales were up sequentially and year over year. Service sales grew much stronger than product sales from the year-ago quarter (up 43.7% compared with product sales growth of 15.1%). Revenue distribution between the two was 70%/30%.The company generated record sales during this year's holiday season
column12: primarily led by its devices strategy. Echo Dot
column13: Fire TV Stick
column14: Fire tablet and Amazon Echo topped the best-sellers list.Segment DetailsThe North America segment accounted for around 60% of sales
column15: representing a sequential and year-over-year increase of 39% and 22%
column16: respectively. The International segment accounted for 32%
column17: up 31.6% sequentially and 17.9% year over year. The AWS segment was up 9.4% sequentially and a massive 47% year over year with revenue share at nearly 8%.North America: Media was up 30% sequentially and 7.1% year over year. EGM was up 40.9% sequentially and 24.8% year over year. Other was up 42.6% sequentially and 80.4% year over year.International: Media was up 35.6% sequentially and 2.6% from last year. Sales from EGM were up 30.5% sequentially and 23.8% from last year. Other revenue was up 19.35% sequentially and 17.9% year over year.AWS: The business contributed $3.5 billion in the fourth quarter. AWS is gaining momentum with customers including McDonald's

column19: Capital One
column20: Salesforce
column21: GE Oil & Gas
column22: Kellogg's
column23: Brooks Brothers

column30: and Bart & Associates Inc. Amazon ended the quarter with 42 available zones across 16 infrastructure regions. The Mumbai (India) region was added in the third quarter
column31: which became the sixth region in the Asia Pacific. Amazon remains the cloud infrastructure leader
column32: well ahead of MicrosoftMSFT
column33: International Business Machines CorporationIBMand AlphabetGOOGL.Gross MarginGross margin was down 122 basis points (bps) sequentially but up 189 bps year over year to 33.8%. Sequential variations in gross margin were largely mix-related
column34: although increased investments were also a factor. Growth in AWS had a positive impact on margin. Pricing is also an important factor
column35: given the increase in product categories all over the world and Amazon's strategy of heavily discounting products and services while building a position in any market. Third party sites did better than retail
column36: which was also a positive.Gross profit dollars were up 29.8% from last year. column1: Apple Inc. (AAPL) Smartwatch Is Still Dominant Despite All the Doubt;2/3/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsWhenApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) CEO Tim Cook went on the attack against claims Apple Watch sales were in the dumpster his comments about record holiday sales were taken with a healthy dose of skepticism.makeArticleAd();Source: AppleAfter all
column3: it was his job to talk up his company's products. Even a similar claim in Apple's Q1 earnings report seemed questionable
column4: with no detail provided. However
column5: a report on global smartwatch shipments for Q4 2016 supports AAPL's claims.The numbers say Apple Watch sales did indeed set a holiday record and took an even larger share of overall smartwatch sales that quarter than in the 2015 holidays.Defending Apple Watch SalesTim Cook had his work cut out for him after AAPL launched the Apple Watch Series 2 in September. Apple was counting on the new model to boost sales going into the holiday quarter of a year where consumer interest in smartwatches was slipping.Alphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column6: NASDAQ:GOOGL) opted to skip its expected Android Wear 2 smartwatch operating system upgrade.Pebble
column7: the early smartwatch pioneer
column8: would soon collapse and have its assets bought up byFitbit Inc(NYSE:FIT).When research firm IDC released a report in December saying Apple Watch sales had tanked
column9: dropping 71% from the previous year
column10: Cook went on the offensive.In an e-mailtoReuters
column11: he wrote:""Our data shows that Apple Watch is doing great and looks to be one of the most popular holiday gifts this year. Sales growth is off the charts. In fact
column12: during the first week of holiday shopping
column13: our sell-through of Apple Watch was greater than any week in the product's history. And as we expected
column14: we're on track for the best quarter ever for Apple Watch.""The problem was
column15: with a new model just launched and the crucial holiday shopping season ramping up
column16: everyone was expecting AAPL to put a positive spin on Apple Watch sales. And without numbers to back it up
column17: Cook's statement wasn't necessarily taken at face value.10 Companies That Are Bringing Jobs Back to AmericaEven Apple's Q1 earnings report
column18: where the Apple Watch was noted to have set an ""all-time revenue record"" didn't convince everyone. AAPL didn't spike out any actual number to back that up and the Other division that includes the Apple Watch saw its revenue drop 8% year-over-year.AAPL Wasn't Blowing Smoke About Apple Watch SalesResearch firm Strategy Analytics released itsreport on global smartwatch shipments for Q4
column19: 2016(the period corresponding to AAPL's Q1 2017). In it
column20: global smartwatch sales are shown to have recovered from a slow first half
column21: to mark a 1% increase over 2015. As for the Apple Watch?""Demand for Apple's new Watch Series 2 as a holiday-season gift in Western markets was surprisingly strong and it enabled Apple to clear a large backlog of smartwatch inventory during the quarter.""According to Strategy Analytics
column22: that translated to a record 5.2 million Apple Watch sales in the fourth quarter
column23: up from 5.1 million the previous year. In addition
column24: while AAPL lost ground in the overall smartwatch market in 2016 - dropping to a 55% share compared to over 65% in 2015 by selling 2 million fewer smartwatches on the year - during the holiday quarter
column25: the company captured over 63% of all smartwatch sales.Where Does This Leave AAPL and the Apple Watch?Apple is still the dominant smartwatch maker
column26: and the Apple Watch Series 2 showed the company isn't sitting still. Its overall market share dropped to 55%
column27: but it remains firmly on top.Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Has a New Hero: Services!Second placeSamsung Electronics Co Ltd(OTCMKTS:SSNLF) took a big hit over the holiday quarter
column28: despite releasing a new model of its own
column29: the Gear S3. Samsung's holiday quarter marketshare dropped from 16% to 9.8%
column30: while its overall marketshare for 2016 dropped from 13% to 11.4%. A collection of other manufacturers from Fitbit toLGtook over one third of the market in 2016 (up from 21.6%) showing the increasing diversification of smartwatch sales.The smartwatch market still isn't setting the world on fire
column31: but despite a slow 2016
column32: any reports of its death are greatly exaggerated. And while AAPL is sharing the market with an increasingly diverse group of competitors
column33: Apple Watch sales have not cratered. They were down overall for the year
column34: but Apple maintained a dominant position and the new Apple Watch Series 2 did indeed propel the company to record smartwatch sales over the holidays.As of this writing
column35: Brad Moon did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceIs Nvidia Corporation (NVDA) Ending the Age of Intel (INTC)?Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Steps on Amazon and Google's TurfThe postApple Inc. (AAPL) Smartwatch Is Still Dominant Despite All the Doubtappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Apple Inc. (AAPL) Could Be a Step Closer to Booting Intel From Macs;2/3/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsIt's an idea that has been around for several years now: replace theIntel Corporation(NASDAQ:INTC) chips currently powering Mac computers with ARM chips fromARM Holdings plc (ADR)(NASDAQ:ARMH). Doing so would have many advantages forApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL). According to aBloombergreport
column3: the prospect of ARM CPUs in Macs is getting closer
column4: with AAPL working on a new chip that would independently control a MacBook's low power mode.makeArticleAd();Source: ARM HoldingsWhether you think it's a great idea or a head scratcher
column5: theTouch Baris the tentpole feature of Apple's new MacBook Pro. The Touch Bar is an OLED strip that replaces the laptop's function keys with a programmable touch display
column6: with virtual buttons based on the application currently being run. It also incorporates a fingerprint reader.And the Touch Bar is powered by the T1
column7: Apple's first ARM-based Mac chip.New ARM CPUs in Macs?Bloombergis now reporting thatAAPL engineers are taking the next step toward ARM in Mac
column8: by having the ""Power Nap"" mode controlled by an ARM chip. Power Nap is a feature that lets Mac laptops run basic background functions such as retrieving e-mail and installing software updates
column9: while closed and sleeping. By shifting control of Power Nap from the Intel CPU to an ARM chip
column10: less power is used and MacBook battery would last longer.Why the excitement about the possibility of Apple making a complete switch and replacing Intel processors with ARM CPUs in Macs?ARM in Mac: The PayoffsThere are many compelling reasons
column11: includingthose laid out last yearby theMacObserver. ARM chips power all of Apple's mobile devices
column12: so switching to ARM CPUs in Macs would simplify and unify code development between MacOS and iOS.10 Companies That Are Bringing Jobs Back to AmericaIntel has moved away from tick-tock processor development cycles
column13: so it may not be moving forward fast enough for Apple's needs. Modern
column14: 64-bit ARM processors are becoming competitive with Intel on power
column15: including the power needed to run an operating system like Windows in a virtual environment; therefore
column16: ARM in Mac wouldn't have to mean Macs lose the option to runMicrosoft Corporation's(NASDAQ:MSFT) Windows.Then there's cost. In a post dating back to 2015AppleInsiderbroke down thepotential financial gain should Apple ditch Intel. It estimated the cost of the A-series chips used in the iPhone and iPad at roughly $25
column17: while Intel CPUs used in Macs were somewhere in the $180 to $300 range.The site points to the Apple TV as an example of Apple making the switch. The first generation ran a version of OS X on Intel processors. For the second generation
column18: AAPL switched to an ARM-based A4 chip running iOS. That move shrunk the Apple TV size and knocked the price from $299 to $99. The numbers may have changed a little since then
column19: but the same basic math applies: ARM is considerably cheaper.Will Apple Ditch Intel?There would be many risks in switching to ARM CPUs in Macs. Even if AAPL did make that decision
column20: it would still need Intel CPUs for a number of years while it made the transition across the Mac product line - and Intel would be able to stick it to Apple for those chips. There would be challenges around integrating ARM chips with high-end graphics cards like those made byNvidia Corporation(NASDAQ:NVDA). Other third-party hardware would also require work.Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Has a New Hero: Services!There is also the issue of manufacturing capacity: AAPL's suppliers would need to be able to pick up the slack from Intel and churn out the needed ARM chips.However
column21: as intense as all this sounds
column22: it's worth remembering that AAPL has done it all before. Twice! The company transitioned the entire Mac platform from 68k to PowerPC in 1998
column23: and then from PowerPC to Intel in 2005.ARM CPUs in Macs aren't a reality yet
column24: but with the new ARM chips rumored for MacBooks
column25: it seems as though AAPL is testing the waters. With Nvidia already causing it grief byturning its video cards into high-powered CPU-bustersand Microsoft once again trying for a version ofWindows on ARM processors
column26: Intel has to be watching the ARM in Mac situation with more than a little consternation.As of this writing
column27: Brad Moon did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceMicrosoft Corporation (MSFT) Steps on Amazon and Google's TurfApple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Has a New Hero: Services!The postApple Inc. (AAPL) Could Be a Step Closer to Booting Intel From Macsappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Investors Turned 'Very Bullish' On Tech ETFs In January Amid Earnings;2/3/2017;"[ibd-display-video id=453308]ETF investors bet big on technology stocks ahead of earnings   reports from marquee names in January. Powered by demand for the   iPhone 7 Plus
column2: Apple(AAPL) delivered supersize results on Jan. 31 and saw its shares   soar.Technology was the strongest S&P 500 sector in terms of   flow of money as the new year got underway
column3: according to Sector   SPDRs. Investors last month poured $897.3 million into   Technology Select Sector SDPR (XLK)
column4: the largest and most active exchange traded fund for exposure   to this sector.makeAd('4'
column6: 'mktsnews'
column7: 'vanguard'
column9: '');This marked a significant reversal from 2016
column10: when investors   yanked nearly $900 million from XLK for the year
column11: said   Dan Dolan of Sector SPDRs. Trading activity in XLK so far   this year suggests thatETF   investorsare ""very bullish"" on the technology sector
column12: in his view.""In addition to the flows
column13: the short positions declined by   27%"" in January
column14: Dolan told IBD via email. ""Earnings have been   very good
column15: he pointed out
column16: ""for most of the big names.""Those names includeMicrosoft(MSFT) andIntel(INTC) - tech stalwarts reinventing themselves for a new cloud-driven
column17: Internet of Things era - as well as chipmakersAdvanced Micro Devices(AMD)
column18: Texas Instruments(TXN)
column19: Microsemi(MSCC)
column20: Lam Research(LRCX) andKLA-Tencor(KLAC).Outliers includedAlphabet(GOOGL) andQualcomm(QCOM)
column21: which delivered mixed results.Tech earnings are tracking higher
column23: than the 6.6%   expected at the start of the Q4 season
column24: according to CFRA   Research. And XLK's 4.3% year-to-date gain
column25: vs. 1.8% for SPDR   S&P 500 (SPY)
column26: reflects investors's optimism   about improving industry fundamentals.[ibdchart symbol=""xlk"" type=""daily"" size=""quarter""   position=""leftchart"" ]While earnings season has put technology   companies under a spotlight
column27: the macro outlook is   driving interest too.Technology stocks are expected to benefit from the economic   strength that tends to go hand-in-hand with periods of rising   interest rates.""As business spending picks up
column28: as consumer confidence grows   and consumption increases
column29: tech companies will be the   beneficiaries of those trends
column30: said Todd Rosenbluth
column31: director of   ETF research at CFRA. Other tailwinds include the promise of   corporate tax reform and repatriation of foreign cash under   President Trump
column32: which disproportionately benefits the tech   sector
column33: Rosenbluth pointed out.Apple CFO Luca Maestri noted   at Tuesday's earnings call that 94% of   his company's record $246.1 billion cash pile is stashed   abroad. Under a Trump proposal
column34: the iPhone   maker could potentially bring home foreign earnings at   a special tax rate of 10%
column35: instead of up to 35%. That tax holiday   could be one of the single biggest catalysts for the sector going   forward
column36: CFRA analysts say.Risks to the sector include the uncertainty surrounding   Trump's vision for economic renewal
column37: the crimp that a   strengthening dollar could put on global IT spending
column38: and the   onslaught of low-cost rivals such as Huawei in key foreign   markets.Investors who remain bullish on the sector's outlook have four   dozen ETFs to choose from. Many of the new launches make   extremely focused bets in extremely small industry niches -   3D printing or Big Data or wearable devices
column39: for example.In Rosenbluth's view
column40: most investors would do well to stick   with a technology ETF offering broadly diversified exposure to   the sector
column41: and to then layer on thematic ETFs in   specific tech industries.Investors have been seeking diversification. Two tech   ETFs far outpaced their peers last year by gathering more   than $1 billion apiece in fresh assets
column42: and both hold a   broad basket of tech stocks. But they take markedly different   approaches to investing in the sector.Vanguard Information Technology (VGT) tracks a   market-cap-weighted index of U.S. tech companies
column43: including more small- and microcap stocks than most other   broad tech ETFs. It invests $10.75 billion in assets across 366   stocks for an extremely low 0.10% expense ratio.First Trust Nasdaq-100 Tech Sector (QTEC) follows an   equal-weighted index of Nasdaq-listed U.S. technology stocks. It   has virtually no exposure to small- and microcap stocks
column44: but has   a significant midcap stake. At 0.60%
column45: its expense ratio is among   the highest in the segment.Investors should be aware that ETFs may sound alike   but offer very different exposures
column46: which affects their   performance
column47: Rosenbluth says.QTEC rose 25% in 2016
column48: nearly double the gains of its   Vanguard peer. It benefited in part from its extreme overweight   to the semiconductor industry.Looking ahead
column49: Rosenbluth believes VGT may benefit more than   other broad-based peers from an improving U.S. economy
column50: given its larger stake in smaller tech companies.XLK and VGT made a 52-week high on thestock marketon Jan. 27.RELATED:High-Yield Strategy Uses 10 ETFs To Deliver     All-Weather Income With Low Risk7 Best ETFs For Your Growth And Income Needs As     Trump Takes The Wheel"

column1: Warning: Don’t Sell Nvidia Corporation (NVDA) Stock Short!;2/2/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsNvidia Corporation(NASDAQ:NVDA)
column3: whose shares spiked 224% in 2016
column4: has been lethal for short sellers. They lost a stunning$4.4 billion. And yes
column5: it will probably still be bad for them to continue with their bearish bets on NVDA stock for the new year.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockNow short sellers are some of the world's best investors. If anything
column6: they have to since the consequences of being wrong are so great! After all
column7: a win for a short seller is if the stock goes to zero - which rarely happens. But as seen with Nvidia shares
column8: the downside can be horrific.The irony is that short positions can provide tremendous fuel for price appreciation. Keep in mind that short sellers need to buy back shares to close out their positions.Something else to keep in mind: It's generally not a good strategy to take a short position merely because the valuation is excessive. There are many examples of companies - likeMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) in the 1980s and 1990s
column9: orAmazon.com
column10: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN) during the past decade - that have sustained long bull runs. Wall Street is more than willing to place premiums on firms that can grow fast and with consistency.As for NVDA stock
column11: the valuation is definitely pricey. Consider that the forward price-earnings ratio is roughly at 42! By comparison
column12: Intel Corporation(NASDAQ:INTC) trades at 12.5 andQualcomm
column13: Inc.(NASDAQ:QCOM) sports a multiple of 11.10 Stocks to Buy That Already Make America GreatBut
column14: of course
column15: NVDA is growing at breakneck speed. So over time the multiples will normalize as the earnings continue to build up. For example
column16: in the latest quarter
column17: Nvidia reporteda sizzling 54% spike in revenuesto $2 billion and GAAP earnings came to 83 cents a share
column18: up 89%.The thing to keep in mind is that Nvidia is positioned nicely to benefit from various megatrends
column19: which should provide lots of room for growth. The company's deep experience with graphics processing units (GPUs)
column20: which allow for intensive computations
column21: is becoming the elixir for cloud computing
column22: artificial intelligence
column23: virtual reality
column24: self-driving cars and gaming. All these markets are massive and on the verge of major changes.For example
column25: according to a recentpresentationfrom Nvidia
column26: the market opportunity for autos alone is at least $10 billion. And the company may be in the best position to benefit. The company has built a full platform for so-called AI car computing - called Nvidia Drive PX 2 - that uses high-performance chips and software to detect surroundings as well as determine optimal routes. Actually
column27: there are over80 automakers that use the system
column28: includingTesla Motors Inc(NASDAQ:TSLA).At the core of all of Nvidia's advantages in various large markets is the company's focus on AI. For the most part
column29: GPUs have proven adept at this type of advanced computing
column30: which allow for trillions of deep learning transactions per second. The result is that a system can quickly adapt and learn. So
column31: this means a self-driving car will know where to turn or stop. Or it could mean that a corporate cloud system has the ability to understand important trends or risks.According toInvestorPlace'sBrad Moon:""Because the GPU is designed for one primary purpose - everything including computer graphics boils down to crunching numbers - NVDA is able to produce them at far lower cost than a CPU at an equivalent performance level
column32: while producing less heat and using less power.""Great
column33: right? Definitely.Valeant Pharmaceuticals Intl Inc (VRX) Has Only a Little Time LeftYet
column34: this does not necessarily mean that the NVDA stock price will continue to rack up three-digit returns for years to come. No doubt
column35: there will be lots of volatility. But again
column36: when a company is at the forefront of tidal changes in technologies
column37: taking a long-term bet often leads to nice market-beating returns.Tom Taulli runs the InvestorPlace blogIPO Playbookand is a registered investment adviser representative (you canvisit his siteto learn more about his financial planning services).He is also the author of various books on investing like All About Commodities
column38: All About Short Selling and High-Profit IPO Strategies.Follow him on Twitter at@ttaulli. As of this writing
column39: he did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace5 Safe Dividend Stocks to Buy for Retirement7 Stocks to Buy That Could Double by 2018The postWarning: Don't Sell Nvidia Corporation (NVDA) Stock Short!appeared first onInvestorPlace."
