column1: The Cloud Drives Technology Stocks This Quarter;1/27/2017;"Analysts and experts have talked at length about the importance of cloud computing and how it would transform the technology sector. But the sense of waiting that underpinned such discussions is now giving way to a sense of arrival.Several factors are making cloud computing a reality today
column2: the most important of which are an awareness of the resultant cost reductions
column3: awareness of the economic value of processing ever-increasing volumes of data
column4: and recognition of the advantages of sharing resources and having anytime anywhere access to data and information.Of course
column5: along with all these advantages comes concerns related to privacy and security
column6: which have been further exacerbated by government snooping
column7: gag orders and orders to turn over data in private individual devices or in servers on foreign soil that have in turn made individuals and corporations wary about adopting the cloud.But technology companies are fighting it out. MicrosoftMSFTfor one has strongly resisted government demands as have AppleAAPLand AmazonAMZN. Alphabet'sGOOGLGoogle has also been vocal in its opposition. It makes perfect sense when you consider that these are some of the biggest cloud computing stocks that also offer computing and other devices. So they have vested interests at both ends of the networks.Other players with similar interests are chip makers like IntelINTC
column8: NVIDIANVDA
column9: Qualcomm and Advanced Micro DevicesAMD; networking companies like Cisco and Juniper; and software/service companies like IBM and Oracle.Here's a brief glimpse of three cloud companies that just reported December quarter results:IntelIntel's results this quarter were driven by both the PC and data center businesses. The PC strength was seasonal and unlikely to be sustained.Although non-volatile memory had the strongest growth rate of 24.8% and will grow even stronger this year
column10: it currently contributes a lower share of revenue
column11: which equates to fewer incremental dollars. Also
column12: the business is poised to benefit from Intel's strength in the server market.Data center revenue growth of 8% year over year was helped by platform volume growth of 3% and platform price increase of 4%. Intel has new products in the pipeline and will also be integrating some technology it acquired through Altera
column13: so this year may be less disappointing than the last when enterprise softness skewed expectations.MicrosoftMicrosoft has become a cloud-focused company
column14: impressing analysts and investors alike. The company is making the most of legacy workloads that use its software and its all-new Windows OS
column15: while leveraging Office productivity software and enterprise relationships to post record growth in cloud revenue.The company reported solid cloud results
column16: with Azure revenue growing 93% (95% in constant currency) and compute usage doubling year over year. Its cloud productivity business also saw strong growth: Office 365 commercial revenue grew 47% (49% in constant currency) with seat growth of 37% and monthly active iOS and Android devices more than doubling to 65 million
column17: Office 365 consumer revenue grew 22% (21% in constant currency) with seat growth of 20.9%.Dynamics 365 paid seats also more than doubled. Nadella promised commercial cloud annualized revenue runrate of $20.0 billion in 2018 and last quarter's $14.0 billion means that Microsoft is definitely on track to beat or exceed the target.AlphabetAlphabet doesn't break out its cloud revenue separately although independent market research data indicates that it is well behind market leader Amazon and even runners up Microsoft. In fact after the December quarter results some analysts have started saying that Microsoft has also started pulling away from the pack in its chase of Amazon.Alphabet's growth should not be discounted however because while cloud and hardware are lumped together right now
column18: its common knowledge that most of its new hardware has been unavailable for a lot of the time. So the 62% growth in this segment seems to be less on account of hardware sales and more of an indication of strength it is seeing in the cloud.CFO Ruth Porat has said that cloud
column19: hardware and YouTube subscriptions will be ""major revenue drivers for Google in the next several years."" This will of course require capital investment
column20: something the company can afford given the way the search business continues to rake in cash. Capex was around $3.08 billion last quarter
column21: that's nearly up by a billion dollars and will mostly be spent on data centers to support its cloud business.Now See Our Private Investment IdeasWhile the above ideas are being shared with the public
column22: other trades are hidden from everyone but selected members. Would you like to peek behind the curtain and view them? Starting today

You can even look inside portfolios so exclusive that they are normally closed to new investors.Click here for Zacks' secret trades >>Want the latest recommendations from Zacks Investment Research? column1: VMware (VMW) Earnings
column2: Revenues Beat Estimates in Q4;1/27/2017;"VMware
column3: Inc.VMWreported better-than-expected fourth-quarter 2016 results. Adjusted earnings of $1.11 surpassed the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $1.08. Revenues of $2.03 billion also topped the consensus mark of $1.99 billion.On a year-over-year basis
column4: revenues grew 8.8% driven by its innovative product offerings like NSX
column5: AirWatch
column6: vSphere
column7: vSAN and vCloud Air Networkalong with strategic partnership with the likes of Amazon Web Services.The company's hybrid cloud and SaaS offerings continued to grow in the fourth quarter and contributed about 8% of the total revenue.Quarter DetailsRevenues from services rose 9.8% year over year to $1.145 billion driven by strength in both its sub-segments.License revenues increased 7.5% year over year to $887 million.The company reported non-GAAP operating income of $747 million quarter
column8: an increase of 14% year over year. Non-GAAP operating margin was 36.8%Other Financial DetailsVMware exited the quarter with cash and cash equivalents (including short-term investments) of $7.985 billion compared with $7.509 billion as on Dec 31
column9: 2015. For the fiscal
column10: operating cash flow came in at $2.38 billion and free cash flow was $2.23 billion.For the quarter
column11: the company reported operating cash flow of $463 million. Free cash flow was $419 million.Also
column12: the company announced a new share buyback program under which it will repurchase $1.2 billion worth of shares through fiscal 2018.Vmware
column13: Inc. Price
column14: Consensus and EPS SurpriseVmware
column15: Inc. Price

QuoteGuidanceVMWare provided its guidance for the first quarter and updated its outlook for fiscal 2017.For first-quarter 2018 the company expects revenues to range between $1.675 billion to $1.725 billion while License revenues are expected in a bracket of $590 million to $620 million. Non-GAAP earnings per share are expected to be in a range of 93 cents to 96 cents per share. Non-GAAP operating margin is expected to be 28.2%.For the full year
column18: revenues are expected to be $7.570 billion while License revenues are expected to be $2.970 billion
column19: up 6% year over year. Non-GAAP operating margin is expected to be 32.3%. Non GAAP earnings per share are expected to be $4.87. Capex is expected to be $260 million. Operating cash flow and free cash flow for the fiscal are expected to be $2.65 billion and $2.39 billion.Transition DetailsAs declared earlier
column20: from Feb 4 onward
column21: VMWare's calendar will be aligned with Dell's fiscal 2018 calendar wherein its first quarter will be from Feb 4 to May 5
column22: 2017. The company will report the results of the transition period in the first 10Q of fiscal 2018.The new company called Dell Technologies holds approximately 80% of VMware shares
column23: which were earlier held by its parent EMC.Our TakeVMware remains one of the leading companies in the virtualization and cloud computing market.  The company's innovative product pipeline and robust international sales are expected to drive overall results. Additionally
column24: the company continues to make strategic acquisitions and ink partnerships with the likes of Amazon.com Inc'sAMZN
column25: AWS and International Business Machines CorporationIBM. These will likely drive long-term growth for the company.Despite these
column26: the company has been seeing weakness in its core business for a while. In order to overcome it
column27: the company is offering newly developed cloud services like vCloud Air and vCloud Air Network along with its offerings like NSX
column28: AirWatch
column29: virtual SAN
column30: and VxRail
column31: which continue to aid the company. The vCloud Air Network revenues witnessed 35% growth
column32: thereby aiding of hybrid cloud and SaaS revenues. However
column33: rising competition from players like MicrosoftMSFTremains a concern.In the last one year

column1: Samsung (SSNLF) Expected to Launch Galaxy S8 on March 29;1/27/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsWith the official Galaxy Note 7 battery review out of the way
column3: everyone has been waiting forSamsung Electronics Co Ltd(OTCMKTS:SSNLF) to release the new Galaxy S8. Samsung still isn't saying anything
column4: but clues have been building that it will be later than normal. NowVentureBeatsays it has the first photos of the elusive smartphone as well as an exact Galaxy S8 launch date.makeArticleAd();Source: SamsungSamsung's well-publicized disaster with the Galaxy Note 7 had a big ripple effect on the Galaxy S8.First
column5: the company had to identify - without question - what had caused Galaxy Note 7 batteries to burst into flames. Then it had to pinpoint a fail-safe solution to the problem. After that
column6: it had to hold an event where it publicly reviewed its findings and outlined the steps it had taken to ensure it never happens again. Thatevent took place last week.Galaxy S8 Launch Pushed Back by Battery ConcernsAs part of the battery investigation
column7: Samsung also had to take measures to ensure the Galaxy S8 would not have similar problems
column8: and that would have involved delayed finalization of the battery and related components. And you can bet the company has taken testing of the battery on its new flagship smartphone to new levels.As a result
column9: it seemed likely the Galaxy S8 launch date would be pushed from it's traditional Mobile World Congress unveiling in February. Samsung confirmed this during last week's event.7 Stocks to Buy That Could Double by 2018The Guardian
column10: citing anonymous sources close to Samsung
column11: pointed to alate March release date. Yesterday
column12: VentureBeat'sEvan Blassclaimed to have specifics
column13: saying the Galaxy S8 launch will take place at a Samsung Unpacked event in New York City on March 29.Galaxy S8 DetailsTheVentureBeatreport also includes many technical details about SSNLF's new flagship handset(s)
column14: including photos.As has been speculated
column15: it appears that this year both Galaxy S8 smartphones will feature a curved ""Edge"" Super AMOLED display
column16: but both will also lose the Home button so nearly the entire front is display - the camera remains at top. As a result
column17: even though the overall dimensions stay roughly the same
column18: both new smartphones will have larger displays than the Galaxy Note 7: 5.8-inches and 6.2-inches.The fingerprint sensor has been moved to the back
column19: and high tech biometrics are supplemented by an iris scanner. The charge port is the new USB-C standard
column20: base storage moves to 64GB (with SD card expansion still offered) and unlikeApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL)
column21: Samsung will reportedly keep the headphone jack.By connecting to an optional dock
column22: the Galaxy S8 will be able to be used as an Android computer. And it will feature Bixby
column23: theadvanced AI personal assistantSamsung gained when it purchased Viv in October.Apple Inc. New iPads Might Be Late to the Party (AAPL)Interestingly
column24: VentureBeatsays the price of both models - which it says will go on sale April 21 - will be €100 (roughly $100) more than last year's models.The Importance of the Galaxy S8 LaunchIt can't be understated how critical this release is to SSNLF. After recalling 3 million Galaxy Note 7s'
column25: its reputation took a serious blow. Apple will be pulling out all the stops with the iPhone 8 later this year
column26: as it celebrates the iPhone's 10th anniversary and mounts a major campaign to convince upgraders.Alphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column27: NASDAQ:GOOGL) released its first Google-branded smartphone in the Pixel Phone at the height of the Galaxy Note 7 debacle
column28: and a follow-up is expected this year.Both rivals will be gunning to boost sales at Samsung's expense.In the last quarterly sales report (from the end of October)
column29: Samsung's smartphone sales marketshare haddropped 13.5%compared to the previous year. The next quarter's numbers could be even worse. If the Galaxy S8 launch flops
column30: Samsung's time at the top of the smartphone sales charts would likely be over.As of this writing
column31: Brad Moon did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace3 Things Apple Inc. (AAPL) MUST Do to Soar in 2017Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Steps on Amazon and Google's TurfThe postSamsung (SSNLF) Expected to Launch Galaxy S8 on March 29appeared first onInvestorPlace."

column2: 000: How Much Should You Worry?;1/27/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsTheDow Jones Industrial Averagefinally broke above the 20
column4: 000 level Wednesday
column5: which has no fundamental or technical meaning
column6: but it's an interesting benchmark. The only real message from the new record is that traders continue to bet on the so-called ""Trump rally.""makeArticleAd();The gains in the market aren't just based on expectations for spending
column7: tax cuts and deregulation from the Republican congress and administration. Growth in earnings has been strong even when adjusted for the one-off windfalls in the financial sector. This quarter's year-over-year growth rate will likely hit expectations for a 5% gain.The real question isn't whether there is continued improvement in the economy
column8: but whether asset prices have gotten ahead of those reasonable estimates. Investors must be worried that evidence that the gap between asset values and what we actually know about the Trump administration's plans is probably widening too much.As you can see in the next chart
column9: the adjusted price-earnings ratio (blue line) is above its 2008 highs. In fact
column10: besides the ""dot-com"" bubble of the late 1990s
column11: the adjusted P/E ratio hasn't been higher since ""Black Tuesday"" in the early 20th century.The 3 Best Sector ETFs to Buy for a Profitable 2017Traders should be careful
column12: however
column13: not to try and derive a timing signal from this ratio. What it really means is that future growth expectations are extremely elevated
column14: which have historically been disappointed.S&P 500 P/E ratio (blue line) versus SPDR S&P 500 ETF (orange line)The reason we care about this measure is that is helps us to understand whether expectations may be gapping away from what we actually know or can reasonably estimate about the future
column15: which creates higher levels of risk. It's certainly not the case that the Trump administration can't help the economy
column16: but usually government intervention takes a long time to come to fruition
column17: and congress hasn't been that good at ""picking winners"" in the past.Who is at risk? The fact remains that changes to international trade relationships carry uncertain risks. The Dow hit its new benchmark mostly becauseBoeing Co(NYSE:BA) reported earnings above expectations.However
column18: one-third of the company's revenue and 40% of its backlog are international customers. This quarter's earnings were really great
column19: but can that continue if reciprocal trade protection strategies are deployed in Asia
column20: North America and Europe?Should You Buy Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock? 3 Pros
column21: 3 ConsMost of the risks posed by the gap between current expectations and what we actually ""know"" don't translate very well into timing signals. Instead
column22: what we can anticipate is that volatility will probably remain relatively high. This is not a bad thing for option traders.Wider price swings are frustrating when they move against us
column23: but the potential for bigger
column24: faster gains in our favor should offset that issue. The breakout in theS&P 500this week is legitimate. However
column25: the likelihood that the trend will hit its price target this quarter is low.InvestorPlace advisors John Jagerson and S. Wade Hansen

column1: Tech ETFs to Watch Post Microsoft & Alphabet Results;1/27/2017;"After the closing bell on Thursday
column2: a couple of tech biggest players like MicrosoftMSFTand AlphabetGOOGLreported their quarterly results. While Microsoft beat our estimates on earnings
column3: Alphabet missed. Meanwhile
column4: both tech titans topped our revenue estimates. This has put spotlight on technology ETFs for the coming days.makeAd('4'
column6: 'mktsnews'
column7: 'vanguard'
column9: '');Let's take a quick look on the major details of their earnings releases:Microsoft Earnings at A GlanceEarnings per share for fiscal second-quarter 2017 came in at 83 cents
column10: easily outpacing the Zacks Consensus Estimate of 79 cents and improving 9% from the year-ago quarter. Revenues rose 2% year over year to $26.07 billion topping our estimate of $25.2 billion.The outperformance was credited to continued strength in the cloud business
column11: particularly Azure
column12: whose sales grew 93% from the year-ago period
column13: as well as a stabilizing personal-computer market. Investors should note that Microsoft's total cloud business brought in about $6.86 billion in the fiscal second quarter and is on track to reach $20 billion in fiscal 2018.This clearly shows that Satya Nadella's efforts of turning around the business
column14: and focusing on cloud services and mobile applications are paying off and bode well for the company's future growth (read:5 ETF Investment Ideas for 2017).Following the results
column15: shares of the world's largest software maker rose 1.43% in after-market hours on elevated volumes. Currently
column16: Microsoft carries a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) with a top VGM Style Score of A
column17: suggesting that it is poised to outperform in the days ahead.Alphabet Earnings at A GlanceSearch engine kingpin Alphabet reported earnings per share of $7.56 in the fourth quarter
column18: well below the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $7.65. Revenues increased 22% year over year to $21.2 billion and outpaced our estimate of $20.6 billion.Fast-growing cloud-computing business and booming YouTube video advertising were behind the robust revenue performance. Aggregate paid clicks rose 36% year over year while cost per click dropped 15%.Given weaker-than-expected fourth-quarter earnings
column19: Alphabet's shares tanked 2.5% in after-hours trading on elevated volumes. However

column12: on both Alphabet'sGOOGLPlay Store and Apple Inc.'sAAPLiOS store. Per media reports

column16: the denial stemmed from the fact that South Korea remains concerned about its national security. It doesn't share warm ties with its neighbor

column18: add media reports.It remains unknown how Niantic

column21: add media reports. Niantic chose to remain silent on this issue during the press conference it held in Seoul on Jan 23

They'll enable us to experience completely new things and be more creative than ever before. Hugo is going to help build that future

column1: Amgen
column2: Inc. (AMGN) Stock Is a Bet on Fatter Yields;1/27/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsAmgen Inc.(NASDAQ:AMGN)
column4: the largest of the so-called biotech stocks
column5: is a very fat company with enormous margins and middling growth.makeArticleAd();Source:Richard Masoner via FlickrIt is the kind of company conservative brokers stick in a client's portfolio knowing it's safe. With a 3% yield
column6: it's almost a bond. Over the last five years
column7: its capital gains of 122% have exceeded those of the NASDAQ
column9: but not by an enormous amount.Writers like our James Brumleytalk breathlessly about Amgen's court cases concerning ""biosimilars
column10: drugs that mimic the work of patented medicines but are made in a different way. But AMGN stock can win no matter how the courts rule.Whether you
column11: as a self-directed investor
column12: want a piece of Amgen depends on your goals. If you want growth
column13: you may want to take a pass. If you want yield
column14: you may want in.Eyes on the Amgen DividendAmgen is due to report its 2016 numbers on Feb. 2
column15: and analysts are expecting the usual roughly 5% growth on both the top-line and bottom line. For the quarter
column16: that means almost $2.1 billion in earnings
column17: $2.78 per share
column18: and revenues of $5.73 billion.The 7 Best High-Yield Investments for RetirementThis means Amgen is bringing over 30% of revenue to the net income line
column19: with mid-single-digit growth. Operating margins are approaching 50%
column20: and management has used that money to reduce debt slightly - about 41% of assets are under debt currently.What you should be looking at is the dividend
column21: which looks ordinary at $1.15 per share
column22: a current 3% yield
column23: but has been growing like gangbusters since it was instituted in 2011 at about 28 cents. If you got in back in 2012
column24: when the stock was at around $70
column25: you're now getting a yield of 6.6%
column26: a yield covered nearly three times by earnings. For a dividend investor
column27: that's a home run.Knowing that AMGN stock management has been hiking the dividend steadily regardless of earnings fluctuations should give you confidence that today's slim yield could easily be tomorrow's fat one.The only question is whether the five-year pattern repeats.AMGN Stock's Patent StoryThis is where the patent story comes into play.Drug companies are all about patents
column28: and Amgen is no different. If you have taken Enbrel for arthritis
column29: or a relative has been given Neulasta to treat side effects of cancer chemotherapy
column30: or your mother has taken Prolia to prevent bone fractures
column31: you're a customer.But all patented medicines are threatened - or rather
column32: their fat monopoly profits and margins are threatened - by biosimilars
column33: drugs that mimic the action of patented medicines but are different enough to merit a separate patent.AMGN stock recently got a biosimilar fromRegeneron Pharmaceuticals Inc(NASDAQ:REGN)pulled from the market
column34: but it is also in court fighting for a biosimilar to Humira fromAbbvie Inc(NASDAQ:ABBV). As Brumley notes
column35: Amgen is also fighting a biosimilar to Neupogen fromNovartis AG (ADR)(NYSE:NVS).If courts rule for biosimilars
column36: the margins on many drugs could be under long-term threat. If courts rule against them
column37: the biosimilar pipelines of many companies
column38: including Amgen
column39: could also be under threat. But take the word threat here with a grain of salt. AMGN stock is playing both sides of the game
column40: and will likely win either way.Should You Buy Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock? 3 Pros
column41: 3 ConsThe bottom line thus remains the same. You buy Amgen if you believe the dividend can keep growing
column42: making today's yield fatter tomorrow. You buy Amgen as part of a diversified portfolio
column43: if you want safe exposure to the biotech field.Then
column44: once you buy it
column45: ignore analyses like this one. Just put it away and leave it alone for five years. You should do OK.Dana Blankenhornis a financial and technology journalist. He is the author of the sci-fi novellaInto the Cloud
column46: available at the Amazon Kindle store. Write him atdanablankenhorn@gmail.comor follow him on Twitter at@danablankenhorn. As of this writing he owned no shares in companies mentioned in this article.More From InvestorPlace10 Stocks to Buy to Survive a ""Trumpsy-Turvy"" 201710 High-Yield Dividend Stocks That Are SOMEHOW Still BargainsThe postAmgen
column47: Inc. (AMGN) Stock Is a Bet on Fatter Yieldsappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: International Business Machines Corp. Is Back! (IBM);1/27/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsWorking forInternational Business Machines Corp.(IBM) was the dream of many students in my business school. A job with the world's leading high-tech company was far and away the most popular goal of both the graduate and undergraduate students.makeArticleAd();The talk was always very positive about the disciplined environment
column3: the uniform of a dark suit
column4: crisp white shirt
column5: sober looking tie
column6: the respect from others
column7: and of course the relatively high pay for their sales representatives. When this company would visit the campus for career day interviews
column8: it was insane. Everyone jockeyed to look their best and get an interview.Perhaps best known for their work in the very early days of the personal computer
column9: ""Big Blue"" is sometimes credited with its invention
column10: a disputed fact. But one thing is for sure: they certainly popularized the PC.The world changed on August 12
column11: 1981; the company announced the personal computer with the unheard-of price tag of $1
column12: 565. Just twenty years earlier
column13: machines with similar capabilities could cost millions of dollars
column14: demanded an entire office building floor
column15: and required a large staff to maintain.This initial mass-produced PC was powered by an Intel 8088 microprocessor running at speeds measured in millionths of a second. It was the size of a portable typewriter and contained 40K of read-only memory and 16K of user memory
column16: as well as a built-in speaker for creating sounds. Its five expansion slots could be used to connect such features as expanded memory
column17: display and printing units
column18: and game ""paddles.""Although this $158 billion market-cap bruiser remains one the Dow's 30 stocks
column19: it is no longer known as an innovator. In fact
column20: many investors consider IBM to be a washed-up giant
column21: worthwhile only for to its 3%-plus dividend and index credentials.But that's all about to change. IBM is repositioning itself on the cutting-edge
column22: with plans to have five life-changing innovations released within the next five years.The 10 Best Stocks to Buy for 2017: The Experts' PicksInternally called 5 in 5
column23: this initiative will not only change our lives
column24: but it may also supercharge the share price over the same time frame.Innovation 1: Making The Invisible VisibleIBM plans to make the invisible visible by focusing artificial intelligence on cognitive health. The goal is to analyze physical signals such as speech patterns to reveal neurological diseases such as Alzheimer's. This will enable medical professionals to take pre-emptive measures to help treat diseases before the more easily observable visible symptoms arise.Innovation 2: Superhero VisionThe company is also using AI to create hyper-powerful imaging devices. Just like the comic book heroes
column25: the technology will help humans see widely beyond the domain of visible light by combining multiple bands of the electromagnetic spectrum. Most interestingly from the investor and consumer point of view
column26: these devices will be portable
column27: affordable
column28: and accessible to everyone.Innovation 3: The MacroscopeIBM's Macroscrope project will organize and quantify vast and complex data gathered by billions of devices within the range of our vision and understanding. It is a system of software and algorithms to bring all of Earth's complex data together.Simply stated
column29: this tool or system will digitize the physical world by gathering trillions of data points produced by the internet of things. IBM states that there are already more than six billion connected devices generating tens of exabytes (billion gigabytes) of data per month
column30: with a growth rate of more than 30% per year.Innovation 4: Medical Lab On A ChipThis device
column31: like Star Trek's medical tricorder
column32: would be a portable and capable of diagnosing any disease. However
column33: IBM's goal is to shrink the system down to a single silicon chip that would contain all of the processes necessary to analyze an illness that would today require a full-scale biochemistry lab. IBM scientists are developing lab-on-a-chip nanotechnology that can separate and isolate bioparticles down to 20 nanometers in diameter
column34: a scale that gives access to DNA
column35: viruses
column36: and exosomes.Innovation 5: Real-Time Pollution DetectionImagine being able to instantly know that there is a leak in a pipeline or energy plant. IBM is developing affordable sensing technologies that can be deployed near natural gas extraction wells
column37: around storage facilities
column38: and along distribution pipelines will enable the industry to pinpoint invisible leaks in real time. This technology has the potential to work wonders in helping to save the environment.Should You Buy Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock? 3 Pros
column39: 3 ConsRisks To Consider:IBM has high goals and the resources to reach them. However
column40: it remains speculative what objectives will be achieved and in what time frame. Investors need to understand that every stock market investment has risk no matter how seductive it appears.Action To Take:Enter long under $180.00 per share with an upside target of $220.00. Initial stops are suggested at $162.50 per share.Editor's Note:America'smost successful tech investorsare getting ready to make MILLIONS off 2017's virtual reality breakthroughs.But they're not investing in what you think…StreetAuthority's mission is to help individual investors earn above-average profits by providing a source of independent
column41: unbiased - and most of all
column42: profitable - investing ideas. Unlike traditional publishers
column43: StreetAuthority doesn't simply regurgitate the latest stock market news. Instead
column44: we provide in-depth research
column45: plus specific investment ideas and immediate action to take based on the latest market events. Visit us atStreetAuthority.com.More From InvestorPlace10 Dividend Growth Stocks That Simply Print Money10 Stocks to Buy for Donald Trump's Second WindThe postInternational Business Machines Corp. Is Back! (IBM)appeared first onInvestorPlace."

column2: Beats Revenues;1/27/2017;"AlphabetGOOGLfourth-quarter earnings of $7.56 missed the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $7.65 due to higher taxes. However
column3: earnings were up 7.1% year over year.Following weaker-than-expected earnings
column4: shares were down more than 2% in after-hours trading. Higher cost of revenue and steeper taxes impacted the quarter's earnings.Coming to the price performance
column5: over the past one year
column6: shares of Alphabet have been steadily treading higher. The stock returned 19.43% compared with the Zacks categorizedInternet Servicesindustry's gain of 19.39%.On the Other Bets side
column7: most of the businesses included in it are in their early stages. However
column8: it is gradually picking up. Management said that Nest
column9: Fiber and Verily were revenue contributors in the fourth quarter.The main drivers of the Google business haven't changed. Pricing remains under pressure both on account of the ongoing FX concerns as well as continued strength in mobile and TrueView. Volumes are however encouraging as total paid click growth of 36% remains a reassuring number.Google continues to enjoy strength on the mobile platform. One of the drivers is Accelerated Mobile Pages (AMP). This is being accepted by many publishers and sites around the world covering more than 700
column10: 000 domains. Management is focused on driving mobile experiences and the company is well positioned to pick up strong intent-to-buy signals as a result of studying mobile searches from its huge data base. As a result

column13: reflecting the ongoing momentum in the business.The company has greater control on the browser through Android as well as distribution agreements with Apple (AAPL). But the upcoming threats shouldn't be ignored. Apple may not renew its agreement

column19: Chrome and Daydream continue to help it draw more users and sell more ads.The Numbers in DetailRevenuesGross total revenue of $26.06 billion grew 16.1% sequentially and 22.2% year over year (up 24% in constant currency or CC). column20: with the ongoing strength in YouTube. Also

column30: while that from partner sites increased 18.7% resulting in a total advertising revenue growth of 13.0%.Google-owned sitesand partner sites grew 20.3% and 7.0%

TrueView and DoubleClick Bid Manager were the primary drivers of YouTube revenue although app promotions are becoming bigger contributors.The traditional AdSense benefited from strength in programmatic and AdMob

column1: Microsoft Finishes 2016 Strong;1/26/2017;"During fourth-quarter 2016
column2: Microsoft Corp.(MSFT) reported net income of $5.2 billion and diluted earnings per share of 66 cents on an as-reported basis. Adjusting for Windows 10 revenue deferrals
column3: net income increased to $6.515 billion while earnings per share climbed to 83 cents. Both performance figures outperformed comparative values for fourth-quarter 2015
column4: suggesting Microsoft had a strong final quarter of 2016 and expects a good financial outlook for 2017.Brief summary of earnings reportFor the three months ending Dec. 31
column6: Microsoft reported revenue of $24.1 billion and operating income of $6.2 billion based on generally accepted accounting principles. These figures represent a year-over-year increase of 1% and 3% respectively. GAAP net income increased 4% year-over-year while GAAP earnings per share climbed 6% year-over-year.makeArticleAd();CEO Satya Nadella praised the company for delivering good value and opportunities as Microsoft ""partners with [their customers] through [the customers'] digital transformation."" Artificial intelligence (AI) advancements further provides opportunities for the company to drive growth in the Microsoft Cloud.The AI advancements contributed to higher Intelligent Cloud revenues
column7: which increased to $6.9 billion during the quarter. Double-digit annuity revenue growth increased cloud services revenues
column8: and Microsoft Azure revenues sharply increased as the number of Azure users doubled year-over-year.Productivity and Business Products revenues increased to $7.4 billion during Microsoft's fiscal second-quarter 2017 as office commercial products
column9: office consumer products and dynamic products increased 5%
column10: 22% and 7% respectively as the number of Office 365 customers increased to 24.9 million.LinkedIn Corp.(NYSE:LNKD) added $228 million in revenue for the period beginning Dec. 8
column12: the closing date of the acquisition.Company has strong financial outlookThe Washington-based software company has afinancial strength rankof 6 and aprofitability rankof 8
column13: both suggesting a strong financial outlook for early 2017. The company'soperating margin
column14: net marginand return on equity outperform over 85% of global infrastructure companies. Microsoft's Piotroski F-score ranks 6 out of 9
column15: and its Altman Z-score of 3.37 suggests the company seldom faces financial distress.Chief Financial Officer Amy Hood cherished the company's fiscal second-quarter results
column16: observing ""strong demand for [Microsoft's] cloud-based services"" and good long-term growth strategy execution. The company returned $6.5 billion to shareholders in share repurchases and dividends during the quarter
column17: contributing to high share-buyback ratios and trailing dividend yields. The former outperforms 92% of competitors while the latter ranks in the top 1% of global infrastructure companies.During fourth-quarter 2016
column18: three gurus expanded their positions in Microsoft. Spiros Segalas (Trades
column19: Portfolio) increased his position 32.04%
column20: adding 3
column22: 268 shares at an average price of $60.15. Manning & Napier Advisors Inc. added 3.53% while Ken Fisher (Trades
column23: Portfolio) tacked on 0.43%.On Jan. 26
column24: Microsoft's stock price closed at $64.27 per share
column25: increasing about 0.93% from its previous close of $63.52.Disclosure:No postion in the stocks mentioned.Start afree 7-day trial of Premium Membershipto GuruFocus.Premium MembersThis article first appeared onGuruFocus."

column1: Why a Toy Maker and a Coffee Company are Pushing Virtual Assistants;1/26/2017;"By now we have all seen demonstrations of the practicality of   thevirtual personal assistant. The biggest tech companies have made daily requests like   directions
column2: internet searches
column3: and local restaurants commonplace
column4: but companies likeMicrosoft(NASDAQ: MSFT) aren't the only ones playing in the virtual   assistant space -- plenty of other smaller players are   incorporating the tech into their existing offerings to keep with   the times and avoid being left behind.Virtual assistants at a tipping point.  Image source:   Pixabay.makeArticleAd();Aristotle virtual assistant for children. Image source:     Mattel.Virtual babysitter?Not to be outdone by big tech
column5: Mattel(NASDAQ: MAT) is creating a device-based virtual assistant for an   entirely different demographic -- your kids.  Its entry
column6: Aristotle
column7: is a multi-function smart speaker designed to grow   with children. It works as a baby monitor in their early years
column8: with live streaming encrypted video to your phone. It can also be   programmed to soothe a crying baby with soft lighting or music
column9: help parents monitor feedings and diaper changes
column10: and remind   users to order diapers when they get low. The distinguishing   feature of Aristotle is the use of voice recognition
column11: which gives   it the ability to understand children's voices from the age of a   toddler. It will read stories
column12: answer child-like questions
column13: and   be a digital friend. It is designed not to be static
column14: but to grow   with kids
column15: like helping older children with homework.    Aristotle incorporates Bing search and Cortana technology   courtesy of Microsoft. It also boasts 256-bit encryption in all   communications
column16: with a focus on protecting the privacy of its   users.Traditional toy makers have been battling a powerful trend as   children gravitate to more digital forms of play. They have been   trying to remake themselves in an attempt to remain relevant   going forward amid the changing landscape. Mattel's entry into   the virtual assistant category is a brilliant move in trying to   capture the hearts and minds of children as they grow.Virtual photo editorImage source: Pixabay.Adobe(NASDAQ: ADBE) is another company you may not expect in the   category. It is considering the introduction of a virtual   assistant that can handle simple photo editing. In aconcept videoreleased on YouTube
column17: it demonstrates a man using voice commands   to crop a photo
column18: flip the aspect
column19: reverse it
column20: and finally post it   on Facebook.  The caption to the video reads
column21: ""Our Adobe   Research team is exploring what an intelligent digital assistant   photo editing might look like. With Adobe Sensei we combined the   emerging science of voice interaction with a deep understanding   of both creative workflows and the creative aspirations of our   customers.""  While it appears to still be in the concept or   potentially development stage
column22: it provides insight into potential   future uses.Image source: Starbucks.Virtual baristaDuring its investor day in December
column23: Starbucks(NASDAQ: SBUX) revealed that it too will introduce a virtual   assistant
column24: My Starbucks Barista
column25: to its mobile app later this   year. Users will be able to place orders by talking into their   cellphone. It will recognize complicated drink orders and confirm   orders via text message.  This isn't the first time   Starbucks has used emerging artificial intelligence (AI)   technology to better connect with its customers. Its   gold-standard rewards program uses AI to personalize over 400
column26: 000   different rewards per week. These rewards are tailored to each   user based on order history.The takeawaySmartphone virtual personal assistants are becoming   commonplace
column27: but the technology is still in its infancy. The ways   in which companies can cater this to better serve current and   potential customers are limited only by the imagination.For investors
column28: it's hard to know exactly what fruit these   initiatives might bear
column29: but the fact that these companies are   dedicated resources to virtual assistant technology proves the   trend is here to stay.10 stocks we like better than Adobe SystemsWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column30: it can pay to listen. After all
column31: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade
column32: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column33: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and Adobe Systems wasn't one     of them! That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even     better buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of January 4
column34: 2017Danny Venaowns shares of Starbucks. The Motley Fool owns shares of and     recommends Starbucks. The Motley Fool recommends Adobe Systems.     The Motley Fool has adisclosure policy."

column1: Alphabet Inc (GOOGL) Whiffs on Earnings
column2: But Here’s the Bright Side;1/26/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsThe world's biggest and most recognizable all-things-internet nameAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column4: NASDAQ:GOOGL) reported its fourth-quarter numbers after the bell
column5: and they fell unusually short of estimates.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockFor the quarter ending in December
column6: the company formerly known as Googleearned $9.36per shareversus expectations of $9.63.Alphabet's top line of $26.06 billion compares favorably to analyst predictions for revenue of $25.22 billion. The company reported a profit of $8.67 per share of GOOGL stock in the same quarter from a year earlier
column7: when it drove sales of $21.33 billion.The numbers interrupt a long-term streak of forward
column8: even if not perfect
column9: fiscal progress. Alphabet has topped estimates in five of the past seven quarters.CFO Ruth Porat commented on the Alphabet earnings report:""Our growth in the fourth quarter was exceptional - with revenues up 22% year on year and 24% on a constant currency basis. This performance was led by mobile search and YouTube. We're seeing great momentum in Google's newer investment areas and ongoing strong progress in Other Bets.""GOOGL shares were 2.1% lower in after-hours trading.New Focus on Hardware Going WellAlphabet
column10: while it was still called Google
column11: was founded primarily as a web search engine
column12: and that's still the lion's share of its revenue mix. Though aggregate cost-per-click fell
column13: continuing a long (and industry-wide) trend of deterioration
column14: with another 9% year-over-year decline
column15: that dip continues to be more than offset by a sheer increase of volume.7 Stocks to Buy That Could Double by 2018Aggregate paid clicks grew 20% on a year-over-year basis. Google - the search engine and its ancillary products and services - contributed $25.8 billion worth of last quarter's revenue
column16: and was responsible for $7.88 billion of the $8.5 billion in Alphabet's operating income.Although search and ads are still its bread-and-butter business
column17: the company has recently begun the development of hardware and Internet of Things devices. The highest-profile of these new initiatives is the so-called Pixel phone. Although the company had brought smartphones to the market in the past - like the Nexus - those were mostly third-party/branded handsets. The Pixel is a true
column18: home-grown
column19: in-house smartphonefrom Google that's designed to take aim at the popular iPhone line fromApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL).Bloomberg recently reported thatAlphabet sold an estimated 1 million Pixels last quarter; the company doesn't provide such details. That doesn't even come close to the45.5 million iPhones Apple sold last quarter
column20: but it's a very good first effort.The Pixel is just one way Alphabet has remained relevant as consumers continue to migrate from desktops to mobile devices. Its Android operating system isnow the OS of choiceon nearly 90% of all handheld devices sold
column21: funneling users to Google's apps
column22: services and revenue-bearing display ads.Digital Is Still ImportantAnd the company is getting serious about squeezing more revenue out of its Google Play store. Going forward
column23: Chromebooks will run all Android apps
column24: making Chromebooks as well as more of its apps more marketable. The move poses a threat to the current king of laptop/notebook operating systemsMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT).YouTube was another bright spot for Alphabet during its fourth fiscal quarter.Although garnering traffic has never been a problem for the online-video venue (the site attracts more than 30 million viewers per day
column25: who collectively watch nearly 5 billion clips every day)
column26: optimizing the ad revenue YouTube generates has proven difficult. The organization seems to have finally found a winning formula though.Again
column27: Alphabet doesn't provide such specifics
column28: but RBC Capital analyst Mark Mahaney estimated thatYouTube generates $10 billion in annual ad revenue
column29: or roughly a tenth of the company's total revenue. Porat also made a point of saying Mobile Search and YouTube led the company's revenue growth for the quarter.Looking Ahead for GOOGL StockJust within the past few days
column30: two experts have chimed in with bullish expectations for GOOGL shares. Specifically
column31: Pacific Crestbegan coverage of Alphabet last week with a price target of $1
column33: and this week
column34: Barron'sopinedGOOGL shares could reach $1
column35: 000before the end of 2017. Those targets are approximately 20% higher than where the stock closed on Thursday.Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Q2 Earnings: They're Good ... But Not GreatAnalysts expect Alphabet to earn $41.07 per share this year
column36: on $104.07 billion in revenue. Those figures are 19% and 16% higher
column37: respectively
column38: than 2016's tally. Nothing about last quarter's numbers suggests the company won't reach those targets.As of this writing
column39: James Brumley did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace5 Blue-Chip Stocks to Sell in February10 High-Yield Dividend Stocks That Are SOMEHOW Still BargainsThe postAlphabet Inc (GOOGL) Whiffs on Earnings

column1: Alphabet (GOOGL) Earnings: Fourth Quarter Revenue Soars 22%;1/26/2017;"Google earnings (Shutterstock photo)Google parent Alphabet (GOOG) reported another strong set of financial results Thursday
column2: beating Wall Street’s fourth quarter revenue estimates
column3: which grew 22% year over year
column4: thanks to the company’s continued dominance in advertising.Over the past couple of quarters
column5: the Mountain View
column6: Calif.-based tech giant has been working to offset declining mobile advertising value with higher clicks. The rate of revenue and earnings growth suggests that this strategy continues to pay off.makeArticleAd();In the three months that ended December
column7: Alphabet reported a net income rose to $5.33 billion
column8: or $7.56 per
column9: up from $4.92 billion
column10: or $7.06 per share
column11: a year earlier. On an adjusted basis
column12: when taking out one-time gains and costs
column13: earnings were $9.36 per share
column14: which misses estimates of $9.64 per share. Fourth quarter revenue rose 22% to $26.06 billion
column15: easily topping Street forecast of $25.23 billion.“Our growth in the fourth quarter was exceptional -- with revenues up 22% year on year and 24% on a constant currency basis. This performance was led by mobile search and YouTube
column16: ” said CFO Ruth Porat in a statement. “We’re seeing great momentum in Google’s newer investment areas and ongoing strong progress in Other Bets.”Indeed
column17: advertising revenue — up 17% to $19 billion — remains the company’s bread-and-butter business
column18: accounting for some 90% of revenue. Google has
column19: however
column20: begun to show strength is its “Other Bets” — a segment that includes autonomous vehicles
column21: virtual/augment reality headsets
column22: its cloud business and
column23: more recently
column24: its smartphones. Revenue in that group came in at $262 million
column25: surging 75% year over year from $150 million a year ago.Google’s cost-per-click
column26: a key metric determining the value of an ad
column27: fell 11% year-over-year this quarter. But aggregate paid clicks increased 20%
column28: showing that the management continue to find ways to offset the decline. As have been the case for some time
column29: the primary growth driver continues to be the strength in search and YouTube. Notably
column30: Google Cloud
column31: which hopes to compete with Amazon (AMZN) and Microsoft (MSFT)
column32: has begun to show meaningful revenue growth.Google websites revenue rose 20% to $17.9 billion
column33: while Google Network revenues increase 7% to $4.4 billion. As with the strong showing the third quarter
column34: paid clicks on Google websites were up 43% year over year. Alphabet did not provide a forecast
column35: but the consensus first-quarter 2017 estimates call for EPS of $9.34 on revenues of $23.74 billion. For the full year analysts forecast EPS of $41.07 on revenues of $104.07 billion.Alphabet stock traded lower on the report
column36: down by about 2.5% at $834 in after-hours trading. I see this as a solid buying opportunity. With some patience
column37: GOOGL stock should reach $1

column1: Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Q2 Earnings: They’re Good … Just Not Great;1/26/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) just pulled off a pretty good fiscal second quarter. The cloud continued to provide a lift for the company
column3: which also saw a positive impact from itsLinkedInacquisition. But it appears Wall Street had already factored much of this in
column4: as MSFT stock was up just less than 1% in Thursday's after-hours trading.makeArticleAd();Source:Via MicrosoftShares may have been due for a breather
column5: though. Since late June
column6: Microsoft stock is up by about 33%.For the quarter
column7: earnings grew by 3.6% year-over-year to 79 cents a share and revenues improved 2.2% to reach $25.3 billion. That's good for a small beat on the top line
column8: and an analyst match on the bottom line.Here are some of the highlights of the Microsoft earnings report:The company returned $6.5 billion in buybacks and dividends.Revenues in the Productivity and Business Processes rose 10% to $7.4 billion.Revenues for the Office consumer products and cloud services jumped 22%There are no 24.9 million Office 365 consumer subscribers.Revenues for the cloud-based Azure business soared 93%.This story has been updated.Microsoft Stock and The Cloud OpportunityOver the past few years
column9: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has been doubling down on the cloud market
column10: where there's plenty of room for growth. According to Gartner
column11: total global spending is forecast to increase from $204 billion in 2016 to $318 billion by 2019.7 Stocks to Buy That Could Double by 2018The irony is that the main rival for MSFT isAmazon.com
column12: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN)
column13: which currently dominates the cloud market.SAP SE (ADR)(NYSE:SAP)
column14: International Business Machines Corp.(NYSE:IBM) andOracle Corporation(NYSE:ORCL) have been notable laggards
column15: but they're ramping up their efforts.For holders of Microsoft stock
column16: it is important to note that the success with the cloud has not been just about being early to the game. MSFT has some some incredible advantages
column17: such as a trusted brand
column18: years' of experience with mission-critical systems and a global infrastructure.What's more
column19: Microsoft has been smart and aggressive about acquisitions. LinkedIn - which provided MSFT with a massive professional network and even core next-gen cloud strategies - ia a clear case for this. There also should be nice synergies for integrations with the Office franchise
column20: Skype and Yammer.Also encouraging is Microsoft's progress in revamping its old-line products
column21: then moving them toward the cloud. Just look at Dynamics
column22: a customer relationship management (CRM) product. Dynamics revenues increased 7% year-over-year in the latest quarter
column23: primarily driven by the cloud version. This could be a sign that MSFT is gaining ground on the giant in the space
column24: Salesforce.com
column25: Inc.(NYSE:CRM).Bottom Line on MSFT StockYes
column26: Microsoft does have issues
column27: such as the PC side of the business
column28: which continues to lag. In Q2
column29: revenues here dropped 5% to $11.8 billion. But a big part of this was an expected drop in phone revenues; once you dig into the numbers
column30: you'll see a 5% increase in Windows OEM products.Alphabet Inc (GOOGL) Whiffs on Earnings
column31: But Here's the Bright SideGoing forward
column32: MSFT stock could get a nice lift from the expected tax changes from the Trump administration as well. A tax repatriation would allow the company to bring back more than $113 billion from offshore accounts. That would allow for more acquisitions
column33: stock buybacks and maybe a special dividend.All of that would be key in keeping shares in bull mode.Tom Taulli runs the InvestorPlace blogIPO Playbookand is a registered investment adviser representative (you canvisit his siteto learn more about his financial planning services).He is also the author of various books on investing like All About Commodities
column34: All About Short Selling and High-Profit IPO Strategies.Follow him on Twitter at@ttaulli. As of this writing
column35: he did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace10 High-Yield Dividend Stocks That Are SOMEHOW Still BargainsThe 12 Best Fidelity 401k Funds to OwnThe postMicrosoft Corporation (MSFT) Q2 Earnings: They're Good … Just Not Greatappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: BlackBerry Ltd (BBRY) DTEK70: Game-Changer or Non-Event?;1/26/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsThe rumor mill is spinning again withBlackBerry Ltd(NASDAQ:BBRY). Code-named ""Mercury
column3: the next BlackBerry device
column4: DTEK70
column5: will reportedly get a Feb. 25 launch date. And BBRY stock holders probably do not care at this point.makeArticleAd();Source:WEi WEi via FlickrBlackBerry is rebranding itself as a software company
column6: but its stock is up a mere 4.3% in the last year. By comparison
column7: Apple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) is up nearly 25% in the last year whileNokia Corp (ADR)(NYSE:NOK)
column8: which exited the Windows Phone market and focused on networking
column9: fell 33%.Still
column10: the DTEK70 release is important for BBRY.BlackBerry and TCL PartnershipBlackBerry outsourced its entire hardware development and manufacturing withTCL. Early signs are positive that ""Mercury"" will win customers
column11: especially in the business space. BlackBerry said that it is 100% indevelopingsoftware solutions. TCL's ""Mercury"" build offers a secure Android operating system and has a physical keyboard. The company earns IP and royalty revenue for each device TCL sells.On its conference call in December
column12: BlackBerrydescribedthe TCL deal:This licensing model allows BlackBerry to generate ongoing high margin royalty revenue from a device software based on the number of units sold. We have a pipeline of additional opportunities that are focusing on
column13: including a late discussion in India that are ongoing.""Decent Price to PerformanceBlackBerry priced the budget DTEK50 in the right range but did not win the mainstream market. DTEK60 demonstrated the company's ability to make a solid
column14: high-performance phone at mainstream prices. DTEK70 is even more practical for business users.Rumoredto run on aQualcomm
column15: Inc.(NASDAQ:QCOM) Snapdragon 635 or Snapdragon 821
column16: the device will have just 4.5 inches of screen real estate.5 Blue-Chip Stocks to Sell in FebruaryThis is the magic number for DTEK70: The device may sell for around just $350. At that price and size
column17: business users who crave for higher productivity will snap up this phone when it is launched.Profit MarginBlackBerry CEO John Chen will not allow the company to sell devices at a loss. Assume profit margins in the range of 25%-50% for TCL. When the costs of software development are included
column18: the profit margin for BBRY may run above 50%-60%.Launch DateOn its blog
column19: BlackBerry said it will give more details about the smartphone at the Mobile World Congress show. The event runs from Feb. 27 to March 3.Interest in ""Mercury""+ ""BlackBerry"" jumped:Click to EnlargeSource:tickertags.comGame Changer or More of the Same?Past BlackBerry Android devices did not give the company much revenue growth. In the third quarter
column20: the $172 million in software services revenue accounted for 57% of the company's revenue.The TCL licensing deal
column21: though
column22: is a game-changer for the software company. DTEK70's development costs are all shouldered by its partner. BlackBerry gets a cut in the sales through the software licensing. High profit margins from software sales will translate to more profits for the company.The one big catch is that BBRY and TCL must advertise and promote this upcoming device. BlackBerry made $12 million in operating income in the third quarter.Profit Model for DTEK 70Assuming TCL pays a 10% royalty on the profits of the $350 device
column23: or $20 per device
column24: BlackBerry could earn the following:Units Sold per quarterProfit100
column33: 000Selling 500
column34: 000 units a quarter would match the company's third-quarter operating income.3 Reasons to Buy Ford Motor Company (F) Stock on This DipBottom Line on BBRY StockThe smartphone market is still wide-open for small players like BlackBerry. Previously released Android devices demonstrated the company could deliver on supplying a highly secure
column35: bug-free operating system. The inexpensive DTEK70 targets the business user.With the rumored price and phone specifications
column36: BlackBerry may have an unexpected winner.As of this writing
column37: Chris Lau was long BBRY. Follow him onTwitter.More From InvestorPlace10 Blue-Chip Stocks That Could Be Holding You Back7 Stocks to Sell Before They ImplodeShould You Buy Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock? 3 Pros

column1: Should You Buy Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock? 3 Pros
column2: 3 Cons;1/26/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsIf you bought and held stock inMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) at the height of the dot-com run
column4: it's been an unpleasant 16 years. However
column5: after a long wait
column6: MSFT stock finally reached a new all-time high last month. Despite the tech world changing drastically in the ensuing years
column7: Microsoft's PC dominance lives on
column8: minting money for the company.makeArticleAd();Source:Mike Mozart Via FlickrThe company's various new efforts over the years have mostly been flops. There's a reason Microsoft stock has performed poorly; efforts such as Windows phones simply haven't panned out. However
column9: it seems Microsoft has finally turned the corner.It is making real headway in several promising areas
column10: including its cloud offering. And investors have cheered
column11: sending Microsoft's stock up sharply since 2013. Can the good times continue
column12: or will buyers up at these levels be in for another long decade?MSFT Stock ConsHuge Stock Run-Up: Since 2013
column13: MSFT stock has more than doubled. At first glance
column14: that seems fine
column15: the market has performed strongly in recent years after all. However
column16: Microsoft is so large
column17: that it becomes hard to achieve further such doublings. With a market cap just under $500 billion today
column18: even one more double takes Microsoft to a trillion dollar market cap. It's worth asking what the company has going from a growth perspective that could justify such a lofty figure.Sure
column19: the company has some growth initiatives under way. The cloud offering is going well. And the LinkedIn acquisition may start to bear more fruit. But after watching the stock run from under 30 in recent years to over 60 today
column20: you have to ask how much more upside really makes sense
column21: particularly since the company has had near non-existent revenue growth lately.10 High-Yield Dividend Stocks That Are SOMEHOW Still BargainsHigh Valuation:First things first
column22: MSFT stock isn't really trading at a 30 price-earnings ratio. I know that's what financial websites report. However
column23: that's based on GAAP figures that include one-off losses related to restructuring. On an adjusted basis
column24: Microsoft is trading in the mid-20s
column25: and at 21 times forward earnings. However
column26: even that doesn't paint a flattering picture for the company. Microsoft traded at 12 times earnings or less over much of the past decade. Is Microsoft worth paying twice as much for now?Sure
column27: the PC market has stabilized
column28: but it isn't likely to ever be a meaningful growth driver again. And the newer initiatives such as cloud seem likely to take years to reach strong profitability. At 21 times forward earnings
column29: MSFT stock is pricing in some serious growth prospects that may well not materialize.Questionable Deal-Making:Microsoft has a reputation for making some head-scratching M&A moves. The less said of the aQuantive purchase and the Nokia buy
column30: the better. Those two alone resulted in almost $14 billion of write-offs. And the recent LinkedIn deal raises questions. Microsoft paid $26 billion for LinkedIn
column31: and offered a massive premium to where shares where trading previously. At the price Microsoft paid
column32: it offered around 30x free cash flow for LinkedIn. On an earnings basis
column33: LinkedIn was still losing money.Sure
column34: Microsoft can cut some costs there
column35: particularly for stock-based compensation
column36: but it's still a massive price tag. And with Microsoft having such a huge war chest on its balance sheet
column37: the temptation will surely be there for the company to make other huge value-destructive deals.MSFT Stock ProsPC Market Stabilizing:For quite a few years now
column38: the traditional PC market appeared to be in serious decline. Sales peaked in 2011
column39: with364 million unitssold that year globally. Since then
column40: sales have plunged. By 2015
column41: sales dropped 24% from that peak year
column42: falling to just 275 million units. And 2016 showed another solid decline
column43: with sales reaching just 260 million units. However
column44: the worst may now have passed. 2020 projections are for 250 million units sold
column45: only a fractional decline from current levels.And themost recent datasupports this further moderation: sales slipped just 1.5% versus the same period last year. And in several areas globally
column46: including Canada and Japan
column47: PC sales are actually increasing again. One possible reason
column48: the rate of forward technological progress has slowed for both tablets and smartphones
column49: reducing pressure on consumers to switch to smaller screens. A stable market would be great news for MSFT stock.Partnership With Qualcomm:Microsoft has partnered withQualcomm
column50: Inc.(NASDAQ:QCOM) for their Internet of Things efforts. Qualcomm has entered conflict withIntel Corporation(NASDAQ:INTC) at first over the IoT market. In the longer-run
column51: Qualcomm may use its chips to even forcefully attack Intel's long-held dominance in the PC market. In any case
column52: Microsoft benefits nicely from partnering up with Qualcomm.The IoT offerings born from this venture will help spread Windows 10 outside of just the traditional PC market. And given the shellacking that QCOM stock took earlier this week followingApple Inc.'s(NASDAQ:AAPL) lawsuit against the firm
column53: Qualcomm has reason to deepen ties with friendly partners. As an industry outcast
column54: Qualcomm needs whatever help it can get
column55: and if Microsoft can use that to expand Windows as a broader OS
column56: all the better.Solid Dividend Option:Microsoft has quietly turned into a nice yield choice for more conservative investors. The company has tripled its dividend since 2008. In total
column57: it's posted 16%
column58: 18% and 16% dividend growth rates over the past three
column59: five and ten years. While the payout ratio currently looks a little high
column60: that's based on abnormally soft recent earnings. Make no mistake
column61: there is plenty of room left here for more dividend increases. The company has an astounding $137 billion in cash on its balance sheet. Even after subtracting out debt
column62: the company has a net cash position of $62 billion
column63: leaving plenty of firepower for increased dividends
column64: share buybacks or acquisitions.VerdictMSFT stock is a decent selection if you're purely concerned with its yield and safety. The company's main PC business is looking healthier than it has in quite awhile. The balance sheet is tremendous. The dividend is significant at today's level
column65: and is bound to keep rising quickly.Here's Why Chevron Corporation (CVX) Stock Is the Best Play in OilHowever
column66: there's little to recommend Microsoft on valuation. The stock is expensive
column67: even when you look closely. Microsoft has plenty of growth initiatives in the works
column68: but actual operating results recently have only been so-so. When buying stocks at all-time highs
column69: you want to see a business with more operating momentum.At the time of this writing
column70: Ian Bezek held INTC and QCOM stock. He had no position in Microsoft. You can reach him on Twitter at @irbezek.More From InvestorPlace3 Energy ETFs That Will Keep Soaring3 Brokerage Stocks That Love Donald Trump's Big Tweetin'The postShould You Buy Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock? 3 Pros
column71: 3 Consappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Play Smart in the Advanced Micro Devices
column2: Inc. (AMD) Stock Pullback;1/26/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsA relatively dismal start to 2017 forAdvanced Micro Devices
column4: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMD) received a bit more negative feedback Wednesday. But before anyone cries out ""Bear Market!"" let's examine AMD stock both off and on the price chart for clues about why
column5: as well as check the options market for a suitable strategy.makeArticleAd();Source:Matthew Rutledge via Flickr2016 wasthe best of times for AMD stockand for good reason. Investors cheered a massive turnaround in the chipmaker's business attributed to strong execution
column6: design wins withMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) andSony Corp (ADR)(NYSE:SNE) and even a return to non-GAAP profitability after flirting with bankruptcy not so long ago.The strong reboot didn't go unnoticed on AMD stock either.Investors witnessed a massive bullish reversal from a January 2016 low of $1.75 to a high of $12.42 by late December. AMD's near-300% gain in 2016 also put the outfit atop the semiconductor group in share price performance.But 2017 hasn't been as kind out of the gate. Nearly one month in and with theNasdaq 100up over 5%
column7: AMD stock has shed roughly 7%. What's behind the about-face and relative weakness?5 Blue-Chip Stocks to Sell in FebruarySome investors could rightfully be looking ahead and concerned that while good progress has been made in Advanced Micro's fortunes
column8: more is required and 2017 could prove pivotal.From the introduction of next-generation
column9: high-end graphics and computing chips to the need to increase market share across key business segments and continuing to build on its bottom-line and cash-flow
column10: there are clear challenges facing Advanced Micro Devices this year.If AMD falters or altogether fails to execute
column11: shares are likely to be targeted by bears. But first things first. Under the leadership of CEO Lisa Su
column12: who took over the role in 2014
column13: AMD has been rising to the occasion withconcentrated betsand surpassing most analyst expectations.And withanalyst sentiment still somewhat coolon Advanced Micro Devices' prospects and AMD stock affording a lower-risk entry
column14: a bit of optimism on the price chart and margin of safety afforded from a hedged AMD position could be well-served.AMD Stock Daily ChartAs mentioned
column15: shares of AMD are off by about 9% year-to-date. From December's high the past month though
column16: corrective activity has resulted in a run-of-the-mill but nice-sized dip of 24% in shares at the recent low of $9.42.Pullbacks like AMD's are common after a substantial price run. In fact
column17: declines of up to 30% are considered quite normal if for no other reason than ordinary profit-taking
column18: which quite honestly doesn't require a bearish shift in the narrative.And technically
column19: with AMD shares having tested 2010's pivot high and the 50-day simple moving average
column20: there are a couple more reasons to embrace
column21: rather than fear
column22: today's and this year's weakness in AMD stock.AMD Stock CollarReviewing AMD stock's options and with shares trading at $10.29 Wednesday evening
column23: the March $12 call/$9 put collar is attractive.Priced for even money
column24: the package price of $10.29
column25: and equivalent to a naked long stock purchase
column26: allows for guaranteed downside protection at $9 in AMD from the purchased put. The insurance policy of sorts is slightly below the recent technical low and a desirable level to protect the stock position for possible re-evaluation if required.As earnings in AMD stock are on tap next week
column27: the collar's protection versus the more open-ended risk alternative
column28: becomes even more attractive in our opinion. So
column29: what's the catch?Bank of America Corp (BAC) Stock Is STILL Too Cheap to IgnoreThe real cost to this AMD position is the matching credit taken in to finance the long put. At the end of the day
column30: the trader has sold a call at the $13 strike.However
column31: as the initial cap on profits is set at 16.6% for slightly less than a two month holding period-there's no alternative facts to suggest this strategy is anything less than a great way to manage risk.Investment accounts under Christopher Tyler's management do not currently own positions in any of the securities or their derivatives mentioned in this article. The information offered is based upon Christopher Tyler's observations and strictly intended for educational purposes only; the use of which is the responsibility of the individual. For additional market insights and related musings

column1: 3 Covered Calls to Drop a $1
column2: 000 in Your Bank Account;1/26/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsTo me
column4: covered calls serve two really solid purposes when it comes to using this strategy in a long-term diversified portfolio
column5: such as the one I'll be building in my upcoming stock advisory newsletter
column6: The Liberty Portfolio.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockCovered calls can be used as a hedge. Let's say the market may turn south
column7: which it may do since it's 20% overvalued right now; if a stock you own is going to go down with it
column8: but you still want it as part of the portfolio you own
column9: sell covered calls against the stock.First
column10: you earn a premium for selling the covered calls
column11: which will partially offset any loss the stock might experience.5 Blue-Chip Stocks to Sell in FebruaryHowever
column12: covered calls are also a relatively low-risk way of generating income. Yes
column13: you risk losing upside if the stock is called away
column14: but you can always repurchase it if you desire.$1
column15: 000 Covered Calls: Microsoft (MSFT)Source:Mike Mozart via Flickr (Modified)Microsoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) tricked me several years ago into believing it had nowhere to go. I stopped paying attention - always a mistake - and it has since become a far different operation than it was under Bill Gates.Yet despite it being as solid a company as you'll find
column16: MSFT stock tends to be rather volatile
column17: and that leads to generous premiums when selling covered calls. Combining a safe company with volatility is a great strategy for covered calls.Usually
column18: I aim to squeeze 1.5% to 2.5% out of selling covered calls
column19: for something approaching a 30-day contract period. That means something like 24% annualized.Microsoft stock closed Wednesday at $63.68. There are numerous many choices for both strike price and expiration
column20: but it's nice and simple to go for selling the 17 Feb $64 covered calls for $1.33. You earn a 2.1% return. Sell four of these for $532 total.By the way
column21: if it is called away
column22: you earn 32 cents in capital gains
column23: or another 0.5%.$1
column24: 000 Covered Calls: Starbucks (SBUX)Source:Javier González Via FlickrIn a similar vein
column25: Starbucks Corporation(NASDAQ:SBUX) offers both safety in the underlying stock and lots of volatility that contributes to even more generous premiums. SBUX is going to enter a new phase soon
column26: as Howard Schultz concocts a new growth trajectory. In the meantime
column27: SBUX remains a dominant global brand with a solid balance sheet.SBUX stock closed Wednesday at $58.70. Thanks to options now being available at 50-cent increments for so many stocks
column28: you can sell the 17 Feb $59 covered calls for $1.15. That provides you with a 2% return
column29: and it's actually for a contract period of only 23 days! That offers an annualized return of 32%.It isn't much
column30: by the way
column31: but if it is called away
column32: add 30 cents in capital gains to the trade
column33: or 0.5%.10 Stocks to Buy to Survive a ""Trumpsy-Turvy"" 2017Sell three of these for $345
column34: bringing you total to $877.$1
column35: 000 Covered Calls: AT&T (T)Source: ShutterstockI'm not a fan ofAT&T Inc.(NYSE:T)as far as it being a long-term growth or value stock to hold. It's not in any kind of trouble
column36: but I just don't see the compelling ROI here. I do
column37: however
column38: understand buying it as a dividend stock
column39: since it pays a very reliable yield now at 4.7%.Regrettably
column40: the ten-year chart shows T stock has literally gone nowhere
column41: although you certainly managed some nice dividend payments during that period. So if want the proverbial ""safe"" income stock
column42: T stock is a fine choice. It also happens to be a good choice for covered calls to generate income. Again
column43: it's a safe stock. The premiums are not that generous
column44: but you can earn something.It closed Wednesday at $41.39. The 17 Feb $41.50 covered calls are selling for 65 cents. Sell two of these to bring you to a total of $1
