column1: Facebook Inc (FB) Hires Former Google Exec to Lead Oculus;1/26/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsFacebook Inc's(NASDAQ:FB) virtual reality division Oculus has had a rough six months
column3: but it looks as though the company is ready to to push VR in 2017 and turn things around. CEO Mark Zuckerberg took to Facebook last night to announce thatHugo Barra will be joining FB to lead VR efforts
column4: including Oculus. If the name sounds familiar it should. Barra is very well known in the technology industry.makeArticleAd();Source: FacebookSo who is Hugo Barra? He was in the news just last week when it was revealed he was leaving Chinese consumer technology giantXiaomi.He was hired in 2013 to lead that company's efforts to polish its image in western markets and help push its products into the U.S. market. At the time Barra said he was returning to his Silicon Valley roots
column5: but gave no details.What Does Hugo Barra Bring to FB?Prior to Xiaomi
column6: he served asAlphabet Inc's(NASDAQ:GOOG
column7: NASDAQ:GOOGL) Google vice president of Android product management.In his announcement of Barra's hire
column8: Zuckerberg wrote:""I'm excited that Hugo Barra is joining Facebook to lead all of our virtual reality efforts
column9: including our Oculus team. Hugo's in China right now
column10: so here we are together in VR. It seems fitting.I've known Hugo for a long time
column11: starting when he helped develop the Android operating system
column12: to the last few years he's worked at Xiaomi in Beijing bringing innovative devices to millions of people. Hugo shares my belief that virtual and augmented reality will be the next major computing platform.""FB's Oculus ChallengesWhen Facebook bought Oculus for $2 billion in 2014
column13: the prospects for its new virtual reality division seemed limitless. But for the last six months
column14: the division has been struggling.10 Stocks to Buy to Survive a ""Trumpsy-Turvy"" 2017Founder Palmer Luckey was bringing inbad press over his political views
column15: complaints over the highprices for its Oculus Rift headsetand the new Touch Controllers continued
column16: andSony Corp (ADR)(NYSE:SNE) unexpectedly began to gain traction with both consumers and game developers with its much more affordable Playstation VR. In December
column17: Oculus CEO Brendan Iribe stepped down. Now
column18: FB and Luckey aretied up in a lawsuitclaiming the Oculus founder stole trade secrets and violated copyrights in order to develop his Oculus Rift VR headset.On top of all this
column19: the hype over virtual reality is beginning to fade. After being a major part of past Consumer Electronics shows
column20: there was a feeling thatVR wasn't particularly compelling at CES 2017.In short
column21: it's understandable why FB wants to kickstart Oculus. An industry veteran like Hugo Barra -someone who is experienced in leading a critical division in a technology giant and skilled at promotion - may well be the answer.Kickstarting OculusWhen Barra takes over at Oculus
column22: there are a few immediate challenges to take on. The lawsuit will have to be dealt with
column23: but FB lawyers will be able to manage most of that.The bigger issue in terms of getting consumers to buy into the Oculus rift is pricing. The Oculus Rift already has mindshare as the VR headset people think of. But where the Oculus Rift was once pretty much the only game in town
column24: every major consumer technology company - exceptApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) - is offering virtual reality gear
column25: and it's almost always cheaper.Apple Inc. New iPads Might Be Late to the Party (AAPL)That wouldn't be such a big deal if you were looking at $100 versus $75. But an Oculus Rift plus Touch Controllers goes for $798. Then you need a reasonably powerful PC (many computer owners would have to upgrade)
column26: which is at least another $1
column27: 000. In comparison
column28: a complete Sony Playstation VR system (including the PS4) can be had for about $800. However
column29: the Playstation VR headset is compatible with the original PS4 - which many gamers already own
column30: so that brings their investment to just $500.Largely as a result of those cost differences
column31: it'sestimated Sony will have sold over 745
column32: 000 Playstation VR systems in 2016
column33: while projections are for the Oculus Rift to hit just 355
column34: 000.The hire of Hugo Barra sets the stage for FB to aggressively promote the technical superiority of its Oculus virtual reality technology over that used by competitors like Sony. It's also a good move in promoting developer relations in an effort to boost the Oculus' lead in compelling VR content. And if he can find some wiggle room to get Oculus Rift pricing down a bit
column35: Barra stands a good chance of turning things around for Facebook's virtual reality division in 2017.As of this writing
column36: Brad Moon did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace3 Things Apple Inc. (AAPL) MUST Do to Soar in 2017Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Steps on Amazon and Google's TurfThe postFacebook Inc (FB) Hires Former Google Exec to Lead Oculusappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Q2 Earnings Preview;1/25/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace   - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) stock has had an impressive run over the past few years. Heading into Thursday's fiscal second quarter earnings report
column3: MSFT stock is right near an all-time high
column4: having increased about 150% over the past few years.Source:Via MicrosoftWhat's interesting about the gains for such a large stock - MSFT is the third-most valuable company on U.S. markets
column5: behind onlyApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) andAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOGL) - is that they haven't been based on Microsoft earnings. Microsoft's EPS was $2.73 in fiscal 2012
column6: and $2.79 in fiscal 2016.makeArticleAd();Rather
column7: the multiple investors assign to MSFT stock has expanded. It has more than doubled
column8: in fact.That multiple expansion has come from increasing confidence toward Microsoft'sfutureearnings potential
column9: most notably in mobile and cloud. Where investors four to five years ago saw a fading giant whose earnings were likely to decline
column10: Microsoft now looks like a sleeping giant. And investors clearly believe the company's self-described ""mobile first
column11: cloud first"" strategy is going to push Microsoft earnings up - at some point.It's in that context that the market will analyze the Microsoft earnings report due on Thursday.Microsoft's Growth Isn't There…YetIt's always dangerous for an investor to believe that the numbers don't matter
column12: but in the case of MSFT stock
column13: the numbers really aren't the most important thing right now.10 Stocks to Buy to Survive a ""Trumpsy-Turvy""     2017Analyst consensus - informed in large part by Microsoft earnings guidance - doesn't predict a particularly impressive second quarter earnings report. The Street expects EPS to rise just a penny year-over-year
column14: which given share repurchases
column15: implies that Microsoft's total net profits actually will be lower in Q2 FY17 than they were ago.  Revenue is estimated to fall almost 2% year-over-year.Microsoft's guidance projects growth in its Productivity & Business and Intelligent Cloud segments
column16: but a sharp decline in More Personal Computing.That shouldn't be surprising. Office 365 growth has helped business revenue
column17: and the Azure platform continues to be a worthy
column18: if still much smaller
column19: competitor to Amazon Web Services in cloud. It's the potential for success in those products that has offset fears about continuing pressure on revenue from Windows
column20: as PC sales decline and mobile usage increases.Indeed
column21: the gain in MSFT stock from $27 to $63 has come mostly from the transition.The fears of Windows losses that led MSFT stock to be valued around 10x EPS in 2013 have turned to optimism toward growth in Azure
column22: Office 365
column23: Enterprise Mobility and other areas. That optimism has pushed the same stock to be valued at about 21x FY17 earnings.So it seems unlikely that investors will focus on the major headline numbers coming out of the Microsoft earnings report. A beat or miss of a penny or two on earnings likely isn't going to drive the market's reaction to the report - particularly if that weakness comes from Windows. Rather
column24: the focus is going to be on the growing
column25: smaller
column26: businesses
column27: most notably Azure.There's a reason Microsoft has steadily expanded its disclosure around Azure and cloud growth: That's where investor attention has been. And it seems likely that's where investor attention will stay coming out of the Q2 Microsoft earnings report.What to Watch For in Microsoft EarningsInvestors seem likely to have some patience with a modest miss in the Microsoft earnings report
column28: as expectations remain relatively low. The company still is getting out from under its deal withNokia Corp (ADR)(NYSE:NOK)
column29: and layoffs this year should provide a boost to margins over the next few quarters. Wall Street in particular isn't expecting growth to pick up until fiscal 2018
column30: where sales are projected to grow more than 6% against a rate under 2% in fiscal 2017.So what seems to be important in the Q2 Microsoft earnings report is whether the base of that growth is intact.While Azure is estimated to generate just 3% of total revenue
column31: accordingto analyst firm MKM Partners
column32: its growth rate certainly will be watched closely. After a 140% increase in Q2 FY16
column33: and 116% last quarter
column34: any slowdown seems likely to hurt the stock. But another 100%-plus figure would give further evidence that Azure is a worthy competitor to AWS
column35: and support the current MSFT stock price.The cloud business as a whole - including Office 365 and Dynamics
column36: which is trying to take share fromSalesforce.com
column37: Inc.(NYSE:CRM) - will be another area of post-earnings analysis.Here's Why Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock     Will Hit $75What does that mean for Microsoft stock coming out of the Microsoft earnings report?Overall
column38: it means that the quarter seems likely to be judged more on ""feel"" than on the hard numbers. Even though cloud and mobile still aren't the majority of MSFT revenue or earnings
column39: they are the cornerstones of the Microsoft strategy going forward. And for now
column40: it's relatively clear that the market is content to wait for those sales and profits - as long as it continues to trust in that strategy.If Microsoft can deliver another earnings report that shows growth is on the horizon
column41: MSFT stock likely will rise - even if the headline numbers aren't perfect. But if there's any sort of stumble in either cloud or mobile
column42: that investor patience could reverse - quickly.As of this writing
column43: Vince Martin did not hold a position in   any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace10 High-Yield Dividend Stocks That Are SOMEHOW     Still Bargains7 Straight-A Stocks to Build Your Portfolio     AroundMicrosoft Corporation (MSFT) Is Building an AI     MonsterThe postMicrosoft Corporation (MSFT) Q2 Earnings Previewappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Tech Stock Roundup: AAPL-QCOM Deal
column2: FB's Zuckerberg Testifies;1/25/2017;"With the 45thPresident of the United States vowing to bring back jobs to the country
column3: teach China a lesson and institute large-scale tax reform
column4: there has been a great deal of uncertainty surrounding technology stocks. To make matters worse
column5: President Trump has an axe to grind with AmazonAMZNand AppleAAPLwhile most AlphabetGOOGLexecutives have openly supported the democrats going into the elections.So companies are now making nice with the President like Tesla's Elon Musk
column6: who has changed tunes and is now tweeting his support. It's been reported that Google's Schmidt has also found reasons to visit the President. Executives that have supported Trump from the start are better off: some speculate that Zuckerberg is considering politics while ex-MicrosoftMSFTand GM employee Chris Liddell is moving to the White House as assistant to the President and director of strategic initiatives. Oracle CEO Safra Catz joined the executive committee of Trump's presidential transition team in December.Then there's Cramer
column7: promising us that the post inauguration sell-off won't last and that it's actually an opportunity to buy stocks.Amidst all the excitement surrounding the swearing in
column8: the FTC sued QualcommQCOMfor anti-competitive practices while Mark Zuckerberg took the stand to defend Facebook'sFBpurchase of Oculus. So let's dig in.Apple Forced to Use Qualcomm ChipsFollowing similar lawsuits
column9: huge fines ($1 billion in China and $890 million in Korea) and anticompetitive investigations in Taiwan and the EU
column10: the U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has sued Qualcomm for ""de facto exclusive deals that were as effective as express purchase requirements and that effectively foreclosed Qualcomm's competitors from gaining processor business at Apple.""The FTC alleges that Qualcomm allowed Apple billions in discounts for exclusively using its chips and not using the competing 4G Wi-Max standard that Intel was pushing. This agreement
column11: running from 2011 to 2016
column12: ultimately killed WiMax. Apple wasted no time in sourcing from Intel after the expiry of the agreement in Sep 2016.Another point in contention is Qualcomm's practice of limiting access to its cellular chips and then hiking royalty payments
column13: amounting to ""a tax on the manufacturers' use of baseband processors manufactured by Qualcomm's competitors."" The FTC filed the lawsuit after a 2-1 vote. Qualcomm has of course denied the charges while Apple chose not to comment.Following the FTC lawsuit
column14: Apple filed one of its own against Qualcomm for a billion dollars. The amount is what Apple alleges that Qualcomm is witholding for rebates. Like the FTC says
column15: the deal was to keep Qualcomm chips in Apple products and is a fair indication that Qualcomm finally has some real competition.Mark Zuckerberg TestifiesFacebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg took the stand last week to deny charges that Facebook was aware of the violation of any employee agreement between Occulus head John Carmack and its former employer id Software
column16: a unit of ZeniMax
column17: the plaintiff in this case. He also denied that the technology developed by the startup Occulus and its founder Palmer Luckey was based on copyrighted technology belonging to ZeniMax.Carmack previously testified that he copied files from ZeniMax before moving to Occulus but did not use the information in Occulus and the terms of his employment allowed him to get involved with Occulus even while in ZeniMax employ. But the thing that could cost Facebook at this point is ZeniMax lawyer Toni Sammi's question: ""So your plan for a $2-point-something billion deal was to begin legal diligence on Friday
column18: and sign the deal on Monday
column19: over a weekend
column20: right?"" to which Zuckerberg said
column21: ""Yeah.""CompanyLast WeekLast  6 MonthsAAPL+2.09%+21.62%FB+0.33%+6.42%YHOO-0.14%+10.80%GOOGL-0.16%+9.94%MSFT+0.21%+16.26%INTC+0.63%+5.38%CSCO+0.20%+0.64%AMZN-0.65%+9.82%Other stories you might have missed-CorporateIndia Considering Apple Case: It's hard to tell just how badly India wants Apple to manufacture in the country. But if government officials agree to Apple's demands
column22: it would indicate that they want it bad. Because Apple has asked for just about every concession possible
column23: ranging from reduction in import duties on smartphones
column24: customs duty exemption on manufacturing equipment and raw materials
column25: a ""less-intrusive"" customs procedure to be completed in 30 minutes
column26: the right to import and refurbish iPhones that are more than 3 years old so they can be exported
column27: and so forth.Apple is trying to convince government officials that Indian made iPhones won't be competitive unless they give in to these demands even as its manufacturing costs in China are on the rise. But Asian phone makers are already manufacturing in the country with no such concessions
column28: so the regulations themselves may need to be altered and relaxed to accommodate not just Apple but also other manufacturers. This could take time.On a positive note
column29: Reuters reports that Information Technology Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad has mentioned the setting up of a government panel headed by the cabinet secretary that would now clear investment proposals in the electronics sector above $1 billion
column30: instead of them going through multiple government departments.Microsoft Executive Joins Baidu: Baidu has appointed Qi Lu as its Chief Operating Officer and Group Head as it turns focus to artificial intelligence as the next growth driver. The company was mixed up in a scandal involving medical ads that led to stricter government regulations and consequently hit its revenues.Lu left Microsoft last year on health concerns but was in charge of its search business and also part of the team involved in architecting its artificial intelligence and bots technology. He holds more than 40 U.S. patents.Google Ad Auctions Are Suspect: The Wall Street Journal has independently confirmed that ads for Google products and the products of its sister companies usually find the top spot on the search engine results page. On checking 25K search results
column31: it found that Google products occupied the top spot 91% of the time and the top two spots 43% of the time.Google has said that this is because it is also a buyer of ads
column32: so its position comes from paying a higher price. It also says that this doesn't raise prices because when others bid for the price
column33: it's as if Google isn't bidding. Bottom line: other advertisers lose the top spot no matter what they bid for it. Google reportedly removed its ads in a number of cases when confronted with the data last December.Amazon
column34: Apple End Audiobook Exclusivity Deal: Apple and Amazon have decided to end the deal initiated back in 2008
column35: according to which Amazon subsidiary Audible became the exclusive supplier of audiobooks to Apple and was barred from selling to any other party. The agreement was actually serving no one because the market for audiobooks has advanced since then and it's now in the interest of both parties to be able to source from others and in Audible's case
column36: to also be able to sell on other platforms. Nonetheless
column37: it was preceded by regulatory scrutiny of the deal by German and EU competition authorities that felt it was inflating prices.Pandora Shares Gain: Pandora preannounced fourth-quarter results that it said exceeded its revenue and EBITDA targets. This came as a relief because it has been lowering expectations the last two quarters indicating continuing bad news. Moreover
column38: Pandora also said that the $5-a-month Pandora Plus garnered 365K new subscribers in the quarter and the Pandora Premium service remained on track to launch later this quarter. It also expects to lay off around 7% of the U.S. workforce
column39: which will further boost margins.Legal/RegulatoryCisco-Arista Developments: The U.S. Customs and Border Patrol agency has expressed concern that its earlier decision to lift the ban on Arista switches may have been incorrect. Following conversations with CiscoCSCO
column40: the CBP therefore intends to reinstate the ban. Arista has said that it will respond to Cisco points and re-engage with the CBP.In the meantime
column41: U.S.-manufactured switches will have to make do
column42: which can result in supply glitches and pressure on its gross margin. On Dec 2
column43: the ITC judge ruled that Arista patents infringe on Cisco's and Arista has subsequently produced workaround while denying the charges. A full commission review of the judge's decision will be completed by Apr 9.New Technology/ProductsGoogle to Launch Android One Phones In U.S.: Google's high-end Pixel phones are mostly unavailable
column44: but it's already gearing up to launch the low-end ($200-$300) Android One devices in the country by the middle of the year. The goal seems to be to build brand value and familiarize people with the Android ecosystem.Android One was first launched in India and later in other countries including Japan and then Europe. It is a system under which Google agrees beforehand with handset manufacturers to push out Android updates as soon as they are available so the experience is true to the latest iteration of the software.M&A and CollaborationsHPE Buying Simplivity: Hewlett Packard Enterprise is dishing out $650 million to buy SimpliVity
column45: the second largest provider of hyperconvergence software (after Nutanix which has over 50% market share). The company describes a hyperconverged system as one that integrates compute
column46: storage and networking into a pre-configured system
column47: managed by a user-friendly software platform that doesn't require extensive IT staff for set up and management.Within a couple of months after the deal closes
column48: HPE will offer a range of integrated HPE SimpliVity hyperconverged systems based on HPE ProLiant Servers. The acquisition significantly strengthens its position in the space where competitors like Cisco and Dell/EMC base their hyperconvergence solutions on market leader Nutanix or Simplivity software. HPE will initially support current SimpliVity customers.Cisco
column49: Ericsson Join Forces in Australia: The collaboration between Ericsson and Cisco on telecom cloud infrastructure has yielded a major customer in Vodafone Hutchison Australia (VHA). The companies will virtualize Vodafone's infrastructure
column50: enabling it to improve customer service and user experience while increasing network agility
column51: reducing opex and capex
column52: and speeding up the deployment of services. The partnership has reportedly generated 60 new deals and is expected to generate revenue of a billion dollars to each partner by 2018.Microsoft Acquires Simplygon: Microsoft has acquired 3D data optimization specialist Simplygon of Sweden for an undisclosed sum. This is intended to play an important role in developing its 3D For Everyone strategy
column53: which is part of the Windows 10 Creators Update. 3D optimization is used by game developers and others to facilitate 3D content creation.Simplygon also does more than this: it has already started optimizing content for AR and VR technology
column54: including for Microsoft's Hololens. Microsoft believes that by making the technology a part of its creators update
column55: users will be empowered to capture
column56: create and share 3D content thus augmenting their productivity
column57: collaboration and creativity.Google Buys Twitter Developers Platform: Google has acquired Fabric
column58: which is based on Crashlytics technology (crash analytics
column59: app feedback and real-time analytics) that Twitter acquired back in 2013. Google hasn't said how much it's paying for Fabric
column60: but has said that it will be a part of its cloud based mobile software effort called Firebase that was itself acquired in 2014. Firebase offers mobile app developers tools to build and monitor their apps
column61: so any attempt to build its capabilities should help the company attract developers.Alibaba Has Long-term Digital Deal: Alibaba and the International Olympic Committee (IOC) signed a deal
column62: according to which Alibaba will be responsible for the IOC's digital presence through its cloud platform. The deal makes Alibaba the digital sponsor of the Olympics in cloud services
column63: e-commerce and television for a period running through 2028. While immediate returns may not there
column64: this lends credibility to the service and should help Alibaba win big customer accounts.WDC Considering Toshiba Stake: Nikkei Asian Review has reported that Toshiba is looking to spin off or sell off a 20% stake in its chip business in which case Western Digital might be the one picking it up. Toshiba is in trouble right now as it has to deal with an unprofitable nuclear business and accounting scandal that requires it to cough up some cash. Selling off a share to its longtime partner Western Digital (the two operate a flash memory fab in Japan) might be just the answer it needs.Some NumbersUK App Store Prices Up: As a result of the pound's continued declines
column65: Apple has been compelled to raise App store prices by as much as 25%.Intel Invests in Retail Tech: At the National Retail Federation's annual conference in New York
column66: Intel said that it intended to invest $100 million in retail technology over the next five years. It also announced the Intel Responsive Retail Platform
column67: which uses a combination of sensors
column68: software kits and other hardware solutions to provide ""in-the-moment information about what customers are buying
column69: what they want and how to manage inventory so it arrives just in time for customers to take it home"".Companies That Reported Results Last Week: CHKP

column1: Baidu Scoops Up AI Talent From Microsoft
column2: But the Tech Titan Won't Be Left Behind;1/25/2017;"Baidu(NASDAQ: BIDU) has made no secrets aboutits ambitionsin the area of artificial intelligence (AI). CEO Robin Li has   said that this is the end of the mobile era and the beginning of   the AI era. Baidu sees AI as a ""key strategic focus for the   next decade."" To that end
column3: it continues to hire some of the   foremost minds in AI for key positions in the company.The brightest minds in AI. Image source: Pixabay.Hiring the best and brightestNews broke earlier this month that Baidu hired Dr. Qi Lu as   its chief operating officer. Lu was most recentlyMicrosoft's(NASDAQ: MSFT)  global executive vice president of   applications and services group. According to his LinkedIn   profile
column4: Lu was responsible for ""all of the research and   development teams across Microsoft Office
column5: Office 365
column6: SharePoint
column7: Exchange
column8: Yammer
column9: Skype for Business
column10: Skype
column11: Bing
column12: and the Advertising platform."" While in charge of R&D
column13: he directed Microsoft's advances in AI and the pursuit of bot   technology during his tenure. He stepped down from his   duties at Microsoft several months ago to recover from a bicycle   accident and it was not clear if or when he would return.makeArticleAd();Lu has a PhD in computer science from Carnegie Mellon   University and is recognized as a leader in the field of AI. He   has been issued 40 U.S. patents and published papers in AI   research. He previously worked as a research staff member atIBM's(NYSE: IBM) Almaden Research Center
column14: which performs much   of the company'sAI-related researchand is the storehouse of IBM's AI figurehead andJeopardy!-winning contestant
column15: Watson. The AI and machine learning   developed there and integrated into IBM's cognitive computing   business produced 35% of IBM's full-year revenue for   2015. The research done here was likely the genesis for Lu's   later interest in AI and the direction he took while at   Microsoft.Microsoft making acquisitions of its ownMicrosoft pursuit of deep learning. Image source:Pixabay.Microsoft continues to pursue its own AI agenda. On the heels   of Lu's departure
column16: it was revealed that Microsoft had acquired   Maluuba
column17: a company that specializes in deep learning and   reinforced learning in the field of AI. The company has made   several AI-related acquisitions in the last few years
column18: but this   is the first that focuses on teaching computers to learn in the   same way as the human brain. To achieve this also requires large   amounts of data for the system to learn. Maluuba's technology   combined with data gained from the acquisition of LinkedIn late   last year gives Microsoft the tools necessary to expand its AI   initiatives.Fitting right inLu will be a natural fit in helping Baidu pursue its AI   agenda. In an interview last year
column19: Lu expressed his frustration   with the state of the mobile experience and apps in general. Lu   believes that the next-generation platform will be led by speech   technology. He said
column20: ""We see a full spectrum of using language as   the baseline
column21: but using graphical interactions in a thoughtful
column22: meaningful way
column23: to elevate the experience."" That may provide us   insight into some of the places that Baidu will go under his   guidance.For Baidu
column24: this isn't the first such high-profile hiring of an   AI expert. In 2014
column25: it hired Andrew Ng
column26: its chief scientist
column27: who   was previously the lead ofAlphabet's(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL)Google Brain projectand an adjunct professor at Stanford University where he taught   AI. This shows that Baidu is willing to make bold moves in order   to succeed in AI.In the press release announcing Lu's hiring
column28: Baidu's CEO Robin   Li had this to say: ""To achieve our goals
column29: especially in   artificial intelligence
column30: which is a key strategic focus for the   next decade
column31: we will need to continue attracting the best global   talent. With Dr. Lu on board
column32: we are confident that our strategy   will be executed smoothly and Baidu will become a world-class   technology company and global leader in AI.""10 stocks we like better than BaiduWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column33: it can pay to listen. After all
column34: the newsletter they have run for   over a decade
column35: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column36: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and Baidu wasn't one of them!   That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even better   buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of January 4

column1: Shorts See the Better Historical Trading Pattern off Microsoft's After-Hours Earnings Moves;1/25/2017;"Microsoft (MSFT) is slated to report its Q2 results in the after-hours session Thursday
column2: Jan. 26
column3: and analysts polled by Capital IQ are expecting the software giant to report a profit of $0.79 per share on revenue of $25.27 billion.Microsoft is mixed in its trading pattern between the sessions
column4: cutting back its extended-hours trade in next-day action in 24 of 51 quarterly earnings events tracked over the last 13 years.MSFT is usually not a stock that benefits longs. In fact
column5: it generally favors cutting back its extended-hours gains in the following day's regular session and adding to its downside evening moves. MSFT has recorded 29 earnings-driven off-hours gains in 51 quarters we've tracked. In 17 of those upside extended-hours moves the stock has narrowed or reversed course the following regular session (59% of the time).makeArticleAd();MSFT has declined 22 times in the after-hours following earnings
column6: and in 14 of those quarters it has added to its downside move the following day (64% of the time).On Oct. 20

column1: These 5 Stocks Drive Vanguard High Dividend Yield's Performance;1/25/2017;"Dividend stocks have been a lifesaver for investors who need   income from their investment portfolios
column2: especially in light of   rock-bottom interest rates on bonds and other fixed-income   assets. In particular
column3: Vanguard High Dividend Yield ETF(NYSEMKT: VYM) offers a low-cost way to get diversified exposure   to more than 400 stocks
column4: all of which have above-average dividend   yields.Yet as with most funds
column5: a substantial portion of the Vanguard   ETF's assets go toward just a handful of stocks
column6: and the ETF's   top-five holdings make up nearly 20% of the entire portfolio.   Let's look more closely at the stocks that Vanguard High Dividend   Yield ETF sees as being most important to its success.Image source: Getty Images.makeAd('4'

column11: '');Vanguard High Dividend Yield ETF's top holdingsStockPercent of PortfolioMicrosoft(NASDAQ: MSFT)5.14%ExxonMobil(NYSE: XOM)4.12%Johnson & Johnson(NYSE: JNJ)3.46%JPMorgan Chase(NYSE: JPM)3.41%General Electric(NYSE: GE)3.06%Data source: Morningstar.What the Vanguard ETF's top holdings say about its   strategyInvestors look to dividend ETFs to provide a combination of   high income and broad-based diversification. The fund's   five-largest holdings show how Vanguard High Dividend Yield   achieves both of those goals. With exposure to technology
column12: energy
column13: healthcare
column14: financials
column15: and industrials
column16: the five stocks   above would make up an impressive mini-portfolio in their own   right. Moreover
column17: they all have better dividend yields than the   overall market
column18: ranging from JPMorgan Chase's 2.3% yield to the   3.5% that ExxonMobil currently pays.Yet in some ways
column19: the fact that the Vanguard ETF's top-five   holdings are as diverse as they are is just an accident of the   market. The ETF tracks the FTSE High Dividend Yield Index
column20: which   weights its components by market capitalization. It's only   because Microsoft has the highest valuation of any of the   companies in the index that it shows up at the top of the   list.That's not the way all dividend ETFs work. Some base their   weightings on the actual dividends that each component pays.   Under that rubric
column21: ExxonMobil would have a heavier weighting than   Microsoft because the energy giant's dividend payments on an   annual basis are higher than what the tech behemoth pays. The net   impact on performance is to keep the Vanguard ETF's returns more   in line with large-cap stock indexes
column22: generally
column23: because the   relative weightings will be similar to the broader index.How Vanguard High Dividend Yield's top holdings have   faredDividend stocks have been extremely popular
column24: and all five of   the stocks above have given investors double-digit returns over   the past year
column25: contributing to the Vanguard ETF's performance.   JPMorgan Chase has led the way with gains of more than 55%
column26: as   the rise in interest rates and more favorable conditions in the   financial markets have combined to give the Wall Street banking   colossus a more encouraging outlook going forward. Microsoft has   produced 26% returns over the past year as it continues to find   ways to navigate changing emphasis areas in the tech   industry.For ExxonMobil
column27: the stock's 19% return has come on the heels   of an impressive rebound in energy prices from their lows in   early 2016. Yet even with the gains
column28: crude oil in the $50s still   has room to run higher
column29: and some ExxonMobil investors are   counting on seeing further gains in order to support earnings and   dividends more securely. Meanwhile
column30: Johnson & Johnson also   produced 19% gains for shareholders over the past year
column31: riding   the success of its pharmaceutical segment
column32: but making key gains   in its medical device and consumer products businesses
column33: as   well.General Electric brings up the rear with gains of just 10%.   Yet GE has equally solid potential as it continues to key in on   its core industrial exposure. Having largely moved out of the   volatile financials arena following the financial crisis in 2008   and early 2009
column34: General Electric now hopes that investments in   areas like aerospace
column35: energy
column36: and healthcare will keep paying off   in the future.Keep watchingdividend   stocksWith these stocks in its arsenal
column37: the Vanguard High Dividend   Yield ETF has the capacity to keep delivering on the dividend   front. With high yields

column1: Why Apple Inc. Stock (AAPL) Was Downgraded Ahead Of Earnings;1/25/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsApple Inc.(AAPL) stock was little changed in early trading on Tuesday before rallying in Wednesday morning trading following a rare downgrade from analysts atBarclays.makeArticleAd();The iPhone maker is scheduled to release its next earnings report on Jan. 31
column3: and the story on Wall Street is weak iPhone 7 sales.Still
column4: some are finding cause to remain positive as consumers seem to be favoring the more expensive iPhone 7 Plus
column5: which of course is a good thing for the average selling price. Barclays' downgrade follows aprice target increaselast week.Apple Stock DowngradedIn a research note Tuesday morning
column6: Barclays analyst Mark Moskowitz went so far as to say that he doesn't see any big catalysts for Apple stock for the next 12 months. This implies that he's not even sure that the iPhone 8 will move the needle on sales enough to boost investor confidence
column7: at least in the early days. Twelve months will bring us past the launch of this year's iPhone models.The analyst downgraded Apple stock from ""Overweight""to ""Equal-weight""and trimmed his price target by $2 to $117 per share.Part of Moskowitz's newfound bearishness on Apple stock is less company-specific and more about the decelerating smartphone sales being felt across the industry.10 Stocks to Buy for Donald Trump's Second WindLooking out to the long term
column8: however
column9: he feels that the stickiness of the iPhone maker's ecosystem

Although he thinks December quarter sales might be in line with consensus

column16: and Android switchers remained stable even as the upgrade rate was strong.Milunovich is concerned about China and currency headwinds even though he still looks for iPhone growth in the double digits for fiscal 2018. He expects continued declines in China.Alphabet Inc (GOOGL) Q4 Earnings PreviewFurther

column21: compared to the consensus of $685.The postApple Inc. column1: Apple Inc. (AAPL) iPhone Takes a Hit From … Netflix
column2: Inc.? (NFLX);1/25/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace   - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsWhenApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) designed the iPhone and iOS mobile operating system
column4: the company chose to exclude support for external storage. On the other hand
column5: many smartphones runningAlphabet Inc's(NASDAQ:GOOGL) Android operating system included the ability to supplement onboard storage using inexpensive SD memory cards. Not a game-changer
column6: clearly.Source: TwitterButNetflix
column7: Inc.(NASDAQ:NFLX) just made the difference a little more important
column8: by adding support for Netflix downloads to SD cards on Android.makeArticleAd();To SD or Not to SDFrom the start
column9: AAPL spurned the idea of giving iPhone (or iPad) users access to external storage. The company designed iOS to hide file directories from the user level - keeping the user interface extremely simple - and that meant not being able to choose whether to save a file in built-in storage
column10: or in external storage.Besides keeping the user interface clean and easier to support
column11: the move also was a financial windfall for Apple. Without any option to boost storage
column12: users who wanted more than the bare minimum would be forced to pay for the next tier in iPhones. So that $649 base model became $749.AAPL's profit margin on that extra $100 was considerable
column13: since the flash memory used for storage is inexpensive.For point of comparison
column14: going from 32GB to 128GB on the iPhone 7 is an extra $100
column15: while a 128GB microSD card can be had for $50. And that's paying retail prices
column16: which AAPL most certainly does not.Google
column17: on the other hand
column18: supported the use of SD cards for external storage. It was limited at first
column19: but by Android Marshmallow
column20: Android users could use that extra storage for virtually anything
column21: including apps. They could buy cheap
column22: lower-capacity micro SD cards and swap them out at will.10 Companies That Are Bringing Jobs Back to     AmericaThis was a very popular feature
column23: asSamsung Electronics Co Ltd(OTCMKTS:SSNLF) discovered when it ditched the feature on the Galaxy S6. After the outcry
column24: the capabilityreturned with the Galaxy S7.Netflix Downloads Makes SD Card Support a Bigger DealThe announcement of Netflix downloads for iOS and Android was a very popular move. Watching video on a smartphone is popular
column25: but cellular data isn't cheap. The new feature meant you could watch Netflix on iPhone or Android devices while commuting
column26: traveling of just hanging around - without worrying about a big data bill.Yesterday
column27: Netflix downloads gainedSD card support on Android. Suddenly
column28: those cheap storage cards - that the iPhone cannot use - became a bigger deal. One hour of HD video downloaded to a mobile device from Netflixuses about 440MB of storage space.With movies approaching 1GB each
column29: you can see how this could add up quickly.For travelers using Netflix on iPhone
column30: the downloads could turn into an exercise in strategic file management. For someone with a Galaxy S7
column31: a $50 card they can pop in their phone would hold 100 movies or more.Netflix just may have become the killer app that makes SD cards on smartphones a serious advantage.Just Another Challenge for the iPhone 8When Apple releases the iPhone 8 in the fall
column32: it's going to be going up against intense competition. Google is expected to release the second generation of itspopularPixel Phone. More importantly
column33: Samsung appears to be throwing everything it has at the Galaxy S8. The company hasput the Galaxy Note 7 debacle behind itand is reassuring consumers the Galaxy S8 battery is practically bulletproof.Alphabet Inc (GOOGL) Steals AI Expert Back From     Apple Inc. (AAPL)In addition
column34: theGalaxy S8 is rumoredto have a curved
column35: bezel-free display
column36: a larger screen (in the same size form factor)
column37: iris scanner and an optional dock that turns it into an Android-running desktop PC.Netflix downloads supporting SD cards on Android smartphones won't derail the iPhone 8. However
column38: now that support for SD cards has a killer app
column39: it's one more feature - or lack thereof - the competition can hammer on when AAPL releases its all-important 10th anniversary iPhone.As of this writing
column40: Brad Moon did not hold a position in   any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceApple Inc. New iPads Might Be Late to the Party     (AAPL)3 Things Apple Inc. (AAPL) MUST Do to Soar in     2017Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Steps on Amazon     and Google's TurfThe postApple Inc. (AAPL) iPhone Takes a Hit From … Netflix
column41: Inc.? (NFLX)appeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: The Tech Battle for the Classroom Is Heating Up;1/24/2017;"Image source: Getty Images.Alphabet(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) has been making steady gains in   the classroom
column2: thanks to the Chromebook. The search giant is   looking to maintain that momentum and has just announced two new   Chromebooks that are specifically designed for the educational   market. Google is also taking the opportunity to share a few data   points. There are now 20 million teachers and students using   Chromebooks and Google Classroom
column3: and over 70 million people now   use G Suite for Education
column4: the company's online productivity   suite that's tailored for educational purposes.makeArticleAd();A tale of two new educational ChromebooksThe two new devices are the Acer Chromebook Spin 11 and the   ASUS Chromebook C213. Google says it collaborated with educators   to include features that would specifically help in the   classroom. Specifically
column5: that includes stylus support for   students to draw and take notes. In order to keep costs down
column6: the   styluses are cheap
column7: don't need to be charged or paired
column8: and are   easily replaced if lost. This move is clearly designed to broaden   appeal by offering something that tablets do.In May 2016
column9: Google said it was bringing Android apps to   Chrome OS. This was part of Google's broader strategy to merge   Chrome OS and Android. Administrators will be able to install   Android apps on educational Chromebooks
column10: which is a big win   considering how much more educational content is available for   Android.Microsoft wants inChromebooks and tablets have largely displaced low-costMicrosoft(NASDAQ: MSFT) PCs
column11: but the software giant is fighting back.   Microsoft also just announced Intune for Education. Intune is the   company's mobile device management offering
column12: which has   historically been catered to the enterprise. Intune for Education   will be a cloud-based application for device management
column13: which   will allow administrators to manage a group of Windows 10 devices   in educational settings. Microsoft says this is one of two   critical pieces that it has been missing in the educational   market
column14: with the other being affordable Windows 10 PCs.Video source: Microsoft.Microsoft makes it clear that it's taking a direct shot at   Chromebooks
column15: saying
column16: ""New Windows 10 Devices Offer Great   Alternatives to Chromebooks."" The company is unveiling a slew of   new Windows 10 devices that are targeting education
column17: fromHP
column18: Acer
column19: and Lenovo.Where's Apple?A few years back
column20: Apple(NASDAQ: AAPL) tried to position the iPad as the ideal   educational computing device
column21: but for the most part those   aspirations have fallen flat. Chromebooks are able to undercut   iPads by a significant margin
column22: and the presence of an attached   keyboard is important for education and productivity. Many of the   Chromebooks and Windows PCs that are gaining traction in the   educational market are priced at just $150 to $300; the cheapest   iPad is the aging iPad Mini 2 that was launched in 2013 and   currently costs $269.The educational market has long been important to Apple from a   philosophical perspective
column23: if not a financial one. But prices   continue to fall
column24: hindering Apple's ability to compete.   Importantly
column25: 2-in-1 devices are expected to continue growing in   education
column26: and Apple does not offer a full-fledged 2-in-1   product.It looks like Microsoft and Google may end up winning the   battle for the classroom.10 stocks we like better than MicrosoftWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column27: it can pay to listen. After all
column28: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade
column29: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column30: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and Microsoft wasn't one of     them! That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even     better buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of January 4

column1: Alphabet Inc. (GOOGL) Q4 Earnings Preview: Pixel & Home Could Fuel Growth;1/24/2017;"As per usual
column2: all eyes will be on the company formerly known as Google
column3: Alphabet Inc.GOOGL
column4: as the tech giant prepares to release its fourth-quarter earnings report on Thursday. The company rolled out its new Google Pixel phone and ushered in a new era of hardware-software interaction during the quarter
column5: making this week's announcement even more important than usual.In fact
column6: the Google Pixel will most likely be the most compelling aspect of Alphabet's latest report
column7: and investors will be clamoring to know how the device sold. It will also be interesting to see what the company says about its Google Home Controller
column8: which also launched in the U.S. this quarter.The Google Pixel is important because it is Alphabet's first high-end smartphone entirely produced in-house and represents a significant challenge to Apple'sAAPLiPhone line. The Google Home tells another story of competition; the ""Internet of Things"" in-home hub is one of the only competitors to Amazon'sAMZNEcho speaker.More importantly
column9: both of these products underscore Alphabet's efforts to usher in its intelligent personal assistant software
column10: Google Assistant. With similar functions to Apple's Siri and Microsoft'sMSFTCortana
column11: Google Assistant is the backbone of the Pixel and Home devices and promises to be the foundation for all of Google's original products heading forward.Also
column12: investors should not forget about the other products that Google launched in the quarter
column13: all of which were officially unveiled at the same event in October. The company debuted its stylish headset for the Daydream VR platform
column14: the ""Daydream View
column15: as well as its first router
column16: ""Google Wifi
column17: and a Chromecast update
column18: ""Chromecast Ultra.""All of these products are important pieces of Google's effort to create a complete line of products that work together and with the new Google Assistant software. This is just the first quarter of sales
column19: but it is also the holiday quarter and should give us a good idea of whether or not these products are resonating with shoppers.Heading into the report
column20: Alphabet Inc. has seen one positive estimate revision over the past week. Our current consensus estimates indicate EPS growth of 8.40% and sales growth of 18.75%
column21: and this has helped earn the company an ""A"" grade for growth. This is especially noteworthy given the relative size and status of Alphabet already. Overall
column22: the stock has a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy)
column23: and that's always a good sign heading into an earnings announcement.Nevertheless
column24: Alphabet currently has an Earnings ESP of -0.26%
column25: which makes surprise prediction a bit more difficult.Zacks' Top 10 Stocks for 2017In addition to the stocks discussed above
column26: would you like to know about our 10 finest tickers for the entirety of 2017?Who wouldn't? These 10 are painstakingly hand-picked from 4
column27: 400 companies covered by the Zacks Rank. They are our primary picks to buy and hold.Be among the very first to see them >>Want the latest recommendations from Zacks Investment Research? Today

column1: Why 2017 Will Be the Year of the Virtual Assistant;1/24/2017;"In its annual mobile apps survey
column2: Research firm Gartner   predicted that by 2019 virtual assistants will account for20% of all smartphone interactions. With that level of user engagement
column3: predictably all of   the largest technology companies are invested in the segment and   each brings a different strength to the field.Will 2017 be the year of the virtual assistant?  Image   source: Pixabay.makeArticleAd();Amazon Echo powered by Alexa. Image source: Amazon.com.AmazonMany media reports  are callingAmazon's(NASDAQ: AMZN) Alexa the hit of the Consumer Electronics Show.    In 2015
column4: Amazon made a skills kit available to developers   that allowed partners to incorporate voice commands. Fast forward   to 2017 and Alexa can integrate with an estimated 5
column5: 000   third-party apps
column6: from refrigerators to TV's
column7: from cars to   vacuums
column8: and lest we forget
column9: the Echo smart home speaker.    The novelty of this device made it among the top selling   items on Amazon's website during the holidays. This was a   brilliant strategic move by a company without a smartphone as an   installed base. Amazon does
column10: however
column11: have a roster of well-known   companies in its corner including Ford
column12: Samsung and LG to name a   few. In addition to product integration
column13: Alexa can be found in a   dizzying number of bots that can order a pizza from Domino's
column14: schedule an Uber
column15: or check your Capital One balance. This gives   Amazon the early lead in terms of reach and momentum
column16: but the   lack of a mobile device means that challenges remain.Apple's Siri. Image source: Apple.AppleApple(NASDAQ: AAPL)
column17: represented in the category by Siri
column18: hasn't seen   much love. Her earliest incarnation could only answer correctly   about 65% of the time
column19: and users complained that far too   often she defaulted to Google rather than answering the question.   Consumers tend to remember those early first experiences
column20: and   Siri still has a bad reputation. She shouldn't be counted out   yet
column21: though. Apple has been taking steps to improve Siri's   understanding. In mid-2014
column22: Siri's brain was replaced by an   artificial intelligence (AI) based neural network and Apple   claims that Siri now has a less than 5% error rate. Apple argues   that it isn't necessary to upload all of your data to the cloud   in order for Siri to improve. It uses a technique called   differential privacy
column23: which keeps individual information at the   local phone level and protects user privacy.  Though it   currently doesn't have a
column24: Echo-like voice-activated speaker
column25: reports indicatethat a prototype is currently in the testing stage.Google Home powered by Google Assistant. Image source:     Google.AlphabetAlphabet's(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) Google has introduced Google   Assistant
column26: which expands on the capabilities of Google Now and OK   Google. This assistant is currently available on its Pixel phones   and can be accessed on other smartphones via the Google Allo app.   This virtual helper is more conversational and has produced   impressive early results due to experiences gained from its   predecessors. It was found to rival and in many cases surpass its   nearest competitors. Assistant's greatest strength may be the   ability to answer follow-up questions
column27: a feature many of its   rivals lack. Integration with Google Home smart speaker puts it   squarely in competition with Amazon's Echo. Its strengths include   entire home synchronized audio and grouping of smart-home   commands.Some researchersbelieve that Alexa will cede its early lead in the category to   Google Assistant by 2020.Microsoft Cortana. Image source: Microsoft.MicrosoftMicrosoft's(NASDAQ: MSFT) Cortana is available across its Windows 10-based   devices including phones
column28: tablets and PC's. It has many competing   features
column29: but has exhibited difficulties responding to requests
column30: reminiscent of Siri's early days. Microsoft announced late last   year that it would open Cortana to third party integration
column31: so   expect a number of hardware integrations on the horizon. It has   yet to introduce an interactive speaker
column32: but its first hardware   partner is Harman Kardon and one is expected sometime this year.    In a shrewd move
column33: the kit used by developers is remarkably   similar to that of Alexa
column34: allowing them to piggyback off the work   they have already done. This will accelerate the process of   producing hardware that will integrate Cortana.Near-ubiquitous technologyThose interested in a task-based comparison between the four   might findthis articlebyBusiness Insiderof interest. Despite the varying capabilities among these   entries
column35: one thing is clear: nearly every person with a computer
column36: tablet
column37: smartphone
column38: or home speaker system will have access to a   virtual personal assistant in the coming year. With this level of   exposure
column39: consumers will begin to adopt these virtual assistants
column40: and as the technology becomes more advanced
column41: providers will find   new
column42: more innovative ways to incorporate them into our everyday   lives. Society is still in the early stages of the adoption cycle   for these digital helpers
column43: but it appears that this year is the   tipping point.10 stocks we like better than AppleWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock       tip
column44: it can pay to listen. After all
column45: the newsletter they       have run for over a decade
column46: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column47: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and Apple wasn't one of       them! That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even       better buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of January 4

column1: Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Is Building an AI Monster;1/24/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading     TipsWhen investors think of artificial intelligence stocks
column3: Microsoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) isn't usually the first name that comes to mind. Many consumers   viewAmazon.com
column4: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN) as the leader in at-home AI
column5: due to the success of the   company's Echo device
column6: while ""Watson"" fromInternational Business Machines Corp.(NYSE:IBM) is arguably the top turn-key artificial intelligence solution   for enterprise-level entities.Those investors who believe AI is the future
column7: however
column8: may want   to put MSFT stock back on their radar as a way to play the   movement.makeArticleAd();The software giant's recent acquisition of Maluuba speaks   volumes about its artificial intelligence ambitions and what it   actually wants to ""do"" with it.What's Maluuba?Maluuba isn't a household name
column9: but within artificial   intelligence circles (and these are VP of AI Research Harry Shum's   words)
column10: ""Maluuba's vision is to advance toward a more general   artificial intelligence by creating literate machines that can   think
column11: reason and communicate like humans - a vision exactly in   line with ours.""In simpler terms
column12: the AI agent doesn't just serve up a   canned response to the most likely question it thinks it's being   asked based on keywords. Rather
column13: Maluuba understands the words   being used
column14: their context
column15: and what information is desired. The utility of such a tool   could vary from finding a specific qualification or experience   from within a company's ranks to a chatbot that actually works   without talking in circles.Those are just small examples of how a   next-generation artificial intelligence - called artificial   general intelligence
column16: in this case - could be used and monetized.   In September
column17: when Microsoft assembled 5
column18: 000 engineers to work on   AI
column19: Shum specifically pointed out that such a technology could   not only make Cortana and Skype more potent
column20: butcould be incorporated into Microsoft's popular   cloud-based apps such as Office 365 and Azureto enhance the ease-of-use factor for those platforms.7 Blue-Chip Dividend Stocks That Are Dead       Weight Right NowYou Ain't Seen Nothin' YetIt's difficult to see
column21: or sense
column22: but Microsoft is developing   its AGI know-how with as much of a philosophical bent as it is a   technical one.Just in time
column23: too. AsCIO's Matt Kapko observed in December
column24: ""While machine learning has generated tremendous interest   throughout the enterprise
column25: a wide gap still exists between   research and beneficial use cases in the real world.""The ramped-up focus on AI (and this happened well before   Maluuba) couldn't have come at a better time for Microsoft
column26: either
column27: and by extension
column28: for owners of MSFT stock.Calling a spade a spade
column29: Microsoft largely missed out on the   early phase of artificial intelligence; now it's play catch up.   It's playing it well
column30: though
column31: particularly focusing on ""bots"" -   or chatbots that can intelligently text-chat with a user - as the   organization believes that's the interface that makes the most   sense of such a platform. This kind of AI could potentially   replace many of the touch-based apps found on your smartphone   withone voice-based conversational tool that actually   does everythingthe way you want it done.President and principal analyst of Moor Insights &   Strategy
column32: Patrick Moorhead
column33: has taken notice
column34: too
column35: commenting   last month that ""Microsoft surprised everyone in 2016 and I'm   expecting more surprises in 2017."" Specifically
column36: Moorhead   believes Microsoft will unveil an artificial intelligence that   will not only be more powerful to individual consumers than   Amazon's Echo
column37: but will also serve a specific business (read   ""revenue-bearing"") function. Incorporating Maluuba's know-how   will only move the company closer to that end zone.At stake is a piece of a market thatcould be worth $16.6 billion by 2022. Tractica thinks the artificial intelligence market willbe worth $36.8 billion by 2025. Both are a far cry from 2016's estimated global AI revenue of   $644 million.Now
column38: all of a sudden
column39: Microsoft's intense interest makes   sense.Bottom Line for MSFT StockNone of this is to suggest that that MSFT stock should be   viewed first and foremost as an artificial intelligence stock
column40: now or later. It's still a productivity-solutions stock
column41: and AI   simply helps the organization provide better solutions.7 Stocks to Buy to Double Your Money in       2017Nevertheless
column42: Microsoft may well be working on one of the most   marketable uses of artificial intelligence
column43: serving enterprises   in a very real way - beyond the home-utility that the Echo   provides
column44: while not imposing overkill with something   like IBM's Watson. MSFT owners may soon find Microsoft quietly   winning the AI war with an elegant
column45: customizable solution to real   challenges.Even if few have come to fully appreciate just how potent this   artificial intelligence product is.As of this writing
column46: James Brumley did not hold a position     in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceThe Top Dividend Stocks to Buy for Safety in       201710 Dividend Growth Stocks That Simply Print       Money7 Stocks to Sell Before They ImplodeThe postMicrosoft Corporation (MSFT) Is Building an AI   Monsterappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: How Microsoft Has Changed in the Past 3 Years;1/24/2017;"Satya Nadella became CEO ofMicrosoft(NASDAQ: MSFT) about three years ago
column2: with his formal appointment   coming on Feb. 4
column3: 2014. It was an inspired pick that also   represented a change in tone from previous boss Steve Ballmer.   What wasn't known at the time is just how radically Nadella would   divert from the strategies of his predecessor and founder/CEO   Bill Gates before him.Nadella wasn't another member of the old guard taking over. He   wasn't a Gates disciple who'd been around since the early days of   the company in the mid-1970s
column4: but having started in 1992. He did   have a strong base of knowledge about where the company was and   where it needed to go. When he took over
column5: he made it very clear   that changes were coming and they were going to come quickly.""Microsoft is one of those rare companies to have truly   revolutionized the world through technology
column6: and I couldn't be   more honored to have been chosen to lead the company
column7: Nadella   said in apress releaseat the time. ""The opportunity ahead for Microsoft is vast
column8: but to   seize it
column9: we must focus clearly
column10: move faster
column11: and continue to   transform. A big part of my job is to accelerate our ability to   bring innovative products to our customers more quickly.""makeArticleAd();Those remarks would prove prescient
column12: as it's fair to say   Nadella quickly changed how Microsoft does business. It was a   radical remake that turned a still-successful tech dinosaur into   a company built for the future as well as the present.Microsoft has changed dramatically in three years under   Nadella. Image source: Microsoft.How has Microsoft changed?Under Gates and Ballmer
column13: Microsoft operated in a closed   ecosystem. The company wanted people to buy Windows computers
column14: so   it generally kept its products inside that system. There wereApple(NASDAQ: AAPL) Mac versions of Office
column15: but even those weren't   updated nearly as often as the Windows versions -- and they only   succeeded because so few options existed.Trying to keep everything in the Windows world backfired on   Microsoft when iOS and Android phones and tablets exploded. Not   having key products such as the various Office programs in the   two major app stores started teaching a generation of younger   folks that there were alternatives.Nadella quickly changed that. In November 2014
column16: he brought the   signature productivity suite to Apple iOS and Android devices. In   addition
column17: the company offered up free versions of programs   including Word
column18: Excel
column19: and PowerPoint that allowed for viewing   documents
column20: as well as some limited editing.These moves
column21: which the new CEO pushed through
column22: also helped   Microsoft change its business model for these programs. Rather   than pushing Office as a one-time sale
column23: the company moved users   toward subscriptions. That was made much easier by Microsoft's   newfound willingness to allow consumers to use Office on whatever   device they wanted
column24: instead of just Windows machines.A different companyIf Microsoft had kept the walls up
column25: it probably would have had   a long future as a steadily shrinking business selling to a core   group of business users. With its new strategy
column26: the company has   been able to introduce Office
column27: Skype
column28: and even Windows to a new   generation while creating a steady flow of subscription revenue.   For example
column29: revenue for Office 365
column30: the name for the   subscription plan
column31: was up nearly 70% in Q2 2016.In addition to opening up the company's products to Apple and   Android products
column32: Nadella has also been a decisive leader. He   made the bold decision to scrap Windows 8 and distance the   company from it by moving right to Windows 10 -- a revamp that   brought back many well-liked features. He was also quick to back   away from the Windows Phone
column33: even if that meant admitting that   the company largely wasted $7.6 billion buyingNokia's devices division.Nadella has also been a strong champion of innovation at his   company. He supported the struggling Surface hybrid
column34: which has   slowly become a strength for Microsoft. In addition
column35: the CEO has   backed HoloLens
column36: a future-looking platform that could help bring   virtual and augmented reality into the mainstream.Microsoft is hip nowCompared with Apple
column37: Microsoft was always square. That's why   the old ""I'm a Mac/I'm a PC"" commercials worked. Now
column38: under   Nadella
column39: Microsoft no longer feels the same. It still may not be   quite as hip as Apple
column40: but the Windows maker has gained some   ground
column41: and its media events now also contain surprises
column42: like the   SurfaceBook laptop.In three years
column43: the new CEO has taken his company from one in   decline to one that has a bright future. Some moves
column44: such as   Microsoft's growing cloud business
column45: can also be credited to   Ballmer
column46: but opening up the company's products to all platforms   has changed the company's trajectory by exponentially opening up   its potential audience.10 stocks we like better than MicrosoftWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column47: it can pay to listen. After all
column48: the newsletter they have run for   over a decade

column1: How to Trade Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock After Earnings;1/24/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading     TipsBig technology stocks are stepping on to the earnings stage   over the next couple of weeks
column3: andMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) will be among their number. MSFT stock has acted splendidly for   the past seven months or so. But now
column4: it's coming into a   bigger-picture area on the chart that could offer some more   headwinds.It's difficult to make risk-adjusted choices - whether in the   stock market or in life - without perspective. During a   conversation with a group of fellow traders yesterday
column5: I was   reminded how short-term-ism is an epidemic in this industry.makeArticleAd();Everyone in this group was discussing potential breakouts or   breakdowns in this and that stock. But until I brought it up
column6: they ignored the fact that the broader stock market for the past   month-and-a-half has been stuck in a tight consolidation   range.In other words
column7: if most stocks as represented by the indices   are stuck in a tight range
column8: then any given stock is likely to do   the same
column9: until a broader directional move takes hold.We need this type of perspective when we look at MSFT stock at   the current juncture.Specifically
column10: Microsoft earnings are scheduled for   Thursday
column11: Jan. 26
column12: after the close of trading. The last time I   discussed shares of MSFT - onNov. 30
column13: 2016- I offered that although the stock at the time was already   reaching bigger-picture technical resistance
column14: upside toward the   $64 area into year's end looked likely.10 Stocks to Buy to Survive a ""Trumpsy-Turvy""       2017Over the ensuing three weeks
column15: Microsoft proceeded to rally
column16: and on Dec. 22
column17: it hit my $64 price target right on the nose. But   shares have been consolidating in a sideways pattern ever   since.MSFT Stock ChartsLooking at the weekly chart
column18: we see that the year-end rally in   MSFT stock pushed it right to the very upper end of a multiyear   uptrending channel that I marked with the purple-dotted   parallels.Click to EnlargeAt the same time
column19: the stock's momentum oscillators - such as   the MACD at the bottom of this weekly chart - remain stretched on   the upside.To be clear
column20: this doesn't mean Microsoft stock has to correct   to the downside immediately. It just means the upside momentum   here likely will be capped.On the daily chart
column21: note that since last summer
column22: MSFT shares   have traded in several well-defined consolidation patterns
column23: each   one leading to a next leg higher.Click to EnlargeThe million-dollar question now is whether this latest   multiweek consolidation pattern (which on the above chart is   taking place at the very upper end of the longer-term uptrend)   will resolve to the upside or to the downside.Trade of the Day: Activision Blizzard
column24: Inc.       (ATVI) Stock Looks to Rack Up GainsLuckily
column25: traders now have well-defined levels to focus on:A break and hold above $63.50  could open upside     toward $65-$66.Alternatively
column26: a break and hold below the 50-day simple     moving average (orange
column27: currently around $61.60) could be the     beginning of a mean-reversion lower with a first price target     in the $56-$57 area. However
column28: traders must respect any sharp     bearish reversal upon an initial post-earnings breakout (a     breakout fake-out move) as a stop-loss signal on longs.Like what you see? column1: Alibaba Earnings: BABA Crushes Wall Street's Q3 Earnings
column2: Revenue Estimates;1/24/2017;"Alibaba announced earnings (Shutterstock photo)Shares of Alibaba (BABA) are rising more than 3% in Tuesday’s pre-market session after the company reported third quarter fiscal 2017 financial results that beat Wall Street estimates on both revenue and profits.The Chinese e-commerce giant
column3: which posted a 54% jump in quarterly revenue
column4: benefited from a combination of factors including higher sales during its Single's Day shopping event. And the fact that the company beat on the bottom line by a whopping 17 cents underscores the extent to which analysts misjudged how quickly founder/executive chairman Jack Ma and CEO Daniel Zhang can accelerate profit margins.makeArticleAd();In that vein
column5: while BABA shares — already up 12% this year — are not a screaming bargain
column6: good luck betting against it. Let’s go through the numbers.“We reported another excellent quarter
column7: with robust revenue growth of 54%. With three quarters of the year coming in ahead of expectations
column8: we are adjusting up our 2017 fiscal year revenue guidance from 48% to 53% year-over-year growth
column9: ” said CFO Maggie Wu in a statement.In the three months that ended December
column10: Alibaba reported reported fiscal third-quarter profit of $2.57 billion
column11: or $1 per share. On an adjusted basis
column12: when taking out one-time gains and costs
column13: earnings were $1.30 per share
column14: which beats Thomson Reuters consensus estimates of $1.13 per share. The Hong Kong-based online retailer posted revenue of $7.67 billion
column15: which also topped Street forecasts by about $375 million.“Our robust December quarter demonstrates the strength of the Chinese consumer and Alibaba’s ability to create value across our vast ecosystem
column16: ” CEO Daniel Zhang said.Beyond Single’s Day
column17: the strong revenue beat was driven by the company’s emergence in the cloud
column18: which posted a 115% year-over-year jump in revenue of RMB 1.76 billion (US $254 million). Not only is Alibaba enjoying an increase in the number of paying customers
column19: the customers are also spending higher than usual
column20: reflecting increased usage of services. Alibaba entered 2017 with a goal of challenging the likes of Amazon (AMZN) and Microsoft (MSFT) for cloud dominance. In that vein
column21: this was a solid first step.The company began reporting on each segment since the first quarter of fiscal 2017
column22: breaking down the performances in four crucial areas. Growth its dominant core e-commerce segment continue to drive better-than-expected results. Plus
column23: with revenue from the core e-commerce business growing 45% year over year
column24: marking a more than the 41% jump sequentially
column25: Alibaba — combined with its cloud growth — has tons of momentum heading into 2017 to send the share price higher. And the fact that Alibabahas friends in high placeswon’t hurt either."

column1: Will Chuck E. Cheese's Be the Best Restaurant IPO in 2017?;1/23/2017;"We all know the place to go ""where a kid can be a kid"". However
column2: in technology-laden 2017
column3: do kids really want to leave the comfort of their homes to play virtual games? Pizza and arcade chain Chuck E. Cheese's has been battling this question lately
column4: especially as home consoles and mobile gaming
column5: with their added level of convenience
column6: have slowed down growth and presented new competition for the arcade chain.Based in Texas
column7: Chuck E. Cheese's is a family oriented restaurant-arcade establishment for children. It was founded in 1977 by Atari creator Nolan Bushnell
column8: and the company now operates 522 locations with an additional 58 franchise locations in the United States and Canada. Parents take their families to the holistically advertised establishment for food and fun as their children flock to use their purchased tokens to play arcade games and earn tickets to win prizes.Private Buy OutApollo Global ManagementAPO
column9: a leading global alternative investment manager
column10: acquired Chuck E. Cheese's parent company
column11: CEC Entertainment
column12: in a private equity deal worth $1.3 billion in January of 2014. With a turnaround plan of new offerings such as free guest Wi-Fi and a new sophisticated food menu for parents
column13: Apollo had proven to do well for CEC Entertainment; revenues in 2015 compared to 2014 rose 11% to $920 million.Increased SubstitutionsSurveys show most American children
column14: both boys and girls
column15: play with at-home video game consoles. This proves to be a challenge for Chuck E. Cheese's
column16: as their revenue growth slumped in 2016. In its third quarter of fiscal 2016
column17: total revenues grew 2.8% compared to a growth rate of 11.1% in the same quarter in 2015.Today
column18: consoles such as the Xbox One by MicrosoftMSFThave taken the excitement of winning in virtual gaming to children's homes. Innovations and ideas such as gamer points
column19: leader boards
column20: and on-line play have not only made gaming more personal and comfortable
column21: but also globally connected.With video game and virtual reality innovations on the rise
column22: Chuck E. Cheese's finds it difficult to increasingly capture the attention of children. As a kid in the 1990's
column23: Chuck E. Cheese's was one of my favorite places to go. Hitting a jackpot and winning physical tickets for a prize was an absolute thrill. However
column24: I did not have the availability and technology children do now. With that in mind
column25: will kids push their parents to seek an experience which they can already find in their living rooms?Looking ForwardCurrently
column26: Apollo Global Management has started discussions with underwriters to take Chuck E. Cheese's parent company public. The aim is to take CEC Entertainment public in the second half of 2017
column27: a deal which will be valued at over $1 billion including debt. Sources have yet to be named as IPO preparation is kept confidential.Right now
column28: it's all speculation regarding a Chuck E. Cheese's IPO. If it follows in Dave & Buster'sPLAYfootsteps
column29: the company has the possibility of outperforming the popularity of the personal gaming industry because of its utilization of interactivity. Children's preferences and attention continually shift as technology progresses. Chuck E. Cheese's taken public has the ability to do well through being an established household name
column30: still proving growth
column31: and shifting offerings to consumer preferences.Stocks that Aren't in the News…YetYou are invited to download the full
column32: up-to-the-minute list of 220 Zacks Rank #1 ""Strong Buys"" free of charge. Many of these companies are almost unheard of by the general public and just starting to get noticed by Wall Street.
